text: B-. Pours a black color with khaki head. Full of flavor and notes of dark fruit

Lekkere donkere quadripel, zoet en fruitig met een licht zure afdronk, zeker niet bitter. Romig en mooi gebalanceerd.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Looks about dark brown with thick a big creamy head. Aroma is a little boozy, but also gives out dark malts and fruitiness. What a great flavor profile, really complex and well balanced. Dark crystal malts combined with spicy-fruity notes all the way to the finish. Ends quite dry which allows some hops to join in. Almost no alcohol present in taste. Full bodied. Very rich in flavors and absolutely flawless. Perfect!
Dark brown pour with a long lasting beige head. Taste has some dark fruits. Very heavy. Really good quad
330ml bottle from Pintas in Moscow. Pours dark brown with a medium-sized light brown head. Aroma is spice, dark fruits, caramel, light alcohol. Taste is sweet, raisins, chocolate, bananas.
Dark, with red reflexes. Molasses, Caramel, lum, malts, yeast, alcohol, herbs. Semi sweet, semi bitter. full body, fizzy.

Long persistent creamy head
Ruby amber color not very clear
Full body
Medium carbanation
Smell deep grains, and even like wine 
Tast Smooth and heavy, heat raising up from throat bcz of the 10 degree alcohal
Really taste like japanese Sake, with hint of soy sauce. A bit of sweetness. Sour bcz of the highly fermentation.
When exhale, get the great falor of ripe grain after sun burn.
HIGHLY SUGGEST! EXHALE AS MUCH AS U CAN! TO FEEL THE RIPE GRAIN FLAVOR!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brązowe. Piana bardzo wysoka, szybko opada, ale zostawia obwolutę na wokół szkła. W aromacie chleb, biszkopty, nuty figowe, miodowe, delikatnie winne. W smaku umiarkowanie słodkie, dosyć biszkoptowe, chlebowe. Alkohol delikatnie wyczuwalny. Goryczka praktycznie nie występuje. Wysycenie średnie. Naprawdę fajne.

Bottle. Dark chocolate brown with a thin floating cream head. Nose is toffee, caramel, cake, bread, raisins. Taste is initially mooted, but then, give it time... Dark fruits, raisins, caramels, cinder toffee, dense bread. Sip sip sip and enjoy. Play with it across the taste buds. No alcohol burn. Just complex flavours playing on the tongue. Yeah. I like this.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 Dark brown with off white head. Dried fruit, resins and malty aroma. Taste of malt, marzipan and caramel.

First impression: very nice beer.
Beautiful notes of roasted malts, caramel and spice. Hints of coffee. Has very nice deep dark red color. Carbonation is just perfect. Leaves a very nice roasted malts / cereal taste in the mouth after you took a sip. 
Only minus: maybe just a tiny little bit too sweet.

11.2floz bottle (BBD: 07.24.2019, paid the discounted price of $1) poured into a large snifter glass. Appears a garnet brown with a moderate amount of tan head, an excellent looking brew. Plum, raisin, and an undertone of caramel compose the nose. Flavor is likewise, but with the occasional tobacco note. Semi-sweet, full in body, and the alcohol provides a warmth without being hot best describes the palate. Besides being nit-picky, there is really nothing wrong with this beer. It is one of beers that define the Belgian quad style. For when I want a true Belgian ale that is malty and yeast driven without the fuss of spices and heavy phenols (added or imparted from the yeast), then this beer achieves all of those things.
Brown beer with cappuccino head, smell and taste is typical Belgium beer but very good, good balance, drunk in a restaurant in Middelkerke

Aromat: słodki i mocny, rodzynki, figi, daktyle, suszone śliwki, karmel. Zapach lepki i zawiesisty, przyjemny i bogaty.
Wygląd: ciemno miedziano brązowe, nieprzejrzyste, bardzo ładna, średniopęcherzykowa warstwa białej piany, szkoda że szybko znika. Sporo osadu na dnie butelki i w piwie.
Smak: karmel, rodzynki, suszone śliwki, figi, białe owoce, skórka ciemnego chleba. Dosyć wytrawne, stosunkowo mało słodyczy. Lekka cierpkość od świeżych, białych owoców, ciut goryczki, estrowość, ja tu czułem jeszcze drewniane nuty. Ogólnie jest to piwo bardzo dobrze ułożone i zbalansowane, alkohol ukryty, piwo pełne, konkretne i treściwe, bardzo intensywne w smaku. Dobre piwo, ale to klasyczna do bólu Belgia.

28/05/2017 - draught @Het Eenvoudig Bestaan, Kerkhove.
Hazy dark brown with nice light tanned head. Nose sweet dark malts, touch of caramel and licorice. Taste is sweet dark malts, some dark fruits, hint of licorice, some chocolate.
Oxidierter Geruch. Vollmundig dunkelmalzig schokoladiger Beginn. Milde Karbonisierung, etwas nussig, süffig. Zum Ende Kaffee, weich, geringe Bitterkeit. Vollmundig, gut. 10/12/11/11//11

A: Dark brown with a small tan head
N: Dark roasted malts. Some summer fruit.
T: Bitterness up front. Roasted malts. Coffee and dark chocolate.
P: Full
O: Decent dark tripel
Perfect quadrupel. Tasty, excellent. Intense in mouth, long drink. Absolutely wonderful.

Barwa bordowa, piana średnia. Aromat karmelowy, figi, rodzynki, śliwki, daktyle. W smaku mega zbudowane. Są rodzynki, śliwki, wiśnie, cukier kandyzowany, czekolada i jakby rum. Alko nie wyczuwalne. Mega pifko.

With a dark crisp taste and lingering after taste this cousin of the Westie is half the price but has all the flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella de 50 cl, cata en Liquidos. Color marrón, um poco turbia, espuma abundante de color marrón o vainilla. Cerveza densa, con cuerpo. Compleja en nariz. Notas a malta tostada, madera. También a dátiles y frutas negras. Sabor dulce, maltosa, muy equilibrada. Trago fácil pese a los 10 grados. Deliciosa.
Dark beer with light brown head. Roasted malt, caramel, dry fruits. Very good beer!

Ciemno-bordowe, nieprzejrzyste. Piana biała, drobna, obfita, zostaje na tafli, lacingu brak. W aromacie figi, rodzynki, trochę ciemnych owoców, karmel. W smaku już owoce mocniejsze, na początku kwaśno, potem wchodzą figi z rodzynkami, karmel w tle. Jest mniej wyraźnie, niż sugerował to zapach. Wysycenie wysokie, goryczka niska, posmak suszonych fig i rodzynek.
Kolor ciemny, lekka piana, wyrzucenie dość spore. W zapachu nuty winne, wiśnie i trochę karmelu. Smak mocno owocowy, rodzynki, wiśnie, troche karmelu, drewna, alkohol ukryty. Super piwo.
Cerveza muy consistente, de malta tostada, tiene notas a frutos negros, en general me parece muy buena.

Biere ambrée 10% légère convient pour les apéritifs peu d'amertume je la recommande 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Great beer! One of our favorites smooth going down light aroma and beautiful color, we like it better than Westvletern!

A delicious beer! Fruity aroma, deep brown color with a creamy head, perfectly balanced flavour with an aftertaste that forces you to savor each mouthful and anticipate the next. When you want to indulge...this is what you reach for. Supposedly, it's based on one of the oldest recipes used by Trappist monks, so no surprise that for this fan of Trappist ales this one ranks among the best!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Botella en 99Cervezas.

Vierte en color castaño más bien oscuro y aspecto transparente y casi brillante una vez que la espuma desaparece y la cerveza se "calma". Espuma generosa de color vainilla, burbuja grande y persistencia media.

De intensidad media en nariz, casi con seguridad debido a que la saqué demasiado tarde del frigo. Notas de dátiles, florales y algunas frescas con un punto como de colonia francamente agradable. A continuación salen notas leñosas y de plátano muy maduro. Hay un punto alcohólico muy suave, aunque nada para lo que cabría esperar de una cerveza de 10°. Compleja en nariz.

De entre los sabores básicos destaca el dulce, acompañado de un amargo ligeramente astringente y de un punto salado. Un conjunto muy equilibrado.

Gran cuerpo y textura espumosa y aterciopelada. Tampoco aquí se perciben los 10° de alcohol (tan sólo se dejan sentir muy al fondo y de una forma más fresca que cálida). Buena persistencia en boca, manteniendo siempre el equilibrio comentado antes y la preponderancia del dulce y sin llegar jamás a hacerse pesada.

Una cerveza de trago medio en cuanto a sensaciones y corto en cuanto a alcohol. El dulzor está muy bien equilibrado por la astringencia suave del amargo, aportándole una gran bebestibilidad para ser una cerveza de 10°. Perfecta para sobremesa y como copa, aunque puede maridar también muy bien con carnes estofadas y me atrevería decir que hasta con pescado (eso tengo que probarlo).
W zapachu suszone czerwone owoce, rodzynki, spalony spód ciasta, skórka chlebowa. W smaku raczej wytrawne, choć pojawia się i słodycz, karmel, suszone czerwone owoce, biszkopt.

Milk and Sugar cafe Ypres 

I gently pour dark red brown I did include the yeast in so it's a little cloudy, there's a one finger faun tight head - considering it is a 10% ABV it certainly lasted the course 

Nose a little yeasty and dark fruit and nodding towards a burnt caramel 

Mouthfeel is luxuriantly lush with a slow and easy liveliness 

The flavours are surprisingly understated to begin with so I decide to let the beer breath a little. This wasn't an exercise in futility and the flavours flourished. Those plumb, raisins and caramel are beautifully balanced with a little bitterness, maybe it's just ambiance of the evening but is that apple pie and cinnamon?

As I look across the market square I hear the chimes from church bells, the chatter of Flemish couples and await the last post ceremony at the city gates this slow sizzler is very warming and settles you into that relaxed holiday mood.

Bruin/rood kleurig bier met een creme kleurige schuimkraag.

Aroma: pruimen, donker fruit, moutig, bruine suiker.

Smaak: pruimen, rozijnen, bruine suiker, klein beetje geroosterd en een bittertje.

Veel koolzuur en een medium mondgevoel.
Hazy dark brown with beige foam. A lovely strong beer its like I can really taste the alcohol 😎 and roasted malt, little caramel, some dark fruits a hint of hops in the aftertaste.
chocolate, brown, cloudy, rocky head, medium sweetness, full body, creamy, soft carbonation,

Well balanced aromas, prominent and fresh citric hoppy character which make my mind go to apple. Subtle tones of dark malt, with both elements of chocolate and bread. The ale is strong so theres also a distinct taste of alcohol, but not at all spoiling. Not sure, but I also think I find some traces of something salty and smoked. 

A little foggy dark brown with a large beautiful creamy head. 

A sweet ale, but the bitterness is the most prominent of the flavors. Also it has some sourness to it, but thats not a bad thing in an ale like this.

A thick ale that stings a little because of the alcohol, but the carbonation isnt that prominent which makes it feel a bit stale in the mouth. Since its a thick ale I would prefer it to be a little more lively. I would also appreciate more length in the finish considering this to be a quad. 

As always you cant go wrong with a quad and this is a delicious ale, but I was a little disappointed with the palate. I will do a revisit after tasting Rochefort 10 as my expectations might have been wrong.
Ocena w ramach uzupełnienia profilu. Pite kilka razy. Zazwyczaj piwo które można brać w ciemno, bardzo ekstraktywne i zbalansowane.
Po otwarciu butelki bucha guma balonowa, sporo chleba, karmel, owoce - karmelizowane i trochę suszonych. Alkohol dobrze ukryty, w smaku dochodzą suszone morele na finiszu. Wysycenie średnio-wysokie.

330ml bottle from beer cartel, poured into abbey glass.

aroma of spice, black fruits, and almost a scotch-like quality. aroma is deceptive and not entirely indicative towards its final flavour.

dark brown in colour, a little hazy but mostly clear i suppose. creamy tan head, dissipating not supremely quickly, but leaving a long enough time to provide aroma and look gorgeous.

tastes a little malt sweetness, but an appreciable amount of hop bitterness and alcohol warmth towards the end. it dances across the tongue, glimmering with - again - an almost whiskey-esque astringency and profile. full bodied, a creamy texture, and a surprising amount of carbonation for what i expected it to be. long, bitter finish, that leaves you wanting more. 4.5/5

Bottle (2 years old). Hazy brown beer with creamy beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, ripe apples, spices, caramel, yeast. Taste is medium- sweet and light bitter, caramel, some brown sugar, ripe apples, dried fruits, spices, light plums and raisins, with lasting fruity aftertaste. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is average to lively. Great, well-balanced, flavourful.
相当不错的啤
Vynikající masivní pivo s jemnějí ale intenzivnějí chutí, nasládlejím aromatem. Pro mě absolutní pička.

Bottle. Pours dark brown color with beige medium head. Taste of caramel, molasses, toffee, roasted malts. Taste of caramel, biscuit, raisin, dark fruits, blackcurrant, fig. Full body with low carbonation, sweet finish.
Purchased in a brick pack(12, 8, 6, Tripel and St.Bernardus chalice) some years ago. I must admit i prefer this over Rochefort 10. Definitely the closest thing to Westy 12.
Dark brown,creamy head.Very complex on the nose, a lot of dark fruit, malt, little bit alcoholic. Taste is malty, some fruity sweetness, some sourness, caramel.. Really great stuff.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 very much an Essential Beer. Struggling to think of something with similarly wide distribution and price that could compete. Definitely doesnt fall in the sugar zone with other quads and traps - drinkable as all heck. Perfect carbo, nice hoppiness.

Bottle (2015) @ Six Roses, Lille - FR. Color: deep dark brown beer with no carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: caramel with cherry notes. Candied and alcohol cherry notes. Roasted malt and small alcohol finish. Taste: full body with strong caramel roasted malt, cherry notes and full candied fruits bouquet. Great balance and quite drinkable. Aftertaste: alcohol and roasted caramel malt bouquet. Really great!

0,33 l bottle. Darkest brown in the glass, think it´s unclear, one finger head. Very complex on the nose, a lot of dark fruit, malt, little bit alcoholic. Taste is malty, some fruity sweetness, some sourness, kruiden as the dutch said.. Really great stuff.
DWF mørk med flott skum. Aroma er balansert frukt caramel. Smak søt balansert humle. Co2 mye. Fantastiskt god. Favorite
Bought this beer as a christmas package for my family. When you drink this beer, it rekindles your lost love for the good abbey work.
Best overall beer Ive ever had. I typically do not drink ales, yet this is my favorite beer period.
Great Price vs. Quality vs. Availability relation. Very stable, one of the best Belgian beers in this matter.
Pours dark copper. Aroma is cherries, and sweet dark fruit. Taste is the same, had this years ago and its definitely a classic.

0,33l bottle. Pours brown with big tan dissipating head. Rich aroma of caramel, malt, some yeast, plenty of dried fruit, some raisin, its a bit tarty and of course it has some some alcohol on the nose. Flavor is similar, more dark fruit even. And you get to feel alcohol more than in aroma. Taste is medium sweet with medium bitterness. Body is full, texture almost oily. Carbonation is average. Finish is quite long, alcohol and bitterness complemented with some sweet dried fruit.

Against the grain I know but ever so underwhelmed with this head dissipates quickly. Nose is weak for such a big beer taste all you would expect from an big abbey beer just not much of it maybe needs re-rating with a different bottle.

(tap) Het ruikt zoetig naar caramel en kastanje achtig. Mooie donkere kleur. Proeft volle diepe warme smaak van een mooie donkere rode wijn met caramel. Wat om een kaasplankje smeekt. Palate is vrij eenvoudig maar is met zon volle smaak ook niet echt nodig. Geweldig biertje voor in de herfst bij de openhaard.

Gran cerveza tostada.
Muy potente.
Facil de beber.
Tostada tomada de grifo en el Kraken.

Para repetir.

Muy buena.

Buen aroma a caramelo y fruta madura.
Buen aspecto, espuma color crema persitente.
En boca balanceada, cuerpo lleno, maltas, fruta madura, amargor y un final seco.

Bottle. 10.0%. Best before 10.09.20. Pours a somewhat hazy, reddish brown, with a frothy, light tan head. Bit of lacing. (Dark) fruity aroma, a wee bit tart, light berries, hint of yeast. Plums, light raisin as it warms. Flavour is dark fruits as well; plums, light yeast. Light malt in the background. Mildly bitter finish. Dark fruits again, bordering grainy. A bit tart. Mild alcohol burn, but nowhere near reflecting the actual content. A bit too much carbonation, which interferes with both the aroma and the flavour. Overall good though. 01.04.17.
330ml bottle. Pours a deep brown with small amounts of brown head. Rich caramel nose. Full body with the same sweet caramel flavours. Delicious beer.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2017 Suszone owoce, marmolada, karmel, lekki, rozgrzewający alkohol. Średnie ciało, dość wytrawne. Wysokie wysycenie, niska goryczka.

Flasche 0,33l: Kastanienbraun, dunkles Mahagoni, deutliche Trübung, sehr kräftiger stabiler grobporiger Schaum; in der Nase kräftige dunkle Süße, Malz, Malzzucker, Karamell, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, Rosinen, leichte Hopfennoten, Röstaromen, Tannine, kräftige süßlich-würzige Bitterkeit; im Körper schöne Süße, dunkle Fruchtigkeit, Malz, Malzzucker, Karamell, dunkle/eingelegte Früchte, Backpflaumen, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, Röstaromen, angenehme dunkel-fruchtige BItterkeit, Tannine, zunehmend trockener; angenehmer fruchtig-würziger Nachgang mit leichten Röstaromen

And now, for my 200th rating, what could be more appropriate than this splendid lady? Goddamn sweet and lovely, exactly what Im looking for when I drink strong beers. Sweet caramelized aroma, deep and complex taste, interesting abv and a delightful aftertaste. Very different from the Tripel variant, this one is definitely easier to drink despite its stronger abv. Well hidden alcohol. Ive gotta try the other ones, only tried the Tripel and Wit for now but I really want more! Superb! APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW!

33 cl. bottle @ Home.
Aroma: not very intense. Toasted malts, fruits, spices. Hints of wine, grapes, alcohol, raisins.
Appearance: dark caramel-brown color with very much above average head thickness. Off-white super creamy foam made of small bubbles. Its dark but it seems clear. Above average persistence. Low Brussels lacing.
Taste: medium-high sweetness, low bitterness, no sourness. Flavors of malts and toasted malts, caramel, fruits, raisins, figs, with hints of grapes, wine. On the sweet side of flavors.
Palate: medium body, dense oily-silky texture, low carbonation, very long bittersweet (much more sweet than bitter) finish of caramel, toasted malts, fruits, yeast, wood, wine overtones, grapes, spices, prunes, raisins, figs.
Overall: very good appearance with not very intense aromas. Very pleasant and intense flavors of malts, toasted malts, caramel with hints of wine, grapes, spices,raisins, fruits, figs. Alcohol is very well hidden under those strong and sweet flavors. Very good mouthfeel. Very complex and good beer.

Bottle, 0.33l. Deep ruby pour, slightly cloudy. One finger creamy beige head. Excellent retention, thick lacing. Nose is hravy malt, yeasty, slightly woody with a touch of liquor. Nice.

Medium body with slightly higher then average carbonation. Nice and lively on the tongue. Smooth texture. Bittersweet and slightly boozy, nicely balanced taste. Rich aroma, tasty and complex. Caramel malts, belgian yeast. Touch of chocolate and cocoa. Herbal liquor, a bit peppery. Subtle sugary molasses. Vanilla. Cake-like mouthfeel. Earthy hops in the aftertaste leading to a mildly bitter finish, slightly dry.

Overall, excellent quad. Absolutely delicious.
Fin kastanjebrun med lyst beige skum. Karamell og tørket frukt i smak og duft. Finner ikke den kompleksiteten som forventes.

bottiglia 33 cl, schiuma media grana beige media persistenza, color mogano, al naso banana pera e alcool, in bocca malto tostato caramello note speziate e alcool, lievemente oleosa, carbonatazione media, corpo strutturato, inizialmente dolce che svanisce con amaro nel finale. Non mi ha entusiasmato, la riproverò.

(bottle 0,33l)
Aroma: Sweet, strong alcohol, dried fruits.
Appearance: Hazy brown color. Long lasting, creamy, beige head.
Taste: Chocolate, sweet, dried fruits, alcohol.
Palate: Medium-full body. Light sticky texture. Alcohol warm/spicy, light bitter finish.
Overall: Tasty, malty, fruity.

Corked and caged bottles dark brown, mostly clear, with a big dark tan head. Lots of lacing. Aroma: dark dried fruits, honey, apples, molasses, yeast. Taste: raisins, figs, dates, prunes, apples, molasses. Rich and savory. One of my favorite go-to Belgians.

Most excellent quad, dark and dense, very fruity aroma, malty, slight bitterness and underlying sweetness throughout. Tastes like fruity alcohol, raisins, figs, a complex and very pleasing combination of flavors. From a bottle in my cellar, outstanding.
Fairly weak pour with very little head retention. Recovers with its aroma and flavors of plum and other red fruits. Crisp and wonderful.

Pours dark brown color with beige medium head. Taste of caramel, molasses, toffee, roasted malts. Taste of caramel, biscuit, raisin, dark fruits, blackcurrant, fig. Full body with low carbonation, sweet finish.

Bomber pours a medium dark brown with minimal head as expected, nose is laden with dark fruit n sweet malt, getting some toffee n brown sugar, mouthfeel follows suit with figs and a pleasing estery feel, quite light to medium bodied at first, brings on some alcohol legs that warms the palate and leaves a perfectly balanced fig n raisin action, a well crafted quad that is a nice warmer for sure for an impending noreaster?

08-03-17 // bottle at home. Bottled: 2014 Gushing! Pours a dark brown beer with a small light beige head. Coffee, chocolate, plum, dried fruits, sweet malty, caramel. Texture was very silky, light soapy, dont know if this is intended. Definitely need to retry this beer.

11.2 oz bottle pours dark hazy brown with a sudsy, off white head. Aroma is fruity with some yeast esters, brown sugar. Taste is very complex and interesting. Notes of figs, raisins, rum, bananas, chocolate and caramel malts. This has a slight hop aftertaste. Awesome Belgian quad!
Murkish brown colour. Smell of figs and brandy soaked raisin and ripe bananas. Quite complex, medium body. Also, taste of taste and hints of alcohol. Not so sugary which is quite nice.
Medium to low lacing. Faint sweetness & cocoa gives way to a slight overpowering booziness and a hint of soap. Tried this alongside Westvleteren 12 and they are markedly different.

Bottle at Strawberry Thief, Bristol.
Small, off-white head, dark red/copper colour, clear. Aroma: cherries, berries, alcohol. Dry/alcohol taste. Full body, long finish, lively. Heavy, strong, quite good, however too much alcohol as for me.

Ponoć klasyk, przyszła pora i na mnie żeby spróbować :) 
Zapach bardzo bogaty, rodzynki, daktyle, cukier, muscovado, praliny. Bardzo przyjemny i sporo się dzieje 
Wygląd: Kolor coca-coli, nieprzejrzysty. Piana wzbudza się duża, wysoka, acz bardzo brzydka. Pęcherzyki tworzą się niregularne jak w domowym piwie 
Smak: Sporo cukowej słodyczy, rodzynki, ciemne winogrona. Dużo alkoholu. Całkiem wodniste i "niepełne" 
Odczucie w ustach: sporo gazu, goryczki brak, alkohol zbytnio wyczuwalny i przeszkadzający, zalega w przełyku 
Ogólnie: Piwo dobre, ale nie pozbawione wad. Jak na dosyć dostępnego abt warto spróbować.
330 bottle at home. Complex full-bodied beer, with a fruity and malty aroma. One of the best representations of Belgian beer.s

Huge, rich aroma filled the air with dark fruits, berry, plum & dark spirits. 
Very smooth on the palate. Medium to full bodied. Slight tingle on the back. 
Taste is very much as the aroma. Malt, demerara sugar, yeast, vanilla & caramel followed on the aft by dark fruits, dark spirits, hints of hops & really long finish.

Birra dal color ambrato torbido. Schiuma color caffellatte non troppo persistente. Allolfatto frutta secca, banana, caramello e toffe. Al palato, corpo pieno con note di frutta secca, caramello, liquirizia. Un ottima birra da conversazione.
By far my favorite after dinner beer. Complex taste with a bit of sweetness and a complex aroma, with a nice silky finish. Excellent through and through

a bottle from lApero, drunk at home. Aroma: malty, grassy, smells very fresh. Appearance: hazy, dark chocolate brown, 2-3 mm. tan head. Palate: full-bodied and thick, average carbonation. Long, very complex and well-balanced finish. Taste: caramel, coffee, vanilla, the alcohol is not at all intrusive. This is delicious, a superior beverage.

Aż taki frykas to nie jest. Przydkie drożdźowe flachory wlały mi się do szkła - od początku nalewania. Na początku zniechęca mocno drożdżowo-skisły zapach. Po ogrzaniu jest lepiej. Natomiast w smaku dużo bardziej przyjemne. Jedna buteleczka dziś, a drugą zostawiam do testu porównawczego z Westvleteren 12 - kiedyś tam.
A grumsy red brown ale with small white head. The aroma is a bit fruity with a medium carbonation and a bitter Taste of alkohol and malt.

Not a bad beer beer at all, but anyone who gives this top marks really has not tasted good Belgian beer, not a patch on Westvletteten 12 which it often gets compared to for whatever reason, a good all round dark beer, but not at all remarkable 7.5 out of 10 at the very most, worth a try but keep your expectations low
Bottle at home. Pours reddish brown. Taste of raisins, plums, dar fruit, yeast. Pleasent and drinkable belgian. Medium carbonation. Very good.

330ml bottle. Pours deep ruby with average white head. Aroma of fruits, yeasts, spices, malts. Medium body with lively carbonation. Taste is medium sweet and well balanced, light, bitter with dry finish. Great beer.

Pours with a decent foam, color is that of dark brown mead. The complex aroma is inviting and fruity, reminiscent of mead again. Aroma has raisins and apple juice as dominant aromas, but additionally one can find coconut and strawberry for example. Palate is perfectly balanced (like a perfect palate would be), very pleasant. Taste is sweet and very rich with slight bitterness being mixed with the sweetness and has raisins, plum juice, faint burnt notes and some alcohol. A very interesting balance between very rich taste, but still not overwhelming to not be refreshing as well. An excellent beer in this genre and would deserve the place as the worlds best beer instead of Westvleteren 12.

The St. Bernardus Abt 12 is the pride of our stable, the nec plus ultra of our brewery. Abbey ale brewed in the classic ’Quadrupel’ style of Belgium’s best Abbey Ales. Dark with a full, ivory-colored head. It has a fruity aroma, full of complex flavours and excels because of its long bittersweet finish with a hoppy bite. Worldwide seen as one of the best beers in the world. It’s a very balanced beer, with a full-bodied taste and a perfect equilibrium between malty, bitter, and sweet. One of the original recipes from the days of license-brewing for the Trappist monks of Westvleteren.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: 330 ml, Price: 2,09 eur 
Labai, labai didelė puta..
Full bodied, and basically the perfect embodiment of the style. Worth rebuying.

Bomber from Whole Foods Market Reston
Aroma: caramel, dark fruits, Belgian yeast
Appearance: dark amber with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Perfect

Dark, dark brown and relatively clear with lots and lots of light brown head. Treacle aroma, very sweet. Less boozy than expected on the nose. Taste is a little more boozy, however it is quite well rounded with the sweetness. Once again treacle, caramel. Dark , crystal-y sugar flavours. Fair amount of malty earth taste. Finishes off with some bitterness. Not too oily in the mouth, still thick though. Goes down smooth. Lots to this beer, different with every sip. Q

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017 I have been looking forward to sampling Abt 12 for a long time. Comes out of a 750 ml bottle purchased at the friendly supermarket. Nice intro, a dark body with a red undertone and a plentiful light tan head. Its nose is sweet dark fruit and banana. I taste plum, raisin, malt and a touch of red licorice. No spiceiness like others. Not my top Belgian, but certainly top tier.

Bottle. (1) BB date May 2011; Drank Feb 2008; (2 & 3) BB date Nov 2012; Drank Dec 2008 & Feb 2009 - Sweet, very malty. Very fruity; dark fruits, raisins & berries, spices. Caramel, brown sugar and honey? Chocolate. Yeasty; lots of floaties. Very, very smooth. No bitterness. Alcohol very well disguised. Terrific beer! 
(2009-02)
black, clear, frothy, tan foam, and there is some spalls in it. banana, bread, grass, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter,

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Deep amber with a medium beige head. Aroma is chocolate, caramel, dried and red fruits (raisins, plums, raspberry, cherries), floral and herbal notes. Taste is chocolate, caramel, honey, raisins, raspberry, molasses, some yeast, alcohol and herbal notes. Warming mouthfeel. Light sweet aftertaste, with some bitterness and sourness. Very balanced. Great beer!

Am I drinking beer or am I drinking liquor? To be honest its good, I like it, but Ive come to realise that trappist beers are not for me. Has an intense aroma of raisins, nuts, and bourbon. Taste is very strong, maybe a bit too sweet in my opinion. Although having a decent fizziness at first, it vanished almost completely by the time it reached the bottom third. Quite slimy also. Strong alcohol presence in the vein of most beers in this style. Ive liked it more than some other quadrupels, but still not my favourite style.

17/20 huge huge taste, plums grapes, strong, red cheeks by end of bottle, so luxurious. Bit like rochefort 10. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Very dark. A lot of dark fruits to the nose. Very yeasty, hints of banana. Very carbonated. Taste is mesmerizing, Burns in a delicate way as it goes down. Its a dream
Malty and alcoholic. Well balanced with a lean to the malty and dark side. Yeast throughout with a caramel sweetness. Dark fruits. Medium-heavy body.

We were so excited to try this Belgian quadrupel, having seen it around for $7/bottle or $24/4-pack and miraculously catching a single bottle for $4.50. It is darker than many Belgians-- a red-brown color-- with a caramel, molasses aroma, some bitterness and light sweetness, and a long finish. You cant smell the 10% alcohol but you can definitely taste it- it contributes to the overall taste and length of the finish. Very yummy and deserves the great reputation!

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2017 Bottle. Color: Dark ruby, frothy beige head. Taste: Dark roasted malts, very ripe red fruit, plum, raisins and caramel. Earthy and fruity, lightly bitter finish. Medium body. Pretty much carbonation. A little bit too harsh in my opinion. Overall a nice beer, but not one of the best for me...

Legendary beer but I wouldnt say its best in its class. Maybe in TOP3. Nice aroma, nothing special in it though, pretty modest aroma. Taste is medium sweet. Honey and candy sugar. Lacks a bit of bitterness at the end, aftertaste is too sweet for my taste. Didnt find that hoppy bite. Certainly a very good beer and alcohol well hidden.
Dark, full bodied, intense, creamy head, malty and caramel aroma, simply delicious

Probably had this one 20-30 times during the years, also had the occasion to try it on tap. Wanted to review this so many times, and finally writing some notes at home from the PC, with a 33 cl in St. Bernardus glass. ------ Pours a medium to abundant, off-white-gray to light beige, creamy head, which keeps an extremely long lasting layer; typical deep and dark mahogany brown appearance. Smells straight off raisins and ripe fruit, sweet spiced, leathery, huge and top quality belgian yeast background. Tastes all sorts of dried fruits and nuts, brown sugar, figs, creme caramel, blended all together by that yeast character; medium plus , very nice and smooth sweetness, almost medium bitterness; very complex and balanced. Medium carbonation, full bodied and quite creamy. Rich and refined. With the Rochefort 8/10 (Westvleteren...) this is the belgian dark ale reference brew; both of which are slightly better than the already awesome chimay blue. Its the benchmark, it defines the style, strong ales in general rarely (never) get better than this.

Abt 12 is an absolute winner. It has a splendid beige and persistent foam. Aroma of Belgian yeast, spices and sweet ripe fruit. The taste is incredible. It contains both dark caramel, raisins, prunes, some cherries and an elegant spicy finish which otherwise found only in oak aged beer. Carbonation is low as hop bitterness as well, and it is hard to taste the alcohol strength at 10%. It is definitely a beer to be enjoyed temperate to retain all tastes. Room temperature must be perfect. This beer is from this moment become one of my favorites.
Intense brown colour with white head. Aroma of malt, caramel. High carbonation with medium body ant taste of brown sugar, malt.
En klassiker. Stor smag af mørke malte det passe perfekt til sødmen. Alkoholen giver en fin varme oveni.

Bottle from Beer Hawk. Aromas of caramel and raisin. Incredibly carbonated, almost stings the tongue. Tastes of caramel with a bitter biting finish. Certainly not "seen as one of the best beers in the world". Very drinkable but nothing exceptional.
UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 Virkelig en god og spæmndende øl, der absolut kan anbefales. Tilpas med sødme i smagen. Alkoholen er ikke for gennemtrængende. Ok udseeende.

Barwa ciemna, cola. Piana sycząca, szybko znika. Wysycenie wysokie. Aromatjest wysokiej jakośći: ciemne suszone owoce, rodzynki, figi. Szlachetny alkohol. W smaku sporo słodyczy, cukier kandyzowany, ciemne owoce, jak w aromacie. Bardzo dobre piwo.
Shared bottle at Addys. Honestly dont remember much except that the beer was exceptional- dark, delicious, well- balanced and somewhat mysterious. I need to find another one and pay more attention.

330 ml bottle from Co-op. Pour is deep reddish brown with small off white head. Lots of caramel and malt, some spice, a little barnyard. Taste is complex dried fruit, more malty grains, somewhat sweet but well balanced. Very smooth, medium body, good carbonation. Wonderful.

Pours a murky brown with a beige head. The nose has mineral, somewhat sweet caramel and lots of yeasty notes, phenols and esters, bread and a slight banana sensation. Again somewhat mineral flavourwise turning towards caramel malts, bready undertones, slight bitterness and finishes with sweet quad notes and hints of alcohol.. nice beer but no 4.1 beer in my book.

From 330ml bottle. Pours very dark brown, almost black. Small off white head. Soft carbonation. Not a huge aroma. Fruity, malty taste with raisins, hops and sweet prune. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is dark sugars. Mouthfeel is overcarbonated. Nose has that also. Taste has some metallic elements. Sweet candy but still a bit thin. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
´Dimmig brun öl med inslag av rött. Doft av torkad frukt, banan och jästig kryddighet. I smaken tilkommer komplex maltighet, viss alkoholsötma och karamell. Välbalanserad.

UPDATED: JAN 15, 2017 Piwo metne w kolorze brazowym z plywajacymi drobinkami. Nalewa sie z niezbyt obfita i szybko redukujaca sredniopecherzykowa piana w lekko bezowym kolorze. W aromacie belgijskie drozdze, suszone ciemne owoce, karmel i cukier. W smaku polslodkie bez goryczki z wysyceniem na srednim poziomie. Mamy sliwki, figi i daktyle polaczone ze lekkim biszkoptem. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, pelne i gladkie cialo, bardzo zlozone a zarazem bardzo dobrze pijalne. To jest lepsze niz inne, nawet lepiej oceniane Quadruple.

Pours hazy brown. Medium beige head. Aroma of hops, wholegrain bread, sugary, caramel, raisins, dried friuts. Taste lightly toasted bread, brown sugar, dried figs. Smooth, full bodied, light finish with some alcohol, medium carbonation.

Pours a hazy mahogany brown with a small head of tan foam. Lots of sediment suspended in the body. Light carbonation and some lacing. Strong aroma of dark fruits and spices. Medium body with a light tingling sensation. Full mouth feel. Tastes of dark fruit, caramel, and light spices. Smooth finish and a nice lingering warm aftertaste. Very enjoyable. Hides the alcohol well. Feels just a little light for a quad?
Bottle at home. Pours dark brown with medium sized off-white head. Aroma is yeast and dried fruits. Taste has dried fruits, yeast and caramel.

Top 5 rated quad, very easy to get, not cheap but not ridiculously priced either. Liking this so far. Sweet and fruity aroma, brighter than other quads I have tried. Flat dark brown color with a large off white head. Tastes a bit oaky with dark fruit and a slightly metallic aftertaste. Great palate, very easy drinking. Overall this was pretty good, better in my opinion than Rochefort 10. The aftertaste does take it down a few notches.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Kolor ciemny miedziany, skromna pianka. W aromacie suszone owoce, karmel. Smakuje suszonymi owocami, przede wszystkim rodzynki i daktyle. Alkohol w smaku niewyczuwalny, jednak przyjemnie ogrzewa przełyk. Piwo jest doskonale ułożone. Świetny quadrupel.

Dune belle robe brune foncée, elle laisse tout de même la lumière passée au travers, elle est coiffée dune belle mousse. Au nez, cest fameux, du malt très foncé, du caramel, du sucre dorge, cest légèrement fruité. Au goût, cest sucré, lamertume assez présente, très malté, des notes de prunes, de caramel, bien balancé, lalcool passe presque inaperçu au goût. Très bon!
La quadruple proche de la perfection. Robe sombre laissant bien filtrer la lumière. On est sur le grain torréfié. Le caramel. La prune cuite. Très ronde. Souple. Une grande reussite.
On tap at Bangers. Enjoyed this more than I thought I would, the spicy yeast flavour is very subtle and the complex dried fruit flavours balance perfectly, almost no hint of the ABV, excellent.

Butelka 330 ml. Wszystko piękne, pełny smak, klasyczne mrowienie na podniebieniu przy wysokim wysyceniu. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, mimo 10% ABV. Kolor jakby śliwkowy, ciemnorubinowy/jasnobrunatny. Piana ładna, choć myślałem że bardziej ozdobi szkło. W aromacie śliwki, rodzynki i inne suszone takie takie. Fajne, wytrawne. Hehe, długi termin ważności.
沉鬱的個人靜

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
A lot of plum, raisin and dates, some honey in the aroma. Unfortunately some wet cardboard also present.
Pours dark brown with ample tan head decent lacing aroma is a bit sour, sweet and pine. Love the taste which is malty and sweet but not so much.

Bottle. Dark reddish brown. Lots of floaties. Huge head. Aroma is sweet. Sugar, yeast, fruity, acidic. Taste: dark berries, banana, malts, caramell, prune, sugar, yeast. A touch of vanilla and something medicinical, phenolic. Strong carbonation. Long lasting and warming aftertaste. Hoppy and sour finish. You definitely can sense the alcohol but its very well integrated. A marvellous beer but I still prefer the offerings from the likes of Rochefort and Chimay.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel and malt. Taste is moderate sweet and light bitterness. I got some toffee and treacle flavours in there. Decent but I wasnt blown away.

03-DEC-2016, bottle @home, from Fakta.
Hazy, dark brown with a lasting, off-white head.
Aroma is sweet fruit, bread, and caramel.
taste the same with some hops. Medium+ body, medium carbonation. Sweet and bitter finish. This is OK. I never realy get to appreciate these Quads. Or perhaps I have grown out of them?

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2016 Denne quadrupel har et uklart mørkt udseende med et svagt hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød karamel aroma med frugt. Øllen smager meget sødt deraf og med mørk malt, hvilket gør at det søde karamel og frugt passer perfekt til øllen. Medium karbonering.
Fanboy ! Noget af det Af det bedste du kan få! Fungere også fint på fad! Og så til den pris! Wow!

Dark amber with solid off white head - Dark malt aroma with some fruity notes - Good dark malt body with some fruity notes and just a hint of hop - The dark fruity dark malt flavour goes into the finish .- This was real good

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours dark copper with limited white foam. Aroma is caramel and fruits under spirits. Spices as well. Body is medium-thick, with quote some carbonation and stickiness. Taste has strong sweetness and only very limited bitterness. Finish is sweet but not too persistent.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Mi quad favorita. En nariz fruta madura y algo de caramelo. Buen cuerpo. Bastante carbónico pero sin picar. En boca toffee, malta tostada y fruto secos. Cálida, pero con el alcohol muy bien integrado. Para mi es la menos dulce de las quads, y por ello es la que más me gusta.
Очень вкусный Бельгий& квадрюп& красивы& цвет, хороший солодов& аромат и вкус, приятно& послевк& хорошая плотнос& алкогол& хорошо запрята& качеств& пиво! Дата розлива 05.04.2016. (Bottle 0,33/ 10%)

Pours a deep mahogany colour with a thin off white head. The aroma is sweet, caramel like with a hint of spice. The taste is caramel, raisins, plums, cherries, yeast spiciness with a solid malt backbone and an oaky quality. My overall impression of the taste is slightly sweet but well balanced, with hints of bitterness and no indication of the 10%abv. Its a smooth, light to medium bodied beer with high carbonation. Delicious, complex, but not overwhelming like similar Belgians.

Bottle. Dark brown with fizzy off white head. Aroma: sweet, banana, dark dried fruits, hints of apricot. Complex taste. Bread and bread malty bread. And I like the balance between sweet and bitter in the end. Very fine beer.
Its repot nice alright, doesnt have a head, though and the taste isnt quite as full and engaging. I get why this is well regarded its certainly a beer to savour.

Aroma: Medium dark fruit, plums, raisins. Medium-light toffee, marshmallow. Light alcoholic, rose. Light molasses
Appearance: Clear, dark copper body. Small, light-brown head. Low retention.
Flavour: Medium-light licorice, bready. Medium bitterness. As it warms up, it becomes a soy like flavour, with some banana notes in the background. Dry finish with lingering alcoholic heat and licorice.
Mouthfeel: Light warming.Medium-light body. Medium-high carbonation.
Overall: The beer starts off very one-sided, but it grows in depth as it warms up. However, the beer does not quite meet the richness of the best of styles.

330 ml bottle, poured.
26D. Belgian Dark Strong Ale

Big bottle, probably 4 years old, served in goblet. Pours deep amber with great and creamy, slightly beige head. Great retention. Aroma is just a punch of dried fruits, caramel, candid sugar, grapes, bread. It has everything a top quad should have. Taste is quite intensive, lots of maltiness, caramel, nuts, dried fruits, very sweet, but quite dry in aftertaste, long and warming finish. Delightful beer.

Bottle 33 cl. Che dire? Classica trappista allaspetto ma con un gusto unico. Aroma luppolato e sapore intenso come poche sui generis. Vaniglia, banana, caramello si fondono per qualcosa di indefinibile...unica pecca (ma non che sia sempre un male) L alcohol è un po troppo pronunciato. Santé

Piwo brunatne z obfitą pianą, która szybko się redukuje. W aromacie suszone owoce, daktyle, drożdże. Dwa podejścia do smaku - piwo wysoko wysycone. To wysokie wysycenie aż drapie w język. Gdy jedna trochę się odgazuje piwo staje się przyjemne - winne posmaki, suszone owoce, kandyzowany cukier.

Poured from 22 oz bottle. Pours brown dark amber with off white head. Aroma is dark dried fruit and yeast. Champagne bubbly mouthfeel. Flavor starts with a sweet fruity dark dried fruit, candied sugar, raisins, and finishing with a yeasty fruitiness.

I could go on all day being fluffy and sophisticated, but I go by the overall experience with the beer. My rating system is Never Again, Drinkable and Lovely.

This beer is Lovely. It just is. Those monks know something. OK: smooth, malty, decent head (if head matters), nice aftertaste. There is a definite reason this beer rates 100,
Draught at Fran Well Oktoberfest. Clear chestnut brown with little head. Sweet malt with a slightly sour finish. Not much hop taste. Very smooth.

Aromat - czerwone jabłko, toffi, rodzynki, lekko cherry i melasa.
Piana - średnia, ale obfita. Szybko się dziurawi. nie zdobi szkła.
Wysoka słodycz, i takież wysycenie. nuty porto w smaku, delikatny karmel, lekkie praliny, coś na kształt ciasteczek . Alkohol nieobecny. Goryczka niska.
Pours with moderate head. Dark copper in color. Aroma has Pear. Feels oily in the mouth. Taste has cider and dark chocolate, with a bitter bite. Aftertaste of salty vodka. Quite dry.

(Bottle)
Aroma:sweet toased malt,dark fruits,bread and caramel.
Appearance:dark copper color,medium-sized yellowish head.
Taste:sweet flavour of toased malt,bread dark fruits (mainly prunes) ,sweet spicy finish,dry boozy and malty aftertaste
Palate:medium.body,slightly oily texture,strong carbonation, quite boozy.
Overall:Ok-ish but it lacks darker malty flavours.

From the bottle poured into Trappist glass pours dark brown with off white head that lasts some time. Nose is roasted malt liquorice and some faint booze. Taste is slightly hoppyy roasty and some dry liquorice... Finish is quite some hoppy bitterness for a Quad...  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

10%ABV. Abbey quad.

Poured out dark red brown. 30ºSRM.

Nose has stone dust, old dry wood, sawdust, nutty roasted aromas as well. Sweet. There are toast and black bread flavors.

Mouthfeel is carbonated. Palate is sweet toasted malt with caramel, southern praline, toasted pecans and hazelnuts. Noble hops and alcohol at the end. There is a hint of wormwood and sandalwood in the finish that is perfumed and woody. Adds some layers to the bitter flavor that you get at the tail end.

Finish is beery and noble hop bitter.

Very pleasant and demonstrating the classic palate of an abbey quad.

Goes on Favorites List!
Dark dried fruits in aroma and taste paired with caramel and alcoholic smooth bitter sweet dark malty finish.

Brune trouble surmontée dune belle mousse ivoire onctueuse. Le nez est superbe, avec des arômes de fruits rouges : cassis, griotte, fraise des bois, mûre, framboise, myrtille; de fruits secs : figue, raisin, pruneau; de sucre candi, de sirop dérable, de pain dépice, de vanille... Derrière, le cacao et le café, signe dun malt magnifiquement torréfié. On ne sent pas lalcool, et les houblons sont subtils car on devine lamertume avec des pointes de citron/citron vert, tel un tonic. Juste sublime darômes, de complexité et déquilibre, la perfection... Carbonatation soutenue. En bouche, très belle attaque avec une amertume marqué et lalcool qui se révèle sur des arômes de kirsch, de mirabelle, de prune. La seconde bouche est toute aussi ferme, mais va sorienter sur le malt et le sucre. Les suivantes sont toutes aussi jouissives, avec le houblon, le malt et le fruit, omniprésents et à parts égales. On atteint ici des sommets déquilibre. Les levures saffirment en fin de bouche. Au palet après une longue gorgée, on a limpression davoir mangé une bonne pâtisserie arrosée dun alcool noble. Sur la toute fin, on découvre des arômes de pomme et de poire... Surprenant et inespéré ! Une bière unique, qui na dégale que la Trappiste Rochefort 10 dans le style. Le summum tout simplement, et un plaisir à chaque fois renouvelé. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.

Incredible! 10abv. Malty with loud alcohol flavor. Who cares, b/c it's so damned good. Abt means "highest rank" as an Abbey beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at home, paired with a stew made with this same beer. Appearance: dark reddish brown with medium ivory-white head. Aroma: red fruits, burnt sugar, belgian yeast, plums. apricot. Taste: high sweetness and medium bitterness. Quite boozy. Notes of red fruits, brown sugar, raisins, bread and yeast. Palate: full bodied, oily texture and lively carbonation.

Very dark pour with lightly colored puffy head. Aroma is dates, raisins, slight roasted caramel. Flavor is delicate caramel malt with dried fruit. Very high carbonation. Lingering finish.

Its been 10 years since I first had this. It once was in my top five and its now just very good. Speaks a lot to the current market.

Jolie robe brun-rouge rubis avec une mousse de couleur crème et moyennement persistante.La carbonatation est assez intense.Le nez nous offre des arômes de malts,fruits rouges et des pointes de réglisse éphémères.La bouche nous amène sur une douce amertume avec un côté "piquant" mêlée aux saveurs fruitées et épicées.La finale nous laisse sur un ensemble très riche et parfaitement équilibré.Une quadruple qui nous donne envie de revenir pour continuer de découvrir ses différentes subtilités gustatives cachées !!!!!!

Dégustée dans un verre Maredsous.
Température de début 9 à 10°.
Belle robe brun rouge avec une mousse beige de persistance moyenne; carbonatation soutenue.
Nez sur les fruits noirs et le malt avec une touche vineuse et un soupçon de levure.
Le goût offre une très vaste palette : dattes,prunes,figues ...
Léquilibre douceur/amertume est idéal et en se réchauffant un peu dautres saveurs se révèlent ; certaines identifiables(chocolat,pain,épices) et dautres sous-jacentes ... la levure fait aussi son retour.
La finale est très longue et exceptionnelle sur un alcool chaleureux et une douceur bienvenue.
Une quadruple idéale en automne.

330ml bottle pours dark brown with light foamy head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and dried fruit. Tastes of plum, bread, yeast, brown sugar and spice. Very smooth and refreshing with plenty of champagne-like fizz and alcohol. Lacks the layering and finish of some other abbey ales.

Appearance: deep brown, slight head
Aroma: raisin, plums, fruits
Mouthfeel: medium Mouthfeel and carbonation
Taste: similar to Aroma, plums, raisins, caramel, no alcohol despite the 10%
Overall: great quadruple
Very good, classic Belgian quadupel. Lots of dried fruits and esters, nice warming feeling and good mouthfeel. Lacking some of the complexity of Rochefort and Westvleteren.

Bottled aged for 2.5 years. Brown color with tones of yeast swimming in the glass. Soapy head. Fantastic aroma of grape juice, caramel, plums, plum marmalade, some sweet red wine, blue berries. Taste mirrors the aroma plus tons of caramel, red grapes. Alcohol completely hidden. Overall mind blowing.

Aromat delikatny, ale bogaty, przede wszystkim słodowość i karmelowość. Do tego suszone owoce, w miare ocieplania sie coraz mocniejsze. Barwa głęboko bursztynowa, przechodząca w miedziany, lekko zamglony. Piana dosyc wysoka, średniopęcherzykowa, szybko opadła. W smaku - lekka słodowość, po czym przychodzą mocne suszone owoce. Piwo słodkie, z lekko gorzkim finiszem. Czuć alkohol, ale szlachetny, lekko grzejący w przełyk. Piwo dosyć nasycone, zdradliwie pijalne.
Belle robe ambrée claire, très bon goût très goût sans aucune amertume. A tester absolument

Drinking a 2007 bottle in 2016. Pours a rich brown. Aroma of sweet buns, toffee, and earthiness. Flavor is soft and slightly oily with a hint of coffee and toffee. Smooth, and comforting. I do not know if I should have drunk it earlier and kept some of the rawness.

Aromat suszonych owoców, nalewki wiśniowej, rodzynek, brzoskwiń z nutą alkoholu, karmelu i gumy balonowej. Smak podobny, zresztą tutaj nie ma co dużo pisać, to wspaniałe piwo, jeden z najlepszych przedstawicieli stylu.
Bottle - clear dark brown color, small but stable slightly brown head. Aroma is coffee, toffee, dark malts. Very high carbo on the tongue. Medium sweet. Finish is Sherry, alcohol.

Magnum bottle 2013 vintage. Lots of carbonation. Yeasty, caramel, fudge and roasted bread. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Older bottle getting near the drink by date into Duvel tulip. Tastes very old and monastic. One of the best monks brews. Hard to tell the difference between this and a Westie XII. Good nutty aroma. Pours cloudy brown. Nutty aroma and tastes that way too. Great mouthfeel. Not much head but every time you disturb the glass creates tons of champagne-like bubbles. Boozy big beer but the taste is well hidden. A great beer that is much easier to find and cheaper than its counterparts. Great stuff.

Bottle. Dark brown with fizzy off white head. Aroma: sweet, banana, dark dried fruits, hints of apricot. Complex taste. Bread and bread malty bread. And I like the balance between sweet and bitter in the end. Very fine beer.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2017 Barwa ciemna. Piana gęsta, obfita, drobna. Aromat intensywny. Ciemne owoce, karmel, czekolada, pieczywo... W smaku

UPDATED: SEP 12, 2016 Subtle smell with banana and yeast. Taste is considerably drier than some strong Belgian beers, which is nice. Banana, figs, creaminess from the wheat, subtle dark fruits, hint of coffee. Long finish. Balanced. Nice balance between serious and creamy smoothness. Always a good choice. Dont serve too cold.

Una abt de color marrón con toques naranjos y alta carbonatación. Su aroma es a toffee, caramelo, frutos oscuros como ciruelas . Su sabor es de un dulzor suave a toffee y caramelo con un final elegante de ciruelas y dátiles.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the bottle theres weak fruity and bready aroma, after pouring into glass walnuts are dominant.
Rather sweet, pretty nutty in the taste.
Feels pretty light for such a high abv%.
Not bad, but definitely not what i was expecting. Maybe i just got a faulty bottle.

330ml bottle: Pours a cloudy dark brown with fizzy off white head the dissipates. Aroma of caramel, dark fruits and malt. Tastes of dried prunes, caramel and some dark chocolate. Low bitterness, big bodied and low carbonation. Overall the flavours are bright, and well balanced.
Аромат диких луговых трав и спирта, вкус спирта и светлог& ячменно& хлеба

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2017 Color marrón oscuro, opaco, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de tres dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. Textura efervescente y untuosa. Aroma a manzana, azúcar, ligero cacao, dark fruits, pasas, alcohol. Sabor maltoso y dulce (muchas pasas, dark fruits, reminiscencias de cacao, caramelo). Mucho cuerpo. Final de amargor leve acompañado de buena dosis de alcohol (algo más remarcado que en aroma). Postgusto a dark fruits. Clásica y deliciosa.

Alcohol, toffee, winter fruits aromas. Big and balanced. Light palate. Lingering alcohol taste with a warming effect. Fizzy and acidic. Missing the champagne bubbles of Westvleteren XII but a great substitute.

Bottle 330ml (2015)  cellared for 1 year. Served at room temperature. Pours a murky, dark brown with a ruby tint. Head is large, beige, and is mostly lasting. Aroma is of herbaceous hops; wholegrain bread, Belgian candy sugar, overripe dark plums, raisins, pears skins, caramel, dried leaves, coriander, cinnamon and pepper. Flavour is exceptionally smooth with a light herbaceous-hop bitterness; lightly toasted wholegrain bread, dried currants, dried blueberries, plums, cooked brown sugar, dried leaves, hints of dark chocolate and notes of black pepper in the finish. Full bodied with medium carbonation, oily texture and a long, warming finish. An unbelievably smooth and well balanced Belgian Quad!
Bottle - pours brown with a small head. Aroma is sugary, rhubarb tartness, bit of yeast and dried fruit. Taste is sweet with a slight tartness. Palate is velvet smooth.

Gushing, Browm, nice head, high carbonation. Aroma: some strange tart notes, caramel, dark fruits. Heavy sweetness, full body. Taste: dark fruits, bread, esters, even some chocolate. Some bitterness at finish and lots of alcohol. Quite balanced.

Not really my kind of beer at the first taste, but became more pleasant after a few more. Mildly bitter taste. I also believe Ive tasted a nuance of vanilla. On the contrary to what every says, I think the alcohol taste is quite prominent. However, it is a pleasant level. Be sure to try it out ;)
Fruity aroma, dark brown color, nice beige head. I like it, it is very strong but you cannot sense the alcohol. But I got drunk after one.
I will have to try this one again, and get better tasting notes. I was out with family in a crowded small bar when I got this. I just remember it was one of my all time favorite beers.

Tout dabord lapparence est superbe, mousse dense et ambrée et une couleur de caramel avec des magnifiques reflets rouges. Des arômes subtils et équilibrés avec un note de fruits trop murs très agréable. légère pointe de réglisse à lattaque mais qui heureusement disparait très vite. Très onctueuse en bouche avec un goût est équilibré, tirant tout de même plus sur lamer que le sucré, amateur de bière "bubblegum" sabstenir. Bref une bière magnifique, seul reproche, son coté tellement parfait qui lui fait perdre un poil de personnalité.
This is a favorite beer. It just works. It is on the expensive side but well worth a try. Its considered one of the best and it is the best.
Pours fizzy amber/dark brown with big forthy brownish head. Malty aroma, raisins, dried fruits. Sweet taste with light malty bitter aftertaste. Nice quadrupel, balanced and not too strong flavours.

0.33 bottle, Pours dark brown color with high, mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma of fruits, flowers, yeast. Flavor is medium sweet, medium bitter, fruity, alcoholic. Finish is medium long and decent alcoholic warmth. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. I have to tell that this review is reflecting the fact that I think the bottle had a problem, cause it was flat, tasteless, like sour water, some kind of alcoholic water. Some flavour. Funny thing is that this bad bottle was better than most good conditioned other brand beers! ^^

33 cl bottle @Amarillo. Opaque dark brown with a average white head. Moderate malty aroma of dried fruits, caramel, resin, bread, yeasty and alcohol. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body, with a slick texture. Medium carbonation. Medium bitterness.

Pours a dark color and a beige head that fades quickly. Excellent fruity aroma, really complex.

Intense malty taste, but hides the alcohol really well. Very drinkable and perfect for a winter night. Ages very well.

One of the finest beers out there!

Burgundy pour, rupturing head falling to a small film. Bogglingly complex nose. Sweet dried cherries and fig, cola, caramel, red apple, baking spice, dark bread, floral, estery fruits, very delicate clove (thank god). Seemingly an enigma. Complex yet simple. Flavor is sweet ripe black cherries, whole grain bread, raisin and date, slight illusion of cocoa, estery spice strategically appears to contrast sweet notes, an utterance of earthiness. As of less than a week ago, Ive been a non-believer in Belgians. Delirium Nocturnum opened my eyes. Now I tried this. My mind, soul, and palate are satisfied and illuminated to the world of Belgian ales. Sincere complexity, sweet, but not cloying, a true testament to the ale. At $10.99, Ill be keeping some in my fridge at all times.
Flesje thuis gedronken. Donkerbruin, helder bier met stevig schuim. Weinig aroma, ietsje fruitig en hoppig. Smaak van koffie en donker fruit. Nasmaak is licht bitter.

Dark brown with ruby notes. Highish carbonation. Beautiful lacing. Aromas of caramel, phenols, rum, and lightly roasted nuts. Very smooth, surprisingly light bodied (Well not actually light bodied, but for its abv) It is a very sweet beer, but nicely balanced by the phenols and roasted flavors. Finishes with a touch of caramel on the tongue, before opening up into a spice clove-like finish. There just the slightest touch of acidity, which helps give this some dried fruit flavors. This is simply, an incredibly beer, very drinkable. One of the best beers in the world.

I am going to have to buy another from a different retailer to compare as this was sub par. 
Bottle at 12 degrees Celsius.
Aroma was a little funky, and the flavour was also strange. And I love big malty quads. Head was off white and fluffy, but didnt last. Will edit review after having another.
Dark brown color. Fruit aromas, spices, alcohol, brown sugar. Taste of fruits, caramel, sugar, spices, yeast and alcohol. Alcohol a bit too dominant. Really good Abt/Quad.
What have I been doing all of this fucking time I havent learnt of this great beer? Very balanced taste; strong and bittersweet finish...from now on, itll be one of my faves

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2016 33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora) U: donkerbruin met beige schuimkraag G: typische Bernardus-gist, chocolade en karamel S: zoetig, kruidig, chocolade met karamel in de afdronk M: volmondig met medium carbonatie

Határozott karamellás, gyümölcsös illat, kitöltéskor nagy hab, de gyorsan eltűnik, és csak 2 milliméter marad tartósan. Intenzív karamellás ízzel indít, erős gyümölcsössel folytatódik, majd édességgel és komlós keserűséggel cseng le, ami utóízében is megmarad. Érezni az erejét, ennek megfelelően igen testes sör. Ez bizony fincsi.
Couleur marron plutôt triste mais sinon pas grand chose de négatif à dire..de très bon arôme de pain, caramel et biscuit...tes bonne bière dans son genre «trappiste»

75 cl bottle. Dark brown colour with quickly disappering beige head. Aroma is malt, leather, nuts, caramel, notes of dark fruits. Taste is exceptional, with a sweet malty start going over to a blend of toffee, wine, nuts and dark fruits. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Very warming feel. Very pleasent sweet finish. This is how you connect flavours, simply outstanding.
From the bottled poured a very dark, amberish brew with a huge tan head. Fruity, malty aroma and flavor. This beer is one of my all time favorite Belgians.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 LOVELY/HOT STUFF/RUND/MALZBOMBE/FRUCHT/FETT/ALLMÄCHTIG.MY BEER!!!!! 0,1 vom Fass für einen Jetson beim ZYTHOS BEER FESTIVAL 2016 in Leuven. Aus der 0,33l Flasche, die ich in einem Supermarkt in Belgien erstanden habe, schmeckt das Bier ebenfalls sehr komplex. Lebkuchen, Sherryfass, Seife, Kräuter und der unbedingte Wille zur alkoholischen Wärmedecke, machen dieses Gesöff zum Rundumerlebnis. Ungesudet ein bisserl eleganter, aber auch nicht so fett....wie später mit Bodensatz. Bombe.

Labeerynt 14.06.2016. W aromacie suszone owoce, karmel, wanilia a wszystko to na słodko z lekko winnym akcentem  ładnie ale mało, naprawdę mało, intensywnie. Natomiast smak to aromat do sześcianu, majstersztyk, arcydzieło  słodki, treściwy, aksamitny nektar z delikatną niemal niezauważalną goryczką. Niesamowicie dobre piwo.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2016 Piana dość obfita, średnio i grubo pęcherzykowa, szybko opadająca do pierzynki. Barwa rubinowa, opalizująca. W aromacie słodko, przede wszystkim cała masa owoców kandyzowanych i suszonych, winogron, karmelu, przypraw, a nawet wanilii, porto, sherry... W smaku podobnie, spora słodycz o profilu rodzynek, daktyli, likieru waniliowego i miodu gryczanego. W posmaku lekka pikantność, fenolowość, do tego niska, ziołowa goryczka, delikatne rozgrzewanie od perfekcyjnie ukrytego alkoholu... Wysycenie średnie, drobniutkie, w odczuciu treściwe, wyklejające, może nie gęste, ale pełne i gładkie.
wietny Quadrupel, minimalnie może za słodki, tudzież odrobinę za niska goryczka, przez co sprawia wrażenie delikatnie niezbalansowanego, ale i tak jest klasa. 

Ps.

Piwo leżakowało u mnie dokładnie rok - możliwe, że świeże jest mniej słodkie, bardziej estrowe (brzoskwinie, morele itp)...

BBE 14.06.17, säilytetty kellarissa vähintään 2 vuotta. 75cl pullo. Ruskea, sameahko, kotikaljamainen, olematon vaahto. Makea rusinainen alkoholin huumaava tuoksu. Liukas, alkoholin luumuinen, jälkiruokamaisen makea, poltteleva, suussasulava, aromaattinen suutuntuma. Kiva quadi, jää kuitenkin vähän yksinuottiseksi ja valjuksi suussa.

Kran. Barwa ciemnobrązowa, prześwity pod światło, piana biała, niska, szybko opada. Aromat bogaty, przyprawowo-korzenny podparty karmelową podbudową słodową, lekkie aromaty chmielowe, lecz nie dominują. W smaku nuty razowego chleba, rodzynek i suszonych owoców. Ogólnie - bardzo złożone, lecz trochę mało wyraziste. Na plus świetnie ukryty alkohol.
Très bonne bière. Nez un peu fermé. Bouche ronde sucrée. Notes amères. Finale un peu courte. Complexe mais manque un peu de développement.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso con algunos destellos rojizos a contraluz, media baja actividad de carbonatación; corona de espuma color beige, copiosa y mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y abiertas.

AROMA: destacan las notas a azúcar no procesado, caramelo, ligeramente toffee, frutos oscuros muy maduros como ciruelas, dátiles, pasas, algunos frutos rojos, se percibe ligeramente lo especiado característico de la levadura belga, el alcohol se alcanza a percibir pero no es agresivo.

SABOR: el paladar sigue al aroma; al tocar el líquido la bocadestaca el azúcar no procesado, caramelo y toffee ligeramente seguido de los frutos oscuros madura, destacan las ciruelas además de dátiles y pasas, frutos rojos y muy sutilmente algunas notas características especiadas de la levadura; el retrogusto un amargor medio a ligero casi seco y con persistencia ligera del dulzor, no astringente.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio ligero con mediana a baja carbonatación. Se siente el alcohol en boca ligeramente y en garganta sólo como una sensación calurosa al pasar el líquido.

RESUMEN: una buena cerveza de acuerdo al estilo.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark copper with a beige head. Mild aroma of breadish malt and yeast. Full oily body with very soft carbonation. The intense taste is rather sweet and long lasting with some alcohol in the finish. Moderately malty, some caramel and honey, dried fruits. Good beer but not exceptional.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2016 0,33l bottle. Dark brown colour with quickly disappering beige head. Aroma: Chocolate, leather, nuts, caramel, notes of dark fruits. Taste: Oh my god! Sweet malty start but with dozen of taste. (toffee, wine, nuts, dark fruits) Almost no bitterness. Full bodied with surprisingly lively carbonation. Very warming feel. Very pleasent light sweet finish. I drunk it in a relatively cold temperature maybe a bit warmer would show more aroma and taste. Amazing quad anyway.
Great beer. Have it any day. Nice aroma ant great on palate. Taste just great hiding high alkohol well. Drink it anytime
Bottle at home. very smooth with nice foam, easy to drink considering its strength

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2016 Bottle at home. Very dark brown colour, big foamy beige head that leaves a nice, stable lacing. Dried fruits like figs, raisins and dades, some red fruits, roasted malty burnt sugar, light coffee, clove, a little boozy, liquorice and quite a dry and bitter finish (distinguishing it from Westvleteren 12 for me). Complex, but balanced and smooth! Sweet, fruity aftertaste. Good body, medium carbonation.

Brun i färgen. Stall och jäst i smaken. Lite frissig och lite för kolsyrad. En liten besvikelse lite för lätt smak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Seriously best fucking beer ever. A fifth of the price of Westvlteren. This is the real deal. Seriously thats it, go with the cheeky monk. He knows beer.

Lovely. Pours a lovely dark with good head. Be careful with the yeast, there is a lot of heavy yeast at the bottom. Tastes lovely, certainly in my top 5 and dare I say it challenges the mighty Rochefort 10? Maybe not but I certainly had to think about it which is high praise indeed.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Pours hazy brown with low offwhite head. Aroma is complex and sweet with caramel, dried fruit like prune and fig and coriander in the end. A bit of roasted maltiness too. Hints of winegum. Taste is sweet and complex with dried fruits, caramel, light and brown malts and slightly spicy. Ends in moderate bitterness with high drinkability, despite the alcohol level. Great one!
Wygląda przepięknie, choć nie obraziłbym się jakby było klarowne. Ładna piana, choć nietrwała. W aromacie czuję głownie przyprawy. Smakuje tak jak pachnie, alkohol super schowany. Bardzo dobre piwo/
Bottle. Brown with a small head. Nutty flavour and very smooth. Amazingly easy to drink considering its strength. Cant understand why I havent tried this one before.

Bought a 75cl bottle from an internet site. Gives a nice beige head when poured. Co2 is well balanced. Smell is a bit of alcohol and banana. Taste is malty and dried fruit. Mostly dried plum. Nicely hopped, and the alcohol is hidden. Something all beer lovers should taste once. Bought this one because West Vletteren is hard to get and expensive. They say it is a good clone..

Aromat średnio intensywny, ale jak na abta przystało bardzo przyjemny - figi, ciemne owoce, fenole, nalewka z aronii, wiele tu można wyczuć, można wąchać i wąchać. Z wyglądu ciemno brunatna ciecz z beżową, początkowo dumną, potem nieco skromniejszą czapą piany. Smak, tak jak aromat bardzo bogaty - ciemne owoce, figa, rodzynki, nieco wytrawnego wina, nieco aroniowej nalewki, troszkę alkoholu, ale z gatunku tych przyjemnych, rozgrzewających, fenole. Piwo degustacyjne, deserowe, cudnie bogate, zachęcające do samotnej spokojnej degustacji, skupienia. Świetne piwo, kolejna z belgijskich perełek, którą można wielokrotnie powtarzać.

33cl bottle at home. pours a dark brown colour with a reddish glow which has a big frothy beige head. Aroma of belgian yeast, dried fruits, caramel, candy sugar, malts, raisins, red fruits, prunes. Taste is fairly sweet, soft bitter with a warming boozy finish. notes of caramel, malts, raisins, yeast, liquorice, prunes, candy sugar, dates. Texture is sticky, full bodied with soft carbonation.
Tap. Brown, rocky head, white foam, medium bitterness, medium sweetness, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, & long finish.

UPDATED: DEC 10, 2016 Mahonie rood/bruin van kleur, 2 vinger hoge crèmekleurige schuimkraag die snel zakt naar een laagje. Je ziet mooi wat karamelvlekjes in het schuim.. net even donkerder. Aromas: Gedroogd rood fruit, rozijen, geroosterde mouten, karamel, brooddeeg. Een hint van alcohol bij opwarming net als de Belgische gisting met een vleug banaan wat naar voren komt.Smaak: Donkere mouten, Karamel, fruit (Pruim) ... zoet maar zeker niet te zoet. Gist, banaan en kruidige hops. De alcohol warmte is er maar toch blijft alles mooi in balans, het geeft net die kleine punch. Prima nabitter. Body is vol en mondgevoel is zacht en romig. Wieing CO2 en droog en bitter-zoet in de afdronk. Prachtige Quadrupel om lekker weg te nippen..... Topper!
Aromas of raisin skin, caramel, bread, and alcohol. Taste is dates, raisins, and Belgium sugar.
bruisende fenolen,volle donkere mouten met een bittere groene hop, karamelsuikers in de nasmaak,wrange fruittonen
Rich, deep mahogany with a thin tan head. A rich concoction. Complex and balanced. Loaded with character and it all comes together. Drinking it where its born makes it all the better.

Mahagony with little beige head. Aroma is plums, chocolate, caramel. Taste is sweetness (comparable with brown sugar) and also carbonation induced sourness. Stays long with a spicy finish. Overall very good.

Bottle from The Bottle Lab, Leek. Pours a deep ruby brown colour with a thin off white head. Aroma of chocolate, raisin, plum, prune, some brown sugar, slight cherry, a little Belgian yeast, subtle marzipan, a hint of caramel and tons of spice. Taste of raisin, plum, prune, some marzipan, caramel, slight brown sugar, a little Belgian yeast, clove, spice and subtle herbal hops. Full bodied, slick texture and moderate carbonation. A long, fruity, spicy bitterness in the finish. A perfectly balanced, complex quad. Tons of fruit and spice and only a hint of alcohol which is surprising. A great quality Belgian beer.

Look; beige head, dark mahogany-ruby misty body.
Aroma; soft n juicy caramels, yeast, leaves, floral meadow. 
Taste; big fruit bowl, prunes, caramel malts, yeasty juicy plums, 
finishes malty, juicy, with confectionery n caramels.
Palate; good, soft.
Overall; solid n tasty.
