Pours golden amber with a highly aggressive head. The usual caramel, malt and hints of honey. Strong alcohol presence is nice on a cold day and lingers through to a warm glow at the finish.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

750ml bottle aged 2 years. Beautiful mahogany pour with a big creamy tan cap that lasts FOREVER and leaves beautiful lace. Lots of Belgian yeast and spice on the nose; banana bread, steeped plums and prunes and grapes. This stuff is smoother than me talking to a pretty girl. Taste is sweet and dry, boozy but balanced. Next to Rochefort this is probably the best Abt Ive tried, and worthy of all the hype its gotten.
Belgians are true masters. Nice color, fantastic aroma and great taste. Top notch!

Mahogany brown color, creamy beige head. Belgian yeast nose, candi sugar, raisins, malty, hints of coffee and cloves. Rich malty taste, candi sugar, anise, Belgian yeast, hints of alcohol and marzipan. Full body, soft to average carbonation.

Wow. This is just great. Even my non-beer-drinking wife thinks so. Dark brown amber in color. Dried fruits on the aroma. A full flavor palate - theres so much going on here - date, fig, raisin, candy sugar, malt. Yet so balanced. Smooth, sweet, crisp. Very little bite from the high ABV. Really, really good.
33cl bottle at home. Dark reddish brown colour with a fizzy off white head. Aroma of Christmas cake and alcohol. Taste is banana, bread, yeast, dried fruit. Lovely

You can read all the other comments regarding the smells, looks, etc, im only going to say, this beer is excellent, you simply can't go wrong with this one. Some of the best examples of what a Belgium beer is. Highly recommended.

330-mL bottle bought in Belgium, poured into a wine glass.

Deep brown color with orange hues. Beige bubbly head which fades off rather quickly leaving nothing behind.

Aromas of plums, raisins, biscuits, Belgian yeast, a hint of alcohol, and a nice herbal hoppiness in the back. Brilliant nose!

On the palate, fresh hops upfront, followed by caramel, dark fruits and yeast. Bittersweet finish with herbal hops. Smooth, with no traces of alcohol.

An amazing beer, but I still prefer the hoppier profile of the Westvleteren 12.

Donkerbruin bier met beige schuimkraag. Geur: moutzoetig, brood, kandij, pruimen, alcoholisch en zelfs wat anijs. Smaak: zoetig, dadels, wat anijs en vleugje zout. Mooie balans. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Redelijk volmondig. Afdronk: warm alcoholisch en zoetig, karamel.
Cerveza oscura deliciosa, muy similar a Westlvteren XII, personalmente me gusta mas la autentica pero es una cerveza fantástica!

Shared a bottle with a friend, pours milky brown with a tan head and fairly high carbination level. Definitely has complex nose and taste, with a blend of bitter, sweet, and sour all in one. Great beer.
Bottle 33cl. Big rippling light brown head. Dark clear color, numerous small bubbles. Aroma is grapes, wood, leaves, hops, caramel, banana. Full body, but not too heavy. Sweet taste of herbs.
Really excellent abbey style beer. Similar to Westvletern 12, but more widely available.
Nice colour, slightly sugary on the nose, tastes of raisins and vanilla and some warmth from alcohol. A little to thin on the palate for my taste.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with nice lasting head. Aroma and taste is complex and difficult to point out things, but is yeast and dark fruits. Very very nice this one.

Deep brown body, small brownish head. Aroma of caralel, melasse, yeast, candy sugar, lots of different malt complexities, dried fruits, vanilla, alcohol fusel, chocolate. Flavours of caramel, melasse, chocolate, malt complexity, dried fruits, alcohol fusel, vanilla, candy sugar. Warm spicy and caramel long finish. Some bitterness and slightly dry. Long warm caramel aftertaste. Full body medium carbo.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Perfect score because I think this is one for the baseline of excellence. Love the depth, notes and complexity it offers. There is something in here for everyone.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2016 Deep dark brown with a medium frothy off white head. Malted biscuit, caramel, nuts and fruit aroma. A rich fruity sweetness, raisins, prunes, caramel and malt taste, and again some nuttiness. Great depth of flavour and a smooth warm finish. Very nice.
11.2 oz. bottle. Poured brown with huge foamy tan head. Aroma was raisin, figs and fruity. Taste was bittersweet. Alcohol was well hidden. Very nice.

Amazing beer. The aroma was yeast, malt, and caramel. The taste was yeast, malt, caramel and a little alcohol, otherwise it hid the alcohol very well. The mouthfeel was superb quite thick and great carbonation. Very nice dark brown color with a tan head.
Great quadrupple! I was going to write that it reminded me of the Westvleteren XII, but then I read the deScription. Bought it in a local supermarkt, so I will definetly buy some more soon.
Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with white head. Plum, raisin, cocoa, malty aromas. Malty, dark fruit, raisin, fig flavors. Just a great beer and a great quad.
Nice big Belgian quad. Big foamy head, reddish brown color. Sweet caramel, clove, banana, bubblegum. Slight hoppy finish. Great beer.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2017 Bottle 33. Couleur : beau brun foncé avec mousse beige opulente mais pas nécessairement persistante. Arôme : malté, caramel, fruits etc ... Bouche : magnifique équilibre entre sucre, amertume, alcool, carbonatation : digne des + grandes brunes de sa catégorie.

Au tonneau au Vaudrée : larôme se précise avec une superbe odeur de framboises. En bouche, la bière est douce mais le bel équilibre de la bouteille nest pas là. Je conserve mes côtes de rating.

Bottle from Drinkshop. Mostly clean dark brown colour, but lots of sediment easily detached from the bottom, readily flowing into the glass. The aroma, nor the taste are readily decodeable. Aroma seems to give away a hint of sourness, but in the taste it turns out to be only a slightly unpleasant alcohol. Other than that it is actually complex and malty with lots of fruits, dark fruits, dried fruits, stone fruits, toasted and caramel. I either had it in not ideal condition, or it is just heavily over-rated.

bottle, 33cl: This is probably the closest I will get to Westvleten 12. This is the commercialized version as I understand it. Wonderful dark brown color, great aroma, dense light tan foam. I found no faults with this beer but withheld the best ratings in all sections as I believe no beer can be perfect. Absolutely wonderful and I look forward to the next one!

Pours a hazy burnt amber brown color with a khaki head. Molasses, raisin, plum, yeast, clove, caramel, toffee and biscuit aroma. Plum, raisin, molasses, funk, yeast, clove, caramel, toffee, toast, mild chocolate, oak and light alcohol flavors. Full body and moderate carbonation. Slightly dry caramel, molasses and raisin finish

Bottle 0,33. Pours dark brown with light beige head. Sweet aroma of roasted malts, caramel , dried fruits and yeast. Taste of dark sugar, caramel a bit spicy with a bitter aftertaste. Full body with above average carbonation.
Bouteille 33cl couleur sombre fort brune, mousse moyenne marron, odeur agréable, goût agréable même pour une personne qui naime pas trop la biére brune

Bottle from JefVerstraete, thanks! Lots of red wine notes, ripe red apples, raisins, cherries, caramel, some sherry. Rich and smooth, slightly astringent from the booze but in a good way. Cherries in the warm finish. Very good, though does not live up to the hype.
UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 Sweet, rich quad which needs to warm up to show its full potential. Hides the alcohol well. Head disappeared quite fast. Not as smooth as the Westvleeteren imo.

Bière à la couleur brune et avec un col de mousse bien présent mais qui disparaît rapidement. Goût de malt caramel bien présent. Amertume très contenue que l'on ne ressent à aucun moment. L'alcool est également bien masque pour une bière qui titre autant. A mon avis, cette bière tient effectivement la comparaison avec la WestV XII.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26D). Bottle 33 cl - Batch A29. AROMA: predominant medium-high fruitiness with notes of dried grapes and prunes, mixed with peppery notes of the same intensity. APPEARANCE: dark ambar color with slight ruby highlights and clear. moderate tanned head, creamy, with lacing and moderate retention. FLAVOR: initial malty flavor with notes of dried fruits and a faint dark caramel character. presence of a peppery note of moderate intensity. low bitterness, just enough to slight offset malt sweetness with a semi-sweet and malty finish. PALATE: medium body with a slight texture and medium-high to high carbonation. slight smooth alcohol sentation that doesnt distract. OVERALL: a belgian dark strong ale with good aroma and flavor notes, that fit the style. it would gain more complexity with stronger esters.

Pours dark brown with a lasting off-white head. The aroma contains roasted malts, dried fruit, caramel, toffee and alcohol. It tastes medium sweet, light bitter and ends with a light fruity sourness. Full bodied, high in alcohol but delicate, creamy texture. Though I prefer the Prior 8, this one is also very complex, balanced and great.
Absolute perfection in a bottle. The malt is beautifully caramelized and is thick in the mouthfeel and aroma. Perhaps one of the best beers in the world. So complex, yet is so easy to drink.

Pours dark, cola-like with long lasting minimal head. Sweet but stingy caramel-aroma. Taste is very rye-breadish and sweet with a slight bitter after taste, long-lasting. A bit grassy. Enjoyable treat!
Pours clear amber. Aroma with toffee and caramel. Taste is complex, but light for 10%.

Sweet, dried fruit and caramel; chocolate bitterness. A bit high on carbonation for this style of beer. Otherwise a great beer. Compared to Westvleteren 12 its less subtle and smooth, but taking the price in consideration its a very good alternative.
Bottle poured into St. Bernardus Watou glass! Beautiful robust off-white head made up of little pearly bubbles. Smell of dark stone fruit. Taste plum, prune, molasses - fizzy. Great full mouthfeel.

Una cerveza oscura, opaca, densa y potente, pero no fuerte de sabor. Tiene un complejo aroma de maltas tostadas, caramelo y hierbas que sigue evolucionando durante el consumo. Licorosa y muy viva -demasiado para mi paladar poco burbujeante- , con gran protagonismo de la levadura.

Aroma: Caramel, dark fruits, brown sugar, chocolate, belgium yeasts.
Appearance: Brown, hazy, tan 2-finger head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, very complex.
Palate: Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, long bittersweet finish.
Overall: Perfectly balanced, delicious, great abt/quad.

Pour light brown with some red tints, and a head that settles to a thin rim quite quickly. Aroma is of funky alcohols and licorice with lemon. the taste follow on the warming alcohol and envelops a velvety texture brimming with citrusy fruits and roasted malts, in a wonderful mixture. The sweetness from more sugary licorice makes this such an easy beer to drink. Wonderful.

Aroma: Roasted malt, brown sugar. Taste: Medium+ sweet, some bitterness. Alcohol. Hops. Belgian style. Caramel. Dark fruits, plums. Palate: Medium- full body, average carbonation. Plums. Good.
Butelka; barwa brązowa. Piana ładnie zdobi szkło. Aromat suszonych owoców, karmelu, ciemnego cukru, lekko winny. Smak suszonych owoców, karmelu, alkoholu. Goryczka średnia.

Pours a dark brown with a solid head. Complex aroma of caramel malt, dark dried fruits, yeast. Flavour is very complex too - sweet, caramel malt, figs and other dried fruits, slightly alcoholic. Very good.
0,33 bottle. Dark red to brown color with medium off white head. Aroma of fruit, caramel, reisin and lots of alcohol. Medium bitterness.
330ml bottle. Dark red with a fine, off-white head. Sweet aroma of red berries and floral notes. Soft haylage flavour with a slight taste of butter. Carbonated texture on the tongue.

11.2 oz bottle. I think I first had this in Portsmouth, NH on draft, about 18 years ago. It has not lost its luster. Pours medium dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is clove, light grains, fruity esters. Flavor is caramel, clove, fruity esters. Finish is nice and dry. Smooth. Hides the abv all too well. Great stuff.

Tap at Pita Kabob in Visalia. Pours dark brown with a frothy brown head that lingers throughout. Aromas of chocolate and dark fruit. Flavor is blend of plumb, sweet bready malt and the yeast adds doughy compliment.
Fabulous beer full of flavour. Pours dark with thick white head. Fruity, bready, hoppy, some bitterness, strong in content but does not feel like it.
One of my favorites. Have had it already so often, but it never gets dull. Absolute quality, depth, balance. Delicious.
11oz bottle, dark caramel pour. Intriguing dates, caramel, and champagne nose. Rich raisin start, lighter body than expected. The Alcohol taste hangs around

Piana, choc gruboziarnista, jest zaskakujaco trwala. Aromat chlebowo-karmelowy. Kwaskowato winny. Lekko alkoholowy. Wraz z ogrzewaniem pojawiaja sie czerwone owoce.W smaku, piwo z czasem mocno sie otwiera. Na poczatku slodowe, chlebowe, karmelowe, pozniej robi sie niemal kompletnie winne, owocowe. Super ukryty alkohol. Bardzo zlozone.

33 cl bottle. Pours a dark brown with tan head. Aroma of toffee, mulled fruits and alcohol. Taste is sweet initially and then a bitter aftertaste. Palate is full body with a oily mouth feel. Overall excellent beer.
Bottle. Large off white head. Dark oak body. Wheat oak alcohol nail varnish remover malt. Bittersweet, some sourness. Dry finish. Full bodied and warming.

Look: dark brown slightly hazy almost no head.

Aroma: fruity sourness with prominent alcohol notes.
Taste: sweet balanced with fruity sourness and some bitterness.
Flavour: caramel, rum, fruits, spicy hops, plume wine.
Slightly harsh alcohol in the aftertaste.

Good but not as complex as expected.
Dark brown colour with tan head. Nose is little bit fruity, some caramel, candy sugar, malt. Mouth is caramel, some bitter notes, plum, candies. Very good!
Bottle. Dark chestnut color, tan head. Aroma of cognac, banana, cookies, cherries. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Very good.

Poured from a bottle. Dark walnut hue with thin tan\ white head with medium lacing. Plum, fig, raisin, with hints of cherry in nose & taste. Malt sweetness has caramel and molasses in its candied profile. A slight flash of alcohol in the nose and finish.
Pours dark brown with an off white head. Fruity aroma with hints of malts. Strong flavor but smooth, some caramel with a sweet finish.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2016 Classic quad stuff going on... plums, sweet malts, bread... cherries... bit more of a hoppy bite to this than with some of the other renowned quads, which makes for a fresher beer. Slips down far too easily.

Bottle. Pours is dark with medium off-white head. Intense aroma of malts, fruity, dark dried fruits, plums, figues, candized brown sugar. Taste is light to moderate sweet with a little hoppy bitter kick, malty based, dark fruity mouthfeel. Medium to heavy body, medium dry, creamy texture, lively carbonation, light alcohol warmth in finish.

Mousse blanche qui disparaît très vite, bière de couleur brune, belle carbonisation, arôme de levures belges, caramel, goût malt, caramel, cest doux mais fort en alcool. Aucune amertume, lalcool se ressent jusquau final. 33Cl Paris Saint-Bière

One of the best examples of a belgian quad. Its also a great gateway beer into the craft scene, which is what the beer was for me. Often compared to the Westy 12, recently thats somewhat valid. The Westy 12, as it is brewed recently, is a more hoppy, far more drinkable, and seemingly more alcoholic version of this.
caramel, roasty,fruits; amber/brown with minimal head, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, also sour, an awful example of what a beer can be,

Bottle from Tanakaya. Raisin, prune, bready malt candied sugar, caramel and molasses on the nose with some light booze and chocolate as it warms. Very smooth and hides the abv well. Sweet on the palate with a heavy mouthfeel. Lots of flavors come out as it warms up along with a just a hint of warming on the finish. I get why this is a great beer, but quads are just not my thing.

All-around fantastic stuff. Pours a clear garnet with lasting, clingy finger of foam - its purty. Aromas of yeast, bread, candi sugar, dark fruits abound. Flavor is similar with raisins and prunes in the foreground and mild spice and yeasty esters behind. While slightly sweet, its never cloying. Very balanced brew and finishes quite clean.

Deep copper brown color with a slightly off white head, no lacing. Aims is fruity and has a wine like character to it. Wine character carries over to the flavor. Malty and sweet with some sour and bitter notes mixed. Very complex and delicious. Full body, good carbonation.

330 ml bottle bought 2014, bb 19.04.2018.
Copper-brown body, with a big, fluffy, a bit lacing, light beige head.
Aroma of brown sugar, milk chocolate, dried fruits, berries, apples, some toast, slight spices.
Taste follows this, but fuller, with subtle alcohol.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, warm, medium sweet, a bit dry, a bit fruity, slightly toasty, with some caramel.

Very nice, although I was expecting even a bit more. Drinks really smooth though, with a very well hidden alcohol and an interesting combination of the typical sugary and fruity notes, with some untypical toasty notes. Overall I was hoping for an equally good beer to the Westy 12, but independend of the hype I consider the latter quite superior to this, while this is also a really enjoyable beer.

Dark brown colour, with a two fingers off white head that fades leaving a ring and a great lace. Smell of dark fruits, raisins, prunes, spices. Medium to full body,, good carbonartion, thick palate. Taste of prunes, figs, raisins, spices, cinnamon, chocolate. Supposedly, they use the original Westvleteren yeast.and they have the recipe, since Westvletern was made at this abbey long ago. Just as good or almost as Westvleteren, and cheaper.

Bottle, 330ml. A dark reddish beer with a medium size head. Aroma is of belgian yeast, alcohol, spices, caramel and dried fruits. Very complex with a strong belgian character. Taste is bitter with some carbonation and considerable astringency. Double aftertaste full of spices and belgian yeast. Superb!

Bottle, 33cl. Opaque dark brown with a frothy to minimal tan head. Aromas of dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, spices, alcohol. Robust bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Well balanced sweetness and bitterness, with a deep malty and fruity character and a complex bitter finish. Excellent.

A clear dark amber body with a khaki-coloured foam that quickly settles down to rafts on the surface of the beer. Nose has sweet notes of caramel, butterscotch, spices and Taste is sweet with some coffee and cocoa bean-like notes and a lingering bitter finish. Lively carbonation and rich palate. Quite a nice warming beer.

Pours dark brown with persistent and creamy beige head. Aroma of grapes, dark fruits, yeast, spices, earth. Taste is wine-like, sweet, light sour, light bitter. Full bodied, average carbonation, alcohol well inserted. A great classic.

Pours hazy copper with off white head. Nose is brown sugar and candy tempered with yeast and a little spice. Flavor is a delicious blend of the elements in the nose with a good bite of carbonation. Would love to try this aged. Great beer.

Very fruity, red-dark berries estery in aroma, not so sharp mouthfeel as Belgian strongs might be. Mild, balanced flavor, if cold- no booze on nose. Beige soapy top, huge but disappears fast. Didnt catch that peppery sharpness nor sugary sourness at the end. Thick bodied.

Flaska från Barley Wine, Kph. Ca 1½ år gammal. Skummade över vid öppning. Mörkbrun disig med tunnt gräddbeiget skum. Torkad frukt i förgrunden, söt med lätt syra. Fyllig kropp, sväller i munnen. Malttung, något kryddig i smaken med ett humlebett i avslutningen. Kanske tunnat ut sig något under lagringen.
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2016 Cerveza muy buena, aroma como a nuez. Tiene bastante cuerpo, y es un tanto fuerte, con gas que se nota vivamente. Una Quadrupel muy muy buena.

Aroma: rich, fruity, complex.Appearance: dark with tan head; good lacing; Taste: also rich, fruity, complex; smooth; Palate: heavy body with long sweet finish; Overall: beautiful quad. Would definitely buy again.

This was poured into a chalice.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a slim fingers worth of head that quickly dissipated. There wasnt much lacing.
The smell had some sweet dark fruits - fig, raisin, prune with a light touch of warming cocoa. Light breadiness with some Belgian spices round it out. Light sweet apple comes in nicely.
The taste was moderately sweet with the breadiness gracing in and around the previously mentioned flavors. Gentle sweet to spicy aftertaste slides into the finish. That "deep throatiness" I normally get seems to be contained a bit, really nice.
On the palate, this one sits about a medium on the body in the front of my tongue but seems to get that "heavier" feel as it runs to the back of my tongue. Still good. Carbonation runs at a nice pace.
Overall, now this is a Quad. Id most likely say, the quad of quads, uh...hell yeah, definitely would have again.
Tried for first time today. Very smooth for a darker beer. Would like to try it from tap; this tasting was from bottle.

A - dark brown with beige foam. So foammy.
S - caramel, molasses, toffee, butterscotch, slightly roasted nut.
T - first caramel, biscuit, date palm. And then fig, prune, raisin, blackcurrant and cinnamon, licorice. Last one. Hop finish.
M - Full body malty-yeasty. Slightly carbonation. Incredibly smooth.
O - My first time drinked Belgian ale. 2~3 year bottle aged. Impressive beer. Never forget taste.
Strong alcohol taste with fruity nose. A hoppy and almost champagne like after taste.

Pours dark with a tan head. Aroma of raisin and molasses. First taste is a little fizzy, but this rapidly settles into a well balanced and nuanced beer with an excellent balance of sweet and spice. Full bodied, rich, an excellent mix of hops and malt, and very warming with the high ABV remaining hidden until the end. Very good.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Amber brown with a nice off-white creamy head. Aroma of dark stone fruits, caramel. Tastes of more dark fruit, spice, caramel, Belgian yeast, some sweetness. Creamy texture. Light bitterness. Complex. Superb balance.

Aroma: rich, fruity, complex.Appearance: dark with tan head; good lacing; Taste: also rich, fruity, complex; smooth; Palate: heavy body with long sweet finish; Overall: beautiful quad. Would definitely buy again.

Slightly sweet and a little bitter. Complex taste. Definitely would have it again
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma: dark fruits, belgian yeast, light caramel and cloves. Taste: dried fruits, caramel, belgian yeast, cloves and brown sugar. Nice head. poor lacing and medium to high carbonation.
@ Lilla barkaby 6-1-7: rätt len och lite metallisk doft. Smaken är lätt maltig, en viss sötma och torkade nötter.
Bottle. Pours dark hazy brown with a frothy offwhite head. Aroma is sweet, dark fruits, raisins, prunes, yeasty, caramel. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, lots of prunes, grain, sweet malt, caramel.
Another very good beer...awesome balance...lots of fruit...dry and quick on the finish...thx Brian great choice.

If youve had Chimay blue, this is a similar styled beer. Whats immediately notable is its surprising crispness at 10% ABV. Youd expect to smell and taste more alcohol, but what comes across, instead, is a crisp, toffee malt and fine effervescence. This isnt my kind of beer--malty bases I cant abide--but I can see why its popular. Chimay blue, in my inexperienced estimation of this style of beer, is slightly more flavorful.

We tried this beer on tap, and we found it less powerful in aromas than the bottled version. However, as it heates to ambiance temperature, the taste and aromas improve. It combines well with sweet things, like Roscón de Reyes.

Poured from a 750 ml bottle. Aromas of dark fruit, caramel, and yeast. Hazy, but a beautiful reddish-brown color and a thick, off-white, frothy head. Initially sweet, but with a slightly bitter-sweet finish. Alcohol comes through just slightly. Nice carbonation that dances on the tongue. Wonderful creamy texture.
A fruity aroma with a hint of plums. Pours a dark brown color with a thin tan head. A fruity taste of plums and dried fruit with a full bodied feel and slightly boozy finish.

Ambar rojizo profundo con buena espuma y adherencia. Lúpulo especiado alto, malta maltoso caramelo moderado, ésteres a fruto seco, fenólicos vainilla-especias, licoroso ligero. Malta maltoso caramelo moderado, lúpulo especiado moderado, lúpulo de amargor moderado, tibieza alcohólica. Final en balance malta-lúpulo-tibieza alcohólica con cuerpo y carbonatación moderada.
0.33l bottle, thanks to Lore. Orangish dark brown body, off-white head. Aroma of cocoa, toast, nutmeg, caramel and cloves. Taste of caramel, cocoa, orange peel, nutmeg, chocolate and floral hops.

Lots of fruit on the nose. Pure deep and dark with some lacing. Lots on the palate too. Some yeast. This has a nice finish. Impressive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Aroma of dried fruits; figs, prunes, raisins, malty caramel, herbal hops and a bit of earthy yeast. The flavours is sweet and slightly bitter in the finish. Lingering fruity taste with a nice warmth of alcohol. The body is full and the texture is sticky. Lively carbonation. A very balanced and enjoyable beer. Nice one...

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 02 09 19 Pours dark brown liquid, medium frothy tan head, fell down after a while, remaining some lacings. Aroma: nice sweet, fruity, candied fruits, banana, caramel sweets, licorice, light warming alcohol, Taste: heavy sweet, medium bitter, light to medium sour, sweet, fruity, candied, plums, caramel, malty, light metallic off-taste, Palate: medium to full body, average carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, long sweet alcoholic aftertaste, Overall: enjoyed, especially the aroma,
Bottle. Nice brown mahogany colour, taste is of dried fruit and yeasty sweet bread.

Tasted side-by-side with its more famous cousin, Westy XII. In a blind taste test, the St. Bernardus held up well, although all five of us noticed that it was like a more aggressive version of Westy XII. The malt and yeast flavors are the same, just louder and not as complex. Still, this is one of the better beers Ive ever had, and unlike its snooty cousin its readily available, which counts for a lot!
330 ml Flasche. Braun-goldenes Bier mit feinem flachem Schaum. Warmer Malzduft, Toffee, Trockenfrüchte, Rum. Sehr kräftiger vollmundiger Geschmack. Cremiges Mundgefühl.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 bottle 33cl. Served in a St. Bernardus chalice glass. 
Pours a dark chestnut brown with a small white one finger head that dissipated really quickly.
Aromas of caramel, malt, bread, wet earth, flowers, spices of cinnamon, cloves, cherry, vanilla, hops, brown sugar, coriander.
Taste is a continuation of the aroma with initial very sweet flavor, full body with a long sweet, hoppy, creamy finish with especially coriander that Im still feeling dancing around in my mouth right now. I understand now why this beer is so high regarded... Its a damn shame my glass is already empty.
Overall an excellent beer, especially for a dark, cold winter night.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2016 Not so much to say! This is how a beer should be. Very good brew! Amazing taste, really nice!!!
Had it again today 2016-11-17, just great!!!

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 16/12/2015
Color marrón,, sabor caramelo, dulce, Gran cerveza

Corked 750ml bottle. Sweet aroma. Pours clear light brown with creamy head. Taste is sweet with slight metallic taste. Sweet finish that is sticky on the palate. It was good, but I thought the Ommegang Abbey Ale was better.
Dark brown pour with a fine head. Smells like caramel and macerated fruit. Smooth mouthfeel, caramel, prunes, strawberry jam, apple brandy, cocoa. Excellent ber.

Pours an ember-brown color, with a fluffy, big head, collapsing to a spider web lacing.

Smells of warmed walnut shell among molasses and bakers chocolate. The aromas reveal a hot peak within a profound rock sugar coating, getting wrapped up by moldy earth and mellowed toffee. Its nutty qualities are distinguishable in the most pleasant way, featuring a spicy cardamon note, together with freshly cracked walnuts and heated chestnut, blending perfectly into earthy malts.

Has a lower carbonation, while the mouthfeel is surprisingly thin till the finish, in which its rich maltiness unfolds its true potential.

Begins with rock sugar from the very beginning, balanced by dusty earth and walnut. A watery quality evolves, going along with the malts, while the flavors do not change at all until after the swallow. A warming spice punch becomes detectable out of nowhere, while the initial rock sugar quality returns in an alcohol soaked fashion, balanced by bakers chocolate and licorice. Dried orange peel, spruce and clove add depth to rock sugar and molasses, while the beer finishes clean, with a gentle bitterness of matured hops and dough bread.

This one I kept in the cellar for about a year, in hopes of this might be smoothing out a bit. While its maltiness doubtlessly is well accentuated, there is not much going on, apart from an overly pungent, boozy sugar quality. For being recognizably full-bodied, its mouthfeel is a bit too thin for me, especially when compared to a stout in the same abv region. Its finish is highly recommendable though, exhibiting lots of different flavors, mostly evolving from the onnipresent malts or complimenting them, creating a nice, warming depth.

Cork-finished 750mL bottle. Pours hazy brown with creamy head. Smells fruity - apples, pears, plums, bananas. Some rich bready malt in there, too. Pils malt dominates the malt profile but the rest is all yeast. Fruity, spicy, and balanced perfectly. Rich initial impression with a dry finish. Scary drinkable for a 10% ABV beer. Will buy again and again.

Bottle 33cl. Dark brown with a ruby red glow. Aroma of malts, sugar , chocolate and coffee. The taste starts mildly bitter and the Co2 is present immediately. Theres a spicy undertone that gets stronger to the aftertaste. Not bad, but not as good as the Westvleteren 12 on which the recipe was based.

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2016 Pours dark brown under a pale tan head. Aromas are fruity, crisp, a bit of tomato jam, raspberries. The flavour is malty, slightly dry, fruity, dried fruits (raisins), yeasty, spicy.... just a hint of wood. Oily and full body, lingering finish.

330ml bottle. Pours a very dark chestnut brown colour, almost black, with a very smooth creamy sandy/tan coloured head, lasts for the duration of the drink - perfect appearance in my opinion. The aroma is fruity, malt, yeast, and some alcohol. Complex flavour of dried fruits, malt, caramel, hops. Full-bodied. Alcohol is present but nice, very warming. Bittersweet finish. Well balanced. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2016 Nutty brown appearance with some bubbly head. Complex tastes of champagne, dried fruits, sweet carrot, spruce, citrus, herbs, alcohol and smoke. Full body, aggressive yet good carbonation and a lasting bittersweet finish. Very tasting
Daar heb je die blije gozert weer! Erg sterk bakkie maar de fruitige en gebrande zoete smaken met vleugje mout maken t toch een fijn ding. Backlog from 2015/02/19.
De goedkopere West-vleteren 12 zegt men ervan, zeer lekker en zo smaakt het ook naar.

Aroma was banana, bubblegum, alcohol, raisins. Quite gentle. Apperance brown- with some reddish tint, some haze, minimal head, off-white foam, ok retention. Taste was light to medium sweetness, light bitterness, very gentle alcohol, banana, bubblegum, again some raisins. More of a medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish that is gently sweet and minimally bitter. 
Overall a nicely drinkable beer, expected something more though. An extra note of flavour, a bigger taste and less sweetness.
Pours dark amber with a medium foamy tan head. Aromas of molasses, caramel, muscovado sugar, figs, dates, butterscotch. Taste is very balanced beteende malt sweetness and oaky earthiness. Very goodn

Gushing na powitanie. W aromacie z butelki ciemne pieczywo, ciemne słody, karmel. Piana dosyć wysoka, beżowa, średniopęcherzykowa, niezbyt trwała, choć w postaci niskiego kożuszka utrzymuje się do samego końca. W barwie piwo miedziane, nieco zmętnione. W aromacie ze szkła głównie czerwone owoce, przyprawy korzenne, karmel, lekka guma do żucia, nuty ziemiste, tytoniowe. W smaku dosyć słodkie, z wyraźnymi nutami ciemnego pieczywa, karmelu, suszonych wiśni, nieco palonych słodów. fenole na umiarkowanym poziomie. Wysycenie jest nieco gryzące i przeszkadza nieco w odbiorze piwa, choć potężne ciało daje mu jednak fajne odczucie. Goryczka i chmielowa i palona i alkoholowa. Alkohol jak na tę zawartość ukryty dobrze, ale daje się wyczuć w przełyku.
330ml bottle. Aroma banana, yeast, sweetness. Taste medium sweet and not bitter at all.

Purchased bottle in Namur, BE. Head not as full, might have been a batch issue. Fantastic taste, in a typical Trappist style. Just a little too sweet but balanced with the Belgian hops. Worth the search!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Caramel and floral aroma but not strong. Fine and long off-white head. Taste is  sweet and a little spicy, with long aftertaste.  Full body, creamy texture.

From a bottle bought at the Vineyard, Belfast. Not a lot of aroma, looks fantastically thick and dark with a mild head but it has a lovely molasses-like taste (but not sweet) and it has a lingering finish. This is a really good beer.

Nez: Réglisse, raisin, épicé
Bouche: Caramel, réglisse, fruits secs, raisin, épicée, vineuse
Une de mes quad préférées.

On tap in Budapest. Fig and sweet cinnamon bread. Light caramel sugary sticky molasses very light and mischievious because I know it?s 10%. Creamy finish sweet and light crisp snap. Really nice quad kinda light and friendly, but that should mean that it?s bomb as fuck, right?

Pretty damn good. Mellow but strong. Typical Belgian flavors. Nice overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Brown color, thick off-white head that stays there for a while. Rich sweet aroma, with some caramel and raisin. Complex full taste, sweet and spicy start with hoppy light bitter finish. just shut up, drink and enjoy this amazing beer.

Aroma: Rich, sweet, malty, dried fruit, raisin, caramel. Appearance: Dark amber, head medium high, stiff and durable. Taste: Sweet, dried fruit, caramel, some spicy notes, raisin, plum, alcohol not feelable, bitterness very low at first with time gets bit stronger and turns to medium level, herbal hoppy notes. Palate: finish is semi-dry, carbonation is high, body is full, alcohol lightly warming.

While Ive had their Christmas Ale, this is my first ever try of their ABT 12. My expectations were fairly high, and I dont think they were quite met. It looks the part, with its muddy brown body, with reddish hi-lights in the glass. 
The nose however is a letdown, with a hint of bready malts, and some dark fruit peels.
The palate is surprisingly on the tingly crisp side, and not velvety smooth like I was expecting. Still interesting though.
The tastes are concentrated more on the red fruit peels, and grapes side of the fence. There is a bit of the bready malts in the mix, but they are very subdued from what I was expecting.
This isnt punching in the same weight class as Westvleteren 12 and Rochefort 10, but once you get your mind wrapped around that, its a pretty decent beer. Might fall into the one-time enjoyment category however, as I doubt Id reach for it again when beer shopping.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2015 Birra color mogano con riflessi ramati, schiuma compatta color crema. Al naso una complessità di sentori che vanno dalla nocciola, all'uvetta, fino al cioccolato e alla prugna. In bocca è un tripudio di bosco e banana matura, dolce, mai stucchevole sprigiona il suo calore già al primo sorso. Un corpo non ingombrante ed una discreta carbonazione fanno il resto. Grande bevuta.
Pretty much the perfect Belgian. Sweet Belgian taste, just enough malt, although a relatively high ABV, the alcohol is anything but overpowering.

Bottle poured into original glass. Very dark brown with a bit of light brown foam. Lots of lacing. Caramel, raisin and plum aroma. Sweet taste with a kick from the alcohol. Really great beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It is dark amber in color with ruby highlights. The initials aromas of malt and dark fruits. There are also aromas of grass and some yeast. It has a vinous flavor with dark fruits, grass, floral elements, yeast, and bready malts, It is moderate as a body, with a dry finish and pleasant alcohol warming. It is moderate high in carbonation.

Rossa molto scura di buona limpidezza con riflessi rossastri, schiuma ocra non molto persistente che forma il classico anello in superficie lungo il bordo del bicchiere.
Aroma di frutta matura: pera in evidenza, banana e frutti scuri, note vinose ed oleose, leggero tostato, caramello, speziatura da lievito belga.
Al palato sempre note vinose ed oleose, pera e banana matura, nota etilica finale che rende "lievemente piccante" la bevuta mista ad un dolce di frutta a polpa gialla e zuccherino.
Retrolfatto di pera ed etilico.
Corpo pieno, mediamente carbonata, oleosa.

Color marrone scuro con leggera schiuma che sparisce quasi subito.
Cioccolato, nocciola, frutta secca, amarene sciroppate. Meravigliosa.

Butelka. Barwa brunatna, z refleksami pod światło. Piana wysoka, sycząca, szybko opadająca. Aromat owoców suszonych jak i ciemnych, lekki karmel. W smaku podobnie,czuć pełnie smaki niezalegająca, lekkie grzanie w przełyk. Goryczka niska, wysycenie średnie. Zacne piwko, alkohol doskonale ukryty. pełne w odczuciu.

On tap @Mad for Beer (Rome). Pours brown/reddish with a beige head. Aroma of dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, alcol, good. Flavour is mostly sweet with a nice balance, decent bitter end ad mild sourish notes. Full body, medium carbonation. Nice and complex, but a bit overrated.

Bottle at pater marcus. Dark brown color, with a small white head that disappears almost immediately. Nose of chocolate and toffee with a hint of alcohol. Taste begins with a strong hit of iron for me. Later on it disappears a nice, slightly sweet, malty taste appears. The warmer the beer gets, the smaller the irony hit gets, but it was a very negative first impression! The taste at first was like -3, after 5 mins the 7 I gave. Very good beer, with a horrible first expression.

Bottle at Pater Marcus. Pours dark brown with a brown head, keeps a minimal head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, a bit of chocolate and hay. Taste is sweet with some bitterness in the end and some coffee aftertaste. Soft carbonation. A mainly sweet beer with some bitterness and a tiny sourness.

Dark brown, almost clear, medium beige head. Friuty, spicy and yeasty aroma, very complex and balanced. Could be more intensive. Fruitiness in taste. Raisins, sour cherries, very balanced and drinkable. No trace of alcohol. Medium bodied, crisp, fruity aftertaste. Dangerously easy drinking. Impression of light, session beer!

Bottle. Dark brown-ruby color with medium light brown head. Of course with lot of lacing on the glass. Aroma: domination of banana with some dark fruits and hay. In flavor again banana and dark fruits rounded with some pepper and grass notes. Oily palate. Medium-full body. Some sourness in finish. Overall: nice, but I believe that there are some quadruples that are more complex and flavorful than this one.  Maybe somekind of disappointment. But,  anyway  still a good beer.
Jedno z lepszych piw jakie piłem. Mimo swojej mocy smakuje wprost wyśmienicie.
Nice beer, the only flaw is the grain alcohol taste I get. Great beer, to be sure.

Brunatne, w refleksach rubinowe piwo o obfitej, gęstej pianie, która zdobi szkło i pozostaje do końca w postaci sporej warstwy na powierzchni. Aromat ciemnych owoców plus lekki alkohol. W smaku owocowe, wytrawne, trochę przypominające wino, lekko cierpkie. Goryczka średnia w stronę wysokiej. Ogólnie konkretne piwo, dobry, jeśli nie jeden z najlepszych reprezentantów stylu, robi wrażenie i z każdym łykiem czuć ciężar gatunku.

750 mL bottle shared by ebone1988. The pour is a deep mahogany brown with a thick tan head and some excellent lace as it falls to a collar and thin film. There is a ton of sediment in this baby as well. The aroma is much more Belgian than I'd like for an Abt. There is a lot of dark fruits and a little fig. It's not as bad as I'd imagine it could be, but I was expecting a little more. The flavor is definitely big on the quad. There is a ton of Belgian malts and a strong yeast on the back end. The dark fruits fall off a little and then that yeastiness takes over. It's not bad, but there could be a bit more to it. The mouth feel is decent. Nice and creamy with a surprisingly high amount of carbonation. It's sharp and plentiful. The aftertaste is lingeringly malty with a bit of fruits. Not bad, but not great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Aroma is malt, banana and clove, apple, figs. Appearance is dark brown, with a light tan head, tons of sediment floating around. Taste is Belgian yeast, lots of malt, banana, clove, not anything like Westvleteren XII. Mouthfeel is thick, carbonation is excessive, lingering booze aftertaste. Overall, pretty disappointing for what I expected.
saldensaromāts, kaut kas uz karameli, tuma krāza, duļķains, neuzbāzīga gara, salda ar mazliet skabumu beigās, laba pēcgara.

Copenhagen 25/10 2015. 33 cl bottle. Gift from my in-laws from vacation in Belgium. Monk looking pretty happy about his St Bernadus Abt 12 on the label. Pours dark brown with creamy off-white head. Settles as 1 cm thick layer of foam. Aroma is sweet of banana, caramel and alcohol. Medium carbonation and oily palate. Taste is intense and follows the nose. Banana, yeast, caramel and pleasant feeling that the beer you're drinking is containing a healthy amount of alcohol. We do not have enough of these happy monks in Denmark.

Bottle
Aroma-dark fruits, alcohol, 
Appearance-brown, clear, tan foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Bottle: Dark brown with a frothy tan head that maintains a nice covering. The aroma is dark fruit and some earthy notes. The taste is raisins, plums, sweet honey and maltiness. It has a smooth yet syrupy mouth feel. The finish is well balanced and hides the 10% abv very well.

Where: Old Line Fine Wine Spirits & Bistro. 
How: 330ml bottle.
Appearance: Dark brown with reddish-carmel hues, mostly opaque, thick creamy foam head. 
Aroma: Sweet fruits, cherry, leather. 
Taste: Sweet malts up front, complex flavored, hops in the middle. 
Palate: Creamy, rich, full-bodied.
Overall: Ridiculously good quad, worth the treat.

330 ml bottle. Bought in rue de freres in strasbourg. Fantastic deep smell, and very different from anything else I have ever smelled, dark fruit that goes deep into your nose all the way down. Dark color with low white head. Taste is incredibly complex, and the sensations in the mouth has well. Fantastic beer, omg!! Thaste a little like almonds, and you dont feel the alcohol at all, I imagine myself getting into a lot of trouble with a couple of this ones. A must try for any beer lover, ended up being has good has expected.

25cl draft at Het Elfde Gebod, Amsterdam on 25-Sep-2015. Dark brown with a rich tan coloured head. Aroma of sweet caramel, syrup and fruit. Full body and medium carbonation. Lots of treacle, chocolate, coffee with a sweet malty backbone. Creamy malty finish. An exceptional beer - the high ABV being really well hidden.
A massive impression of course. On tap it is a really great experience and the taste is massive and heavy. Lightly sweet but alcoholic.

Big bottle. Malt plum alcohol fruit aroma. Reddish plum color with a white head. Medium heavy body with carbonation. Plum raisin caramel gig flavor. Sweet finish without the sticky mouth feel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Julios. Dark brown with lasting eggshell head and some lace. Woody earthy aroma with fig/raisin and tobacco. Rich medium sweet raisin plum purple grape sweetness with earthy woody tobacco bitterness that lingers with a hint of sweetness but no stickiness, no cloy. Smooth creamy medium body with very fine internal carb. Excellent...as everybody already knows.
The taste of this one is close to the taste of Westvleteren 12. If there is no change to drink a westvleteren 12 or a Rochefort 10, you can choose this one. It comes very close to these two.
Bottle. Had it a couple of times over the years and find it to be a complex, malt forward, medium bodied, medium sweet, well balanced beer. Excellent job.

Jy reviens ... Histoire de comparer mon goût daujourdhui avec celui dil y a quelques années. Et bien ma foi cest plus léger et moins bien que dans mon souvenir, même si ça reste de bonne facture ...

Bottle. Nearly black with dark creamy head. Massive taste, juicy and chocolatey with a very long smokey treacle aftertaste. An absolute treat.

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle.

Originally rated on 11/1/2007. I have had this a few times, i have to say this one of the best beers in the world. its complex, flavorful, great apperance and smell. I would (and have) recommended everyone i know to give it a try, you wont be disappointed.

In bottiglia. Colore marrone scuro, schiuma fine beige che si dissolve rapidamente. Aroma di frutta secca, nocciola, frutta sotto spirito, dattero. Al palato corpo rotondo, alcool pungente, frutta secca, noce, nocciola, dattero.

A killer! This is a superb beer. Brown beer witha red glow Licht brown head.
Touches of banana in the smell,, raisins in the taste. A soft bitterness, which lastes long in the mouth. Easy to drink in spite of the 10,5 %.

Bought in Discount Stores Cardiff. Fruity and malty flavours, rich heavy taste, but smooth. Good but not overpowering carbonation. Whopping alcohol content concealed well but I got red faced after a while! Looked forward to this but was slightly disappointed. Think I prefer the trippels.

At Ollie's place. In a snifter. Pours rich brown with a tan head. Aroma of sweet malt. Initial rich sweet malt with a creamy mouth feel. Delicate caramel sweetness.

Superb. Short lasting lacing, off white head. Wonderful, wonderful flavours from the off, beginning as a light, sticky fruit loaf and cascading through to a smooth leafy fig syrup before giving a final nod to resinous hops and boozy content.

caramel, bread, toast, roasty, herbs, leaves, butterscotch, licorice, brown, cloudy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish. Good quad, but it isnt the best.

33Cl bottle from Beer Hawk. Pours fluffy off white head, dark amber coffee body. fruity malt on the nose. tastes sweet, raisin and malt, Like a fruit loaf in a tulip glass. Well balanced Delicious. Fantastic beer.

750 ml cork bottle from Plonk. Pour dark deep red almost black, lasting head. Dried fruit aroma, malt, some yeast ester fruitiness, all classic for the belgian dark strongs. Mild sweetness and dry moderately bitter finish. High carbonation, medium body. Mild warming alcohol finish. Excellent.

Comprada en botella 330ml. en Whole Foods, Union Square, NY. Cuadrupel belga, tono amarronado, mucho cuerpo, poca espuma.

Bottle from saq A: licorice, caramel, raisins, dark fruits, brown sugar dates app: hazy brown orange small white head some lacing. T/p: full body with moderate long sweet finish. Moderate high carbonation. O: a thing of beauty. All the different levels of sugars/aromas makes for an awesome brew.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2016 This quad is a "little brother of the most famous Westvletern 12, with the same hops, same yeast and the same malts, but with much different character:
Pours dark purple haze colour, with tiny creamy, unstable of-white head.
Aroma with mild-low notice of an alcohol, and with strong presence of caramel, candy sugar, grape (muscat), port wine and cloves.
Flavor is similar: alcohol is medium noticable, with taste like port wine. Also are detectable malt notes of caramel, candy sugar, with hints of grape, dried fruits, especially plums, and with some spices, like coriander and cloves.
Malt sweetnees is high, hop bitterness is low, body is soft, and sticky, finish is also sticky.
Very good quad, but still not in the same rang as Westvleteren 12 and Rochefort 10.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2015 Bottle, 75 cl. Dark brown/ruby body with an off-white head. Sweet and fruity aroma. Sweet taste with light bitterness. Fruity flavours and notes of spice and yeast. Some alcohol warmth. Medium body with a very prickly carbonation. Very tasty quadrupel, but the carbonation detracts from the overall experience to some extent.

UPDATED: OCT 14, 2015 Fresh bottle from Craft Beer Base. 
L: pours a very dark red, mahogany, with a huge fluffy tan head that takes ages to settle and leaves nice lacing. 
S: a champagne whiff, with dark fruits and citrus beneath. 
T: Rich and complex, slightly boozy. Made to be sipped. 
F: awesome mouthfeel, creamy at the start, full-bodied, nicely carbonated, and a lovely warmth running long. 
O: World-class, delicious, a wonderful quad.

brown cloudy beer, minimal creamy head
Aroma: sweet fruits, biscuits, hint of chocolate, this specific quadrupel esters, almost like a bubble gum. 
taste: medium to high sweetness. Flavours similiar as in aroma.
Palate: medium to full body, dry alcohol on finish. Low to medium saturation.
Overall: good, sweet, really pleasant beer. Altough Rochefort 10 was way better, St Bernardus 12 is flatter in aroma and taste, and lower carbonated. Also seems to be way more sweet.

Botella. Color café. Casi opaca. 
No demasiada espuma 
No mucho aroma. Pasas y caramelo principalmente 
En boca, mucho cuerpo. Muy equilibrada en todos los sentidos. El alcohol disimulado, sólo se nota más al final.
De cualquier modo esperaba más matices para su fama.

Bottle from 2011. Cant believe Ive never rated this! Maybe not the most representative drinking though. Aroma is a bit more boozy than a fresh one. Rich and fruity. Taste is similar but also has that yeasty malty ovaltine thing that Id expect. Very easy drinking with a little spritziness at the start then a long fading finish. Little booze burn but very nice stuff.

33cl bottle in chalice
A:  ruddy dark Amber brown with thick very fine cream head
A: sweet malty, caramel, banana, grass
T: lightly sweet, nutty, medium bitter, salty
P: medium body, quick short flavor, creamy almost oily, warming, lively carbonation
O: pleasant and similar to a Westy but not as full bodied.  Still a mighty fine Abbey ale

Frothy light brown head that diminishes fast. Murky brown body.
Caramel, coffee and nutty malt aroma. Average creamy yeast touch. And licorice of course.
Medium body with soft thin carbonation. Very pleasant. And moderately bitter.
Long and moderate sweet and bitter taste. Touch of minerals.

Brown, muddy look with beige head. Aroma is intense, with lots of brown sugar but also somehow fresh. Taste is balanced at first, with some spices, dark sugar taste but without the sweetness. It slowly builds up to a bittersweet finish. Quite easy to drink for 10% ABV but the alcohol is a bit present in the taste. Carbonation is on the high side, something I dont really enjoy for high ABV beers. Overall its a good representation of the style but not really my type of beer.

Raisins, dark liquor aroma. A bit of caramel. Taste is way sweet. Rich toasty dark malts... bit of alcohol warmth. Stone fruit. Just on the edge of too sweet. Pours a cloudy brown with a big bubbled head. Lightish bkdy

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit and liquorice.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque ruby/brown beer with a medium/large beige/brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet and slightly bitter with malts  caramel, Belgian yeast, dried fruit and liquorice.

Overall:

This beer is intense, balanced and complex. The only reason it gets only a 4.3, is because I know there are other beer in this style (read: rochefort 10) that I like even more. God, why are Belgian beers so good?

Excellent Belgian. Dark, nut brown pour with a foamy off white head. Nice head retention and lacing. Flavours of yeasts, brown sugar, caramel, burnt sugars, etc. Really nice natural, bubbly carbonation as well.

Very balanced beer. Dark brown with light tan head. Fruity nose and caramel tastes.

dark malt, caramel in the scent it looks very dark but held against the light got some ruby the flavor has candy sugar caramel liquorice some sweetness one of mine favorites

Huge off-white/tan head, fades very quickly. Rich ruby brown colour. First pour is fairly clear, second half is much more murky with yeast sediment. Aroma of plum, dried fruit, raisin, Flavours match but very rich, nice sweetness amplifies the plum, dried fruit, cherry. Slight alcohol in after-taste. Med body, dry finish. Complex and very nice.

Bottle. Brown in colour with creme head. Aroma of malt, caramel, cabdi syrup, dried,fruits like raisins, plums, also hint of cherries and peach. Spicy note on the finish. In taste sweet, caramelly with dried fruits. Full bodied, dry finish with hoppy bitterness. World class quad, must drink for everyone.

Dark ruby, hazy, beautiful thick head. Aroma of dried fruit, port wine, spice, syrup. Medium to full body. Oily. Average carbonation. In flavour notes of dried fruit, port wine, grassy hops. Quaffable, very warming, still no boozy feel. Excellent balance. Delicate bitterness. Very nice
Real dense and toasty with some nutty character. Complex fruits in aroma and taste. For how thick it was the carbonation and palate were great, well balanced.

This is by far one of my favorites. Excellent taste. Aroma is wonderful. Definitely an "oh yeah..."

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 dark brown color, but I expected bigger head retention. aroma is roasted sweet malt, molasses, clove and dark fruits. slightly sweet and slightly bitter, superbly balanced. full bodied, smooth carbonated. warming and dry finish.
On tap at Little Delirium in Brussels. Thick cap, balanced taste with bitter and fruity nuance

Small bottle. Medium bodied, creamy. Huge head. Full of strong aromas - plum, raisins, caramel, bread, yeast. Sweet, with gentle bitter finish. Average carbonation which softly bites tongue. Perfect in every sip. One of the most memorable beers to which, due to availability, I like do come back.

dense quad: sticky cane sugar, toasty roasted malts, pungent hops, black truffle, leather, clove, black pepper, stewed beef, vinous heat. no component outweighing the other. like a tight young claret, with everything in the right place, i think my bottle would have loosened with time. one to stick away.
Bottle. Pours dark ruby, low head, a bit of lacing. Lots of ripe sweet fruits in the aroma, port wine taste, but not as heavy. Dark and complex, sweet and still refreshing. What an excellent beer!

750ml bottle...purple brown pour with a head that settles to a Petri dish colony. The nose is Port wine and the taste is a very complex mix of ripe dark fruit, weathered leather, tobacco, and primo weed. Awesome.

text: Birra favolosa, è corposa, ha un bel colore scuro, lascia un retrogusto amarognolo ma non forte
How: Bottle Appearance: deep brown with a medium to large off-white head. Aroma: dried fruits, citrus, caramel, stone fruits, grapes, pepper and ginger. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.
Aroma intenso e muito agradável, com notas de chocolate. Bem escura, quase totalmente preta. Sabor bem balanceado entre amargor, frutado e teor alcoólico. Enfim, umas das melhores!

Draught @ taphouse w friends/ ancient DTU. Appearance: pours clear reddish brown with ok off-white creamy head and lacing. aroma/taste: caramel, brown sugar, spices (anise?), chocolate, banana hints and some dark fruits. palette: strong malty and fruity aroma, average carbonation, medium to full body, distinct sweetness, not quite balanced by a medium bitterness, medium to long duration and an oily texture. UPDATED: NOV 6, 2015 Pours deep brown with small sediments floating around. Off-white creamy head. Aroma of dried fruit, slight caramel and roasted notes. Flavour is chocolate, dried fruit, caramel sweet and slight bitter. Doesnt hit the same smooth balance as Westie 12. Nice but not perfect

Aroma of caramel, toffee, spices, raisins. Pours brown with beige head, unfortunately not stable. Taste is balanced between sweetness and sourness with caramel, spices, fruits and wine. Bitterness is low. Overall very nice quadrupel but not delightful. I think I drunk it too fresh, so I will keep a couple of bottles for aging.

12 oz. bottle poured at my brothers house in Methuen, MA. This is a complex beer with a lot going on (and it all seems to work) but ill do my best. Pours a cloudy reddish brown with some sediment. The beige head was pillowy but died quickly and left no lacing. I poured this beer when it was too cold so I didnt get a lot of aroma at first but after I let it sit awhile I got cherries and red wine smells. Taste is hard to describe; good but hard to describe. There is an alcohol taste and some carbonation, along with cherries and spice of some sort. It has a hoppy, malty aftertaste and a nice slight bitter finish. This is a very drinkable beer; the more I taste it, the more I like it.

This is an overall great beer and enjoyed it thoroughly. It is quite hard to find in New York City however.

Smells like fruits and nuts. Has a dark ruby color. Has a taste of cherries, figs, plums, mixed with a port wine. Later you get a taste of oak, combined with some hops. It has a bitter finish.

Un top du top.
Très dure à définir. On est sur des notes épicées et typées genre Chimay bleue.
Lalcool est très présent : ne pas hésiter à la laisser reposer une dizaine de minutes dans un verre calice pour que lalcool se calme et les arômes se révèlent. Limiter la mousse : elle nen a pas besoin.
Déguster en mangeant quelque chose de fort en goût : bourguignon, gibier etc... Chaque gorgée a quelque chose à faire découvrir.

Bottle. Excuse me, could I have my beer back? Someone stole it and left me with a glass of head. Now, that said...Pours a clear red-brown with a very, very high light brown head; extremely creamy, extremely lacy, and very very solid. Looks like you could walk on it. On the palate, its a bakery gone wild; dark fruit. spice, vanilla, and yeasty notes. Finish is long and sweet. Darn Belgians. Theyre too good at this.

0,33 bottle. Muddy, brown beer with a noisy beige foam. Aroma: strong, wine, sweetness of caramel and toffee, dried fruits and higher esters.Taste: port wine mixed with toffee, caramel, dried fruits, spices, candy sugar, brandy. Great beer!

Dark fruit, yeast, brown shugga, dark malts... quite a quaff. If I was stuck on a desert island with only only type of beer, I would not be a happy camper... but half a dozen types? This would be a good choice for one of them. Very fine blend of flavors, good complexity, well hidden ABV, not too sweet and overall well balanced. A tribute to the brewers art

330ml bottle pours a deep ochre brown with decent off white head fading to cap. Nose is roast chestnuts, toasted malts and well toasted toast. Taste is, wow, nutty, creamy, bit of oak. Brilliant mouth feel, full bodied medium carbonation. Lots to love little to fault.

Somewhat cloudy dark brown. Nose grain, yeast, forest fruit. Medium bodied, not dry at all, light fresh aftertaste. Taste caramel, yeast, grain, alcohol, some red fruit. Much abbey beer, very natural, lots of grain, not much else going on. Basic, but well done. Very pleasant.
Flaska 1,5 l  magnum edition 2014 systembolaget. Disig mörkt bärnstensfärgad. Nötig aningen söt doft med torkad frukt och bränt socker. knäckig smak med äpplekart ,sirap och lite bananskum
Deep colour. Slim foam. Elegant. Sweet fruits. Oh well, the taste is so belgian I got a sudden craving of waffles. Great, just awesome. If I were a monk (or not) Id brew and drink this.
Bottle 33cl, pours a Brown colour with a beige head, aroma of fruits and candy, dry and warming aftertaste
A dark beer with an excellent complex taste with little bitterness making it smooth at the same time. Its very easy to finish this bottle.

Somehow I missed rating this.......From memory. Poured a deep amber color, clear, and small tan head. Aromas were typical of this style (at least what I get from them) with plum, caramel, vanilla, raisin, and bread. Flavor followed the nose and was very smooth at 10%. A friend and I split the 750 size bottle. Medium body type, creamy texture, good carbonation. Dont remember any bitter at all. Slightly dry on the finish, but smooth drinking beer.
UPDATED: AUG 22, 2016 A fantastic beer. Creamy and smooth, dark with big head, caramel, coffee, fruit. Very balanced.

Grandiosa. Color castaño oscuro. Poca espuma, es lo de menos. Aroma delicioso a clavo, fruta y dulce malta. Sabor extraordinario. Piensa un matiz y ahí está. Frutas. Cafe. Caramelo. Hierbas. Especias. Cuerpazo. Final contundente donde sale bastante el alcohol redondeando el conjunto, sobresaliente. La reina entre las reinas de las Bernardus.

12oz bottle into a chalice. Pours a cloudy brown with a few peripheral ruby notes, slight tan head. Big-time nose of dried fruit, caramel and bready malts. Flavour-wise, plum, caramel, raisins. Bittersweet finish. Rich, bold, complex, and simply gorgeous.

Aroma: malt, carmel, raisins, some yeast notes
Palate: sweet, perfect carbonation
Taste: dark fruits, carmel, chocolate, raisins, some bready notes

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dunkelbraun rot leicht trüb mit hellbrauner Schaumkrone. Im Geruch zeigen sich schon die schönen Aromen von Dörrobst. Geschmacklich kommen schöne Aromen von Dörrobst, Karamell und Gewürzen zum Vorschein. Wenig Hopfen erkennbar, der hohe Alkoholgehalt hingegen ist präsent. 
Gut!

S:
-caramel,plums,raisins,dates,banana,spices,sli bready
-T:
-Follows the nose
F:
-alcohol well hidden
O:
World class Quad
