Pours dark red brown with a small ivory-coloured head with sufficient retention. Aroma of bread, malt and an unplacable sweetnes with a little yeast. Low carbonation, yet a very creamy mouthfeel. Extremely complex taste of Christmas cake, plums, caramel, figs, malt, dark fruit, a little yeast...and lots more which also continues in the long aftertaste. Alcohol of course present, but kept well in check. Despite its silly label, this is a great Belgian Abt/Quadrupel.
Bottle from Oxford beer store. Pour is abbey dark brown and thick head if you don't pour well. Nose is malty and complex and taste follows. Well done sir.

Dark brown color beer with a big beige head that does not last much. Aroma is dried fruit, caramel, roasted malt and a lot of alcohol. Flavor is predominantly sweet with some bitterness notes. Alcohol is evident during the whole tasting and drives to a long licor-like end. Thick body and medium carbonation.

Foam: ivory-coloured head, not big, diminishing.
Colour: very dark red/brown.
Aroma: sweet fruits, malts, cherries
Taste: full body, lower carbonation, plums, apple, salted caramel, alcohol, toffee, yeast, figs, raisins, dark fruits, as you drink it you find a lot of more, in finish with herbs hops notes, very nice one, great excellent beer.
This beer is super complex, so many different things going on, nice yeast character, crazy malt structure, sweetness, you name it. I love this beer, hope they re-release the special edition too.

Fruity and smooth. Good aroma but not great. Good beer but not great. Something is missing for my liking. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A nice abbey appearance, the beer has a dark brown thick white layer of foam, there was a nice smell, however, the smell was not that strong. There was a nice sweet smell with a alcohol aroma. The smell also contained some bitterness. The taste also had this alcohol in it, which fits a dark traditional beer like this. The finish had a nice amount of bitterness.

From 750ml, poured into Belgian style tulip glass

Aroma: sweet malts, fruits, cherries, 

Appearance: brown with red hues, hazy, big tan head with great retention

Taste: Heavy sweet, light bitter

Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, dry finish

Overall: Very creamy and smooth quad. Slight taste of alcohol, but its subtle against the complex sweetnesses. Aroma is very sweet, almost like fruit and cherries. Nice dark brown color with hazy/cloudy body and big tan head. A very solid quad with a slight bitterness that balances the heavy malty sweetness. I slightly prefer La Trappe over Abt12, but theyre both highly enjoyable.

Bottled, Cesky Brod, CZ, Malt,caramel,dark fruit and alcohol aroma, Dark brown color, bigger lasting head, Sweet taste, long dry finish, Alcohol warm, Full body, Average carbon, Interesting experience.
Pours a murky brown. Earth and hay aromas. Very spicy and a touch of brown sugar to compliment.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Lekker zwaar biertje met een iets bittere nasmaak. Enorm lekker met een super smaak.
Dull brown pour with a short, light tan head. Earthy yeast aroma. Fruit and caramel equally represented and well-blended.

2 bottles opened and tested in parallel in May 2015. one new purchased in the U.S. with a 2018 best before and one 8 years old purchased in Belgium with a 2011 best before date. The older has less head and is darker. Old has strong port and dried fruit aroma. New has minimal aroma but some similar notes. Old: plums, dried fruit, molasses. Slightly sweet and slick finish. Low carbonation. New: drier an similar notes but much less pronounced. Some more hoppy bitterness detectable but not strong. More effervescent mouthfeel. Old is significantly better and the basis of the review. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Froathy, thick head. Coke-brown body. Smells of syrup, caramel, citrus, almond. Bubbly fresh taste of plum, syrup, apple, salt, caramel and almond. A very lean sweet and bitter aftertaste which balances out the hight amount of alcohol. An amazing beer that never disappoints but took a surprisingly long time to actually rate!

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy, dark reddish brown with a small beige head. Sweet malty aroma of dried fruit, caramel, yeast and alcohol. Sweet malty flavour of dark fruit, liquorice, caramel, yeast and some bitterness with a dry, warming alcohol finish. Full body with an oily texture and fizzy carbonation. A complex and well balanced beer. Great for sipping.

Une des meilleures bières quil me soit donnée de boire. Il manque juste une longueur en bouche et ce petit quelque chose quapporte certaines autres trappistes de même calibre pour atteindre la perfection.
Bottle from Congress, Longton. Pours deep brown with stiff off white head. Some sweetness, dark fruit, boozy kick, well carbonated. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2017 0,33 l bottle from EDEKA Mohr, best before May 2018. Clear, very dark ruby with a huge, creamy, almost stable, tan head. Pleasant, fruity aroma of figs, plums, raisins, cherries, toffee and nuts. Slightly vinous. Fantastic, sweetish-fruity and vinous taste of cherries, figs, plums and raisins with a bit of port. Long, medium bitter and hoppy finish with a bit of warming alcohol and coconut. Full body, very creamy and smooth mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Wow, fantastic beer! Very rich and harmonic, not overly sweet and with a nice hoppy finish as a counterpart that lasts long on your palate. Very satisfying!

33 cl. bottle @ home. Dark brown beer with brownish white head. Fruity aroma. First sip is sweet with lively palate. Afterwards the palate gets smooth. Taste turns to caramel and chocolate, followed by a hint of liqour (whiskey?) in the aftertaste. Lives up to the expectation.
Big fluffy head. Perfect nose. Dark fruits, plums, raisins. Baked bread, spices, sweet Belgian yeast. Some brandy on the long finish. Sweet and balanced. Superb quad!
An excellent Belgian classic that exemplifies the quad style. Dark brown pour with off white head and full of rich dark fruit.
dark brown, strong malt taste, some brandy, very fizzy,decent quad but not the best

Pours dark brown. Tawny froth.
Intense aromas of plantain, coffee, rucola, chocolate.
Powerful and dense. Fizzy, full body. Very long sweet-ish finish. Fantastic.

I was never a Trappist beer person until I had the Westvletern in Brussels. After that, I had to try some other. I had heard that St Bernardus was basically the same. I found the St Bernardus ABT 12 to be a bit more hot from the alcohol and less caramel from the malt. Not real chocolate for me.

Bottle from Uba ja Humal in Tallinn ( 4). Murky dark brown with a red hue. Massive light beige head with good retention and little lacing. The nose is nice: warming and full, caramel and dark dried fruits, and a hint of alcohol. Tastes of caramel, toffee, figs, prunes - nice mellow sweetness plus very faint bitterness in the finish, mixing with the rather boozy warmth. Thin but active carbonation. Body mediumish. Nice complex beer. Not too impressed though.

Shared bottled with Jeppe. Aroma of alcohol, dark dried fruits. Reddish brown colour with long lasting tan head. Alcohol sweetness, medium sweetness, light bitterness. full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, sweet, alcohol finish.
33cl bottle. Pours dark brown with big head. Strong taste of fresh cut wood and malt. Rich malty and yeasty taste. A little short aftertaste. Very drinkable beer.

Cor marrom escuro, turva. Espuma boa e de média persistência, cremosa. Aroma que remete ao vinho, caramelo e frutas escuras. No paladar notas de frutas escuras como ameixa e alcoólico. Cerveja complexa, corpo forte e retrogosto agradavelmente alcoólico. Fantástica.
In bottiglia ZBF 15. Aroma di frutta secca, nocciola, frutta sciroppata, nel finale appare anche del floreale, sfumature legnose e una nota di vino liquoroso.

Its always great when a beer lives up to its reputation. Everything I wanted in a Belgian Quad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2015 Compra: www.cervezasespeciales.com

Opinión: Lo unico malo de esta cerveza es que al tener tanta graduacion no se pueden beber muchas seguidas
Flesje bernardus. Bij het openen maken komt Er al wat schuim uit. Mooi bruin bier, geuren van oa karamel. Smaak is precies wat je van een quadriple verwacht met een zachte afdronk en wat frisse tonen

Poured from a 355 ML bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- big malt and fruit smell, really good
Appearance- Pours a dark brown with a big tan head. Has a lot of sediment and I let that settle before tasting.
Taste- Incredible flavor, malt, hops and maybe some fruit
Palate- A medium bodied beer with mild carbonation. Excellent creamy texture.
Overall- A world class beer, outstanding.

bbe 01/04/2015 . I have no idea how to describe the aroma. nothing distinguishes itself from the rest except a basic malty aroma. coca cola colour, off white head. taste is plums licorice, medium sweetness , no bitterness, hint of alcohol. soft carbonation, slick feel, medium body, ligth bitter finish. Extremely balanced beer, havent tasted this fresh.

Pours dark brown with nice head. Aroma of caramel and dried fruits. Full bodied. Good balance, sour/sweet. Bitter at the end.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours mahogny brown with light brown head. Heavy malty flavour. The Taste is sweet and plummy, Very well balanced.
Sabores a caramelo y pan, color pardo con una espuma blanquecina de color blanco. buen cuerpo

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2016 Hazy brown, not opaque, with a dedcent fluffy beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, dry fruits, raisins, dates, yeast. Taste is sweet with a light sour astringent and bitter finish. Full bodied, average carbonation. Good but Westvleteren is so much better (much more silky and smooth).
94-7-4-17=41

22/03/2016
So damn boozy!

Sampled via bottle at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Poured a hazy brown with a thick cream top. Taste of alcohol, toffee, Belgian yeast, and dried fruits. Highly active carbonation on the palate, medium body. Final thoughts: overkill on the alcohol flavor.

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Pours dark, reddish brown; off-white head, some minimal spotty lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, yeast and caramel. Taste of caramel, fruit and bread. Balanced, enjoyable and quite drinkable; very good beer.

Pours a dark hazy brown with a small but long lasting foamy tan head. Lots going on with the aroma, bready caramel malt, slightly herbal hop note, doughy yeast and figs, plums and other fruits. Lots going on here! As the description reads it is nicely balanced sweet, bitter and malty and the alcohol is hardly noticable! A complex and very enjoyable beer, very nice indeed.

Bottle split with a friend. Pours a deep, dark, rich mahogany color. Aroma is complex molasses, fig, raisin, and cherry, with caramel notes as well. Flavor is sweet and sour fruit up front, with a lingering bitterness. Delicious. Palate is a bit chewy, not unpleasant. Overall a great beer.
Tot op heden is dit mijn favoriete trappist. De heerlijke smaak blijft zeer lang in de mond hangen.

Pour is dark brown with a thin head. Intense nose of dried fruits, Belgian yeast, and some doughy and roasty aromas. Earthy. Taste is spicy and boozy with lots of prune, raisin and some chocolate notes. Medium bitter finish. High carbonation. Great beer!
Deep reddish brown pour with a thin tan head. Yeast, fruit cake, malt, brown sugar, little spicy. Taste is caramel, dark fruit, a little boozy. Pretty damn good.

3/31/15 (Bottle) - Very dark brown pour, generous thick tan head. Aromas included malts, fruits, raisins and spices. Incredibly smooth to drink, light carbonation, beer went down easy despite the heavy ABV, though you did feel it later.Well balanced taste of malts, hops and flavor. Right amount of "wrong", sweet and firm. Overall an excellent beer, one of the best I ever had.
33cl BBE 22/07/18 This is a place holder. I am sick, and I can not taste beer properly. Will get back to this one. First impression is good. A bit yeasty for my taste, and rather thin though.

On tap at la maison belgue. Brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma is a yeasty, sweet malty. Flavor is a rich caramel with a maybe too high alcoholic for my taste, balanced by an earthy sweetness. Nice warmer beer, but not my fave quad.
Poured from a tap. Reddish cloudy, sweet aroma, no head, slight lacing. way more Apple taste than I expected, good ABV.
Bottle a home, bought in Brussels, 29th March 15. Pours dark, aroma, rich fruit, yeast, bread. Flavour is rich, dark fruits, bready notes, yeast, sweet, but not overly. Great Quad

Bottle - big foamy head, very dark brown color, pretty balanced but complex aroma and flavor, fruity, malty, almost a bourbon/whiskey note in there, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: Es una cerveza oscura color oscuro amarfilado, opaca, densa y potente. 
- Aroma: Complejo aroma de maltas tostadas , caramelo y hierbas sigue evolucionando durante su consumo, dependiendo de la temperatura de la copa. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: Cuerpo redondo y equilibrado, no fuerte de sabor, suavizado por el agua especial de características dulces, predominando el sabor a malta tostada, levadura, y caramelo, con notas de frutos rojos, y café. El final del trago es suave, pero con un creciente y agradable amargor.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Brown beer with white head. Dark fruits, candy sugar, spicy aroma. Taste has ripe fruits, candy sugar, plums, raisin, warmth of alcohol.
Spoko piwo. Fajny aromat, spoko wygląd i świetny smak. Jakoś nie byłem przekonany wcześniej do tego gatunku, ale to piwo powoli to zmienia..

Tried a small bottle out of a holiday mixer pack.

Smells very sweet. A little off putting to be honest. Fruity aroma.

Pours a very dark amber. Head dispersal quickly. Very hazy with bits of fermentation suspended in the beer.

Has plenty of carbonation. Goes down smooth for a beer with such a high alcohol content.

Overall I was very pleased with this beer. Little to no overpowering hop taste. It was a little sweet for my liking, but we will see how the cellered bottles do in a year or so. You can tell this is a quality brew.

MB
Color marrón oscuro, espuma compacta y persistente. Aroma de maltas, levadura, frutas maduras. Sabor maltoso dulce, licor y fruta madura. Cuerpo y carbonatación medios. Final dulce. Muy buena Abt.

0.33 bottle. Very dark, brown color and a large, off-white head. Aroma of malts, yeasts, overripe fruits, some ash, raisins, and delicate alcohol. Sweet taste of malts, caramel, fruity bitterness, and spices. Medium to full body, slick texture, and average carbonation. Finish is more roasted though generally follows the taste - a molasses-like bitterness lingers. Overall a good beer but has perceptible flaws.

This came off rather sweet, but with a sickly sour second note. The beer is smooth and pretty, but has a slightly off taste. I tried downing a handful of dried cranberries to adjust my tastebuds, which improved the flavor of the beer, taking out the unpleasant sickly sweet. Afterwards it tasted like a good quad, but without much complexity.

DWF; MAR 14. Bottle, Magnum Edition 2014, 1,5 L. corked. A unique collectors item.. hmm. Pours large, dark brown with a large frothy to creamy, lacing, moderate lasting tan head. Aroma is heavy malt, caramel, yeast and nuts, moderate overripe fruit, light ash, grass, alchol and spice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate bitter with a lasting, warming, roasted finish. Body is medium, texture is oily to silky, carbonation is avarage.

Poured from 330ml bottle after cellaring for four years. 

Clear, dark reddish brown with significant suspended dark sediment. Even more sediment was left in the bottom of the bottle. It had a 1-finger pastel yellow head and very good lacing. 

Intense raisin aroma with other dark fruit, toffee, apple, pear, vanilla and yeast. 

Taste of dates, raisins, black figs, apples, cloves, spices, vanilla, toffee and dark malt. The sediment does not seem to have hurt the flavor or the mouthfeel. 

Medium body and high carbonization.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 0,33l. Pours hazy brown color with frothy beige head. Aroma raisins, fruity, sweet. Taste light toast, caramel, almonds. Medium body, oily feel, creamy.
330ml bottle from beer gonzo. Typical Belgian beer aroma. Taste stewed fruit and malty yeastiness. Great beer

Bottle @ Koht, Tallinn.
Dark amber color, medium head. Well balanced taste. Caramel, bread and yeasty aroma. Drinks like a good wine. Very good.

Colore marrone, schiuma molto abbondante, marroncina.
Odore molto ricco, dolce, caramello, frutta matura, fichi, banana, fruttatissimo e alcoolico.
Sapore dolce, fruttato, maltoso e caramelloso. Finale aspro, piuttosto che amaro, e ancora fruttato. Alcool abbastanza nascosto. Sapori dolci predominanti.

Dark brown colour, thick creamy head. Strong full-bodied mouthfeel with moderate carbonation. Taste is a combination of sweetness and bitterness. Caramelly malts with notes of raisin, licorice, spices, cherries.

3/7/15 Carmel colored with huge yeasty smelling head. Strong carmel malt flavor. Bittersweet and spicy. Good and complex but not a big fan of this style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 11, 2016 Het broertje van de Westvleteren 12. Mooi heel donker bier, kleine schuimkraag. Goed in balans, niet te zoet en ook de alcohol overheerst niet. Heerlijk bier om rustig van te genieten ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2015 Pours a dark amber color. Aroma has anise, caramel, candy sirup, orangepeel, mandarin, clove, belgian spice. LOADS of aroma. Flavor has caramel candy sirup, clove, anise, belgian spice, yeasty, sweet toast. So damn complex. Delicous quad. Alcohol is not at all prominent. Awesome!

Bottle shared with mikkvoika and tarmok. Pours brownish with frothy beige head.Aroma is a bit weak, sweet, raisins, roasted malts, fruity, candy. Taste is medium sweet,caramel, lightly roasted malts, almonds, slight bitterness.Medium creamy-oily body. A bit to sweet for me. Not a fan of belgians. But this one i can drink occasionally.

Bottle. Pours cloudy hazlenut dark brown with particles in suspension and small off white head. Aroma of ripe fruit, spices and a bit of booze. Taste is reminiscent of candy apple, with a sweetness and an acidic aspect running parallel. Nice.

Banana bread, spicy, sweet aroma with a touch of raisin/date. Ruddy brown to deep red with lasting thin head. Flavors are very complex Belgian signature spice without the fruitiness or pit-fruit notes often found in other Quads-Dubbels. Oddly enough you get a hint of herbal spicy hops on the finish. Bready oatmeal cookie malt notes dominate along with the spice. Unctuous mouthfeel is perfect. Overall it doesnt disappoint. Excellent example of the style. Those hop notes are interesting, setting it apart from other examples.

Aroma: raisin, candy, alcohol, roasted malts. Appearance: brown hazy liquid, frothy beige foam. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, caramel, light roast, almond. Palate: medium body, creamy, soft carbonation,

Great beer. Just as written. Fruity fig or tea flavor. Really smooth. Low head retention plenty of carbonation. Very good big drinking beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Très belle bière de type quadruple dun brun profond. Mousse beige épaisse, onctueuse et persistante laissant beaucoup de dentelles sur le verre. Au nez, beaucoup dépices et de cassonade. Nez fidèle au style bien que corsé. En bouche la bière dévoile beaucoup de sucres résiduels. Très ronde et corpulente. Bière très complexe de par les arômes de réglisse, de sucre dorge, de fruits confits et dépices. Longue en bouche, elle nous permet de profiter longuement de ses saveurs évolutives.

2014 Magnum Bottle 1500ml by my self. Scent of Mazarin and yeast. Good fragrance. Easier hopped with a little yeast and a little alcohol but still good. Okay bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the upper part of the mouth briefly. Okay beer but does not feel so special anyway. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

33cl bottle from my cellar. Pours a deep, cola brown color with a big fan head. Aroma is dark fruit, cherry, raisin, vanilla. Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, nutty, raisin, bread, caramel, with a sweet, dark fruit finish. Excellent.

Bouteille de 750ml. Arôme sucré et bonbon. Apparence bourgogne intense presque opaque. En bouche, cest très miel et caramel sans trop tomber sur le coeur. Côté belge un peu trop subtil a mon goût. Bonne bière à partager.

bottle at home. brown color, big tan hdead, smells yeasty, fruity, pears, apples, dried fruits, some sweetness. full body, bubbly, good carbonation, taste of dried fruits, alcoholic, light liqueurish, nice bubbly feel on tongue and throat, light astringency, good bitter / alcoholic / astringent finish.
Has a very strong smell of caramel, burnt sugar and alcohol. Pours dark cloudy amber with a beige head. Tastes a lot of caramel and burnt sugar. The mouthfeel is smooth and creamy.

WYGLĄD: Barwa ciemno miedziana, zamglone. Piana drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, nietrwała, niska.
AROMAT: Na początku zapach warzyw strączkowych (fasolka szparagowa, groszek), belgijskie drożdże, bardzo dużo przypraw i ziół, nuty likierowe, kandyzowane owoce.
SMAK: Ponownie ziołowość oraz kandyzowane owoce. Słodowość i przypalony karmel. Wysycenie średnie.
OGÓLNIE: Jest zupełnie identyczne jak w opisie, czyli niesamowicie zbalansowane, pełne i zrównoważone pomiędzy goryczą, a słodyczą. Alkohol idealnie wkomponowany w aromat i smak.
Such a powerful beer. Extremely well made. Perhaps the best tasting beer I have ever drunk.
Heerlijk donker bier, stevig schuim, volle smaak. Perfect alternatief voor Westvleteren...
Chestnut brown. Lighter than some root beers, head like soda. Smells strongly yeasty like one of my first wine brews. Nice light body and yeasty sourness.

Dark amber colour, beige head diminishes fast. Sweet aroma of malts, dark fruit. Taste is sweet, spicy, notes of plums and bubblegum. Aftertaste has this bubblegum note again. Almost no bitterness. Full, creamy, rich body. I can see why this is so famous.
(bottle) clear, deep amber colour with a medium tall, beige head; aroma of cereal, then honey; balaced, intense flavour with a long, light bitter finish

A personal favourite of mine. Pours dark brown with a creamy head. Heavy dark fruit aroma with a hint of malt. Complex flavours of caramel, figs and earthy malts. Very full and rich body, nicely balanced with a smooth finish.
Dark, large head. Aroma of hops. Full body, average carbonation. Taste is sweet and bitter.
Flaska från Saveur-biere. Mörkt brun med beige skum. Söt doft med inslag av jord och frukt. Söt med lite choklad och en del beska.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Color marrón rojizo oscuro. Espuma beige jabonosa poco persistente. Aromas a frutas maduras, levadura malta. En boca es dulce y amarga a partes iguales, sabores frutales y a levadura con final mas afrutado...a cerezas kizas termina mas amarga con matices mas malteados y a levadura. Redonda en textura y aceitosa..carbonatacion media.el alcohol no se nota nada. Buena Birras...muy redonda.

Questa celebre quadrupel non stecca mai, al top della sua categoria. Si presenta marrone scuro con buona schiuma bianca e di media persistenza. Al naso dolce e profumata, malto evidentissimo. Risplende al palato con i suoi sapori di caramello e frutta, con un finale alcolico grazie al corpo deciso dato dai 10%. Abbastanza frizzante per il suo stile, la bottiglia in esame in particolare aveva una notevole quantità di lievito sospeso come si vede. Eccellente e immancabile tra le grandi birre dabbazia belghe.

Dried fruit right is spot on, some chocolate and caramel with just enough yeastiness and bitterness to compliment. Alcohol (hard to believe its 10%) is faint but warming. Bubbly throughout, surprising light and clean finish for a brown ale. One of my favorites and also a great winter warmer.

It pours a brown color with a massive long lasting off white head. It has the aroma of dried fruit. bread, nuts, leather and earth. It tastes like bread, raisins, leather, barnyard flavors and Belgian yeast. This beer is absolutely wonderful. Sinful and divine at the same time. Im so glad I bought this beer. I could drink this over and over again.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep amber with loads of big yeast sediment, bvdr, and big creamy thick dense head. Aroma is kind of malty, not really sweet but some candied sugar. Only slight belgian yeast and esteres. Some booze. Taste is raisins, caramel, malty finish. A bit one dimensional. And candied sugar with big creamy body and relative high carbonation. Some warming alcohol. Think this one was off.

Im not going to even sugar coat this one. This beer is perfect. Dark fruit dominate the aroma. Plums, raising and figs. Its a beer you sip and enjoy. Its no joke. The taste is just a gigantic amount of dark fruit and sweet malt. Its really carbonated which surprised me. There are just so many flavors going on and it all just works so well. I have heard that this is one of the finest beers in the world and I was given it as a gift and had to try it. Im really loving it.

Pours dark amber with a big, creamy beige head. Hevy aroma of dried fruits, alcohol, caramel and esters. Mighty warm flavours in the taste, dried fruit, alcohol, caramel, toffee and a hint o coffee. Full body, low carbonation. Great beer!

Sweet dark fruity potent aroma. Off white head that lingers nicely considering how potent this stuff is. A dark fruity taste. Hints of raisin with a little bitterness. Warms your palate. Feels bubbly and and tangy. Appears brown but if held to light it has a mahogany red tinge in which to see the sediment floating around. Enjoyable.
In the aroma some hints of coffee and chocolate. Subtile and malty. Its taste is, kinda exotic, warm, little sweet and rich in alcohol. Some hints of nuts.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2015 750ml bottle from saq shared with friends. Drank on January 30th. Aroma :Dark fruits, spices, sugar, alcohol. App: brown murky with small beige head. Taste and palate :full body, medium sweetness, sweet and warming alcohol finish. Sticky. Overall : not my first time, not my last time that I drink this amazing beer. A perfect strong ale.

Bottle. A Belgian told me once this is as good as Westy 12, and indeed is pretty much the same recipe. Given I can buy 5 of these for 1 Westy its no competition. Smooth ripe dark fruits, malts, esters, velvet body. Touch foamy but a little thing only. A good winters day comfort.

Pours a reddish copper in color with a full, bubbly looking darker beige head. The aroma is potent and more tart, with cherry, apple, raisin, caramel, Belgian yeast, and some spices. The taste retains the detected tartness while adding a more mild bitterness to it. Cherry, plum, and spices are found initially. This is followed up with some caramel, figs, and earthy malts. Belgian yeast remains throughout. The aftertaste is cherry and lesser caramel, with a slight sourness lingering for awhile. Medium to full in body, a bubbly, sticky texture, and lots of fizzy carbonation in here. I would never have guessed that this one is 10% without the label telling me. It is very drinkable, as the lingering sourness encourages more drinking. Complex and delicious, everyone needs to try this.

Gamle noter fra tidligere ølsmagning:

Duft 2,8 ud af 5
Smag 4,2 ud af 5
Udseende 3,5 ud af 5
I alt: 6,3 ud af 10

St. Bernardus abt 12 uitgeschonken in St. Bernardus bier bokaal. Diep donkerbruine kleur met beige schuimkraag. De geur is kruiden, rozijnen en Belgische gist. De smaak is zacht zoet en complex. Met tonen van kersen, pruimen, rozijnen, dadels, chocolade en specerijen als kaneel en kruidnagel. Verder smaken van karamel, brood en koekjes deeg. Echt lekker complexe smaak. De afdronk is kruidig en chocolade met een zacht bittere hop toets. De St. Bernardus abt 12 is geen echte Trappist, maar staat op hetzelfde hoge niveau als Rochefort 10 en Westvleteren 12. De gebruikte gist schijnt de originele Westvleteren gist te zijn. Een keer een smaaktest doen tussen deze 2 Belgische top Quadrupel bieren om de smaakverschillen te kunnen onderscheiden! De St. Bernardus abt behoort in elk geval tot de beste bieren van België in de Quadrupel stijl.

My my what a treat. Pours a dark opaque ruby with a large off-white foamy head, leaving behind a crazy amount of lacing. Aromas of Belgian yeast, cherry, plum, slight booze, caramel, and earth tease the nose, a sure sign of what is to come. Has a very full body with a fizzy carbonation along with a fairly oily/chewy mouthfeel. Almost a meal in a glass I reckon. This beer hides its booze very well, leaving just enough boozy flavor to make it nice and warming. Starts off with a light sweetness on the tongue followed by a dry cherry-like bitterness. Easily my favorite of the St. Bernardus line yet.

My kind of Saint, bringing a huge heavy hitting harbinger of happiness ahead! Little beastly yeasties floating within the ebb and flow of fine full flavours, this dark chesnut brown nectar holds a potent ivory skullcap. Plums, raisins, burnt toffee, leather, oak, basement, earth and red wine comprise the aroma and taste of this rich, sweet but well balanced dry finishing thoroughbred king. Very mildly tart notes of cherries and currants further pique my already appreciative interests. A silky smooth yet effervescent feel round this champion brew out to near perfection.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy dark brown, nose is dark fruit, sweet, caramel, taste is similar, rich.

Bottiglia 33cl comprata da giangaspero e bevuta a casa.
Marrone tonaca di frate con schiuma piuttosto persistente.
Mio carbonata, amara, esce alcol.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 Butelka, warka do 21.10.2018. Ciemno brunatne, lekko przeswitujace z rubinowymi przeblyskami piwo. Piana bardzo bujna i ladna, niemniej opada w nienajpiekniejszy sposob (zostaja grube, nierowne pecherzyki) i tylko lekko koronkuje na szkle. Aromat wyjatkowo intensywny, glownie ciemne owoce (sliwki, figi, winogrona, wisnie, banan) rowniez suszone (czytaj: rodzynki) a moze kandyzowane, gdyz czuc tez cukier trzcinowy. Do tego nieco slabszych, slodowych aromatow (tostowo-chlebowych). Smak dosc analogiczny, dominuja nuty slodkie, owocowe. Goryczka niewysoka. Raczej wytrawne. stosunkowo wysokie nasycenie. Alkohol ewidentnie rozroznialny przez ogrzewanie gardla, jednak w samym smaku czy aromacie ladnie zamaskowany i ledwo wyczuwalny - po niezbyt dlugim lezakowaniu pewnie by zniknal zupelnie. W ustach dosc lepkie, wrecz momentami oleiste. Jedno z tych piw, ktore same zachecaja do jak najszybszego siegniecia po kolejny lyk. Klasa. butelka, warka do 12-03-19. Jeszcze intensywniejsze odczucia, w stosunku do powyzszych notatek mam wrazenie, ze bardziej wyczuwalna kwaskowatosc w smaku, idealnie kontrujaca slodycz. w zapachu z kolei bardziej slodko, jakies nutki miodu... ocena jeszcze  lekko w gore :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).urealnienie oceny :)

Appearance: dark red 
Head: Medium, frothy
Aroma: Strong aroma... Cinnamon, hops and little caramel
Mouth: good carbonation, light.
Taste: malt, spices, and caramel. Little hops.
Overall: Complicated taste with a very distinctive aroma. Must try!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Marrom escura com boa formação e estabilidade de espuma. Aromas de toffe, caramelo, banana passas, ameixa, figos, caramelo. No sabor vem o brandy, mel, melaço. Corpo médio alto, quase licoroso. Amargor médio-baixo, Aftertaste alcoólico, aquecedor, adocicado e levemente frutado (vermelhas). Sensacional.

Deep brown in colour with a very good head and lacing. Dark fruits of plums, dates and raisins with a good caramel and malty sweetness. A nice smooth finish, excellent beer, one I could drink any time.

Pours a brown / muddy beer, brownish head, good lacing. Aroma is absolutely delicious, sweet ripe fruits, raisins. Tastes really good, again dark fruits, plum, raisin, caramel. Very high on carbonation, bit too much imo. But nevertheles a highly enjoyable beer.

Poured from the tap. Dark mahogany amber with full beige head. Very nice sweet malt and caramel with dark dried fruits, mild alcohol. Medium-to-full body. Could use a little aging to flesh out an already great beer.
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Brun med tett medium skum. Nydelig aroma av karamell, sukker, malt, tørket frukt og noe gjær. Smaken er karamell, sukker, alkohol og malt. Mildt sur smak. Tørr.

Robe brune. Nez puissant sur des notes chocolatées, un coté malté assez prononcé, du caramel. Bouche à lattaque ample, un belle rondeur, une impression de sucrosité et une longue finale épicée sur une pointe damertume agréable. Une très belle bière qui se marie à merveille avec les fromages. A essayer sur des fromages bleus.

This beer is everything you need to know about belgian quads. Fruity aroma, plums, raisins, some spices. Pours deep brown with huge head, typical for belgian brews. Sweet, fruity taste. High carbonation.
Brun med orangeskjær med høyt beige skum som legger seg fort. Mørke stenfrukter, svisker og gjær. Fyldig. Søtlig. Kjenner alkoholen. Tørr avslutning.
Beige skum. Skummet la seg fort. Lukt av mørke bær. Sterk smak. Rund. Fizzy karbonering på tunga. Svak alkoholsmak. Tørr.
Bottle. Sweet, tight, little alcohol content. Good saturation. Excellent Belgian Quad.
Draft pour at beer authority. Dark brown pour, slight sour aroma but not a sour beer.

Pours a dark brown body with full off-white head. Massive rings of lace exhibits an impressive presentation. Aroma is packed with fruit, including blueberries and bananas. Pleasant malt scents with a hint of alcohol. Nutty bread taste with a nice punch of hoppiness. Perfect level of carbonation. Velvety smooth finish makes this an excellent option that I will enjoy again in the future.

Bottle from a seasonal 6 pack sampler. Poured a muddy, reddish brown. Very active carbonation. One finger, tan head, slowly continuously building. Scent of hay. Touch of the alcohol coming through. Very complex flavours. Strong from beginning to end. Moderately bitter, medium long finish. Light lacing. Thin texture. Not quite as great as I was expecting, but still an excellent beer.

Pours a dark tawny with a small off white head, earthy aroma very complex beer, grain, hay, spice and fruits had a soft carbonation but very lively in the mouth, sweat across the palate excellent example of a trappist

Another very good quad. If you like this style then this is a good choice when you cant get the Westveteren 12. This beer is caramel, roasty, and earthy. Great when imbibing with good friends who enjoys the quad.

Poured into St Bernardus glass a nice brown with tan head and lace. Aroma is fruity, dark fruits, bready and earthy. Taste is complex, dark fruits, toffee, and roasted malts that get deeper as it warms. Raisins, figs, toasted bananas,and carmeled sugars. Amazing
Bottle. Pours a dark opaque brown with a thin layer of tan head. Aroma and taste of dark fruit, caramel, and malts.

Rich malt aroma of caramel and bread. Appearance is a dark Amber with an off white head with good retention. Flavor is malty sweet with notes of dark plums and raisins. Mouthfeel is medium full with medium high carbonation. Overall, this is a great Belgian quad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Brun uklar farge. Moderat karbonert med hvit skumtopp. Smaker gjær, krydder, malt, karamell og mørk frukt. Muy bien cervesa
Strong and heavy Abbey beer with a lot of different taste. Rich palate with hints of chocolate. Sometimes called the affordable sister of Westvleteren, it is one of the better dark ales available.

Tastes like Blue Moon...nothing special, i have had better trappist beers, not an "official" trappist beer but obviously made in the same respects as you can notice the "trappist style" but definitely very fruity and very much like blue moon...which makes me question why i would spend so much money on a blue moon.

Pours mildly dark with a nice head. Has a fairly fruity taste, smell is also fairly fruity. Its a really great beer.
Had from a bottle.

Cloudy brown pour with nice mahogany highlights and a pretty good carbonation content. The substancial head is fluffy and creamy showing a light tan. It also develops great lacing and retains very well. The nose is complex, sweet and earthy, fruity and lightly smoky. I got caramel and dark fruits like figs paired with good yeasts. The taste is bold but subtle all at once. The earthy hops come along first closely followed by the yeasts and a very nice and balanced lightly bitter sharpness slowly invades the palate from the back of the tongue. The sweetness is again just right and gives a nice foundation to all of the other elements. The mouthfeel is olily, sharp and dense which from my stand point is right on target. This Abt is full-bodied, complex and overall a very enjoyable product. Cellar this one for a couple of years to let develop complexity and youll be glad you did.

Packaged in an impressive corked bottle. Deep brown with a thick ivory head. Plenty of lacing. Very malty with a slight hop bite on the finish. Very balanced. Fruity with hints of plum and raisin. Quite a kick at 10% ABV the alcohol is not overly present in the aroma or taste.

Heerlijk bier om lang van te genieten, donker bruin met een goede beige schuimkraag. Eerste smaak is zoet, wat overgaat in aangenaam licht bitter. Drinkt makkelijk weg, lijkt daardoor lichter dan het is. Pas op, het bier tikt flink aan. Een van mijn favorieten.
Got some aniseed. Elegant beer after the first sip a tiny hint of spirit. Will definitely rate this again.
Bière au goût très prononcé et qui évolue. Arrière goût qui dure. Bière très agréable, mais assez lourde à boire.

0,33 bottle purchased and consumed in Kosovo in its original glass. Pours a reddish dark brown (chestnut skin) color, some sediments in the end (I have not poured it all) and a nice dark ivory foamy head. Nose: round and pleasant attack of dry fruit (prunes dominate the nose), fresh juicy black figs, fruity overall feel, hidden but perceivable hoppy bitterness. Mouth: what a joy to drink it during a winter evening! Juicy and chewy maltiness, dry fruits, good carbonation, some after taste pleasant alcohol notes, soul warming feel. Great beer.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2016 1,5 L MAGNUM BOTTLE -SHARED.
Appearance: Cloudy dark brown with a thick creamy offwhite head that dissipated slowly and left lots of lacing
Aroma: dark bread ,yeast ,plums ,raisins,some spices.
Taste:medium sweet, medium bitter, with dark bread, caramel, yeast,and some dark fruit and dried fruit. Good long aftertaste. 
Medium body,creamy texture, soft carbonation
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Excellent quad, that is very bold in flavors and appearance without too much of an alcohol taste. I prefer however rochefort 10, which gives me a more heavenly after feel

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2016 I had been dying ti try this beer and I finally got my hands on a bottle. It was poured into a Trappist glass and had a thick creamy head that dissipated slowly but left lots of lacing. The smell was malty but not overpowering. The aromas kind of disappears. I could hardly smell the alcohol though. The taste was malts and complex fruits and somewhat sweet like caramel or brown sugar but not too sweet either. Really nice to drink this beer as it warms. Theres a definite bitterness in the back, like a mild aftertaste but it only makes me want to drink it more. Hard to describe but reminds me of a Tannin taste from a wine, but not bad.. This quad feels smooth and slightly bubbly. Its actually really nice to drink.
330 ml bottle from LCBO mix pack. Sweet brown sugar, herbal, dark fruit, esters, yeast, wood, heavy and smooth.
Poured from a bottle it is a cloudy dark amber color with a slight head. The aroma is fruity and the taste is hoppy with a bittersweet finish

UPDATED: APR 12, 2015 Bottle 0,75l, brown color with fast falling head. Aroma of raisins, soy sauce, caramel and dried apricots. It has a nice balance of sweetness bitterness and some sourness, but still the beer is quite heavy and oily. Carbonation is very strong and hurts a little bit the tongue in the beginning. A good one, but I like Rochefor 10 much more.
Thick, brown, rich pour. Rich flavours of yeast and caramel, this is tremendous beer!

0.33l bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Aroma is malt, raisins, dark fruits, caramel, spices, candy sugar and yeast. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with fruity notes. Full body. Overall its great beer with wonderful aroma and complex taste. One of the best Ive tried so far.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; room temperature.

Very very good beer, not as good as the Westvleteren XII, but very good.
Great appearance, but most of all, great taste of trappist yeast.

Go get it !

Pours from a bottle a turbid rich brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma is a yeasty, banana. Flavor is a rich caramel with a nice, even bitterness hiding in the back, balanced by an earthy sweetness. Palate is perfect. Extremely good beer.
rich malty slight raison aroma. dark brown in color with a long lasting foamy head. taste is very complex. rich dark carmel malts, candi sugars, raison, and good mouthfeel.

Bottle @ home. Pours with a brown colour, big medium lasting off-white rocky head. Aroma is rich: medium malty, with notes of fruit; medium hoppy, with notes of herbs; medium yeasty, with notes of basement aromas. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, slightly sour. Medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation.

Not sure if this is a Beer or a heaven cookie, is soooo full in every aspects!
It is a Dark brown beer not too sweet, is like, the best bock beer i haver had, but without the coffee bitterness...and not too sweet. Got this instead of the westvleteren 12.

By the way it is 12% not 10!

11.2 oz bottle poured into chalice. Could review, but honestly the description depicted it perfectly. Alcohol is masked well, hops, yeast and melt ell present in the taste and nose with a hint of fruit notes as well. A great beer.
One of the very best abbey beers. Great palate, fantastic aroma, and beautiful in the glass, this is among the greatest in the world. Not so sure about that label, though.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2016 It has a good perfume, but does not appear so easily to our sense.

Dark brown beer, moderately cloudy, with a thick beige foam, forming high and lowered just to keep for a long time, a low to medium height.

With a high alcohol content, this beautiful beer remains smooth and balanced. Very complex and intense.

Aroma and flavor are levemento burned caramel, brown sugar and cocoa. A fruity touch, black fruits, complements the range of attributes. Its flavor explodes with ease. Your Aftertaste is super persistent and maintains the exact characteristics of flavor that will prolong the striking rustic for nice rustic.

The creaminess of the foam, mouthfeel, smoothness even 10% alcohol impresses this drink.

The aroma and taste, I would say that there are beers that are more complex than this, but the hard thing is to have this balance, respect a perfect drinkability which lets you take sips and gulps without even going near seasick.

A true relative of Westvleteren 12.

Pours a dark tawny with heavy particulates with a small off white head, earthy aroma very complex beer, grain, hay, spice and fruits had a soft carbonation but very lively in the mouth, sweat across the palate excellent example of a trappist

Bottle. This was a really tasty beer. One of the better ales Ive ever tasted definitely in my top beers. Amber in color with a really nice head. Aroma is dried fruit, with a complex whiff. Taste was complex but pleasant.

purtroppo separata dalla "regina" delle birre (westvleteren) non ha però perso la sua qualità...birra che deve essere sorseggiata per rilevare i sapori di nocciola e frutta con un retrogusto di banana. Una birra che al palato è dolce pur essendo una birra a doppio malto! prodotto a mio parere notevole!

Grosse déception. Produit qui me semble tellement surévalué. Je narrive pas à comprendre la comparaison qui peut être faite avec la westvleteren. Peut être le même brasseur mais pas du tout le même rendu. Et, nen déplaise à certains, je persiste à être dérangé par un genre de goût doux.

33 cl bottle at home. Pours a deep red-brown colour, with just a hint of red showing against the light. Small white head. Aroma is of roasted malt, fruit and peppery hop. So peppery a deep sniff makes the nose tingle! Taste is sweet to start but there is also a deep bitterness. Exceptional palate. Lively on the tongue, there is no doubt that this is a strong beer. Creamy, rich and satisfying with a long finish ending dry and leading you back for more. This is a world-class beer in every way.

UPDATED: JAN 18, 2015 Cloudy brown color, small off-white head. Aroma of berries, raisin, dark sugar, alcohol and yeast. Taste is same, alcohol is noticeable. Heavy sweetness. Full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Sugary finish. Very good. (Vrutak 0,33l bottle)
Nez épicé, biscuité, houblons amers, très fin.Bouche maltée, torréfiée,chocolats, amertume subtile, corps épais et porté par un puissant taux dalcool.Incroyablement complexe et équilibré.Excellence.
Evenwichtige smaak. Diepe amberkleur, redelijk volle smaak. Hoewel 10% is de afdronk toch zacht.
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours dark brown with a retained white head. Aroma of malt and bread. Sweet finish.

Dark brown color, nice header .Taste is roasted caramel, figs, licorice, ...
It has different levels of taste and a nice long finish. I really enjoy drinking this beer.
Fantastic. Sweet aromas. Figs, spice, chocolate, dark sugars. A bit of powdered milk. Taste is great.

33cl bottle
 pours a dark brown with cream coloured frothy head
 Aroma is sweet malty grain with a bit of sweet fruit
 Taste is heavy malt with bit of spice and long sweet and dry finish
 really nice beer
 Knocks spot off westverletern (probably the most overrated beer on earth)

Couleur brune foncé avec un mince col assez durable. Des aromes assez complexe de fruits rouges de peches, dalcool, de caramel. Cest bien balancé mais lalcool prend beaucoup de place. Il existe surement mieux dans le style mais cest superieur a la Rochefort 10!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Beautiful full bodied brown abbey beer. The monk on the bottle is so tacky, that I cannot not buy when I see it... Caramel, hints of licorice and banana.
People say it is very close to the Westvleteren 12 and I agree but stil ther is something more in the Westvleteren, the taste is more complex...
Bottle from local store. I think our bottle was pretty old cuz it had some cardboard notes in it. Other than that the beer was very nice to drink w/ several layers to appreciate. Well done.

Very nice Belgian yeast banana nutty aromas and flavors. Candied sugar but not too sweet and well balanced. Awesome quad. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2015 Pours dark reddish brown with a really thick and long-lasting light tan foam. It looks beautiful! Aroma of bread and caramel with a pleasant fruity acidity and hints of yeast and vanilla. Full body, creamy feel, average carbonation. Taste starts off with a warm and fuzzy hug from the alcohol but quickly moves to sweet licorice, caramel and dark fruits. Long finish with a dry and subtly hoppy bitterness.

Re-rated 03-2015, 06-2015 and 11-2015: Still just as delicious!
Very heavy beer with a smooth taste of chocolates and hints of vanilla. Beautiful matched body. Almost too easy to drink.

Poured a rich mahogany with an ample off white head. Sweet brown sugar, caramel, raisins, and plums dazzled in the aroma. My mouth overflowed with the flavors of toffee, caramel, brown sugar, and light stone fruit. The mouthfeel was smooth and there was a chewy quality to it which mixed nicely with the slight bite from the alcohol. This was definitely one of the best beers Ive ever had the pleasure of drinking.

Molto buona, complessa, praticamente completa.
Un piccolo meno sullaspetto e il colore.

Donkerbruin bier met snelzakkende schuimkraag.
Neus geeft veel alcohol met zoet karameltoets.
Mondgevoel is vol met zoetige afdronk en fruitige toets.
Een topper!

330cc bottle. Smells caramel, cocoa and hop. The taste is like the nose also fruity. Very "trappist" like. A fantastic beer with a very soft and friendly alcohol . It is not the flavor explosion felt with a Westvleteren XII or even a Rocheford 10 but outstanding drink also!

330 mL bottle. Pours deep walnut with a thick pale head. Big, dark fruity nose, applesauce, fig, toasted dark bread. Some leathery, earthy, spicy hop presence. Cocoa and yeasty esters. Full bodied with high carbonation. Light malty sweetness balanced with gentle hopping and a hint of alcohol. Creamy texture, with great length. Exceptional.
St. Bernardus 12 is a great alternative to Westvleteren 12, and much more available. I couldn't really even notice difference in taste. Great beer!

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 Bu en pression. Couleur brun très claire; la mousse est de couleur blanc cassé et tien peu. Et bouche elle est très douce pour sont tot d'alcool vraiment sympa !! 
Au bout de 3 ans de cave:
Très mousseuse, la couleur et toujours claire 
Au nez arôme pain dépices 
En bouche saveur sucrée et porté sur le pain dépices , la cannelle et la vanille . Au top!

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2017 Aroma: dried fruits, bread, caramel, noble alcohol, esthers and earthy hop.
Taste: sweet; caramel, dried fruits, fruity, belgian yeast esthers. Fantastic beer!

Aroma has yeast, caramel. Taste is malty with long aftertaste. Flavors of ripe fruits, malt, chocolate. Warmth in the end.

Drank from bottle. A: musty, earthy, spicy, fig, toffee. A: hazy dark brown. Fluffy white head with good retention, foam lingered to the side. T: pepper,igh minerals, fig, caramel, slight clove . P: viscous but clean finish. Sl
Brown coloured beer. Taste is real full and a perfect addition to the bernardus familie. Quite complex and interesting taste pallet. Good after taste!

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2016 Una quadruple in pieno stile belga dabbazia. Di colore scuro con un buon cappello di schiuma avorio. Sentori di frutta passa e ben maltata (caramello e tostato). ottima persitenza nel retrogusto
Perfect beer for my tastes. This beer has brought me back to my love of Quads. This is how all beer should be.

Bottle, ordered a crate from systembolaget.se. Served in trappist glass. Pours dark brown. A bit murky. Above medium, for a quadrupel, amount of foamy, white head. Fruity nose. Date, malt, some metal, some caramel and alcohol and hint of apricot nose. Very sweet. Some bitterness as well, hidden in the sweet taste. Full and a bit oily mouth feel. Warming alcohol. Well carbonated. The palate is well suited for this beer, and true to style. Licorice, some herbal (cough drop) and red fruit, mild raisin, wineous and undetermined basement flavour. A good beer. Could use more candy and ripe, red fruit flavour.

Personal notes. #500. Crate shared with rickfifty.

I am thoroughly amazed. The aroma contains bread and dried fruits. Probably missed a lot there. So much to smell. Color is very dark red with an off white head which gets thin fast but the thin layer of foam stays. Nice carbonation.
Feels very creamy and sweet. The slightly bitter aftertaste makes this a very complete beer. Even if youre not into dark beers, try this one. You will enjoy it.

330ml bottle at Beer Palace, Oslo. Tiny light brown head which vanishes quickly. Muddy copper colored body with a LOT of sediments. The aroma is dominated by dark fruits. Dates, raisins, prunes and yeast. Some caramel, liquorice and alcohol as well. Mostly sweet on the tongue with a long, smooth aftertaste. Light bitterness. Extremely well balanced. Creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle November 2014. Wow. Just an absolutely outstanding beer. It tastes like magic. I'm not clever enough to do it justice.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Excelente cerveja, muito equilibrada. Aroma lembrando caramelo e sabor igualmente caramelado e, apesar da alta graduação alcoólica, pouco aquecimento.
Bottle thanks to sarkynortherner. Brown red decent head. Aroma is fruitcake malts taste same some bread spice alcohol warmth long bitter finish. Nice full smooth body.

Delicious. Nice dark brown with a small head and lively prickly carbonation. Heavy and sweet but still subtle and accessible. Flavor of licorice, malt sweetness, spices, and hops. It starts sweet and rich and end in a moderately bitter spicy taste that seems to stick in your mouth. Dighly recommended.

0.33L bottle. Pours hazy dark brown with a rocky, off-white head. Rich, bready malt aromas, coupled with dough, leather, bubblegum, licorice and alcohol. Flavor is medium sweet, and really complex. Cereal and bready grain along with bitter chocolate, licorice and clove. Finishes with a long, dry, herby hop and yeasty bitterness, along with warm alcohol in the chest. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel and active carbonation. Overall, a lot going on with this beer. Really nice aromas and a complex flavor profile thats well balanced. Yum!

Bottle poured into trappist glass. Hazy, dark brown color with tan head. Very complex aroma of candied and dried fruits, pleasant alcohol, cherry, plum, sugar, hints of caramel, some vanilla, little spicy. Taste is well balanced. Its sweet but not too much, slightly bitter and ends with nice alcoholic note. Full bodied, creamy texture. Great beer.

Pours a murky dark brownish with a tan head that leaves plenty of lacings. Aroma of fruity banana esters, sweet candy and lightly toasted malts. Hints of vanilla, and dried fruits. Taste is sweet but not overly, lots of fruityness here, some candy and finishes with an ever so lightly bitter note. Full bodied with a thick and somewhat fizzy feel.

Première critique depuis léchec total de la perte de mots de passe, tout recommencer à zéro! Grosse quadruple de st bernardus toujours aussi délicieuse! Arômes de dates,prunes..mures sauvages fruits rouge confits, quelques traces de caramel suivis de vanille timide mais présente. Au gouts cest extrêmement bien balancé,belle chaleur dalcool pétillement délicats, soyeuse légèrement liquoreuse mais pas trop sucré,arrière gouts terreux et joliment boisé.Se boit très facilement et cest tant mieux.(a faire des réserves pour lautomne-hiver). Trop bonne!

Drink cool, 10-12°C
Eye: Pours a dark brown colour with a slwly dissipating white to beige head. low carbonation though.
Nose: dark malts chocolate, sweets.
Mouth: reminds me a bit of a straffe hendrik at first. lots of dark chocolate malts, not so much coffee, sweets, dark fruit, sweet but not too much.
Palate: chocolate and dark dried fruit.
Overall: nice belgian beer but definitely not the most complex.

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2015 750ml bottle from the LCBO. Huge foamy off-white head on top of a deep-dark ruby red/brown brown thats almost black and opaque. Aromas are really what sets this beer apart as one of the 100 percentile: it has some wine-like qualities, some alcohol is present on the nose, black licorice, cherry, wet wood, plum, cocoa, raisin and some vanilla. It has an elevated alcohol presence, however it is well integrated to seem lesser than what is actually there. It is smooth and almost creamy for its full-bodied nature.

"one of the better early Belgians. The mouthfeel and flavor would maybe get a higher score, but the yeast takes the carbonation too high for me, and really gives it a flavor common to many Belgians...not a bad thing, but not completely unique either. Good, but a little overrated? 3/09 - had with the Rochefort line-up and while it wasnt as good in my mind as the 10, it did ok. the abv is more noticeable and takes away from the feel and flavor, compared to the 10-not as smooth and a little more harsh and spicy, but still good. same scores."

On tap at Beer House in Lombard, IL.

A: Arrived in the snifter as a deep, hazy cherrywood hue, with a lovely thick head that fell quickly into a white cap and left crazy lacing on the snifter.

S: Malt candy, for lack of a better term. Sweet bready caramel sugars, wreathed through with raisin and plum notes, and something that reminds me of an oaken single malt scotch barrel.

T: Oh, that is glorious. Malt candy, indeed - yeasty caramel sweetness right up front, uncut by any hoppy notes. Raisin, plum, cherry, and fig notes writhe through this delicious beer, with some faint woody-oaky echoes. The finish is pure Belgian yeast, with a boozy warmth and some echoes of fruit and sugar.

M: Liquid silk, coating and clinging to every surface of mouth and throat, like drinking molten butter with more flavor.

O: Just a fantastic and wonderful experience, and a beer I go back to again and again.

Draught @ Fermentoren Cph. Pours dark amber/reddish brown with a thick off-white head. Aroma is malty, yeast, herbs, dark fruits and brown sugar. Flavour is sweet, alcohol, dark fruits and caramel. Its well-balanced. Not too sweet, full bodied, medium carbonation. Finish is light and soft, a little fruity.

This beer is an experience. Truly an excellent beer. Beautiful dark brown appearance with a thick foamy head. Incredible malty aroma. Smells a little sweet and citrus as well. Taste is malty, sweet, slight citrus and bitterness. Finishes dry with little after taste. Wonderful and complex. Too much going on for me to properly describe. It is delicious. This is a game changer to my definition of a great beer. Many of my old favorites just don't stand up to this.

Mörkbrunt med ordentligt skum som dock försvann snabbt. Doftar sött och smaken är oxå mkt söt, lite bränd karamell. Lång eftersmak med maltig sirap. Dracks på fat, kändes lite "flat".

UPDATED: APR 24, 2015 Tasted from 33 cl and 75 cl bottles as well as from tap many a time, this is one of the leading abts of Belgium. Historically, this was the commercial version of Westvleteren 12, under the brand name of Sint-Sixtus, a cooperation which ended in 1992. Today, Sint-Bernardus Abt, Prior and Pater are still made with the same malts, the same hops and the same yeast as Westvleteren, though clearly the yeast has evolved a bit differently since then. Since Westvleteren has received so much media attention - a consequence of it achieving the highest rating on this very site - this beer is often presented as an easier to obtain alternative, and indeed the similarities are still striking, though I will not go as far as to claim that no differences are discernible. This beer bears a moussy and relatively (even surprisingly) stable, pale beige, sticky head and shows a warm, dark burgundy colour with equal haze. It presents a strong, wonderfully perfumed and therefore very agreeable aroma of great complexity, revealing hints of overripe pears, sweet cherries and plums, port wine, marzipan, banana, iron but in a good kind of way, brown sugar, liquorice, chocolate liqueur, fresh orange, brown bread, blue grapes, candied dates, cloves... Taste kicks off with a soft, candyish sweetishness of candied fruits, raisins, pear, candi sugar; fluffy and full mouthfeel, medium, minerally carbonation; in the background, I get a profound, chocolatey and caramelly, smooth maltiness, bready yeast and elegant spicy notes dancing on the tongue. Finishes graciously with a leafy hop bitterness which lingers and perfectly balances out the sweetness, maltiness is also still present as well as a certain yeastiness, everything rounded off with a warming, not too astringent, whisky-like alcohol effect. Though indeed very similar to Westvleteren 12, this is clearly a different beer, which anyone familiar with both should be able to distinguish in a blind tasting session. It has nearly the same amount of complexity and nobility, but the aromas do not match completely, the alcohol in this one is perhaps just a little bit less hidden, the mouthfeel is a little bit more syrupy and there is a little bit less aromatic spiciness to it. I will do a side by side tasting of both soon. In any case: Sint-Bernardus Abt 12 remains one of the great landmarks of Belgian beer culture and a proud classic in its own right, regardless of the historical links with the Sint-Sixtus abbey.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2014 Nice brown color with huge head. Chocolate, malts, fruits, yeasts. Great smooth taste of (milky) chocolate and dark fruits like plums. A little bit tart and even a little bit salty. Well-balanced, smooth mouthfeel. Very lecker. The alcohol only comes through after a while. You can spend a long time with a glass of this beer and not be bored at all, still finding ever new aspects. Fantastic.

Sweet caramel, mild roast, chocolate, fruity, and floral notes. Dark reddish-brown, off white, creamy head, and mild lacing. Full bodied, sweet entry, salty, lemon hop bitter notes. Decent balance, mild alcohol, medium, lasting bitterness.

Very smooth and tasty. Great mix of fruty chocolate did I say smooth. Well balanced malty good beer
Dark brown with medium yellow bit creamy cap. Rich taste full of fruity notes, well balanced sweetness and sourness, mild biter tuch at the end.

330ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Dark brown colour, foamy beige head and aroma of bready malt, caramel, chocolate, dark fruits, spice. Taste is bready, grainy, malt, dried fruity, toffee and caramel, dark chocolate, earthy yeasty with some lingering spicey bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, warming drying earthy long bitter finish. Complex and very drinkable.

Bottle 330ml. Clear dark brownish-red with quickly diminishing medium beige head. Sweet malty aroma, cherry, liqueur, some fruitiness, yeasty. Very sweet flavor, dried plum, cherry, raisin, hints of roasted malt, light bitterness and sourness, the alcohol is quite noticeable. Moderate carbonation. full body. Sweet-sour aftertaste. Actually its quite boring.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle served in a Westvleteren chalice.
A: Pours a dark amber almost brown color forming a creamy and very persistent beige head. A lot of lacings are formed and left in the glass
S: Sweet, fruity and very malty. Strong notes of dark fruits (plums and raisins), caramel malts, roasted malts, candy sugar, vanilla, brown bread and liquor. Very bready and earthy Belgian yeasts. A bit of alcohol can be felt too
T: Very complex. Again, sweet, malty and very fruity. Strong notes of dark fruits, candy sugar, caramel, caramel malts, roasted malts, brown bread, earthy Belgian yeasts. Finish is slightly bitter
M: Full creamy and molasses body. Good carbonation. Sweet and malty aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability! A Belgian Quad masterpiece
[ BA Review @ 11/24/2009 ]

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a slight red hue, with a big mocha head. Aroma is roasted caramel malts and nice fruity yeast, with toffee, chocolate and molasses, dark fruits and kandi, as well as notes of oak and some slight alcohol. Full body with soft carbonation. Flavour is slightly burned malts with toffee and chocolate, as well as bread and syrup, grain, molasses, and notes of dates, prunes and tobacco. Sweet finish with kandi, chocolate and yeast with notes of burned wood.
Chestnut color with fluffy khaki head and lacing. Sweet and nutty malts, dark fruits, bitter hop presence, and Belgian yeast in nose and flavor.
Dark brown color, reddish tinge, fully foaming head. Apples and plums in the aroma and flavor. Incredibly smooth and rich, satisfying. Lighter in body but truly excellent. Lights hints of chocolate.
Bière goûtée à Louvain. Brasserie voisine de la Westleren. Belle amertume, mousse légère.

Verwant aan de Westvleteren 12. Mooi bruinrood bier met een ferme schuimkraag. Geur: pruimen, gedroogd fruit, noten, chocola. Smaak is complex, pruimen, gedroogd fruit, noten, drop, chocola, heerlijke lichtzoete nasmaak. Hij lijkt op de Westvleteren 12 en de Rochefort 10, maar is net iets minder dan deze 2 omdat zij iets zachter van smaak zijn, zeker de Westvleteren. Maar desalniettemin een absolute topper!

Smelling of nuts, prunes and tar, very dark with thick beautiful foam. The taste starts with a wonderfully pricking, fizzy carbonation; before the beer orchestra starts playing. The orchestra borrows melodies from raisins, prunes, tar, oil and cough syrup, which unfortunately is a tad overshadowed by the carbonation. The aftertaste contains soy and raspberries, as well as the best from Belgian browns. Too bad about the carbonation - this is close to perfection.

Smells of strawberries & cognac. starts off fruity (apricots, peaches) then there is pause before a sweet, raisin finish. This beer should be more famous than it is (maybe the dates packaging doesn't help...), a Belgium classic.

Rated by BrewTom

750 ml bottle into signature chalice, best before 6/1/2017. Pours slightly hazy/cloudy dark reddish brown color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, and reduces to a small cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, toast, toffee, brown bread, brown sugar, clove, pepper, light chocolate, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome balance and complexity of dark/bready malt and fruity/spicy yeast notes; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, toast, toffee, brown sugar, brown bread, clove, pepper, light chocolate, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of raisin, plum, fig, date, cherry, toast, toffee, brown bread, brown sugar, clove, pepper, light chocolate, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt flavors; with a great crisp malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, and lightly slick/creamy/bready mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Quadrupel style. All around fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt sweetness; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. An insanely delicious offering as expected.

Ciemny kolor, przyjemny lekko słodkawy smak. Z każdym łykiem bardziej do siebie przekonuje. Warto spóbować, warto.
coffee, smoke, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, caramel, black, soft carbonation,

An outstanding beer. Very much like a Christmas beer. Pours a beautiful deep red with a white head. Smell is very floral and herby. Taste is full and creamy, with lots of herbs and some molasses and merengue, finishing with a bit of booziness. Classic belgian. Had on tap at the Trappist.

330ml bottle. Aroma is malt, little alcoholic, light apple and yeast. Appearance is dark, chocolate brown with a brown-ish head. Taste is sour and sweet. A light dryness, winey, apple-ish aftertaste. A long finish. Very good and almost a Westvletern.

750 ml bottle. Pours brown with foamy, long lasting, off-white head. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, piney hops, dark fruit, brown sugar and some port and bread crust. Body is full and smooth. Plums, yeast, good amount of spicy hops, bready and caramel malt fill the mouth. Finish is long and dry. Delicious, complex brew.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur acajou foncée opaque, mousse beige aérienne laissant une montagne nuageuse au milieu du verre ainsi quune dentelle évasive. Arôme de levure, malt caramélisé, caramel foncé, sucre dorge, noix de Grenoble, cassonade. Goût de malt caramélisé, alcool, noix, fruits foncés séchés (dattes, figues), léger côté épicé en arrière-goût. Carbonatation faible, corps moyen-dense.

750 ml corked and crowned bottle. Pours a translucent reddish brown color. Finger high rocky beige head. Rich, earthy dark fruit malt nose. Redolent of black cherries, herbal hops, sweet cocoa and plum wine. Aroma reminds me of Red Velvet cake. Flavor is subtle and complex with notes of chocolate covered cherries, dark dried fruit, Madeira wine and earthy yeast. Smooth and silky mouthfeel. Complex sweet bready dark malt mid taste has some banana notes. Finishes with a spicy, yet subtle hop bitterness. Some stickiness in the aftertaste. There is a warming alcohol presence as well that comes with first sip.

Stands on same level as Westvleteren 12, Westmalle and Rochefort 10. Smell urges to taste. Thick foam. Rich correct Abbey beer taste. Right hop and mix of bitter, sour, sweat and coffee. You are not aware that taste is 10.2%
, caramel, koffie

Coloração marrom escura. Creme belga bege, fino porém muito persistente. Aroma de maltes torrados e caramelo, com frutas maduras ao final da taça. Sabor delicioso do álcool bem inserido (apesar dos 10%), com boa carbonatação e predomínio de maltes torrados, frutas escuras (principalmente ameixa) e chocolate amargo ao final. Retrogosto equilibrado, percebendo-se levemente o lúpulo. Excelente breja.

330cc bottle poured (gushing) into glass. Color is dark brown with a lot of sediment. The off white head is initially large but doesnt stay for long. Full body, medium-high carbonation. Sweet malty taste with caramel and ripe fruit aroma. Low bitterness. High ABV is very obvious. Excellent beer.

Pours a dark amber, hints of purple, golden-brown and a nice 2 finger, off-white head. Some sediment in the glass, but typical of the style. Aromas are initially sweet with caramel, toffee, banana and dark fruit coupled with some clove, allspice and lingering alcohol. Taste is very rich and balanced. Much like the nose. No surprises here, just a great balance. Maybe some hints of tobacco and leather along with the well-hidden alcohol. Finishes with a moderate bitterness and nice interplay of the malt/yeast.
Pours dark brown with small head that doesn't last very long. Smells like liquor, alcohol, medicine, siruppy. Taste is quite alcoholic, caramel, banana.

Bottle at home. 2 years old. Has a deep, nut brown colour with a big, light brown head. Nice aroma of dried fruit, chocolate, leather, cured meat, alcohol and beech. Has a malty and rich flavour with more chocolate, rye bread, sweet malt and some leather. The mouth feel is rich and soft, and has a light bitterness. A rich, sweet and wonderful quad.
Bottle 0.33l from Brewery Kazematten in Ypres Belgium.Pour it dark color with small white head.Taste terrific.Aroma of caramel, malt, coffee, Belgian yeast and spices.What to say perefection.

This is something else, one of my favourites.

Rich and soft taste, slightly sweet and floral. Mixes of many spices. You feel the alcohol in the end in a wonderful away. A truly great beer.
After drinking more of them, I really have to change my opnion of it. Its not the same as the westvleteren XII, but beers like these make drinking beer funny.

Bottle. Dark brown, foggy with a big frothy light brown head. Aroma has yeast, ripe fruit, raisin and wood.

Taste has nut, orange, wood and malt. Surprisingly strong carbonation. Well-rounded light aftertaste. Very easy going dispite the high alcohol content. Characteristic.

33cl bottle in a st. Bernardus glass. I really enjoy this beer. It has a touch of champagne and alcohol and the yeast is great.

A beautiful pour .... an opaque dark chocolate and tar color with a tobacco stained ivory head with fine bubbles that hang ... giving off a spicy and malty flower aroma. The sticky smokey malt resonates with a subtle holding bite.

Botella de 33 cl la ultima en agosto de 2012 en la céltica. Botella conservada lote 0267 con fecha de cons pref para antes fin 1997. Color marrón oscuro. Sabores maltosos y tostados dulces de caramelo todo ello con una buena sensación alcohólica de 10 vol que esta presente de principio a fin. Bastante buena, para repetir sin suda.
Currently my favorite beer. Smooth and consistent, alcohol is hidden very well.
The beer is a dark but somewhat transparent brown. Its taste is amazing slightly sweet with fruit but also balanced with dark cocoa and coffee notes. All around great beer.

Dried fruits, plum, coffee liquier and sweet cake on nose. After worming its a festival of deep and sweet malty flavours. Cocoa, coffee, essence of plums with added herbal and cinamon spices. Universe in a small bottle!
Tap at Hilpea Hauki, Helsinki. Aromas and flavors: Belgian yeast, dark fruits and malts. Super soft.

draft and I have had this several times but never rated until now. pours a darkish red brown with nice white lasting head. the aroma was of sweet malts, dark fruits caramel slight breadiness of the yeast. the flavor is just incredible for a sipper. sweet malts, caramel, dark fruits blended perfectly together slight bread/yeast with a mildly warm alcohol burn on the end. words cannot begin to describe the smoothness of this ale. if you cant have westy 12 then you might as well get this one. plus its always available.

From my previous experience with quadrupels, I had decided that I did not like the style. Not really excited about ever trying the rather dear Westvletern 12, until someone points out that the St Bernardus Abt would be very close to the iconic W12, and much more affordable. As I had particularly enjoyed other products of this brewery, I had a go. And now everything has changed. If quadrupels are really like this, then I want more. This dark amber beer has those fruits in the cellar holding the main backbone of the aroma and taste. An explosion of apples, plums, peaches and apricots, old books and wooden crates, wicker baskets and dusty curtains, dark empty wine bottles and firewood. Its all so round and timeless, with sweet malts, vanilla and yeastroasted almondswine pruneshoney  wow! So perfectly crafted, altogether the flavours are well-mended, nothing standing out or overshadowing each other, with a reasonably dry finish, smooth, one would never dream of the high ABV hadnt it been so famous.

Bottle. Now this is one of my Belgian classic favorites, next to Orval. And much better (and I dare to say more complex), than its secret rejected cousin Westvleteren 12. In the aroma I find sweet malts, toffee/caramel, dark fruit, raisons, sweet alcohol, some spices maybe. Taste is complex but well balanced. The alcohol is present but not overwhelming. Drink it from the 75 or 150 cl bottles; its even better.

Bottle. Dark amber-brown with a lasting, creamy off-white head. The aroma is balanced nicely between fruit and malt, with some spices and yeast. The flavor is sweet malt, honey, fruits, caramel, a little bitterness and a warming alcohol finish. Great beer, I know we get this back in Tasmania so Ill definitely be getting this again.
Black beer with a small white head. Smells like caramel and strong alcohol. Taste is caramel, fruits strong herps. A fantastic beer, not so good as a westvleter?

Aromat piwa nieco winny, słodowy nad wyraz klasyczny i bardzo dobry bez udziwnień - nigdy takiego nie piłem. Ponadto pomarańcza w zapachu i smaku. Dochodzi do tego zapach stodoły i wsi :) Karmelowość i ukryta słodycz nadaje temu piwu dużo gładkości a jednocześnie pijalności. Później odczuwalne nuty sterylne jak najbardziej na miejscu

One of the greats. Nice aroma dark fruits, vanilla, banana bread.. Appearance is so so.. Merky brown with a low head. Palate is top notch.. Sharp and smooth. Tates is complex and rich super balanced with a bitter finish. Hides the high alcohol well.

Bottle at home split with sarah. In a goblet glass. Bottle is about 4 years old. Had this a few times before. 
Aroma is apple and raisin cake, vinous notes, unrefined sugars, christmas pudding. muscavado sugar. 
Clear caramel burnt orange coloured pour with a lasting fine cream head. 
Flavour is full and rich with cakey , caramel malts, delicate pinchs of spices and nice fruity raisin apple. Very little age character to it. Has aged very well. Nice vinous quality to it. Lingering complex sugars and fruits. 
Palate is semi-sweet, semi-dry in the finish and high tingling carbonation. Nicely attenuated.
Really very good. My second facourite Quad after Rochefort 10.
Nice appearance, dark honey or copper. Relatively low carbonation, and very smooth. Caramel with subtle banana flavor, followed by raisin and fig.

Has aroma of dark malts and brown sugar. The color is dark copper, its hazy, with small head and awesome lacing. In taste its also quite sweet with malty notes. Its very smooth because of low carbonation. The alcohol is covered quite well, but its warm the throat so quickly. After few seconds its starting to pinch the esophagus and warm you quite nicely. Then you can feel the alcohol much clearer. In the end in the aftertaste and aroma the notes of sweet fruits (dehydrated plums, raisins) appear. The bouquet is so rich.
Pours a dark mahogany with an off white head. The nose is hint of raisins and malt. The palate is full bodied with malt sweetness, slight caramel, and a slight bitter hop aftertaste.
Een heel lekker donker bier zoals het hoort te zijn. Zonder twijfel de beste van deze brouwerij

The aroma is malt, caramel a touch of raisin/fig and a slight floral. Pours a cloudy copper/amber brown with mostly diminishing big light brown head and excellent lacing. The taste is a light bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish light bitter. Overall not as good as I remember but I have another aging and well see how that goes.
Nice caramel aroma, spicey, a bit hoppy, alcohol at the ending, medium carbonisation, sweet beer with medium notes of bitterness. Better when cooled. Really great brew!

Butelka 0,33l Nr . warki A 21 03 18.
Barwa rubinowo herbaciana. Piana niska, musująca jak w napoju gazowanym - pojawia się i błyskawicznie znika. W aromacie karmel, śliwki, wiśnie, mokry karton. Alkohol lekko wyczuwalny, ma w sobie coś z rozpuszczalnika. W smaku silny i dominujący karmel, w tle nieco śliwek, rodzynek. Alkohol wyczuwalny, lekko gryzący. Obecny mokry karton. Goryczka niska. Płaskie, nudne z wadami - spore rozczarowanie.

Color castaño claro un tanto turbio, media cabeza de espuma beige permaneciendo una fina capa en la copa; en nariz aromas a malta tostada, caramelo y frutos del bosque; en boca entrada suave con bastante carbónico, notas a especias y algo de naranja, amargor equilibrado con alcohol bien integrado, pos gusto algo picante; esperaba una cerveza un poco más compleja.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2015 Bottiglia da 75. quadrupel favolosa con un bel colore marrone scuro e una schiuma abbondante e abbastanza persistente, allarome risalta caramello e frutta scura, corpo bello rotondo e consistente con una buona carbonazione, i 10 gradi non si fanno sentire

This beautiful dark brown beer has a thick creamy head. It has the aroma of sour grapes and sweet fruity flavors develop into a smokey malty flavor. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a ruby red with a slight brown. Nice light tan head which lasts. Roasted malt, hazelnut and strong tea aromas. Taste has wood with a tea linger has almost a light rum finish. hides the 10% VERY well when cold. As it warms you get the boozy sting.
