One of the best beers you can get, just read the description of this beer, I can not describe the fullness of the flavour, the complexity of this beer, its awesome and you missed something in your live if you havent tasted it.
Strong head, dissipates after a few sips. Rich bronze color, slightly hazy. Flavor is rich with csrmel, a deep malt, and a slight alcohol finish. Quintessential Belgian quad, fantastic beer.

Aroma and tatse of fresh bread, cereals and fresh hops. I would expect a bit better but it worrth tasting. I have tasted one year before in delirium tremmens in bruxelles and I could tell that it was a lot more fascinating.

Transfer from BA review on 7-18-12 - 
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  The beer was served a brownish-red color with only a tiny white head. The head faded very fast to give only a light amount of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma was a nice mix of fruit, bread and yeast. There were stronger notes of dark fruit, such as prunes and plum, as well as a good yeast cake aroma. These were all balanced by a semi-sweet brown bread and biscuit aroma. Overall it was quite nice.

 Taste  The taste starts out with a good shot of fruit and malt. A sweet dark cherry flavor mixed with a biscuit base great the tongue. As the taste moves on other dark fruit flavors enter the tongue and are mixed with notes of a yeasty flavor as well as some candied/sugary flavors. All the while a prune flavor accompanied by an alcohol flavor creep into the taste. At the end a somewhat alcohol flavored, dark fruit sweet and lightly bready flavor are left on the tongue. Delicious.

 Mouthfeel- the body of the beer was about right for its abv., being on the creamier and thicker side, with a carbonation level that was on the lower side. Both the body and the carbonation accentuated all the dark fruit and malty flavors as well as complemented the warming feel of the alcohol quite nicely.

 Overall - Rated high for a reason. It has a wonderful taste, aroma, and feel . Delicious.
Huge root beer float frothy head with dark brown color below. Spicy beginning and end with nutty raisin flavor

Ha! Look at that happy Monk. No girls, vows of chastity, maybe silence, only so he can serve Our Lord. Dont know it that would keep me happy. But being drunk on this great beer might help. Cheers to St. Bernardus Brouwerij for making a great Monks style brew. The beer itself is a cloudy brown with bits of the lees floating in the mix. Head is slightly tan with a few more of those bit. (Might have been a little less than gentle with this bottle before the pour.) Nose of caramel sweetness, nice toasted malts, smallest hint of nuts and some bready yeasts. The taste has some booze, lots and lots of lovely roasted and carmelized malts, theres some sweetness in there too. Very clean finish with a lasting taste of malts. Nice beer without a lot of the overly fruity raisins flavours that seem to come with this type.

Dark Brown with a small creamy khaki head.
Aroma is sweet with lots of chocolate and marzipan.
Taste is as above but with some herbal bitterness.
Full body, high but soft carbonation.
Dry chocolatey after taste, some warming alcohol.

Bottle 330ml. Pours with huge white head, dark amber/brown color. Aroma is absolutely fantastic. Lot of dark fruits, raisins, plums, candied sugar, caramel, bread, also spicy belgian notes. Very complex. Its sweet, with some nice notes of fruits, caramel, light bitterness. Excellent mouthfeel, highly carbonated. For sure, one of the best belgian beers, I like it even more than Rochefort 10.
Too much spicy, malted bread for my liking. Will have to try again once I realign my spirit.

Medium brown with a light tan head, smells of sweet notes and toasted oats. Taste is quick sweet and rich, notes of chocolate and toasted oats.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A deep velvety brown color beer with an extremely aggressive dense tan foamy head that fades to a lingering veil that explodes with any sudden movement. Good lacing.
Fine malt aroma with Beligum yeast faint aspects of cloves and fruit.
Taste is rich and complex malts. I taste also cloves candied sugar and sweet fruitiness of plums or raisins. Oh yeah, and a big alcohol bite.
It feels in the mouth to be a thin to medium bodied beer with a dry finish and alcohol warming.
Pleasing to look at and pleasing to drink.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 Molt bona cervesa. No es trapistes pero es molt bona. Te aromas a panses, xocolata etc...
Pours a dark brown body with a thick head. Rich malty aroma with a belgian touch. Warm complex and very nice taste.

20/VI/14 - 33cl bottle @ t Einde (Gent) - BB: 25/VI/18 (2014-647) Thanks to Thomas and Annelies for the celebration beer in honour of their child-to-be! :-)
Clear dark purple brown beer, big irregular light beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: malty, caramel, liquorish, aniseed, bit spicy. MF: lots of carbon, medium body. Taste: quite some liquorice, caramel, aniseed, little burned, sourish. Aftertaste: aniseed, little bitter, liquorish, dried fruits, mocha, bit of chocolate. Honestly, this is not how I remember this beer. I thought it was way less spicy. Very odd...

Copper brown pour, with thick, long lasting head. Lively carbonation from bottle conditioning . Sweet toasty oats on the aroma, with Belgian yeast coming through as it warms. The flavour is full of hazelnuts , almonds, and a balanced hop finish. Totally luxurious beer.
330cl bottled. I have only had Westvleteren12 for once so far. As another quadrupel, this beer is much easier to get and not bad though.

UPDATED: SEP 3, 2014 Verfrissend luchtig aroma, mooie schuimkraag die langzaam wegtrekt. Ontwikkeld zich langzaam maar mooi in de mond en fel in de afdronk. Krachtig bruisend. Complexe smaak van donker fruit met hinten van chocolade.
Dark brown, tall off-white head. Aroma of yeast and some fruit. Flavor is complex, sweet, with some chocolate. High carbonation with medium body. Very good. Why did I pass this up for so long?
On first taste, dark and chocolaty. Comforting. But palate has lighter notes: citrus and almonds. The bubbliness lightens the beer significantly. Pure delight.

Appearance: Dark red-ruby almost brown with a light tan head 

Aroma: Dark fruits, plums, figs, sweet malts, along with the classic yeast smell for Belgian quads. 

Taste: The dark fruits hit your tongue with a slight banana flavor likely from the yeast, spices are there as well. Decently sweet without being overwhelming and a ever so slight bitterness. 

Palate: Medium-bodied that doesnt seem to completely coat the mouth like some other quads Ive had. Theres a sweetness that is there that doesnt stick to the inside of the mouth like syrup, its almost a clean quad if there is such a thing.

Overall: Delicious quad! Perhaps my favorite quad ever.
Pav?js aroma prieks kvada. Garsa: gaidiita, alko arii jutams. Belgjiigs. Gazeets. Truuks fiicas. Tipisks aroma: xz :D

Bottle at home, yeast in bottle consumed as part of drink. Dark brown liquid with overwhelming carbonation and a thin but persistent head. Aromas reminding me of fresh air and spring floral notes. Tastes sweet and slightly hiding the regular dark beer notes I expected from the memory of earlier bottles. Very enjoyable. I must find one which tastes like this except for the suspended yeast. Maybe the next Abt 12 bottle?

Clear dark brown pour, decent tan head. Nose is cherries, figs and yeast. More bitter than sweet. Middle is currants, more cherries, dark roasted grain, and a hint of alcohol. Finish is coco and slightly bitter hops. very deft on its feet @ 10%. Complex, inviting, and soothing. Went great with a sirloin, mashers, and peas!

On tap at Mekong, Richmond. Pours a dark hazy brown with lasting wisp of head and lacing. Aroma is subtle, biscuit, malt, dark fruits and yeast. Flavor is a delicious round malty brown quad. Always an event to have this beer, and to have on draft is amazing.

Bottle from Fyne Wines, Argyll. Hazy brown with amber hue, no fizz, malty-brown head falls quickly. Sweet smoked toffee aromas with hints of salted liquorice. On the palate, flavours of smoked dates and dark caramel take hold first though more liquorice develops and lingers with a touch of fennel on the finish; very gentle carbonation. Certainly taste the alcohol (10% abv); a good solidly flavourful beer but not worth its 100 point rating!

Pours darkest brown with thick light-brown head. Aroma of cherries, booze, chocolate, teak and cloves. Tastes of the same. 
oily mouthfeel. Long aftertaste of alcohol, chocolate, cherries and spice. Hides the 10 pct abv well.

750mL with best-by date of 2/12/2019


Appearance: Dark ruby-brown with off-white head; the ruby really comes out in direct light.


Aroma: A lot of dark fruits, plums, cherries, figs, sweet malts, yeast and caramel.


Taste: Tons of figs, cherries, dates, some apple and banana along with spices I cant put my finger on. Moderately sweet and very light bitterness.


Palate: Medium-bodied with a lot of carbonation; very palate-cleansing. The dark fruity sweetness lingers in the finish.


Overall: Fantastic quad, representative of the style and one of the finest beers Ive tried in general.

Mélyvörös színű, pörkölt aromájú ital intenzív ízjegyekkel, melyek tökéletesen kerek kompozíciót nyújtanak a maláta pörköltségével, az édeskés, kissé vaníliás aromával és a komló jól érvényesülő, határozott jellegével. Az alkohol remekül beleolvad az ízvilágba. Azt hozza, amit várunk, de azt rendkívül magabiztosan, a tökéletesség megnyugtató érzetét keltve.
Tasted Alongside Westys, Rochefurt, Decadence, others, Pours murky brown with big carb. Aroma is big sweet dark roasted fruits. Taste is similar with a semi dry light bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 Drunk in riegrovy while watching france royally pump switzerland, fantastic game. pouring dark amber with an endless creamy head. aroma is great. apple, chocolate, dried figs, plums, cinnamon. the taste and feel are amazing. delicious chewy toffee apple, spices with a bitter dose of yeast. banana, bubblegum, but mostly that taste of musty spiced fruit. its also proper boozy, but thats masked extremely well. all you get is a warming creamy sweetness. fuckin amazing. drinking this was a pleasure and probably my fav abt so far

Edit: had a 2 year bottle of this on saturday 20/06/15, almost a year on, wow hahaha. it was great, like so much better. my first real experience of what a year or two can do to a beer. huge fudgy butterscotch aroma, with vanilla and caramel and peaches. seems to be much smoother and sweeter than before. cam and i each took a bottle home as well. too good not to

Bottle. Murky brown pour with a reddish tinge and a creamy tan head. Dark fruit, sweet malt, nice dankness and alcohol warmth in the aroma and taste.
Well balanced and every bit as good as the hype.

Pours a murky brown with lots of tan head. There is yeast and bread aromas with flavours of yeast, malt, hints of dates and some spicy notes. This is an okay Belgian ale but not one I would run out and buy again soon.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2014 ASPETTO: colore mogano scurissimo con riflessi rubino. Schiuma fine, ne rimane sempre un po. AROMA: non particolarmente intenso, ma molto buono. I sentori se emergono sono il liquoroso e il fruttato. GUSTO: tripudio di sapori: prugna, ciliegia, ciliegia sotto spirito, liquoroso, frutta secca, orzata, orzo tostato. CONCLUSIONE: birra di altissimo livello, è sempre un piacere berla. Non stanca mai lungo la bevuta, anzi, evolve sempre.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.
Dark amber with creamy white head. Good looking. Malty sweet taste. Very smooth from the beginning to the end. High quality :p
Vraiment géniale. ..de loin la meilleur ABT. Jen nai toujours deux au frigo depuis 1 an, très hâte de la reboire!
Absolutely delicious. Rich and creamy with a strong caramel aroma. Perfectly balanced, boozy and decadent. Perfect dessert beer.
UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 Dense tan foam, steady. Hazy liquid, color of dark molasses. Carbonation medium to light. Full body. Aroma of caramel. Medium to heavy sweetness, medium bitterness. Great one.

I'm do impressed with this beer. So much going on....incredible aroma....bubbles, bubbles, bubbles. Malty, hoppy....hops good on the palate. Very easy to drink. Almost a champagne amount of bubbles. I definitely want more of this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown with off white creamy foam. Aroma of dried fruits and malts. Full body, taste is rich, complex sweetness. Evening warmer.
Na kérem: ez számomra a belga sörök királya. Igaz nem Trapista (ami szintén előkelő helyen áll nálam), de ízre, zamatra, küllemre eddig ez tetszik a legjobban. Kedvencem!

Small bottle pours dark toasted brown with light red edges. Lots of floaties in bottle, avoided pouring into glass. Nose is sweet malty berry, cherry, fruits, date, raisin, dark bread. Taste is similar with a touch of alcohol warmth, nice mouthfeel but not quite as creamy as some other quads. Finish is somewhat sticky sweet dark fruit, raisin, subtle booze warmth, fruit bread, grape. Quite nice.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours cloudy ruby. Head is initially around a finger of soapy light tan, but dissipates quickly leaving only a slight sheen and some very thick lacing. Very bready on the nose, with a big presence of dark fruits, liqourice and caramel, in addition to notes of toffee, honey, clotted cream fudge, citrus, vanilla, spices and a hefty hit of alcohol. Taste consists of prominent notes of of bready/cakey malts, brown sugar, toffee, marzipan, cherries, dark fruits, and a very yeasty, almost cheesy aftertaste which right at the end almost borders on vegetable. None of these clash somehow, which is impressive in iteself. Superbly warming on the finish, to the point where Im sweating as I write this at 2AM. Moderate carbonation adds a pleasant tingly effect to go with the larger than life body and oily texture. Certainly not for easy drinking, and youd do well to savour every mouthful of this. Not quite as awe-inspiring as Rochefort 10, but brilliant in its own right.

Location/Date:Bottle on June 6th, 2014.
Appearance: Pours a murky brown with some sediment. 
Aroma: Aroma of dark fruit, yeasty.
Taste: Dark fruit, light bitterness
Palate:Medium heavy.
Summary: The last of a four pack St. Bernardus sampler. Tasty, just not an everyday thing for me.

Bottle. Murky ruby red, off white head which sticks heavily to the glass. Christmas pudding, cherry, some rum, vinous aspects and candy sugar. Similarly sweet flavours of Christmas pudding, cherry, candy sugar, deep caramel malt and cola which works toward a really enjoyable hop profile that allows for a great juxtaposition between sweet and bitter. The abv sticks out but that's to be expected in an Abt. Great beer.

Pours a nice mohagany with a frothy off-white head which quickly fades. The aroma really smacks you in the face with red fruit, fruit cake and malt. Taste is sweet with cherry and spices with a great herbal finish. Carbonation is perfect light medium. Overall a fantastic beer!

750ml bottle. Pours a beautiful clear ruby with a two finger beige head of fine bubbles that soon disappeared. Aromas of red plum, dried dark fruits, light earthy mineral notes, hard candies, and fruit cake. Not too sweet with dark bread notes, raisins, light molasses, dark maple syrup, and some very obvious alcohol up front that leads into more molasses, hard candies, spice, and more boozyness and a bitter menthol-like hoppy finish. Excellent.

Is this my favourite beer? If Westvleteren is truly better, then it will be a while until Ill be in that part of Belgium to find out. I cant see our family holiday plans coinciding with Dark Lord day, and there are no signs of the Pliny family in my part of the English Midlands any time soon. But ... you can buy an extraordinary beer like this for less than you would pay for a pint of the lowest rank lager in a typical night club in a typical city like mine. Beer is good, isnt it.
This is really good. It looks great, with a dark mahogany colour topped with a persistent off- white head and good lacing. Great mouthfeel - medium bodied and creamy. Aroma, like some fantastic pudding is baking in the background. Taste - malt loaf, rum & raisin ice cream, prunes, herbs and spices. 
Maybe my favourite beer. Or is it Trappist Roquefort....?

Quadrupel ben fatto, con un gusto discretamente complesso, dominato da frutta scura, caramello, una sfumatura di uva sultanina e bacche, forse un tocco amarotico finale. Forte presenza alcolica, ma piuttosto ben bilanciata.
Very good, picked up a large bottle based on a recommendation. Pricey at $13 for a 750 ml, but strong beer. Would definitely get again. Best brown ale and highly carbonated.

Couleur brune-noire, bonne mousse crémeuse beige. Nez malté (un peu grillé) et vieux fruits. Gout fort malté et fruits noirs et alcool, petite amertume. super bien balancée, fin un peu de legere reglisse et caramel.

Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is not strong but nice with caramel, chocolate, fruits and slight spiciness. A full and rich beer, sweet and slightly bitter to balance. Very fizzy carbonation and a long finish. Delicious.

Bottle poured. Dark ivory brown color with a fluffy brown head. Caramel aroma with faint floral hops. Medium body with creamy texture. Unexpectedly sweeter than I thought itd be with slight bitter after taste and a hint of caramel to the taste as well.

Bottle pour. Dark cloudy brown with a large brownish head and nice lacing. Aroma is lighter than expected, but is good. Caramel, citrus, and spices can be noted. Silky and goes own easy. Complex taste. Malty flavor as you can taste caramel and slight toffee. Finishes with nice balance of hops. You can barely taste any alcohol for how high the alcohol content is.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Magnum edition. Dark amber. Dark beige head and lacing. Vinous and fruity aroma, with plum jam, orange, coriander and overripe bananas. Similar taste with a hint of liquorice, well balanced with bitterness. Quite carbonated. Fine aftertaste and good drinkability.

Uune belle brune avec une mousse semi persistante. 
Un nez plutôt malté presque sucre, à "haute" température quelques vapeurs dalcool.
En bouche une explosion de saveur, des notes épicés se mêlent avec les arômes maltés. Tout est équilibré entre alcool saveur et amertume en fond. Une bonne brune belge pleine de puissance et de finesse.

33 cl bottle shared two ways. Pours a dark bronze with a frothy dirt white head. Nose is very sweet with prunes, raisins, some yeasty notes and light grain. Taste is very smooth and balanced. Again prunes, figs, some vanilla, light yeast and some cereal. Fairly easy to drink and no sign whatsoever of the high ABV.
Great full flavored beer with an incredible amount of flavor. Loved every drink!!!!!!

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2016 Dark brown color with white foam. The aroma is fruity with hints of caramel.
The taste is of roasted malts, just accompanied by a slight bitterness at the end.
dark brown with a thick creamy head. complex aroma and flavor: cherry, oak, earthy and spicy. flavor hits you from multiple angles. minimal alcohol burning. overall a very excellent beer.
Bottle to Glass caramel, honey, . Appearance: dark hazy brown, medium beige head. Good Palate Overall: Smooth and not much burn.

Pours dark chestnut brown with a creamy white head. Aroma is not as strong as expected but very elegant: some dry fruit and dark wood notes. The taste is overwhelmingly complex: very solid malt base with dark fruit and esther notes, smoe spices (?), a subtle sourness and some earthy yeast notes. Everything wonderfully combined and giving you the idea that there is still much more to explore. The alcohol is well hidden. Medium carbonation. Long and impressing finish with intense hop notes. Great stuff!

Bouteille de 330 ml dégustée au Pub Italia à Ottawa le 22 mars 2010 au coût de $11.95. Bière brune voilée. Mousse assez, col crémeux moyen beige-crème, très persistant. Odeur de levure et de crème bien présente, dalcool en finale. Très douce, très sucrée, peu amère. Goût de sucre candy, de café crème. Goût crémeux mais pas trop, un peu sirupeuse, se boit bien mais en quantité limitée.
Wasnt sure what to expect but was initially shocked at how smooth it was to drink - no burn! Would like a little more raisin and dark fruit flavours.

La meilleur bière de chez saint bernardus, forte et fruité.
Petite sœur de la westvleteren.

Aroma: caramel, honey, both very intense. Appearance: dark hazy brown, medium beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: initially caramel, light dry bitters coming up. Overall: nice Abbey Quadrupel, not too sweet. Bottle at t Brugs Beertje, Bruges.

@ Hotel Guldsmeden, Köpenhamn. Flaska (330ml) från Ølbutikken, Köpenhamn (38 DKK). Maltig och fruktig, torkad frukt, söt med jästtoner, medelfyllig. Avslutningen är ganska söt med toner av malt, frukt och jäst.

It pours dark brown and is very opaque. The head is thick and creamy, with a tan color that leaves good lacing. The aroma is full of cherries, earthy yeast and dried fruits, as well as intoxicating liquor smell. The warming alcohol is bold and up front with roasted malts and some bitter hops. As you continue to sip the dark fruits come out. Black cherries, prune and dried apricot mingle with a caramel like sweetness on the on the tongue. The palate is thick and velvety smooth with a long finish and lively carbonation.

33 cl bottle, label says 10% not 10.5? Pours dark brown with foamy beige head. Malty and fruity aroma. Sweet but not too sweet with dark fruits, some chocolate. Alcohol is noticeable. Balanced and deliciuos.
heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, sticky, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish, caramel, floral, alcohol, butterscotch,
cereal, toast, brown, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, lively, long finish

the aroma is top notch fruity belgium that lets u know your in for a treat,brown, cloudy, frothy, medium body, lively, smooth finish,light sweetness, lightly sour, strong competion in my mind for top belgium against chimay.

750mL from Costco Bloomfield. Amazing beer with inviting aroma. Extreme carbonation, pours beautiful cream head. Brown in appearance but combines brown flavors with those typically in a Belgian wheat. High ABV is also apparent in flavor. One of the best Ive ever enjoyed.

Bottle, 330 ml in Beertija, Zagreb. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Sweet malty and fruity aroma. Malty, caramel flavor with dried fruits. Complex and full bodied. I wasnt thrilled with it because it was too heavy for me at the time. Id like to re-rate it.

Bottle 330ml, foam erupted all over when opened, probably been put through some rough handling. Pours a nice, hazy, dark amber-brown body with a medium lasting off-white head. Aroma is of malt and some caramel, slightly of wine and some alcohol - really lovely and gentle. Mouth feel is great with medium carbonation that along with alcohol results in a strong tang around the tongue. Taste is warm and sweetish, malt and dried fruits with some ample sour notes and is perfectly balanced by roasted bitterness and carbonation. Notes caramel and roasted flavors and slightly of dark chocolate. High alcohol level is only slightly present in taste, but provides a wonderful tang and warmness, as well as contributing to a wine-like feel. Ending is bitter-sweet, with a sticky, sweet after taste.
Overall very balanced and pleasant to drink, great for a cold day. The flavor profile is, however, quite too simple and lacks in complexity and flavor development.
I think that I like the prior 8 more.
pours dark brown one finger head that leaves quickly. smell is sweet dark fruit , raisin . good beer

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 Bottle at home, bought from Beers of Europe. Caramel-coloured, slightly hazy. Heavy carbonation. Aroma of raisins, hay, dough, leather and a slightly sour yeasty smell which jars a bit. Taste is sweet, almost cloying but pulls back. Balanced finish. Gorgeous. There a sweet/saltiness to the aftertaste, and the carbonation guarantees an enjoyable mouthfeel. An unusual and satisfying quad.

This is one I would drink for the Alcohol content. Better of the higher alcohol beers in flavor. The taste stuck with me through Cajun fries I had afterward. I would have it again but not as my last beer of the night.
My favorite of the trappiste beers. Beautiful color, strong but pleasant aroma, and the taste fruity and rich. Exactly what you want in a quad.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 Massive, dunkle Früchte in der Nase, sehr edler Geruch mit leichter Rum-Aromatik. PErfkte Farbe, braun-rötlich, fehlerlos und schöner, kleinperliger Schaum. Am Gaumen Süße, Alkohol, dunkles Malz. unterstützt von viel Kohlensäure. Grandioses Bier.

Poured into a snifter from 11.2oz bottle. Pours super dark with a frothy white head that quickly dissipates. The aroma is of beautiful Belgian yeast with hints of raisin and sweet malt. The flavor is more of the same with a slightly more sweet feel than I was expecting, but not overpowering in the least. This is truly a great quad. So deep in flavor and aroma. A top notch Belgian quad to put it mildly. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a bottle. Dark tan in color with a big fluffy white head. Smell is yeast, bread, and sweet. Very very tasty. Sweet, yet not to much. God amount of bitterness. This beer is excellent. One of the best beers Ive had. Also, I poured it at around 60 degrees. Had one cold and it lost a lot of flavor and aroma from that.
From bottle in Trollekelder in Gent. Smells of raisins. Very dark with a slightly red color. Sweet taste with small bitterness. Nice quadruppel.
Nice beer aroma. The color is great dark with some reddish tones. The taste is too much caramel and cream. Overall a very good belgian but lacks completely soreness, so not completely my type.

Pours a dark red, light brown with decent head and lacing. Aroma is sweet, alcoholic, fruity with some hints of smokyness and grapes. Taste is sweeter, alcoholic and quite malty. Not too bitter or hoppy, well rounded and a slightly bitter aftertaste. Strong, drinkable and a proper quadruppel.

11.2 oz. bottle to Pilsner glass. Extreme frothy light brown head, pours reddish brown with excellent lacing. Aroma of prunes, leaves, sour grapes.
Tastes fruity, nutty, alcohol apparent but sweet. Slightly bitter, slightly sour. A lot going on here. Full bodied, texture is almost syrupy. Lively carbonation with a long bitter-sour finish. This is the best beer Ive ever had the pleasure of sampling, so interesting.

330 ml/33 cl, flaske, 10 % ABV, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 27. april 2014. 
Mørk/sort/brun belgisk Dark Strong Ale med 3-4 cm tyk flot "gæret" offwhite-farvet skumkrone. 
Syrlig duft af gær, tørret frugt. 
Fantastisk smag! Sødme og bittert indtryk, der bare går hånd i hånd. Umiddelbart et lidt for højt kulsyreindhold, der lige skal "skummes af" i munden. Men ellers en dejlig øl, der bare udvikler sig i smagen, mens temperaturen "arbejder".
En fin lille Quadrupel udenfor trappist fællesskabet.

On draught at Roscoes for Belgian Beer Summit. 2010 vintage. Dark reddish brown color. Aroma is berry lollipop, plum, vanilla, and raspberry. Taste is Belgian candi sugar, prune, raspberry, caramel, and toffee. Just enough bitterness to cut through the intense sweet components. Belies its alcohol content.

Bottle. Cloudy dark brown pour, slight red colour. Thinner layer of beige head. Yeasty. Aroma is spicy, sweet, dark fruit. Taste is a great mix of malt and hops. Alcohol, dark fruit, some chocolate, caramel. Probably my favorite beer

Bottle poured into a tulip glass---Pours a dark amber with a red tint. Big head, lots of bubbles. Nice sweet smell. Taste has kind of a plummy grapey thing going on, nice. Typical body and carbonation for this style of ale. Over all I like this beer.
While similar the Trappest 10 its not quiet there. I prefer Sierra Nevada Olivia Quad at a fraction on the price.

Bottle. Pours brown caramel with active carb and a fluffy light tan head. The aroma is yeast, dark dried fruit, and burnt sugar. The taste adds malted barley, chocolate, raisin, plum, and maple syrup. The palate has a rich feel and high carb. Complex, balanced, Really awesome overall. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2014 The Abt 12... a favorite of mine. Beautiful dark beer. Bit of a vinous aroma. Clear ripe dark fruits, some alcohol, yeast and malty sweetness.Tastes fruity and sweet at the beginning, followed by a mild roasty and sweet taste in the middle. The finish is lightly bitter and sweet (chocolate) and evolves into a warm aftertaste which strengthens the complex flavours that this beer encompasses. A very nice spicy alcoholic bite as well... Very full bodied, beautiful creamy mouthfeel...This beer is on the same level with the bests single malts available. A true gem within its kind and if you ask me a true gem within the history of beer as a whole. Enjoy this beer slowly. Sip it. Do not serve below 14 degrees centigrade. It will destroy the taste enourmously.

Scent of caramel, yeast, dates, and malt. Opaque, near black colour. Flavours f chocolate, dried fruit, coffee, burnt sugar, and coffee. Sweetness with light bitterness and mild carbonation. Quite delicious.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2014 Bottle, 75cl. Pours dark brown, reddish color with nice bubbly foam head. Aroma is barley wine (boozy), caramel, raisins, hint of dark chocolate. Nice. Taste starts sweet, barley wine taste is first to hit the palate (not quite as boozy as the aroma makes you expect though). Chocolate taste which fades into a creamy sweet/sour kick. Develops a light bubblegum taste. Little bitter in the aftertaste. Great. Settles nicely in the stomach. One of the best Dubbel beers around.

Heerlijk trappistenbier zoals hij hoort: een echt donker speciaalbier met een toets van karamel (in tegenstelling tot vele anderen waarbij het zoet overheerst). Robuust en vol, maar toch relatief licht op de maag. Aanrader!
Pours dark brown, with off-white head. Malt, yeast and slightly roasted. Very malty, caramel and chocolate flavour. With a nice bitter finish.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Blind quad test against Pannepot, Pannepeut, Rochefort 10, Westvleteren 12, St Amatus 12, The Sixth Glass, & Chimay Blue My prefered order was; Pannepot, Rochefort 10, St Amatus 12, Westvleteren 12, St Bernardus, Pannepeut, Sixth Glass and last Chimay.

-
Aroma on this one is much more yeast then the others, also a bit more spicy, some licorice and a lot of raisin. Taste is not the general dark fruits, this is pure raisin, quite spicy, a lingering mouthfeel and drier compared to the others, yeast has a bigger role in general on this one, quite rough, but i can get how people like it, its quite different than the others.
no discussion for being a top beer - although less known than the Westvleteren12, its almost 100% similar. Nicer from cellar temp than fridge temp, much smoother & richer taste.
Bottle from Piccolo Parco in Taipei. Bready spicy yeasty aroma. Big bubbly taste. Spicy with very malty bready finish. Doesn't taste like 10%. Not bad for this style.

Had this many times but finally sat
down to rate this at Piccolo Parco bar in Taipei. Bottle. Aroma of overripe fruit, plum, smoke, leather and a little liquorice - somehow with so much in the nose it still smells sweet and relatively light. Taste is spicy fruit with a long malty finish. Body is dry with loads of fluffy carbonation which, together with the spiciness and high alcohol, gives this a nice kick. A complex Trappist ale that's dry, fizzy, fruity and spicy.
4 year old bottle, marked 01.07.15. Plums, dark fruit and raisins. Complexity is out of control. Time has smoothed out any rough edges. One of the best beers you will ever have. Damn monks are solid.

Malty, fig/plum nose. Hazy copper with perfect persistent head and Belgian lacing. Malty but not cloyingly sweet. Rich toffee, malt and dark fruit flavors completely mask any alcohol heat. Yeast flavors subtle but in perfect compliment. Low but perfect carbonation and just enough hop bitterness for a perfect balance. On tap at Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma frutado com notas de cravo. Aparência marrom caramelado. Sabor com algo de banana e especiarias. No paladar, um leve amargor. No geral, uma bela trapista, muito parecida com quadrupel. Deliciosa.

On draft at Chelsea's Kitchen. Copper red with white head that dissipates quickly, but leaves nice lacing. Smells of cereal, yeast and a little caramel. Nice, bold brew that finishes dry. Wouldn't have guessed 10% abv. Highly endorse.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Cloudy brown/orange color, average sized tan head. Full body, soft to average carbonation. Aroma is very fruity (dark fruits, red fruits), also caramel malts, raisins. Its sweet but far from too sweet. Just the right amount of sweetness actually. Excellent beer.

Dark pour with a huge head, aroma is malty, banana, candied fruits, sweetness. Taste is liquorice, roast malt, apricots and some sweetness, with alcohol notes towards the end and a smooth finish. Very nice

Deep brown with beige head. Bitter-sweet promising aroma. Complex taste, raisins, dried apricots, cinnamon, banana. The high abv quite well disguised.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured into a 16 oz snifter. A dark hazy copper with a minimal head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of malt and fruit punch. Sweet malt flavor with a smooth alcohol finish of a typical Trippel. Quite pleasant! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy deep brown color, large and lasting head. Very fruity aroma, dark and dried fruits, toffee, roasted sugars and malts. Balanced taste between sweetness and little bit of sourness and bitterness. Great and impressive Abt Quadrupel style beer.
Bottle. Pours brown with off white head. Nose and flavor is brown sugar, pear and alcohol. Delicious.

11.2 oz bottle from Hazels. Appearance: finger of khaki head that does not last long, but lingers as a nice film, deep amber/copper red, lightly cloudy, good to great lacing. Aroma: caramel, cereal, light grass and pine, earthy leaves. Palate: medium body, lively carbonation, slightly dry finish, alcohol texture. Taste: heavy and deep sweetness, very commanding but not overpowering. Overall, very solid beer, maybe drank a little too cold (low 50s?) so I missed some aromas, but still very lovely quad.

Bottle 50 cl.
Pours dark brown, with off-white head. Malt, yeast and slightly roasted. Very malty, caramel and chocolate flavour. With a nice bitter finish.
its really great beer, full body, complex taste and aroma make it very special, one of the best Belgian beers

An aroma of sweet raisin and some dehydrated strawberry. Appears purplish brownwith lighter white lace. Taste is predominantly raisin followed by brown sugar, but it is all balanced with some hop bittering; overall flavor is pretty mild. Palate is fizzy, not watery. Overall, this is a very good beer, not great, but very good.
Tap. Dark plum brown. No head or lacing. Vague aroma. Strong brown sugar and raisin. Good but not what I was expecting for the hype!
Backlog. On tap at Green Lion Inn. Complex with caramel, apricots, raisins and dried fruits.

Wonderfully complex. Not sure where to start with my description, but it has to rank among the best beers in the world. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaska från 2012. Lätt karamell och nöt. Mjuk syra med belgotouch. Vackert skum och underbar doft.

This has to be one of the best beers in the world. Color is a reddish, very dark brown with a huge head when poured into my Duvel glass (should have used the Chimay glass I guess). Aroma is yeast, malt, dried fruit and booze. Taste is very complex, brown sugar, roasty malt, prune, banana-bread-like flavors and well-placed hops bitterness. This is top-notch.
Une de mes favorites tout comme la Pater 6, elle represente parfaitement les bière dabbaye belge
Possibly my perfect beer,... nose of plum, molasses, and alcohol. Pours a dark brown with great head and decent lacing. Goes down smooth.

Bottle, poured into a St Bernardus chalice. Pours a very dark brown, murky, a ruby tinge when held up to the light, a half finger light brown head which lasts, especially around the edge. Aroma- sugary sweetness is the first thing that hits, then plum, fig, sugary raisin, banana cake, fruitcake, cherries, sultanas, boozy. Lovely aromas. Taste- caramel, sugar, molasses, banana, treacle, plenty of dark fruit, alcohol, a bit of roasted nuttiness, dark malts, full mouthfeel, long and complex finish. Bloody good, not quite as good as the Rochefort 10 (by a fraction).

Bottle 0.33L.
Dark brown body with reddish nuances; huge, creamy, tan head, mostly lasting with nice lacing.
Moderate-to-heavy malty aroma (caramel) with notes of dark fruits, raisins, alcohol and maybe choclate and licorice.
Moderate-to-heavy sweet flavour quite balanced with bitterness and light tartness. 
Full body with creamy texture; soft carbonation; light-to-moderate alcoholic warming in the finish.
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur brune foncée et peu de mousse, une attaque en bouche très axée sur le grillé et la noix pour terminer sur le côté caramélisé, excellente.

The beer pours dark brown with a healthy one inch head. Some
Hint of coffee in the aroma. 

The beer has an interesting sweet taste the first time one drinks it. It is a malty mix of sweet and hoppy tastes that comes as a welcome surprise. 

The initial taste is soon replaced by the natural aromas that the legendary st Bernardos is known for. 

Definitely worth trying and one of the best Belgian brews, esp non Trappist. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: APR 1, 2014 Cerveja escura de muito corpo e alto teor alcoólico. Complexidade alta de aromas e sabores. Fantástica!

(Drinking date: 27 March 2014) Hazy brown-coloured beer with a layer of white/beige foam. Looks good!! Aroma of dried dark fruits (especially plums), chocolate and a bit of metal unfortunatelly. Nice aroma, but could have been more powerfull. Nice taste! Milk/pure chocolate, alcohol, dried dark fruits. Bitter and sweet at the same time. Bitter aftertaste, and a warm and burning feeling from the alcohol. I like it! Good thicker mouthfeel, with the good amount of carbonation (medium). Overall, I like this beer! It is delicious, but not the best quad Ive had. But still its very good! Thats why I give it the total score of 3.9!

The aroma is apparent as soon as you pop the cork -- dark fruit, baked goods and caramel with a hint of flowers. Pours a thick, hazy (almost opaque) orange-brown with a large head. Lively carbonation cuts through a panoply of rich flavors -- brown sugar and rich dark malt with a touch of honey and floral/hoppy notes. Stays on the tongue for a few moments, developing into a slightly bitter citrus that soon dissolves away. Very good.
Le top de chez St Bernardus. Couleur brun foncé, arôme de fruits et légèrement sucrée. Alcool bien présent. Une valeur sûre !

Large bottle consumed during March Madness. Aroma has a lot of dark fruit influence....plum. Appearance is cloudy, maybe mahogany, slightly brown/light chestnut. Great nose. Taste is reminiscent of fall dark fruit. Sugar present. Belgian yeast too. When you think of Belgian breweries, this should be one of the first ones to come to mind. Really good finish. Awesome.

Big corked bottle. Plum Color with off white head. Dark fruit yeast aroma. Plum , balanced sour and sugar , fig. Mouthfeel is perfect , some carbonation, but smooth. Alcohol is hidden well. Classic Belgian yeast flavor as well. The slightly sour dark fruit builds throughout but finishes very clean and nice. Excellent in every way.
Had during a bottle share at Pinglehead Brewing in Orange Park, Fl. Belgian standard! Incredibly balanced.

33cl bottle @ home. Dark-brown color, big beige creamy head. Aroma fruit, caramel, roasted malt. Alcohol is immediately noticable in the throat and stomach then quiclky goes into the head. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, slightly salty. Full body, lively carbonation, average bittersweet finish which is more bitter at the end. Not a big deel at all, but its good desser kind of beer with high alcohol level.

Bottled. Dark brown, clody body with a huge stable beauge foam. Aroma full of spices, caramel, malts, alcohols, wood. Tastes sweet, strong, flavoured by caramel, accent on alcohol closer to the finish, which is not so long.

Hazy, dark brown body with a small, off-white head that leaves little lacing. Strong, sweet and extraordinarily complex aroma of all sorts of dark dried fruits, sugar, light roast, Belgian yeast and a whiff of alcohol. Strong flavours of raisins and other dried fruits of the dark kind, Belgian yeast, dark candi sugar, overripe banana and a tad too much alcohol. Moderate sweet taste with a moderate bitter finish. Smooth and creamy texture, full body, moderate to soft carbonation. Very nice, but shouldnt the alcohol been better integrated?
[33 cl bottle enjoyed 4 years before BB date, shared with mfroseth @ Nydalen Bryggeri og Spiseri, Oslo]
Pours a dark brown. Aroma of dark fruits and spices. Taste lingers with dark fruits, caramel, and spices.
Very nice thick tan head, dark brown color, great aroma, very smooth taste, light sweetness, soft, light bodied, very pleasant finish.

Abt 12 has earned a place of honor among its Belgian contemporaries. St. Bernardus has paid its dues to get into that select group. Make no mistake, its hard work to make beer that is this satisfying. The plain brown body supports a hearty head and contains a lot of dark sediment. While the aroma is light, it reveals an abundance of dark fruit and grains. The tasting experience is awesomely complex. Champagne-like fruit flavors hit the tongue, first. They quickly mature into sensations of plum and raisin. The long finish eventually dissolves into a brown sugar sweetness. Its the kind of brew that deserves to be sipped and shared.

Zeker en vast een van de beste Belgische bieren en zelfs het echte originele recept van Westvleteren. Gesofisticeerd biertje zeer rijk palet qua aromas en een lange bittere nasmaak die de fruitigheid toch niet teniet doet. Een absolute aanrader.

Bottle.

A- Raisins, plums, dark fruits, spices, alcohol.

A- Brown color, cloudy liquid, off white head.

T- Raisins, plums, dark fruits, licorice, brown sugar, peppery, metallic.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, fruity finish.

O- A largely fruity body, especially with the dark fruits. Also some burnt caramel notes. Lots of sediment in the appearance. An okay beer that I just didnt feel quite lived up to expectations.

33cl bottle from abbatia.pt, pours red, brown, hazy, white foam, aroma is caramel, taste is medium sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, creamy, good carbonation long finish, one of the best beers around the world!

This is one of the best beers Ive ever had. Pours dark brown almost black with a garnet hue when held in the light. Nice thick, creamy head that leaves artistic lacing. Aroma of dark bread, raisin, plum, tobacco, alcohol, slightly floral. Somewhat sweet, rich, and fruity flavor, with good spiciness and a nice alcohol burn. This stuff goes straight to your head. Wow, I will definitely get this again.

Hazy brown color , big off-white head. Rich aroma of dark fruits, wood , caramel. Taste of fruits , chocolate , caramel. Full body , low carbonation. Warming aftertaste with light bitterness. Very rich and complex belgian abbey beer.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, sehr fruchtig, reife Früchte, alkoholisch. Geschmack stark fruchtig, dunkle überreife Früchte, leicht röstmalzig, alkoholisch.

Bouteille de 750ml achetée à la SAQ. Couleur brune avec reflet ruby, assez brumeuse. Mousse blanche/beige très dense et très gouteuse en alcool. Nez de fruits mûres, surtout pruneaux et rainsins, sucre dorge, réglisse. En bouche beaucoup de sucre, de malt et de fruits, cette fois surtout le raisin. Peu damertume, mais un peu dépices en fin de bouche. Effervescence quand même élevé pour une Abt mais sinon palais médium, pas trop costaud mais piquant. Un produit vraiment de qualité, très ressemblant à la Trois-Pistoles pour les amateurs de Unibroue, À essayer.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2016 Tap. Clear ruby amber with a small off beige head that lasts in spots and laces. Aromas of raisins, plum, cherry, caramel, clove and spice. Flavor is the same with some light yeast. Medium bodied, slight dry finish and lingering dark fruit.

Aroma is fruity. Dates. Grapes. Yeasty. Estery. 
Appearance is definitely not dark ivory. Its more like red grape color. A red brown sort of thing.

Taste is smooth grape. Dates. Sweet but not as bad as Trappist rouchfort 10 (a good thing) a bit of booze.

Very nice on the palate. Dry. Smooth. Easy going. Medium body.

A very nice beer complex enough but could maybe be a.bit more so. It has a very one note of dates and grapes. A.solid beer Im glad I tried it but probably will not see another go.
Gekocht bij slijterij t Vaatje in Rijnsburg. Erg lekker bier. Zoet, veel alcohol. Krachtige nasmaak die lang blijft hangen. Een van de betere Belgische bieren.
Got this is a bottle and found it to be very drinkable. It is nice strong beer with a light fruit flavor. Very enjoyable to drink.

Bottle at Ølbutikken.
Hazy dark brwon. Richa aroma, some sourness to set the saliva running. Fruity. Full flavour, very belgian. Bitter hops, candy sugar. Superb, but the competition is tough today.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2014 Bottle. Pours murky brown with a large tan head. Aroma: alcohol, raisin, dried fruit, bit of wood. Very smooth mouthfeel, initial carbonation smoothes quite fast. Lots of dark fruit in the taste, raisins, bit of honey. A balanced beer with quite a lot going on. Lovely brew!

750ml bottle. Murky brown with a foamy off-white head. Flavors are raisins, cherry, dough, toffee, brown sugar, spices, roasted malts and alcohol. Medium to full body, lively carbonation, creamy texture.
Very nice flavor without being overwhelmingly sweet. Has some nice dark fruit, caramel, banana, cloves, and fresh cracked pepper flavors.

First saw this bier at a restaurant in Tongeren last year and had to try it. Had to try one more. And one more after that. Im not into the play-by-play aroma,malt, hops, head, taste, etc. trying to analyze or over analyze every little sip. I just like a good bier. This is one and has become my favorite Belgian.

330cl bottle in a Trappist goblet. No overwhelming aroma, slight hint of raisin. Fantastic deep fruity taste with raisins again coming through. Slight alcohol flavor in the finish. Can only be described as neither sweet nor bitter with a fantastic warming taste and feeling. Certainly lives up to its reputation

poured a thick light tan head. Brownish copper in color. Had some chunky monkeys at the bottom... tried to leave the last bit int the bottle. Aroma was peppery and spicy. Taste... beligiany spicy. Excellent beer. One of my favorite Belgian Beers.

33cl bottle sampled in a trappist glass. Dark brown brew with low retention head that leaves no lacing. Aroma of caramel, dough, dried fruit, hit of licorice and lots of alcohol. Tastes of the same, but without the licorice. Mouthfeel is warm of alcohol, full and slightly creamy. Atertaste is lasting of dough and dried fruits. Great brew!!

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2014 Those that drank recently, fragrance feel a little unsatisfactory. It is destroying the balance a little taste only noticeable feeling of alcohol, but it ends up just just buy Given the difference in the distribution of beer and examples of this beer. But be a sense of discomfort people know the taste of the star performer ...

Bière brune foncée avec un haut col de mousse noisette. Nez complexe de gateau, réglisse, épices, caramel, . Bouche ronde, cremeuse et moelleuse, bonne carbonation, faible amertume en attaque qui se développe petit à petit, gout de réglisse, de biscuits, notes de bananes, de prunes et de raisins macérés dans le rhum. Lalcool est très présent et procure une agréable chaleur. Superbe, une des meilleures abt du monde !

Pours a very effervescent dark brown color with a thick lively head which dissipates perfectly to fill the top of a trappist glass. Aroma is very fruity with plum, peach, raisin, a very lightly roasted chocolate, sweet bread, dough, malt, buttery smooth cereal. Taste is dark malt and chocolate coating fruit flavor of plum, cherry, slight licorice with an extra finish of cocoa. Extremely deep and complex, one of my absolute favorites of the style going away from straight fruit. Cant say Ive had a malt note like this before.

Presentation: 330mL brown bottle, served in an oversized wine glass.

Appearance: It has a very dark brown color and develops a tan, two finger head. It has good retention, so it stays for a while and leaves some nice lacing.

Smell: The sweet malty smell is right up front with a strong alcohol note in the background.

Taste: Just as with the nose, theres a very dominant malt sweetness at the front, with some ripe fruit notes and a warming alcohol feel throughout that wraps things up very nicely.

Mouthfeel: Its full bodied, with average carbonation. Very smooth and creamy, it just feels balanced.

Overall: An incredible beer. This is a must-have.

pours hazy redish brown with a fluffy off white head. some lacing. Aroma is toffee, caramel, darker fruits, and a little bit of roasted malt. Some spicy character as well. Tastes sweet at first with strong malt character. Caramel and roasted grains give way to prunes and cherries, with a nice spicy finish. Good mouthfeel, tingles the tongue and leaves behind lingering flavors.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep Amber large off white head, some lacing. Aromas of toffee, tropical fruits, cherry, honey and some toast. Taste of toffee, honey, roasted malt, some prune. Nice medium mouthfeel, finishes with some interesting spicy notes.

Bottle from the LCBO. Pours a deep hazy brown with a big tan head. Nose is yeast, bread dark fruit and spice. Sweet balanced start of caramel and cherry. Spiciness is well blended with the sweetness. Full slick body with quite active carbonation. Excellent.
Bottle. Color dark brown with medium white head. Aroma caramel, fruits, roasted, alcohol. Taste fruits, caramel, alcohol.

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 Poured from a bottle with a hazy brown color and a thick, foamy off-white head. Has a subtle fruit aroma, perhaps too subtle. Has a sweet dark fruit flavor and no hint of the 10.5% alcohol. Feels smooth and has a nice full body. St. Bernardus, I would say, is heavenly .

Bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a thick tan head that lasts and lots of lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, cherry, some roasted malt and just a bit of spice. taste is a blend of the dark fruit and malt with some toffee and chocolate to round it out. Mild bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, thick and creamy with a velvety texture. Excellent balance with no trace of the 10.5% ABV. Great beer to savour. Gold standard for the style.

A true masterpiece!
the best dark strong Belgian ale I ever tasted. well balanced chocolate caramel notes, a very fruity pallet, a rich full body and moderately priced.
Much better than Westvletern and certainly better value.
Very nice Quad. Not quite as good as Rochefort 10 but a fairly close second. It has a nice head is very smooth and creamy. Very nice beer indeed!
Belle couleur sombre, pas beaucoup de mousse mais dense, goût sucré et caramélisé, arôme d épices grille et houblon.. Excellente bière...

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Uitermate lekker bier van sint-bernardus. Vergelijkbaar met de westvleteren12. Er is een verschil tussen beide bieren maar dat is echt miniem. Donkerbruin met mooie schuimkraag. Vol van smaak met toetsen van mout, koffie, chocolade en rozijnen. Zeer mooie zoete afdronk. Topbier !!

330ml Bottle. This pours a dark brown opaque body topped with a light tan medium head of medium duration. Its aroma is mainly malty with hints of vanilla and dark fruits. The maltiness also transfers to the taste where dark chocolate and burnt toast fight their way through the sweetness you would expect with a 10%er Belgian beer. Not a session beer and its good but not that good,

Dark, red cherry color almost against the light. 
Beautiful head, creamy and silky texture and smoothness.
Carbonation maintained on every sip, a fizziness that excites the flavors over the tongue.
Notes of raisin and chocolate covered cherries. 

A superb beer, perhaps Im spoiled, but compared in a flight of quads, this one was only second best.

Bottle, pours a coppery color with an off white head leaving heavy lacing. Aroma of malt and yeast. Notes of apple, citrus, malt and yeast, smooth mouthfeel. Very easy to drink, very good trappist brew.
Reddish pour. Taste is apple and malt. Alcohol non existent. Very smooth. Top of quad list.
Compared to Westvletern, this feels almost like a light beer version but still has all the flavour.

Pours dark caramel brown. Aroma is dark fruits, prunes, cherries. Lots of bready notes hay. Some spice maybe cinnamon. Gets right into the nose. Full bodied and full mouthfeel. Flavour is smooth sweet bread and yeast. Bitterness on finish with alcohol lift. Alcohol strength is managed well. Although full bodied it still feels light. Excellent beer.

Couleur brune foncée. Une mousse dense mais non-persistante. Arome équilibré: houblon-caramel-levure. En bouche, lalcool est perceptible et chaude. Des arôme dépices restent en bouche longtemps. Caramel, noix, sucre candy. La finale est amère et résineuse avec une pointe de fruits sècher. Exellente !!!
This beer lives up to my expectations. Nose= raisin, malty, sweet. Delicious!

Dark amber beer doesnt want to stay in bottle, some of it insisted on getting out before I got my glass ready :) Medium head and a complex sweet fruity aroma coupled with Belgian yeasts. A hint of alcohol. Taste is fruity sweet and yeasty, also balanced with malt body and warming alcohol. Ripe fruits with something like a hint of coffee or something darker. Smooth. Really really good, just not quite there :)

First of all, WOW. This stuff is excellent. Pours a deep brown hue with a thick light tan head. Strong malt flavour, Caramel and biscuit taste. Complex malt profile that becomes more complex as it warms. Another Belgian classic.

75cL bottle poured into a goblet. Strong raisin and doughy notes come off the beer as its being poured and dominate the nose for a couple seconds before a mild fizzy and astringent character peeks through, which, in turn, if followed by a combination of citrus and spice, some vanilla, cola-like caramel, and banana. Near the end, a minor woody note comes through with a light mildew / damp towel note. The beer is a deep, dark, lightly hazy mahogany with a big, jello-like, off-white head that has excellent retention, but a runny lacing that looks nice for a second before cascading back into the beer. The taste is highly sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Its full bodied with loads of carbonation giving it a relatively thin texture that goes down smooth and creamy. Dark cherries hit the tongue first followed by a floral gin-like alcohol warmth and bitterness. The floral gin notes stick around for the finish and a smokey bourbon quality with some spice come through. The aftertaste is dry and smokey with raisin, dry cherry, and toasted bread and butter flavors. A subtle fatty / umami character appears in the aftertaste very late, well after the beer is finished.

Possibly the best beer in the world. This beer definitely shows the Brewers expertise and craftsmanship. Tastes of smooth dark sweet fruits. Plums, raisins, dark cherries. Compares to, yet better than the most extravagant of wines. After a heavenly palatable experience, a smooth Smokey alcohol like finish. Very pleasurable indeed. Quite orgasmic in its complexity. Kudos to this Brewer!
Draft. Dark fruit and earthy aroma. Complex flavors of fruit, oak, bananas, some dusty and earthy notes.

Pours a deep, opaque mahogany brown with a fine beige head. Aroma is dark fruits, plum, raisin, sugar, caramel and cherry. Taste retains all the complexity and elements present in the aroma, with an exceptionally smooth refined and creamy mouthfeel with a drawn out aftertaste. A superb example of the style.
Dark ivory coloured beer with a fruity aroma and a wholehearted flavour. Very nice and long afterflavour too.
Bomber poured into trappist glass..killer mahogany color..great aroma of fruit,sugar..malty..lingers exceptionally well..great quad.

Pours a dark reddish brown with a bubbly milk chocolate head that dissipates quickly. Very little lacing. Smells of dark fruits, tobacco, bread and malt. Plum, raisin, malt and caramel taste. Alcohol is very pronounced. Medium mouth with a fair amount of carbonation. I prefer the Rochefort 10 by a slight margin, but this is an excellent quad.

Botella de 33cl. Un clásico belga y para mi gusto de lo mejor en su estilo. Nariz muy agradable y con muchos matices. Color oscuro y con un carbonatacion muy adecuada. Una cerveza muy fácil de beber, teniendo en cuenta su alto contenido alcohólico.

Bottle from Systembolaget, Sweden. Best before july 17 2018. ABV: 10.5 %

Dark brown, hazy, beer with a two finger high head that leaves lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Dark fruit, raisin, plum, grapes, brown sugar, butter and caramel malt. 

Taste: Rich and complex! Bread, caramel, syrup, banana, grapes, dark rum, raisin and dried fruit.

Great carbonation and a creamy feeling. Sweet and warm finish. 

Halleluja! Im saved!

Very surprised by this one. Aroma was full of dark fruit and alcohol. Definitely a malt taste that was filled with fruit tones. Alcohol was almost overbearing.. Depends on the consumer. I enjoyed it very much compared to similar beers. Keep it as cold as possible!

APPEARANCE: Dark, almost black body that demonstrates a reddish hue when held up to light. Strong, thick head. Sediment floating around inside the bottle. 

AROMA: The aroma is fantastic on this beer. There's dark fruits, like plum, raisin, fig. Sweet, caramel malts. I also detected brown sugar and a little bit of cinnamon. There's also a whiff of alcohol in there - at 10% it was expected. 

TASTE: What a great, complex taste, with just about all elements of the nose showing strong. The malts offer a sweet caramel breadiness that's well complemented by the plum, raisin, and fig, as well as a little bit of banana. Brown sugar is also noticeable, with a trace amount of chocolate mixed in as well. 

MOUTHFEEL: No surprises. Thick and heavy, with alcoholic warming. Also somewhat creamy. Where I think this beer shines is that despite the sweetness, it's never syrupy or sickly. 

OVERALL: People who've had both tell me that Westvleteren XII is marginally better than Abt 12. I haven't had Westy, so for now, Abt 12 is my favorite quad. I feel like I should have more quads before giving this a 100, but I think it's the perfect example of the style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Bruges. Pours deep ruby with a big fading tan head. Plenty of flavour with sherry, fruit cake, liquorice, raisin and soy sauce notes. Warming and reasonably evident alcohol. Full creamy mothfeel. A very nice beer, but it doesnt compare with a good imperial stout for my tastes.
Rich flavors of bread, candied berries, molasses, pound cake and hints of clove and yeast. Perfect feel and carbonation.
I am not that excited about the 12 Bernardus. I found it to be a regular quad. I dont share the complexity taste opinions that others have. Maybe trying again later en re-rate.
Light aroma deep golden brown color with thick head and enduring lace. Spicy malty taste with clean hop bite that leaves no lingering aftertaste. High ABV but easy drinking.
33cl bottle. Aroma dark fruit, caramel, alcohol, fragrant yeast. Appearance, near opaque espresso colour. Sweet, wine-y full bodied taste. Initial prickle, and enduringly creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle in Jerusalem. Exp date: 9/2018. Pours a deep dark brown with with three fingers of packed foam that dissipate into a finger of rocky fluff. Ring of yeast at base of bottle. Active carbonation in the glass. Aroma is rich oil and butter up front, yeast-dominant, with notes of leaves or hay and some subtle toffee suggestions. As the beer adjusts to room temperature, a woody alcohol aroma is given off and the Belgian yeast character comes into sharper focus, with the butter aromas transitioning into cheese. Taste evokes caramel and butterscotch, definitely on the sweet side, with some prune and juicy Medjool dates. Alcohol isnt detectable in the mouth, nor is there any bitterness to speak of. Body is medium-tending-to-full, carbonation is average. Not much lacing. Bottom line: enjoyably complex and a beer to take ones time drinking but sweeter than Im usually in the mood for.
Dark amber brown with moderate head poured from tap. Full bodied and sweet taste. Like a stronger triple
On tap @ t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Dark brown with light beige head. Sweet aroma and taste. Little bitter aftertaste. One of my favorites.

750ml bottle from LCBO. Toronto, Ontario. It pours an opaque light cola color with minimal head. Rich and complex aroma with good balance between orange, grapes, wine and yeast. It tastes sweet and malty with notes of brown sugar followed by raisins and fig. High carbonation.
Another amazing trappist quadruple, sweet and complex. As usual you feel only the right amount of alchool. Second only to the Rochefort 10.
Hands down one of the best beers on the planet! Amazing complexities in smell and taste.

Das Bier hat eine schöne dunkelbraune Farbe, Geruch nach Malz, Melasse und ein bisschen nach Lösungsmittel. Geschmack relativ süß, malzig. Insgesamt recht süffig, schmeckt gut gekühlt besser als warm.

Nice honey aroma at the nose. Pours great with a nice deep auburn or burnt red color. The taste is wonderful but nothing compared to the finish. A great Belgian abbey ale. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Was my staple for Belgium beer until I had Westy 12! It still remains a favorite, especially due to its availability.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. A dark brown beer with a good beige head quite persisitant. Fruity aroma, alcohol, caramel, spices. Primary taste is sweetness. Bitter background. Full body, oily texture. Sweet finish. Warming beer. Overall, an excellent beer I would like to drink during summer in a café terrace, at dinner.

Aroma of dates, yeast, oranges, spices, slightly herbal. Hazy plum brown colour. Taste mimics aroma, with sweet boozy body. Malty, bready, thick mouthfeel. A good beer but not my favorite big belgian. Would still buy again when available.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2014 Mild aroma, dark in color with little head. Sweet, brandy, malt, lite fruit taste, lite bitterness. Not as strong as you would think having such a high ABV indicates. Great beer.
Hazy dark brown body, beige head. Hoppy, fruity aroma, caramel and raisins. The alcohol gives a warning feeling to the taste. Sweet dried fruit and caramel again. Right amount of bitterness.

UPDATED: JUN 7, 2014 33cl bottle served in a Trappist glass (with the yeast). Lovely dark colour which produces a billowing head. The mouthfeel is truly astounding just the right viscosity and you feel the bubbles burst on your tongue. Taste wise it is the most susceptible beer I have ever tried to temperature. It really wants to be served at a higher temperature than that recommended on the bottle. Very much a staple in my beer menu. Hides the ABV particularly well.

2013 v 2009

Young bomber vintage 2013 best by 06.02.18
Cork smells lovely, big sweet creamy dates, pours up an opaque dark dried apricot body with a smooth 1.5" off white head fading to a solid sheet with several delicate peninsulas and dots of lace

fig and date with apple cider, caramel and milk chocolate, obvious Belgian effervescence, fall leaves and peppery spice on a spritzy yet cohesive medium-light body leaving a nicely coated sweet-spicy-bitter palate with vague residuals, a touch of vanilla and butterscotch coming into play with warmth, balanced and subtle

Aged 11.2oz vintage 2009 best by 15 12 14 aged at 55-65º
Noticeably darker body, much less hazed, mahogany with a creamy smooth 1" light khaki head crowned by a few soapy bubbles, dense wall of solid creamy lace

Apple cider at center stage initially with lazy creamy fig and spice rounding out, warm chocolate and coffee push their way to main attraction with warmth 

fruit cake and vanilla on a medium full body, residuals of wood and leaves with accents of milk chocolate and coffee, vastly improved with age

55º into Luigi Bormioli Michelangelo 17 oz. Burgundy wine glass
Dark brown beer with a light head. Subtle dark hoppy aroma. Strong bittersweet taste with a hoppy raisin aftertaste. Subtle sweet alcohol aftertaste. Very nice beer!
Aroma. Fruits, flowers, cherries, caramel. Taste. Dried fruits, caramel, raisins, apricots. Smooth and balanced. Warming, nice finish. For me Perfect beer!
UPDATED: AUG 6, 2014 Bottle. Amber dark beer. Aroma is a bit malty and fresh. Taste is good with a bitter. Overall a good beer.

Pours a clear deep brown with a reddish hue and a light brown fluffy head that leaves a good amount of lacing up the glass. Aroma of caramel, raisins, plums, brown sugar and molasses. Flavor is we great balance between booze and the sweet brown sugar and molasses flavor. In addition there are sweet dried fruits like plums and raisins present but the balance of these flavors is what makes this beer great and easy to drink for a 10.5% quad. Mouthfeel is silky with a moderate carbonation but never gets to the point where the carbonation is high and the alcohol is hot it is balanced ever so delicately and make the overall experience of drinking this beer a pleasure.
1500ml Bottle - Dark brown/copper in colour. Marzipan, caramel, raisins and sultanas in the aroma. Fruity and slightly roasted taste with sultanas, nuts, raisins, toffee and brown sugar.

Rapportée de Belgique en 33cL. Effervescente au service, dévoile une mousse dense mais non-persistante, mousse pâle et collante. Arômes timides mais axés sur léquilibre houblon-caramel-levure. En bouche, lalcool est perceptible et chaude. Des arôme de mélanoïdes et dépices sont présents et restent en bouche longtemps. Caramel, noix, sucre candy. La finale est amère et résineuse mais équilibrée. Au visuel, amas de levures. Couleur de tuiles orangés.
Uitstekend donker bier, diepe dropachtig smaak. Goede afdronk. Komt heel dicht bij een Rochefort 10.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 Pours deep brown with a slight sheet of foam on top. Deep & rich flavours upfront: dark plums, candied fruit, rich yeast. A spice & pepper presence throughout. The booze isnt as stealthy as expected. Gets more interesting as it settles in glass, & starts to sparkle in the spaces between the sips.
Bottle 0.75. Fruity aroma and a taste to match. A dark amber color, with a tan, finger thick head.

Ar: Brown sugar, rasin, peach, molasses - some caramel and apple.
Ap: Reddish-brown - medium beige head with good retention - leaves a ring of foam with a thin cap.
T: Clean alcohol and raisin - peach and brown sugar - toffee and treacle - orange rind and rum - medium-low bitterness, quite clean - a small touch of sherry oxidation.
P: Medium body with high carbonation - finish is dry.
O: Complex dark Belgian ale - mixture of dark sugars and ripe fruits - solid.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe website (£3.19):
Rich and complex with good balance between a whole host of dark fruits, sugar, sweet malts and spices plus some grapes, figs, yeast and even some banana. Some light alcohol rounds things off.

Murky to caramel brown with a thumb sized, bubbly head that holds well. Lots of visible carbonation too.

Very sweet and filled with sugar upfront, the beer is loaded with sweet fruits that includes some banana and figs along with a touch of apple and grape. There is some Belgian yeast in there too and a touch more alcohol than the nose had suggested but it is still lighter than you would expect going in. The beer is rounded off with some further fruit flavours and an intensely sweet taste.

Smooth and crisp on the tongue with medium body and a well carbonated feel to it. There is a huge amount of sweetness from start to finish with only faint hints of alcohol in places. Great balance & it goes down well.

Very sweet and highly drinkable with a great combination of fruits all balancing with each other very well indeed and combining to give a solid, highly drinkable beer.
A good, fruity aroma and a taste to match. A dark amber pour with a tan, finger thick head. This is my first Quad beer, but I think it will be very hard to beat.
This is the best beer I've ever had. I always have one or two in the fridge and so should you!
voor de mensen die geen fortuin willen spenderen aan westvleteren XII is dit een zeer goede keuze.

New-ish bottle drank next to a Westy 12 ~1 year old. Pours with a slightly lighter brown with a big soft head and lace. Its still got a lovely hue and coloring. Aroma is light bitter orange peel, sarsaparilla, pepper, fresh dark bread & yeast, underlying sweetness. The flavor is sweet, earthy bitter, orange light cola, dark fruits, lightly astringent, long linger. The alcohol is not as hot. Very lively. Soft and velvety. Its very similar but much simpler and not as deep as the Westy 12. But it is still a beautiful beer

pours a brown color with some ruby in it. the head is medium sized with a good amount of lacing. the aroma is a dark fruit (plum) and you pick up some alcohol in it as well. the taste is the dark fruit, alcohol, and some sweetness. this beer is heavy with malts and light on hops. personally, this is a good beer worth a try but not as good as expected.

Pours a hazy honey brown with sediment you can see. It has a crimson bush deep int he beer and while its hazed it lets light shine through. Off, off white, almost tan head of foam that looks like it will last but doesnt. Leaves sheets of soapy lace to look at as they fall back into the glass.

Nose has a bit of alcohol on it. I bring it up first because its a bit sharp . medicinal. Nose is clove, ripe fruit. Plum and fig. fresh and alive. Waves of sweetness from malt and a light brown sugar. Cake like malt. Buttery, juicy earthy too. The yeast is powdery and dry and promises some lightness. Nothing burnt, nothing roasted just as it should be. Its comforting.

Taste is complex and rich. It unfolds and becomes so many things. It starts with fresh plum and fig, then becomes dried prune and raisin. then there is a touch of tart cherry. The yeast stays soft and dry and keeps things light and uplifted. The carbonation is effervescent and while thats true this beer is creamy. CREAMY. The fruits are sweet and resilent and the alcohol has a touch of dryness, a touch of spice and a bit of pepper and bitter to impart to the finish. 

The finish is sweet and warming and by the time you finish this glass the alcohol is sweet not sharp. It has won you over with flavors that surrounded it. The fruit danced on the palate, the malt richness was cake like and light. The spice intriguing. I will have another even though I said I wouldnt at first.
UPDATED: DEC 2, 2016 Clear brown, airy, thick light beige head. Aroma has dried fruit, malt, ripe fruit and whiffs of alcohol. Sweet flavour, caramel, dried fruit, vinous notes and warming alcohol.
Actually identical with the WestVleteren XII. One of my favorite beers!

Bottle.
Very pretty dark red colour, light tan head that keeps on truckin. Strong fruity aroma (raisins, apples), tastes of dark druit and caramel. Sweet with a somewhat bitter finish.

Excellent beer, and I must say Westvleteren XII doesnt live up to this one.

12oz bottle poured into tulip. Appearance is cloudy brown with a tall resilient white head that leaves beautiful lacing all over the glass. Aroma is malty bread, dark fruits, clove and other spices. Taste is all about malty sweetness with the fruit esters and bready yeast leading the way. The spicy notes kick in right behind. A warming alcohol finish rounds out the flavor profile. Full bodied, creamy, thick texture, fizzy Belgian-true carbonation, sweet/boozy finish.
UPDATED: APR 15, 2014 Small/medium white head... red colour red glow... smell yeast little roasted... taste malts..
Bottle 75 CL. Pours hazy murky brown dirty fluffy smooth tan head. Notes of caramel, Belgium yeast, bready malts, syrup, candy. Very smooth. Goes down extremely easy.
Shared by benzai en abijen. Copper color with a offwhite head. Smells and tastes fruity, sweet, caramel, malts.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2014 Deep brown color with white head, caramel malt aroma, taste with fine coffee, chocolate and caramel notes, no fizzy and full body... Not my favorite St Bernardus, but good product
Good beer, but not outstanding, malty and sweet, low hops makes you feel warm...slightly fruity

750 ml shared with family. Pours deep brown with a frotty white head. Nose of caramel and dark malt, slight spice aroma (cloves and cardemom). Balance is totally wrong: too sweet and too much alcohol heat compared to the body of the beer. Taste is sweet malt. Burn in the finish. Overrated to say at least.
Copper with slightly off white head. An aroma of dark fruits is matched by a sweet, plumy, boozy brew that has moderate carbonation. A great easy to find beer.
auburn brown color with a thin off-white head that lingers. aromas of fruit and spice. flavor is fruit, spice, hints of cocoa and booze. soft carbonation.

bouteille de 750 ml de brune avec beau col riche et crémeux. arome léger de caramel de pain et de noix. au gout on trouve des notes de mêlasse, dépices / clou de girofle. amertume assez puissante et on retrouve lalcool puissante mais bien équilibré. ne tappe pas sur le coeur! fait changement! pas trop sucrée

Pours brown/red with a thin but solid off white head. Nose is a little lacking a hint of spices but not a great deal else going on. Malty sweetness, chocolate, some fruit prunes and some spices, cinnamon and some cardamom.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a rich deep maroon, with a huge off white head. Aroma is packed with notes of plum, fig, apricot, berries, coriander, yeast, floral, apple, pear, smoked meat, woody. The tasting notes include fig, and other deep fruit notes, liquorice, herbal, tannin, spicy middle, and a slightly bitter finish. 
This is fabulous, as I have come to expect from Trappist brews!!

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Cudowny aromat kremowo - waniliowo - bananowy. W smaku kremowość kontrastowana słodyczą, ale i lekką kwaskowością czerwonych owoców takich jak wiśnie i porzeczki. Alkohol? Jaki alkohol? No dobra, w przełyku delikatnie rozgrzewający jest. I ta pijalność! Ta kompleksowość! Jedno z lepszych piwnych doświadczeń w życiu.

330ml bottle. Dark amber/brown beer with a medium off-white head. The aroma is composed of fruits (plums, raisins, banana), spices, sweet malt, yeast and alcohol. Heavy sweetness in the flavour. Quite a bitter finish. This beer is full-bodied with a creamy texture and soft carbonation. This is a nice and balanced belgian ale.
Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard. Dark brown colour with a light brown head. Yeast, dark fruits, chocolate, caramel notes, plums. Very nice mouthfeel. Thisk and warm palate. Very delicious beer.
A true compliment to the style, St Bernardus never disappoints, stay true to that monkein way!
Caoba nítido con espuma beige. Aromas de frutas concitadas y frutos secos. En boca, es densa y muestra un dulzor inicial muy afrutado con un final ligeramente ácido y muy afrutado. Xcelent

Thick light beige head with sweet toast aroma. Body is thick and warm. very good balance between malt, cinnamon spices and bitterness. A very good Trappist alternative to match cheeses.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very similar to the normal Abt 12 of St Bernardus, but with a less strong aftertaste.Earlier Rating: 10/11/2013 Total Score: 3.9the virtue of this quadruple is to be strong without tasting like liquor. Sweety, thick, caramel-like with hints of lemon.

For cap collectors: a blue and grey cap with the imprint of "St Bernardus.Abt" and "12" in the centre.

Pours a large Brown head. Malty aroma, dark fruits, plum, raisin, chocolate, yeast. Very complex. Taste is more yeasty, more plum and other dark overripe fruits. Also bread, overripe banana, pear and much more. It goes down very smooth and has a oily, sticky body. Very, very good beer.

Enfin, jai réussi à mettre le grappin sur ce grand classique belge! Brune, un peu rougeâtre, elle nous émoustille dès le départ avec son beau collet beige qui nous accompagne tout au long de lexpérience gustative. Un bouquet complexe de levure, de noisettes, de sucre et de malt rehaussent lexcitation dun cran. La complexité se répète en bouche avec ses saveurs de caramel écossais, de fruits confits, de céréales et dalcool, confirmant ainsi que lon a affaire à une grande bière. Une fine pointe damertume vient donner un petit "kick" en finale. Magnifique!

Pours dark brown with a big head that quickly dissipates to frothy lacing. Aromas of chocolate, bread and spiced fruit. Flavors of dried fruit, biscuit, and fig. Finishes with chocolate raisin and an alcohol warmth. Clean, peppery mouthfeel. This is really a very delicious beer with a multitude of flavors.

Black with red tint, lacy head. Liquorice, raisins, yeast, fruits. Medium sweetness. Alcohol comes through strongly. Very strong and complex, Belgian beer at its finest. Though probably my one year old 75cl bottle was still to too young to reach its full potential.

375ml, Bb 5/7/14

A: Pours an orange brown ale with excellent clarity. a single finger off-white billowed creamy head halves into a quilt of the same. Loose and broken sheeted lacing.

S: Dark fruits up front. plums, figs, graham, toasted cinnamon, some hints of vanilla and herbed maple deep in there.

T: Raisin, fruits, good complex malts. Maybe slightly oxidized it seems with a hint of carbboard in there. However,alcohol is well hidden, and the beer offers up more than I can articulate. Very nice.

M: Full bodied and silky with lower carb. Very good mouthfeel. 

D: This beer is outstanding. I was surprised by the quality provided the volumes they kick out. Very good beer.

Serving type: bottle

03-18-2011
Red brown pour with small beige head with some lacing. Dark fruits and some alcohol. General maltyness. Very fresh fruityness and sparkly mouthfeel.
On tap at Biercab. Brown colour with off-white head. Malt, dark fruit, caramel aroma. Sweet, malt, dark fruit taste (figs, raisins), some caramel. Full body.

Ive read a lot of other reviews comparing this beer to the Westy 12 and Rochefort 10 (Ive had both recently) and was curious to see how this brew stacked up. I was a little disappointed. The nose nor flavour matches either of those beers in my opinion. The colour was a deep amber/brown and and the head poured a cream colour. The head disappeared in quick order. The taste lacked the dark fruits and bready flavour other beers in the style display. Decent but disappointing.
