Looks great feels great, tastes even better. Taste is like dark chocolate with red berries. Beautiful warm aftertaste, with just enough alcohol to make you feel real good and comfortable. Must be in a nice, warm, not too noisy place to really enjoy this brilliant beer.

Aroma: Malty, yeasty, dried dark fruit, caramel Appearance: Dark brown, red glow, dark little yeast flocks, off white head, mix of fine foam and big bubble frothy staying head, medium to high carbonation, full lace Taste: Dark fruits, caramel, light sweet, hint of malts, nice long dark fruit aftertaste, think aging will make this even better
Reddish brown color. Aroma of raisins. Tastes malty and crisp with currant and dark fruit. Drinking of draft..seems more dry and balanced than typical quads.

0,33L bottle, BB 02.07.2018. Pours very dark red, almost black with huge very light tan head. The head stays for a long time. Aroma is intense: very fruity, a lot of raisins, apples, plum, mild caramel, hints of phenols. Taste is caramel, dark fruits, alcohol, and sweetness. Finish is bitter. Medium carbonation. Overall: it smells and looks really great, but isnt as well balanced as for example Rochefort Trappistes 10; taste isnt as interesting also. Dont get me wrong it is still a great beer, but not as great as I hoped.
Aroma is pleasant...spices with floral...appearance seems heavy with a wonderful frothy head...warming alcohol bite with a carbonated finish. Decent!

33cl bottle at home. Clear dark brown with a medium off-white head. Complex body with moderate carbonation. Sweet with bitter herbal notes. Caramel, brown sugar and vanilla. A great full flavoured Belgian experience.
so gooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo Very nice beer.

Pours dark mahogany with an off-white head. Aromas of bread, spice, orange peel, dried plum, and a slight hint of tartness. Taste of bread, yeast, dark dried fruits, a bit of cola, and spice. Sweet, dark, fruity, and delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Niet echt sterke geur. M Heep donker troebel. rood. Heep zoet. Lekker. Van de tap. U. Grote schuimbellen, wel snel weg. G. Zwaar zoet, zuurtje. S. Zoet. Te? Kruidig! M. Teveel koolzuur. T. Hm.. Te veel op ondertussen.

Weer herzien naar 3.0 na blind proeven. Wel goed dat het quadrupel was.

Very full rich flavor ,high alc. 
  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flasche (75 cl). - Kastanienbraun. Schwer, voll und süß. Datteln, Pflaumen, Feigen auf solider Röstmalzgrundlage; leichte Säure bei insgesamt zurückhaltender Süße. Abgang etwas röstmalzbitter, kurzer fruchtig-herber Hopfeneinsatz. Die flambierte Banane und Sachertorte, die andere hier finden, sind zum Glück nur angedeutet. - Außerordentlich harmonisches, ja vornehmes Starkbier.
A wonderful Belgian Dark Strong Ale or Quadruple. Spices, like pepper and clove. Caramel and toffee. Dried fruits fig and raisin.

750ml bottle @ #HPJ-13. Pours a dark brown with a decent, off-white head. Aroma is pear, apricot, plum and prune. Yeast and caramel are present. Taste is semi-sweet with dark fruits. Prunes and dates. Pear, marzipan and yeast are present too. Complex. Medium with quite a lot of carbonation. Very nice.
On tap. Burgundy color with a big creamy head. Brown sugar, dark stone fruit, vanilla, and Belgian yeast. Smooth and complex.
Poured a hazy dark brown with a lot of sediment and a huge tan head with great lacing. Aroma was sweet and malty with caramel and brown sugar. Taste was sweet and bready with dark fruit and caramel.
Bottle. Dark amber color with a foamy beige head. A lot of yeast flakes. Aroma of caramel, syrup and dried fruits. Sour, sweet and bitter taste. Warming alcohol in finish.-- via beerbasher/winphone

[ASPETTO] 			
Marrone scuro, color castagna, leggermente velata; schiuma abbondante, color crema, media finezza e persitenza			
[OLFATTO]			
caramello, biscotto speziato, vaniglia , frutta molto matura con evidenti note alcoliche, 			
[GUSTO]			
note dolci controbilanciate da subito da una certa asprezza amarognola, complice lelevata alcolicità che non si nasconde e una carbonazione notabile. Mantiene una sensazione di frutta matura e sottospirito. Finale speziato e piuttosto amaro.			
[TEXTURE]			
copro medio, piuttosto carbonata, sensazione alcolica evidente			
[COMMENTO FINALE]			
abt curata e nonostante i 10 e passa gradi mantiene un certo equilibrio di base. Tuttavia nel complesso rimane piuttosto ruvida, con una alcolicità che infonde note amarognole piuttosto invandenti nel finale. Per il resto una ampio spettro speziato, una fruttale che mantiene un tocco acidulo.

Pours a murky brown colour with a large rocky off white head. Head dies down to a half cm cream with tight bubbles. Smell is awesome and complex. Raisins, banana, nuts, Xmas type spices, brown sugar & caramel, stewed fruits, sticky dates and some plum. Mouthfeel is superb, soft carbonation. All the dark fruit flavours come through in the mouth with plenty of toffee, almond, vanilla and a touch of hop bitterness to balance it out a little. Superb beer. The Xmas tree beside me might be emphasising it a little perhaps? How does this compare to me rating of the Westy 12 I wonder?

UPDATED: JAN 2, 2014 [Bottle / 2012 / Fresh] Brown, murky, swampy, & copper like a quad should be with a thick, dense, frothy, beige layer of latte-looking foam. Aroma is lovely & highly complex with notes of grapes, figs, dates, candied plums, spicy Belgian yeast, brown sugar, molasses, light licorice, bready malts, pecans, mild herbal hints, earthy & fruity esters, faint booziness... So much to take in at once. Taste is just as complex, coming through with lots of candied dark fruits, toffee, molasses, licorice, yeast, faint coriander & clove spice, baked bread, & even some finishing white grape & apple notes. Light discernible hoppiness, aftertaste of toffee, booze, buttered bread, & sweet Belgian yeast. Extremely close to Westy XII in terms of aroma & flavor, plus its much cheaper & easier to obtain. One of the best quads out there.
[Bottle / 2007 / 6 Years Old]  Thanks, Jeff! Very much loaded with aromas & flavors of grapes, raisins, & red wine... It has grown more vinous with time. Big, sweet raisin bread flavors with some molasses, toffee, baked dough, & healthy Belgian spices. Nice & creamy mouth feel. Nearly no sign of (harmful) oxidation, perhaps a touch of sherry? This has held up very well for six years. Still not a lover of quads, but I love this beer.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013  a) Test von 2007: 
Der Schaum ist feinporig und leicht bräunlich, der Geruch erinnert etwas an braune Lebkuchen. 
Das Bier schmeckt sehr voll und etwas "dickflüssig", dabei sehr angenehm süßlich-malzig. Auch der hohe Alkoholgehalt bleibt dem Geschmack nicht verborgen. Außerdem ist das Ganze auch sehr schön süffig. 

Test vom 9.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,13,13,13,12,13 - 12,85  
  b) Neutest 2011 - Bier MHD 09.2015 
Dunkelbraune Farbe im Glas mit beigem Schaum. 
Malzig-milder Geruch. 
Im Antrunk ist das Bier toll vollmundig-malzig, durch die ins Glas gelangte Hefe mild-weich. Zum Hauptteil hin werden die Malzaromen deutlicher, weiche Milchschokolade, Schokopudding, weiches Karamell. Einfach toll. 
Die alkoholisch-wärmende Note ist omnipräsent, die alkoholische Schärfe taucht nur ganz kurz im Übergang vom Hauptteil zum Nachgeschmack auf und verschwindet schnell wieder. 
Der Nachgeschmack ist lang, vollmundig-weich, milchschokoladig-faszinierend. Kaum herb. 
--> ein richtig tolles Bier im Trappistenstile. Uneingeschränkt empfehlenswert!


Test vom 19.1.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,14,12,14,12,13 - 13,00

Bottle at home. Dark brown with a foamy head. Sweet, caramel, fruity malts. Sweet taste, malts, fruity, slightly bitter aftertaste. Very nice beer.

Pours a dark brown beer with a nice head. Aroma is fruity (cherry) and sugary. Taste is fruity, chocolate and a touch of coffee .A very gentle bitter taste at the end, almost unnoticable. The alcohol gives a warm and pleasing sensation. Very smooth and tasteful!
Dark brown, foam top disappears quickly. Heavy but fruity, sweet, but not sticky. Raisins, vanilla, a hint of coffee too. Perfect long finish. One of the best

Notes from 2011 -- Pours a dark brown that is very thick. Has an off-white foamy, two-finger head. Small malt aroma with yeast smell. Tastes very carmelly, not sugary sweet, extremely enjoyable. Aftertaste has a slight hint of toffee very little to no bitterness. Overall a great beer that I love to drink.

Bottle dark body with nice tan head. Aroma is what should i say typical belgium aroma of malt fruits and some bretts or sourness and hints of alcohol taste is balanced between malts sweetnes also bretts aftertaste is malts bitterness great complex balanced Belgium beer.

Dark & opaque amber appearance with a thin light tan head. Typical sweet aroma & taste with sugar and caramelized banana. A little more heat on this than the rochefort 10 and the alcohol isnt hidden as well but the character of the malts stay interesting throughout the drink. Excellent beer thats sweet but doesnt rely on the sugar for all of the character. A+
Nice aromas of bananas and raisins; very good balans in taste between sweet and (malt-)bitter. Strong alcohol flavor. After taste is very long. A nicely complex beer.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2016 Awesome beer. Great taste, perfect amount of carbonation, soft but fizzly. Tastes rich. Chocolate, caramel, vanilla, though the tastes are a bit mild.

Edit: rated a bit lower after the supermarket-beer-tasting with Rik 13/8/16. Very dominant alcohol in the taste, and a bit of "cheap sweetness".

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2014 Grandissima Birra, poco altro da aggiungere. Color ebano, quasi color noce, non del tutto impenetrabile ma molto scura. Bellissimo il bouquet di profumi, con il caramello ed il lievito che si avvertono prima che gli altri, ma con sentori anche di pane, spezie, uva passa. In bocca, Frutta secca, frucca sotto spirito, lievissimi ritorni di liquirizia e caramello, assenza di carbonatazione, e soprattutto castagne. Oh, che birra paradisiaca.

Ribevuta,un po più fresca e forse per questo meno pronta. Molto carbonata,un dolcione von cioccolata e poca frutta. Finale poco amaro,corpo quasi scarso , anche al mouthfeel non incanta.

Very interesting and complex taste that just doesnt get boring. High on alcohol, warm aftertaste but the actual alcohol taste is well hidden by all other flavors that are going on. Nice bouquet of fruits, caramel, chocolate.

Aroma: sweet fruity aroma

Taste: very strong fruity taste with notes of belgium sugar and greatly balanced hops. Very smooth given the ABV

Appearance: dark amber body with nice lace white head

Aroma: Indeed very fruity with notes of cherry as long as molasses and caramel. We can also find a bit of sugar cane and also red licorice. Alcohol is also present. A sugary and fruity nose, very complex but with a little lack of strength.
Appearance: Brown with a lot of yeast particles. Big particles. A thick, foamy and long lasting head. Little lacing.
Taste: An intense warm full sensation invades the mouth to start with, followed by a fruit salad; cherry, raisins, figs, as well as caramel, spices (cinnamon, clove). Yeast is developing a slight acidity that comes lifting up this fruit and spices cake. Excellent balance between sugar spices and acidity. Mouth feel is full, round, unctuous, warm and creamy. A very elaborate taste profile. In the purest tradition of great Belgian beers. A pleasure to drink.

pas une vraie trappiste, mais elle en a le style. Le nez est très fermé, encore plus que celui de la Westvleteren. La bouche est moins fruitée, plus sur des notes de réglisse, de caramel torréfié. Lalcool est bien intégré. Bonne finale, un peu plus épicée que les autres mais qui manque beaucoup de fruits cuits. Bien en-dessous de la Rochefort 10 (ce jour-là en tout cas).
From bottle. Dark brown with quite a bit of foamy head. Terrific balance of sweetness, booziness and bitterness. Very nice Quad.

So smooth... such taste... wow! Bernie gets me high like no other beer can- it literally tastes like happiness. 

caramel-y, warm & creamy, frothy, christmas

Poured from 750mL to glass. Reddish hue with a creamy tan head. Heavy yeast chunks in suspension. Aroma is bready, estery, with a slight banana essence and fruity caramel. Taste is initially estery sweet from the fermentation followed by a CO2 sharpness from the strong carbonation. Medium-full bodied and slightly chewy consistency. Overall, this is a nice Belgian quad.

Gets even better as it warms up. More and more flavors are coming through.

330ml bottle from Appellation Wines, Dalry. Pours hazy dark brown, with quite a lot of loose sediment coming out, frothy off-white head. Aromas of dark sugar and prunes. Sweet but clean taste, good balancing bitterness. not noticing the high alcohol. Medium body, creamy texture, long finish. One to savour.

The beer pours great with a nice deep brown, mahogany color to it that passes almost no light, a nice two finger brown head, and some lacing on the glass. The beer smells great with a nice blend of raisins, red plum, and a hint of brown sugar. The taste is outstanding with a solid flavor of raisins and dark fruit with a somewhat boozy finish but blends well together. The mouthfeel is outstanding as the beer is perfectly carbonated and somewhat sweet and dry. Overall, an outstanding quad...

Dark, chocolate soda appearance with a creamy thick white head. Overwhelming nose of raisins/prunes and perhaps candy sugar. Full and sweet. Alcohol is definitely noticeable but never obnoxious or unwanted. Warming. Finish is vanilla and very much intertwined into the alcohol presence. A pretty enjoyable quad, for sure. Goes great with flavorful cheeses, like the excellent Bellavitano Raspberry.

Had on-tap at One-Eyed Bettys in Ferndale, Michigan as part of a paddle.

Appearance: Basically perfect. The 10% ABV seems impossible given the nice little head this beer showed off, and the wall of lace that this left through my whole sample glass. Wow. Abt 12 has a deep brown/red color, and doesnt seem to have much (any?) haze. Marvelous to look at.

Smell: Ive never had a quadrupel... thats my disclaimer here. I didnt know what to expect going in, other than that this is one of the very best beers in the world, according to a lot of people. I got a lot of doughy bread and dark fruits. The cracker aromas sort of came through in the initial whiff, and the fruits were in the "after smell". Very good smelling stuff.

Taste: 10%? Really? Initially I didnt think I really loved this beer all that much, but then I noticed that I was sipping it more often than the other beers I had in my sampler. Theres just a lot going on with this beer. The cracker/dough flavors are there in a pretty big way, then the non-descript "dark fruits" come in a little bit, and then theres just an alcohol warmth and its all gone. All the while, Abt 12 is never bitter and never really sweet (and therefore cloying) at all.

I got this beer for a few reasons. First, Ive heard insanely good things about it. Second, I had never tasted a quad (to my knowledge) before. Third, and most college-boy esque of me, it had a pretty high ABV and I didnt think it would hurt to get a little buzz going on. Turns out, this mayve been my favorite beer from the night. I dont tend to drink imported beer (local jobs, yadayadayada), but this is impressive. Its not cheap, by any means, but this is something worth treating yourself to, time-to-time. This really makes me want to try beers like Rochefort and Westvleteren now... my interest has officially been piqued.

Yeah...this could be a benchmark for Belgian strong dark - quad beers. Absolutely lovely fresh or aged up to 7 or more years. Beautifully balanced malt body of rich dark fruit, raisins, toffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate all blended together where none stands out overwhelmingly. Big alcohol but not hot. Great with soups. meat or rich vegie dishes, deserts. Ive had this in Belgium, in various states, on tap, in small, big, and very big bottles. This is a great beer to serve fresh or after years of aging. I should add that I did in 2007 represent St Bernardus in California which means I drank a lot of their whole line-up. Theres a few beers I might want to rate higher, but this is definitely in the running for a desert island beer. Exceptional!
Pours a pretty dark ebony brown with foamy top. Tingling palate, and deep aroma of berries, caramel, honey. Good flavour overly fruity for my tastes.
Zware afsluiter. Donkerkleurig. Tikkie bitter en heel klein beetje koffie. Ook vrij zoet.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Rated blind against the westvletern 12 at cambrinus restaurant in Bruges... Sweet almost fruity aroma, a little more tannish head on the Westvletern, almost prune like aroma, definitely can appreciate a little more candi sugar and maple syrup on the westvletern... St bernardus is a little more subtle in its nose, not as aromatic, yet still slightly sweet... Both colors are nearly identical, deep brown caramel... Alcohol content is more apparent in the Westvletern, not outrageously sweet as I expected, but pleasant, not overpowering... Leaves a nice slightly yeasty finish on the palate, very nice and well balanced... St Bernardus is slightly sweeter which conceals the ABV better and slightly less bitter and yeasty on finish, however the Westvletern may be more complex... Both amazing beers

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well balanced with a solid finish at first which fades rather quickly into a lingering medium lasting one. Nice beer! Really nice!

Appearance: Hazy ruby/brown with a billowing 3 finger thick off white head.
Aroma: Pepper, prune, dried fig, woody, slightly earthy, vinous, hint of banana, marzipan and bread.
Taste: Medium sweetness, bitterness and sourness, vanilla, marzipan, dried fruit and vinous. It is verging on spiritous and is akin to brandy.
Palate: Smooth texture and medium body, prickly carbonation, the finish is a lingering fruity sourness with a slight alcohol warmth. The finish becomes increasingly astringent over time.
Comments: Very refreshing and lively when uncapped. Left a glass lace.

Murky, dark brown color with big and long lasting head. Incredibly strong aroma of dried fruits (plums, cherries), sugar and spices. Taste is also (or even maybe better) fantastic! Bunch of dark fruits, some wood, spices and pinch of hop. All of ingredients are perfectly balanced. Alcohol is well hidden gives some warming. Very long finish  sweet and dry. One of the best beer Ive drank.

Bold and yet subtle. Finely crafted. Comforting aromas of malt, bread, caramel, yeast and alcohol. However, the alcohol was very well hidden. Deep brown color with minimal head. Soft and smooth with a weighty palate. The flavors were blended very well. Along with the flavors to match the aromas there was also some spice. Good drinking.

Revisiting an old favourite! AU$9, worth every cent. 

Pours a two finger head, relatively clean white and hangs around for a while. That dark, murky quad look - unappealing to the uninitiated, but perfect for the quad drinkers!

Smell of dark fruit - fig, plum, cherry - as well as brown sugar, bread. 

We've got the beautiful quad brown sugar, bread, a touch of spice. Less fruit than was on the nose. Very well balanced however. Alcohol is there, but not as boozy as Rochefort and lacks the heavy fruit notes of Rochefort and Westvleteren.

Where this beer beats the other quads is on its unparalleled, warm mouthfeel, very full and it sits on your tongue for an eternity, slowly making its way backwards bringing smooth flavour until you get a small hop sharpness at the back. Beautifully warming, as good as mouthfeel gets! 

I love Abt 12, Ro 10 and Westy 12 all in their own ways. This is the 'weakest' if you can say that, but it truly grows on me every single time I try it. It really isn't the same as the West 12 - despite the fact they seem similar on paper due to their history - but to simply look at it in those terms ignores what it truly is. I would thoroughly recommend the Christmas ale and Wit to any St Bernardus fans too.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cl. flaske købt i ølkonsortiet i Aalborg. 10 %. Virkelig en spændende øl i verdensklasse

Pours nicely from the bottle with a generous and gassy head that lasts for a short while. Slight carbonation remains in the beer as you drink it, which smoothes the feel nicely. Tastes earthy/oaky and gently warming from the high abv. A finely crafted beer ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ fairbar, 15 / 8 2013. Dark clear brown, small off white head, not a lot of lacing. Aroma, malty, toffee, bread, banana, red fruits/wine like, .Taste, malty, toffee, red fruits, bread, slight alcohol, banana, . Ends with a red wine like dry aftertaste. Very good quadruple.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2014 Bomber into Trappist glass. Clear deep ruby-brown color with creamy tan head. Aroma of dark fruit, candy sugar, caramel, Belgian yeast, alcohol, some white wine and light spices. Taste is fruity (cherry, plums, raisons), licorice, sweet caramel malt, slight sour note in the sweetness, some chocolate, slight vanilla, earthy spices ending with very minimal hop note. Medium body, moderate carbonation, complex, smooth, sweet, fruity with sweet malty finish. Awesome balance of quad elements, scary drinkable too for the ABV.

Har precis krupit ner i sängen med nyborstade tänder när Johan knäpper en flaska. Bara att stålsätta sig och fram med anteckningsblocket. Känns spontant som en blend av rochfort 10 och westy 12. Ja varför inte testa det på nån provning framöver? Lite syrligare möjligen men svårt att lita på smaklökarna med nyborstade tänder.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2013 330ml bottle sipped in France. Pours mahogany brown with quickly receding head. Has a slight sourness that propels the yeast and fruit way beyond the Prior 8 or Tripel. Excellent, captivating complexity that evolves the more it breathes in the glass. For me this is definitely on a par with Westvleterens efforts and a firm favourite during my time in the French Flanders region.

Yep, can see the attraction. Dark ivory tinted amber pour. The monk dude on the from looks a happy chap. You know why? Hes just heard Check Your Head for the first time and he knows it, absolutely knows it, that ABL are heading up there too. The big man said so. He lives in the village. In a big house with a big dog called Frank. Oh yeah, it aint over...big beast of a beer, you dig?

Small bottle from HOTB. Pours a dark reddish brown with a big off-white head that dissipates into a foam with some lacing. Aroma of alcohol and dark fruits. Some taste of cherries and figs. Smooth complex flavor masks the high alcohol content. Great carbonation. Silky smooth. I now see how it is rated so well by so many. Not a polarizing beer. Just a good beer.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur marron-cola, mousse moyenne de tenue assez faible. Arômes de caramel, de fruits trop mûrs, une touche de réglisse, une pointe dalcool. Beaucoup de corps, texture très agréable, très vivante et soyeuse. Un tout petit peu en dessous de la Rochefort 10. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.
Darkbrown pour with an offwhite head. Taste is malty, dark fruit, caramel, liquorice and black pepper. Nice one.

On tap at The Beer Market in Vernon Hills. Pours a reddish amber copper with an off white head no real lace. Aroma has sweet overripe fruits, thick Belgian yeast. Taste is of sweet fruits, rum raisin, caramel, and nuts, with a lot of body. And alcohol. Medium bodied. Super complex. Finish is sweet and deep. A very good brew! More complex than easy to identify.

Bottle from MatchCopal, Grevenmacher, Luxembourg!

Pours murky brown with small creamy head. Smells caramelly, dark fruity and yeasty. Starts with deliciously sweet caramel malts, lots of belgian yeast and dark fruits. Fizzy carbonation. Middle part has lots of plum, raisin, belgian yeast and sweet caramel. Goes into a yeasty and caramelly finish with lots of dark fruits and a slight touch of alcohol.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 As was said by an old Swedish living 33 years in Belgium: This stuff is a Mercedes among beers. Right! Rich palate with nuts and coffee, full body, hazy dark colour, impressive look. Great looking beer, clear brown with a littel short lasting beige head. Nose is licorice, caramel, yeast/fruity, coriander and alcohol.Taste is yeast, fruity licorice with a rounded alcoholic finish. Palate gets a bit foamy.Great beer.

De Sint Bernardus Abt 12 is ook één van de bieren die al langer tot mijn absolute favorieten behoort. Er nu pas een beoordeling over schrijven is zoiets als het warm water terug moeten uitvinden. Het verhaal doet de ronde dat dit bier gebaseerd is op de Westvleteren 12. In de periode dat de brouwzaal van Westvleteren aan vernieuwing toe was, werd de productie enige tijd overgenomen door de naburige brouwerij van Sint Bernardus. Tijdens deze periode zou de toenmalige brouwmeester dit bier hebben ontwikkeld met de Westvleteren 12 in het achterhoofd. Aangezien ik ooit nog maar eenmaal het genoegen had en Westvleteren 12 te drinken, en ook er mij weinig van kan herinneren aangezien dit in een pre-ratebeer.com tijdperk was, kan ik dus geen objectieve vergelijking maken. Door neemt niet weg dat Sint Bernardus abt 12 een graag geziene gast in mijn koelkast is. Het aroma van de 12 is zacht zoet met en vleugje gebrande Candij. Het bier is donker met een licht amberkleurige toets. De schuimkraag is vol, mokka-kleurig en gewelfd, vermoedelijk door de hogere gisting. De smaak ligt in het verlengde van het aroma, doch laat zich meer geworden. Een bier met een zachte candijsmaak, een vleugje karamel en een lichte fruitige toets die het midden houdt tussen pruimen en donkere, rode vruchten. Wat ik zeker kan appreciëren in dit bier is dat zowel in het aroma, maar ook in de smaak de uitgesproken banaansmaak achterwege blijft, dit terwijl de 12 toch een bier van hoge gisting is.
Het mondgevoel is wat mij betreft perfect in balans, met een goed evenwicht tussen enerzijds sprankelend verfrissend, doch voldoende stevig om lang van elke slok te kunnen genieten. Wat mij betreft is de Sint Bernardus abt 12 dus een echte aanrader, ééntje dat ik maar al te graag in huis heb, zowel ?s winters als in de zomer, maar waarvan ik even goed weet dat hij niet elke bierliefhebber, zoals sommigen in mijn omgeving, kan behoren. En heel toegankelijk donker bier van hoge gisting en met en behoorlijk hoog alcohol percentage.

Top shelf Belgian ale. For whatever reason, I get an intriguing aroma of white wine that I havent quite detected on other abbey or Trappist ales. From the first sip it made my lips start to title slightly. The alcohol is moderately detectable. Delicious.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Head: light beige, small, frothy, poor retention. Colour: dark ruby-red/brown, slightly hazy. 

Aroma: spicy phenolic alcoholic, dried sweet-and-sour fruit, slightly toasty. 

Taste: dried fruit, sweet sticky caramel, warming alcohol, light bitterness (more like from alcohol than hops). Bod on the thinner side. 

Somewhat disappointing pretty generic dark Belgian ale. Alcohol, albeit not dominating, will not let you forget about beers abv.

Had on tap at Todd English p.u.b. in Vegas 

Deep brown/reddish color.

Fairly weak aroma.. 

Rich and complex flavor.

Can't go wrong with it

---Rated via Beer Buddy
A very nice strong aroma as soon as you open the bottle. A rich chocolatey/ivory color. Very smooth taste and incredibly refreshing. Likely the best beer I have ever had.

Bottle from mane liquor. Holy fuck! Pours a murky purple brown with a nice frothy off white head. Superb lacing left around the glass. Aromas showcase plums, cherries, mulberries, booze, licorice & grassy earthy hops. The nose is insane! Taste is massive on the dark fruits heaps of plums, candied sugar, booze and yeast. Earthy spices becoming apparent as well. The palate is left with this clinging bitterness. Cherries cling to the palate. Fuck this is good. Can't believe it took so try this baby!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draft at the Map Room, in a tulip, beautiful chocolate brown with plentiful white head that dissipates to full lacing. Smells fantastic, lots of earthy and fruit tones, delicious, one of the best beers I have had...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet Jesus this is a winner. Amazing dark fruit notes, plums and cherries. Some earthy woodiness, very delicious palate. Extremely impressive, world class beer.

25.4 fl oz / 750ml corked and caged bottle into a trappist glass. Served cool.

Aroma: Yeasty. Some sweetness comes through. A little fruit and spice.

Appearance: Translucent dark red/brown body with a thick but dissipating khaki head.

Taste: Quite fruity and spicy! Really big flavor. Alcohol is present but not overpowering. Really quite nice.

Palate: Long, kind of boozy, sweetish bread-y finish. Full body.

Overall: Quite nice! I feel like I preferred Rochefort 10, but they are both really, really good beers.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2014 Bottle from Systembolaget. Did a blind tasting together with Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren 12, unfortunately this one stood out as the least impressive (Yes, W12 won...). On its own its better but I think it is a bit too sharp and sprawling. Pours hazy dark amber/brown with an off-white head. Aroma has figs, candi sugar, spicy yeast and alcohol. Taste is sweet and a bit sharp with a dried fruit, sherry and alcohol warming finish.
As good as rochefort 10 although it is a little less full of taste. Really good belgian

seriously ? THIS long on ratebeer and ZERO ratings? 
apearently, this was made for a wedding . 
that , and it has a diffrent ABV . dont know what exactly is the diffrence in brewing proces ( maybe diffrent hops or something like that ? ) 

pours brown, no foam. smells sweet, sharp carbo ( and to much carbo ) , malty, sugary , sweet, pretty much alike the regular abt 12 . wich is, as a basic, not that much of a favourite beer to me, personaly . Earlier Rating: 8/8/2012 Total Score: 3.6draft @ gollem 
the identical twin of westvleteren 12.
tastes rather weak to me. the elements of a good beer are there, but way to much in the background..a good beer, yeah, but to be so highley ranked? maybe this proves the point that you shouldnt drink westvleteren before its 6 years old. i wonder if it would have the same effect with this one??
Excellent beer! Very full pallet, wonderful aftertaste. Simple one of the best readily available beers, very similar to westvletteren XII.
A real piece of art. This dark beer has a warm and rich taste. To be enjoyed slowly and thoughfully.

Hugely overrated. I found this one tasting like one of my homebrews(probably same yeast). This beer is all about the yeast. it smells yeast (wlp 500) and thats about it. Taste is full bodied yeasty wlp 500. aftertaste is Rich With raisins, and more yeast. Overall: not a fan.
This is a MUST try beer when trying to choose from all the great Belgium beers. Next to Westy, and Rochfort this is the next best thing IMO. Great malt flavor and the yeast is not over powering.
Botella 33cl. Excelente cerveza. En su gusto se pueden notar notas de chocolate y toffee. Lo único que quizá flojea aquí es el aroma. El resto es todo excelente.

I have never had a quad before, so no expectations. This was amazing! I would have to say the first thing that came to my mouth after my first sip was root beer. There were dark fruit notes and bready aftertones but this beer was unique and amazing in my book. I am for sure getting it again and will recommend it to anyone who asks about it.

7/13/13 on draft @ Iron Abby $8. 2nd (and last) beer drank in chalice. Real Good stuff. Dark fruits bready very very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
brown, off-white head. dates, raisin, apple, chocolate, spice, cherry. alcohol. medium-heavy sweet. full body, creamy feel, active and fizzy carb, warm, sweet finish.

Fruity yeast tang, peach and plum slight flowery scent. creamy khaki colored head and bubbly thick brown body. Yeasty juicy cherry plum and peach flavors, little heat in the end. Crisp juicy and carbonated on the palate.

One of the best top class beers in the world. Very thick, full body, complex amazing aroma. Never disappoints. This is the kind of beer you have in a Belgium Beer glass sitting in a Cambridge style leather club chair in front of a burning fire place when the temperature outside the house is 10F......

Pours dark brown with off white head. Aroma is fruity yeast, little bit of metal Dont get alot out of the smell really. The first thing that jumps out at me is its much more sour than I expected. Its got a tart dark dried fruitiness to it. But that the sour taste dies away after the first couple drinks, it was almost acidic at first but in a good way. Its pretty dry and fairly bitter on the back end, also peppery and spicy, with a hit of metal in the aftertaste, but not enough to detract. Very nice Palate, lots of bubbly carbonation and it has a nice smooth mouth feel with a medium body. Awesome.

Pours a rich dark brown, with a thick creamy head (hints of extra malt hanging around in the head). Metallic taste, with slight hint of raisins and apricots. Very pleasant beer. The palate is quite metallic - not unpleasant, but different.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is one of only a few beers that I have literally drank my weight in. I adore this beer. A true classic!

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 ReRate - 2015.09.26 #CraftTakesSeattle Day 3, Beer 59 - Draught at Taphouse Grill. Exquisite, not sure if I got a musty old bottle but this is truly a gem of a quad. Lovely raisin plum notes with a melodious blend of sweet,bitter, and boozy.

330ml bottle from Sherbrooke. Dark chestnut coloured pour with a creamy, bubbly tan head that fades quickly. Aroma is predominantly yeast, hint of roast malt and dried pear. Flavour is dried fruit, sourness from the yeast and a lingering bitterness. Not doing it for me compared to other abts I have sampled, getting more yeast and spiciness than richness of chocolate and fruit notes.
Dissapointment after spending so much on a bottle. I guess Belgians just aint my thang.

Very fruity on the palate, aftertaste is pretty alcoholic. Overall very tasteful and balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2014 Bière brune rouge, totalement remplie de particules pouvant être assez grosses et au travers desquelles leffervescence est difficile à observer, mais celle-ci semble tout de même bonne, et surmontée dun col beige un peu mince mais bien résistant. Arômes de pain grillé, caramel, chocolat et petits fruits foncés (raisin, cerise, prune/pruneau), avec des traces de levure belge, de banane bien mûre et dépices (anis et clou de girofle surtout). Le nez est bien agréable, affichant une belle complexité, mais il pourrait être plus intense cependant. En bouche, cest peu pétillant sur langue, plutôt mousseux, et affichant une belle onctuosité au palais, cest rond et soyeux. Au goût, on retrouve pas mal les arômes précédemment humés, pain grillé, caramel, beaucoup de petits fruits foncés, un peu de levure belge et danis. Mais ce nest pas tellement sucrée comme bière (surtout pour le style), le malt étant bien équilibré par, dabord un houblon floral tout de même assez présent menant à une amertume plutôt légère mais bien sentie, mais surtout par un goût alcoolisé passablement présent. Je trouve dailleurs que ce goût alcoolisé semble par moment à la limite de lagréable, surtout en fin de bouche qui semble par moment très alcoolisé. Cette bière est (heureusement!) bien plus intense en bouche quau nez, où elle affiche toujours cette belle complexité. Équilibre intéressant, intégration des différentes saveurs entre elles qui pourrait être mieux (je pense surtout à lalcool ici). Très bonne bière néanmoins!

St Bernardus Abt 12 is overrated in my opinion. Not much aroma coming from that nonexistent head. Dark purplish color. Taste is fermented prune juice but not much else. Abt 12 is a decent beer but doesnt live up to the hype (or the high price.)

Very surprised. Those monks know what they are doing. I think I will shave the top of my head and apply for a job. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drank about half right out of the refrigerator and the other half about 20 minutes later. Much more flavor after it warms up 10 or 15 degrees, the fruit flavor really comes out. Touch of alcohol taste on the finish. Outstanding taste and flavor. One of the best.

Profondément brune, sa mousse couleur cassonade clair est persistante et généreuse ; au nez, sucre cuit, fruits confits, un peu de vin rouge, et du boisé. Cest finalement en bouche que la symphonie démarre : sucre dorge, caramel, un peu danis, des saveurs puissantes mais qui nexagèrent pas. Un délice complexe et envoûtant, plus timide quil ny paraît, mais qui compense par une panoplie de qualités.

Dune robe brune, coiffée dune somptueuse mousse moka, cette St. Bernardus apparaît opaque et effervescente. Alors que le verre se réchauffe avec son précieux contenu, des effluves de fruits mûrs (framboise, cerise, prune...) parfument déjà lair ambiant. Lalcool et le sucre cuit se joignent tardivement à la fête. Dès lentrée en bouche, la bière se présente comme étant riche et sucrée; le liquide est à la fois soyeux et ample. Une pointe dacidité ainsi quun soupçon boisé viennent minutieusement teinter la finale de notes fruitées. Limpression dun porto, le mirage dune bière hors pair. Un chef-doeuvre indémodable!
One of my top 5 favorite beers. Good anytime time of the year. Nicely balanced overall delightful.
Aroma like going to heaven, basic brown, basic avb, taste perfect, compares to Rochefort 10, palate not as good as in Rochefort/Chimay, but edaquate. Palate semi thick. Overall almost perfect.

Bière brune de 10 % dalcool. Elle possède un col mousseux, du type liqueur Pepsi-Rootbeer. Il y a comme un odorat sucré, mais très minime. Elle possède également un goût sucré, pas trop prononcé. On goûte bien laspect céréalier (orge), mais on croirait que cest du sarrasin. Elle est surprenante et bonne pour le pourcentage dalcool et elle est douce, malgré le fait quelle soit considérée comme une bière forte !

Bottle. Poured dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma and flavor were rich and malty, lots of fruit (raisin, cherry, date), a touch of chocolate, some anise. More bitter than most quads. Had almost a burnt character to the malt. Oddly enough, tasted sort of one note (the rich burnt malt). Thick mouthfeel.

Thanks to Blade86. Ruby color with red flashes. Medium sized beige, fast falling head. Medium body, oily texture, low carbonation. Aroma: Caramel malts, dark fruits, a bit winey, light alcohol. Soft notes of basement? Taste: Moderate sweet, caramel malts, notes of sherry. Long, complex finish with aromas of dark malts.
One of my favorite beers. In my opinion also one of the best Quads there is. Visited the brewery earlier this is, its a real treat!

Bottle. Dark chestnut brown with a huge foamy off white head. Dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar, vintage sherry, alcohol. All good things. Taste is medium/heavy sweet and medium bitter. Full body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Great stuff, could be interesting to try against Westvleteren 12.

Aroma: not very intensive but complex, blackberry and other dark berries, some yeast, noticable alcohol notes, maybe chocolate & woody; Appearance: very dark brownish ruby; little hazy, not very big and not very long-lasting beige foam; Palate: full body, creamy feel, noticable (slightly) alcoholic "sharpness", average(-) carbonation, long bittersweet/, dry finish;
Overall: great beer, plain and simple

1 year old bottle, enjoyed with some cheese. Mahogny colour, big foamy dirt white head. Lots of different dark fruits in the aroma, also some earth, licorice, brown sugar and yeast. Dry taste, ends with some nice peppery bitterness. Alcohol is very well hidden. Very smooth, soft carbonation.

Had this beer many times in the days before I made and effort to rate and records my thoughts. As good as I remembered. Pours a darkish brown with ample white head. At least to me, the nose is all booze. The flavor is sweet, but well hidden and not in the manner of candy. The bodium is medium with a light viscosity and strong carbonation. Bottle - Ale Yeah! - Decatur, GA

Colour: Dark brown with a firm 3-finger head.
Nose: Chocolate, coffee, dark fruits with a hint of spices. Roasted malts.
Flavours: Very intense and smooth with roasted malts, dark coffee, preserved fruits (raisins, plums). Slight bitterness in the aftertaste which compliments the fruitiness.
Finish: Lingering. You can feel the forte of this Quadrupel.
Verdict: Magnificent. It easily rivals the great Trappists, with the exception of Rochefort 10 (I have yet to evaluate Westvleteren XII).
Good aroma. Nice dark color and lovely texture, yeast gives the final touch. The flavour is bitter but equilibrate, with perfect carbonisation. I really enjoyed.

Bottle enjoyed at The Treacle Tap, Macclesfield, Cheshire. Poured out a very dark red brown colour with a good head. Fruit, caramel and sweet malt aroma. Full body and thick texture. Soft carbonation. Slight bitter finish.

Aroma and taste is complex dried fruits (prune, raisin, plum) some toffee, caramel malts, some spicy pepper, yeasty, woody nuances. Complex yet balanced. Immense.

Media carbonazione, colore ambra scuro molto intenso. 
Aroma floreale ma non troppo pronunciato con sentori di agrumi e lavanda.
Morbida al palato, i suoi 10.5% non si percepiscono se non negli effetti. Il gusto è decisamente il suo punto forte: molto corposo di frutta candita e con una gradevole punta acidula che ne inibisce la stucchevolezza.
Il retrogusto è persistente e tonico.

The aroma is subtle with a combination of dough yeast, sour fruit, and basement aromas, and the appearance has a cloudy auburn color with nearly no head. The taste is very well balanced and is mildly sour, a touch sweet, and slightly umami, and the palate combines a medium body, a thin yet slick texture, a soft carbonation, and an abrupt finish.

This is one of the best brews I have had in a long time. It is truly epic. It is a bit fruity with a warm scent. But it is surprisingly flavorful and has a smooth wash down. This is definitely a brew you share with a good friend or enjoy it by yourself. If you have not tried it seek it out. It is easily on my top ten lists of great brews!

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 33cl bottle from Beer-shop.it. Pours copper, yeasty opaque, with light beige foam, thin, thick and persistent. Fine, complex and intense on nose, with pear, caramel, spices (cinnamon, pepper), slightly toasted malt (biscuit), fruits like cherries and very slight solvent when it warms. In mouth is even more intense, persistent, warming, sweet but not too much, with all the flavours that were on nose. An explosion of red fruits, spices, burnt caramel, berries, nuts, almost tannic, vinous character, with a slightly dry finish. Strong alcohol is well hidden. Good body but thinner than I would expect. Quite well done example of belgian dark strong ale.
Very complex beer. Pours a deep reddish brown with tan lacing. Very full bodied, thick aftertaste.
33cl from Auchan (Luxembourg). Hazy light brown with a nice and persistent head. Smooth for a 10% alcohol. Please, another one.
Today , once more I enjoyed this wonderfull beer but now from tap. Although I am not a huge fan of the darker sweet beers, this is absolutely amazing!

Pours with a big head that shrinks quickly. Cloudy dark brown in color with a beige head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle bought at our last trip to Belgium at Stassen Vin in Aubel. Had so great hopes into this one, that I didnt open it until all the other beers were drunken. And it really was worth it: Unclear dark brown colour with low head and smooth body. Nose of dark nuts and malt. Taste of high fermentation, Belgian yeast, malt, nuts, torf, roasted caramel and roses. Easy and really nice to drink, you dont notice the strong alcohol at all. Flowery and fruity finish. Great one and Im looking forward to get some more St. Bernardus beers in the near future.

Pouring in deep brown with a huge, fast disappearing head. Starts of with alcohol, peaches and some caramel. Bit spicy in the back. Thick beer with full body. Nose is ok, but the taste is really fine. Complex mixture with some herbs. Good one for sure. Not the best ever but there is some rocket science in the making.
I thought this was a very good beer in the taste area I like, I recommend this to drinkers who like a sweeter beer without the bitter hops
Dark brown colored beer with some beige head. Complicated aroma and taste with sweetness and dark fruity notes and some yeastiness. Strongly carbonated and alcohol comes through a bit.

Another perennial favorite from my days drinking exclusively Belgians. 

Awesome fruity, bready, spicy, typically Belgian aroma. Surprisingly jammy. Fruit and spice sync up on the palate, joining the strong malt backbone to yield a sweet, fruity, mildly boozy overall profile. Warms the back of my throat as I swallow. 

Good stuff. This, Rochefort 10, and Westy 12 have a stranglehold on the style.
Au mondial.  Belle robe brun foncé.  Chaud (alcool), caramel, boisé, cuiré.  Un bonne bière.

Dark, almost opaque with medium head.
aroma has bubblegum, banana, a bit whitewine-like.
Flavor is really complex. In addition of fruity and flovery flavors there are peppery and liquorice notes.

Carmel and boozy. Fruity. Super alcohol flavor. The ratings surprised me. I'm a craft beer fanatic and like big ones, but this puppy is a choker. Hate the style to be fair. I realize why this might seem reallly good to people that appreciate this style

Dark brown color. Big creamy brown head, compact, creamy and very long lasting. Aroma is caramel, banana and fruits. Palate is oily, body is moderate to strong, alcohol is nicely masked. Taste is caramel and fruits, very deep, complex and amazingly balanced.

Bottle. Dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is prune, toffee, spicy yeast and light chocolate. Flavor is toffee, dark fruit but not too sweet, balance with spicy yeast and alcohol. Medium to full body and very smooth. Ive had this one many times and have always enjoyed it.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 Caramel, bread, chocolate, coffee, roasty, spruce, leather, clove, woody, smoke, brewery Bernard Brouwerij, Abt style (or quadrupel), 10%	of alcohol content, very fruity, smoothly tasted and a dark ivory color.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with stable light tan head. Intense aroma of malt, caramel, dried fruit and alcohol. Sweet, malty flavour with clear notes of caramel and fruit. Warming alcohol presence. Rough, sweetish aftertaste. Good.
UPDATED: JUL 5, 2013 Bottle at home. Great story behind the beer. Sweet taste of dark fruits, some port, raisins, malt taste,Great head on top. Nice beer

750mL bottle. Poured into a Chimay chalice (wondering if thats bad form in Trappist circles? Monk brawl, anyone?)  Murky brown, lots of carbonation, floaties, nice big off-white head, good lacing. Nose is fruity, some yeast, malts peaking through, some florals as well. Mouth is surprisingly lighter than Id expected - medium bodied, with some Belgian yeast mingling with a semisweet malt backdrop, dried fruit (apricots and raisins) apples, vanilla and caramel on the back end. Pretty complex stuff. Nice Quad.

Pours amber brown. Not much carbonation. Looks fairly light bodied with little flecks of yeast or protein floating near the bottom.  Smell is sweet and almost dr. Pepper in quality. No real hop presence.  Mouthfeel is way thicker than the beer looked. Powerful complex taste. Very malty, fruity, with licorice, and a slightly earthy quality. Bitter finish with lingering spice. I'm not sure I would want to drink a while bottle myself. I give high praise for the complexity but I think I will need time to appreciate this beer more; as I appreciate but don't enjoy it as much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an opaque, medium brown with a half finger of off-white that slowly dissipates to a cap and leaves moderate lacing. Small amount of sediment and carbonation. Nose is very complex. A ton of malt and dark fruit up front-raisin/prune and plum. A little bit of yeast and a slight roast presence that is just awesome. Mouth is just as complex and awesome. Once again the malt and dark fruits (plum, raisin and prune) come in strong at front. Yeast, spice and caramel hit perfectly. Definitely a medium body, with a surprising carbonation feel. This one was absolutely delicious.

Aroma: Complex--lots of malty aromas but hints of dried fruit, raisin, etc. 
Appearance: Clear amber with rich, tan head.
Taste: Light sweetness with a tart sourness in the finish.
Palate: Full body, slick texture, average carbonation, soft finish.
Overall: Very smooth. I enjoyed it, but Im not blown away.

Dark brown, close to black with off-white head.
Smooth, sweet and strong. But, the alcohol is hardly noticeable.
Best smell for beer with floral, caramel malt, dark bubble brown, sweet fruity smooth but somewhat carbonated and heavy, right texture, one of the best beer so far

Bottle. Dark cherry red. Off white head. No visible carbonation. Not an intense aroma, sweetness there, and maltiness with some wheatiness and beef jerky. Fizzy in the mouth and enough fullness. Tastes like it smells with good boozy bitterness to finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Hazy chestnut body with a medium off-white head. Steady carbonation. Nice lacing. Aroma of caramel, nuts, stewed tea, cigar, brown bread, prunes and yeast. Flavour of boozy sultanas, caramel, yeast and wood. Medium body with an oily mouthfeel. Surprisingly fizzy carbonation. Wonderfully complex - every sip seems to reveal different flavours.

Love this beer. Dark brown with a big head, good lacing The aroma is caramel and sweet  malt,  The taste is sweet like a Double bock. Good carbonation. It doesnt taste like the high alcohol beer that it is no aftertaste easy to drink.

Brune foncée, dépôt en suspension, belle mousse beige crémeuse. Caramel, chocolat, herbes, épices, amertume, notes de fruits, un peu trop dalcool et une petite sécheresse: tout cela se conjugue parfaitement pour cette quadruple complexe et équilibrée!

Aroma leve. Cor marrom linda. Pouca espuma. Sabor forte pela presença alta de álcool, mas delicioso! Desce bem.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,35 Bottle from cardinal. Dark brown colour, big brown creamy head. Plum, alcohol, yeast and berries in aroma. Flavour is strong cream and toffee with a sting of alcohol. Also malts and yeast make their way through. Lovely product with a nice long roasted aftertaste in the throat as well as creamy toffee. Nice balance from the candis. One of the nicer qauds i had.

En cuanto a las notas aromaticas que desprende esta cerveza destacan las caracteristicas levaduras de St.Bernardus que dan notas aromaticas muy especiales. Así mismo se perciben  olores a granos, maltas caramelo y esteres frutales.

En cuanto a su apariencia, color cobrizo con destellos rubíes a contraluz, carbonatacion ligera, cuerpo redondo y corona de espuma abundante y de alta retención.
 
En boca es suave, elegante y compleja.

Al paladar es una cerveza sumamente interesante y grandiosa. De principio suave y cremosa. Un equilibrio excelente con final seco, pero que fiel al estilo, perimte sobresalga ligeramente el sabor dulce de las maltas. Se percibe una amplia gama de sabores dificiles de describir, y a pesar de su potencia alcohólica, no se percibe ni obstruye el resto de grandes sabores.

En resumen una cerveza de campeonato mundial, fácil de distinguir el por qué es considerada una de las mejores del mundo!
Aged 2 years by redpooba. Pours tan brown, head doesnt linger. Aroma includes yeast, wheat, toffee and apricot. Tastes sweet and fruity, creamy and chocolatey. An absolute revelation.

Pours deep copper with thick pillowy off-white head. Smells of sticky-sweet pale malts with hints of mustiness and green apple. Flavor is sweet like cotton candy and apple pie and fades off to a raisiny aftertaste. Thick, creamy, and full, this is a delightfully tasty brew!

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, nuts, toast, 
Appearance: brown, hazy, 
Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate: medium body, lively, 
Overall: Other incredible beer, maybe to sweet for me but there is not a big problem.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2015 Re-rate on 07/07/15 On tap, served in St Bernardus chalice glass.
Hazed brown color with a thick off-white head. Rich and complex aroma of dried dark fruits and malt . Very sweet malty flavor with notes of dried fruits,raisins caramel, honey, candy and alcohol. Palate - full bodied, smooth and creamy.
This is a good beer.  Not as good as Rochefort 10 or Westvleteren 12, but still quite good.
Draft. Pours deep copper with a small white head. Aroma of caramel and malt. Medium body with malty sweetness some oiliness and a warm alcohol finish.

Pours dark brown colour with fluffy tan head. Aroma is yeast, dark fruits, caramel. Taste is the same, with also some bread in it and a malty quality to it. medium to full body. Nice alcohol warmth, alcohol is not overpowering. Nice lingering aftertaste. Not as complex as the Westvleteren 12 to which it is often compared to, but nevertheless an excellent quad!
Dark ivory colored beer with a high fermentation.Soft aroma and tastes very smooth. Fruity flavor.

On draft at the Hungry Monk in a chalice.  Pours a crystal-clear dark amber. Heavy raisin, currants,  brown sugar, and banana-like esters on the nose. Complex taste of caramel, oak, raisin, a bit of green apple, some spiced rum, and cinnamon. The booziness and spices really pop as the beer approaches room temperature. Smooth body with a bit woody texture. One of my favorite quads.
St Bernardus was oh so brave, he fought for his people... he bought them joy, representing our life was such a thrill for him todayyy

Pours a rich dark reddish brown with a very pale brown bubbly head. Very complex nose, lots of candy sugar and dark fruit up front, very sweet, a yeasty breadiness, ripe bananas, slightly boozy with a hint of pine resin. Wow, rich caramel and plum taste up front, quite sweet, ripe fruits, the alcohol is hidden well, and very subtle hop bite at the end. Medium bodied, high carbonation. Perfect balance and really delicious.
Koffie, noten, geroosterd, kruiden, alcohol, rozijn, vanille Heerlijk op keldertemperatuur

Stiamo parlando di una fra le 50 migliori birre al mondo. Prevale un profumo intendo di caramello, la schiuma è scarsa e poco persistente, laroma è fantastico con un netto retrogusto di cioccolata ed un gusto prevalente di fiori e limone.
Lalcol, molto presente, si fa sentire un po alla volta ma con educazione e senza stravolgere i sensi.
Un birra per intenditori dal gusto complesso ma molto ben definito.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2013 Bought a 330ml bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Aroma of caramel, banana and raisins. Brown beer with a nice red glow and a creamy head, and is highly carbonated. Taste of caramel, bananas, raisins and candy. Has a sweet taste and a bitter aftertaste which are well balanced. Overall, this is one of the best beers Ive ever tasted.
Bottle into can .. cheese shop.. murky brown ..arona of wine and alcohol....  taste is good..potent some apricot..

Bottle pour, wow. Weird lookin pope mother fucker on the bottle. I'm a bit wasted to rate. Great brew!

What a tasty Abbey Ale this is. Thank goodness for the monks and all their free time. When I drink this, I feel JUST like the St Barnadus on the label...happy and fulfilled. Great head that stands up well. Substantial weight of taste. Heavenly nectar!

330 ml bottle, at home, poured into a trappist glass. ABV 10% on my bottle.
Very deep mahogany brown colour on the body, with one finger tall head, but that comes mainly because of my glass width. Beige in colour, with average to good retention, and light lacing left on the glass.
Aroma of dark fruits, plums, and malts. A bit of the alcohol too. Aroma becomes stronger as the beer warms up. 
Very nice taste, with lots of dark fruits, red grapes, malts, with the alcohol very well hidden.A metallic flavour at first but again, seems to disappear as the beer warms up.
Thick on the body, with biting carbonation that works pretty well for this beer. Dry on the palate but also kind of sticky.
Really good brew!  Dark fruits, nice head, not too bitter is taste and has a very nice aroma.  Gotta find those monks!!!!!
Really cant fault this in any way at all. If only I could brew this one!

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours hazy dark brown with white head. 
Aroma caramel, lots of dark fruits, yeast, sugar. 
Taste a nice bitter up front, followed by a modest awesome caramel sweet. 
Mouth-feel dry, creamy. 
Awesome beer complex nose and taste.

11.2 oz bottle (best by 2-2-17) from Supermarket Liquors into a Duvel tulip.   Dark, deep brownish appearance with a tan head.  The aroma is Belgian yeast, dark fruits, sweet, caramel-like malts and candy sugars.  Similar flavor, rich, malty and sweet with cloves and faint alcohol.  Silky smooth and creamy feel with a full body.  Complex flavor with a warming finish.  Fuckin A-mazing.

Poured from a bottle.  Redish brown with a big foamy head that eventually disapates to a thin cap, a twirl of the glass is all it takes to regenerate it.  The lacing is outstanding.  The aroma brings caramel, sweet bready malt, and hint of tart cherries... and a healthy dose of booze.  The taste is sweet, but not overly so.  The malts provide caramel and toffee and as the beer opens up a bit, the dark fruits really start to shine through.  Theres a bit of spice (clove) in the finish and the whole thing warms you up a bit.  The mouthfeel is outstanding - the carbonation gives the beer a crispness while maintaining smooth drinkability.  Overall, a very enjoyable beer.
Overall: Sweet,  high carbonation,  young, but good.Note: Bottle 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2013-05-03.

Well, Rochefort 10 is not so different then few would like to suggest. Not bad at all. Smaller top, less aroma and hard to characterize, prunes, hops, and alcohol on the nose. 
So the beginning is not as good, but the taste surprises, its more then I could smell: dark chocolate , prunes, overall heavy sweetness, figs, and the alcohol is present not on the background but balanced, peppery note at the back of my mouth hits last.
It is actually rather good and will not let You down.

330ml bottle into a snifter.

Pours a clear very dark ruby with really no head at all. Just some lace that swirls on the surface and also leaves a bit of wispy lacing.

The aroma is very vinous with an almost port-like quality. Lots of dark fruit such as raisins, prunes, dates, and figs. A little bit of toffee and roast is in there too with even a very quick whiff of coffee. Quite deep and complex.

The flavor outdoes the aroma in terms of depth with a huge hit of dark fruit and red wine along with plum and fig. Some underlying notes of overripe fruit and toffee with a touch of roast coming in at the very end when all of the fruit dissipates. There is just a light hint of bitterness and a breath of alcohol at the end with a silky mouthfeel and a lightly sticky finish.

Overall, what a wonderful and complex brew. There is just so much depth of aroma and flavor here it is indescribable. Truly a world-class beer that all beer lovers should experience.
UPDATED: MAY 3, 2013 Right up there with goudon carolus blue.... Perfection.... One of my favorites... Delicious

Bottle at home in London - picked up somewhere in Belgium. Aged between two to three years. Pours clear, red-brown with a staunch, beige cream head. Plenty of sugary, semi-dark malts in the nose, rich toffee, some faintly tangy fruits, dates, plums, figs. Big sweet flavor with an explosion of ripening fruits, caramel, rich bready malts, some alcohol kick, prune, fig, banana. Full bodied with lively, massaging carbonation. The finish carries a fair amount of boozy warmth, with lots of sugary, bready malts, toffee and caramel, more ripening fruits such as dates and figs, plums, berries, bruised bananas, some dark cherries. Yeah, absolutely a world-class quad. One of the most drinkable 10%+ ABV beers Ive had in a long time.

A - Pours a dark murky brown with a small tan head that dissipates quickly.

S - Soft Belgian yeast. Clove, brown sugary malt, dark fruits.

T - Dark cherries, plums, bananas, caramelized toffee and brown sugar. The malt is complex and comforting. The spices are soft and subtle. Has some ginger in the middle. Belgian yeast resides throughout.

M - Medium to full bodied. Low carbonation.

All the flavors melded together with perfect harmony. Soft but bold. A very easy drinker with the alcohol well hidden. The yeast has a subdued presence.

Serving type: on-tap

01-03-2011
Much lighter than expected. A smooth, floral/fruity quad that hides the alcohol very well. Will be stocking my shelf with this one.

Supposedly a copy of the "best beer in the world", the Westvleteren 12.
My personal experience: the Vleteren seems to have a slightly drier finsh. If youre looking for a quadruple, then you cant go wrong with the St. Bernardus, tho; this is truly world class.
My personal #1. Flavors are complex and varied. THE PERFECT QUADRUPEL. And boozy to boot. This one is a party starter... and a party ender.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur brune et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (prunes, raisins, dates, traces dagrumes) et épicées (clou de girofle, léger de poivre), de caramel toffee, léger de sucre brun et de malt rôti avec des notes dalcool, de houblon herbeux et de pain. Ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture moyennement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (prunes, dates, léger de raisins) et légèrement épicées (clou de girofle, notes poivrées) avec des traces de chocolat noir lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement  un goût de caramel toffee aux notes rôties avec un léger goût de pain et des notes de sucre brun puis le tout se termine par un léger goût dalcool vineux et réchauffant ainsi quavec des notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût long, moyen-léger amer dalcool, léger de rôti avec une léger goût de levures fruitées (pelure de raisins et de prunes) avec des notes de houblon et quelques traces de chocolat noir. (2006)

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2013 Marron/noir avec une enorme mousse beige. Larôme de malt, fruits noir et levure. Le goût est de malt, un peu sucrée, avec des fruits noir. Je peu presque pas goûter lalcool mais il y a un bon challeur en finale.

Wow... Holy FOAM batman! The saint is packed with dark fruity malted goodness. Light with lots of head. Very nice finish. Def say a little prayer and pick up the friar. This is an awesome Belgian ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The Saint....once fairly easy to find, now an elusive fella, if you see that fat little monk smiling on the label, DO NOT pass him by, DO NOT take him for granted. Pick this guy up, immediately head home, dust off your favorite snifter and go to town. This guy is delicious. Its brewed with artisan water that is pumped from a depth of 500 feet, which is especially impressive when compared to the likes of bud light or Miller lite, whose water source is, on the best day, a puddle and on the worst day toilet water. Toilet water from the upper tank, no doubt, but toilet water nonetheless. The aroma is pleasing and not overwhelming, and although this packs a mean alcohol punch, youd be hard pressed to taste it. This is a living ale which can be aged for up to fifteen years...which means this is probably the perfect birthday present to get your favorite 6 year old. Happy birthday little buddy, youre welcome in advance.

Ohhhhh The Saint. Long one of my favorites, and difficult to find around Rhode Island. Blind taste tested along with Chimay Blue and Rochefort 10 (it came in 2nd behind Chimay), it was slightly sweeter and less smooth than the Chimay, smoother and less sweet than the Rochefort, and definitely contained the best display.  Slight banana flavor, extremely crisp. Carbonated slightly above average, perhaps due to the 500 foot deep artesianal well water, which is just plain awesome, although I have no scientific facts about that.  Overall, its one of my favorite beers.
Amazing winter ale. full of malt, dark fruits and yeast. enjoyable every single time.
At Broken Top Bottle Shop; tangy, tasty, flirty, with a sweet zing at the finish.

Bottle was a gusher, which is depressing but I still had half the beer. Great aroma. Fruit and yeast are most prominent. Flavor follows with some caramel and booze on the finish. Really good but I do wish the alcohol on the end was a little less noticeable.

From 330 ml bottle, pours a solid dark brown with a persisting beige head. The aroma is awesome - plums, cherries, dark bread and some caramel sweetness. The taste shows some stewed fruit, burnt sugar, orange zest, fruitcake and a slight mineral note. The alcohol is apparent but not overwhelming. Powerful, but pretty great all the same.

Dark amber colour. Slightly Belgian phenolic aroma with hints of alcohol. Can taste Dried fruit, raisins with an alcoholic finish. Great full bodied beer. High carbonation adds to a lingering bitterness. Overall a nice beer and hides the alcohol ok.

Pours a dark and deep amber color with a medium tan head. Aromas are fruits, raisins, but also a hint of bubble gum. Long and bitter finish. Alcoholic taste is a bit too strong.

Smell of plums burnt sugar some wheat bread. Muddy brown apparel with a head that lasts and lasts.  Taste of coffee, chocolate cane sugar malt wheat bread and plums again. Love the mouthfeel of this one, nice and thick. Carbonation medium. Overall a nice belgian abbey. I can drink this one forever.

Bottle @ home. Profumo decisamente fruttato prugna, pera e qualche nota alcolica. Schiuma color nocciola  estremamente compatta mediamente persistente ( 2 min circa) e parecchio stabile.  Birra color moka, con riflessi rossastri in controluce. Il corpo è pieno, di consistenza oleosa, con carbonatazione minima. Il gusto è fruttato dolce, con qualche nota di cioccolato  alle pere. Il luppolato è una discreto sottofondo che non disturba i gusti dolci . caldi  alcolici di questa birra. Può ricordare un po una rochefort 8, la 10 è di un altro tenore. Comunque molto buona.

This has got to be the worst "great" beer I have ever had.

Poured a reddish brown with a huge, frothy off white head. Aroma of dark berry fruit. Medium, lively body, flavour of the aroma, some cherry and a slight aftertaste. Dont get the hype at all, fairly average at best.

From a bomber. Pours opaque medium  brown with a light frothy head. Sweet and smooth Tastes like dates, figs, prunes, toffee. Smells like fermenting fruits, brown sugar, syrup. Medium body and low carbonation.
August 2010. From bottle. Pours dark brown with a generous head. Dark fruits and brown sugar all the way. highly recommended.
Muito boa. Sabor de Caramel, grass, basement aromas, chocolate, vanilla. Misto de delirium noturnum e tremmens

Aroma of delicious candy.  Figs, sugarplums, tootsie roll, black cherry, and raisins.  Pours deep brown with some fluffy film.  Taste is everything this style aspires to be.  Dark fruits, candied pecans, cherry cordial, and rhubarb.  No sign of booze.  Perfect beer.
Een bijzonder biertje deze abt 12. De eerste slok is niet zo bijzonder, maar daarna komt een.hele speciale aroma naar voren. Heerlijk
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 Aroma: rasins, alcohol, spice. Appearance: deep brown. Taste: well balanced, smooth, sweet with a slightly spicy finish.

330 ml bottle from Belgium. Nice beer. Good head that floats down into itself. Good quality, Trappist beer.

... one of the worlds best beers?? smells and tastes great but almost too approachable. pretty light-weight quad. high abv is hidden.

Nice rich scent of brown sugar, plum, dark berries, maybe a little chocolate. Taste is clean, moderately carbonated, mild sweetness, very nice, subtle liquory aftertaste.
Compared to Westvleteren XII it is a great second. Its a very flavourful, well-balanced and rich beer. One of ky tree favorite beers.
Bottle. Biirti brugge. One finger foam. Hazy brown. Caramalty. Brown sugar molasses. Black peppery dark fruits. Superbrew.  Long finish.

Bomber poured into goblet. Color is hazy reddish brown with a thin, light white head. Great carbonation. Smells fruity sweet with noticeable booze. Medium mouthfeel with flavors of dig an other fruits, a sugary sweetness and distinct boozy sting. A delicious palate that shares new flavors with each sip. I'm not into sweeter beers but this is great.

Poured from a bottle into a trappist glass, the color is a deep brown with a ting of red, the nice velvety head covers the top, the aroma is yeast, fruit, the taste is mildly sweet with some spice, candied fruit, carbonation is again velvety smooth. Very nice but I still am partial to the trips.
Pours a dark muddy brown. Has a raisin like smell, with lots of interesting spices. Surprisingly smooth for such a strong beer, hints of butterscotch, raisins a very dry finish. Good stuff.
A multifaceted flavor, but almost overly malty with little sweetness to balance. Poured with more head than am used too, which may have diminished the taste a bit.

Intense aroma of hops, chocolate, yeast, and fruit (apple, raisins). Very full bodied. Sweet, malty taste with porto, some fruitiness and a alcohol burn. A bit tart. The aroma is more intense than the flavor. Nevertheless a complex and delicious beer

0.33l bottle. Its somewhat murky looking in the the glass this, dark brown in color and it has lots of big chunky sediments and a nice medium sized off-white head. The aroma is lovely dark fruity with lots of sweetness - like a good quad should have. Dark candied sugar, prunes, brown sugar and a little bit of alcohol. Im not blown away, but have to admit that it smells pretty darn good this. It has a near silky mouthfeel with a just below average carbonation level. That lovely sweetness continues in the taste. Dark glazed and dried fruits like prunes and figs. Its just melting away on the tongue this. Lots of dark almost burned ashy candied sugar. Also there is a good bitterness - almost like a dark chocolate bitterness thats balancing the sweetness quite elegant. A pleasure to drink, and the bottle went away way to fast! 29.03.2013

Oh sweet monk of delish beer in Belgium. Uve such a spl beer with cork like champagne or other fine beverage for rich man to enjoy. Much alcohol of 10% and make me become happy like man monk on bottle with much excite for fine beer of craft and hard work. This beer is my favourite and keep in cellar for aging like fine wine and much flavor. Telling from my heart, I love you so much.

What a beer should be in my opinion: dark, clean tasting, sugar balanced out (some Belgian beers have way to much sugar>ABV) raisins, alcohol, dates, with a clean finish and nice after taste that lingers. Great beer!

750ml bottle. Pours a dark amber, slightly rusty color with a frothy off white head. Aroma of bready malts, dark fruits, and brown sugar. Taste is candied sugar, caramel, dark fruits, with a hint of citrus.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2013 On tap @ Toronado SF. First time tryin Abt 12 and it didnt disappoint. Great mouth feel, no alcohol bite, and great Belgian flavors.
