Poured from a 22oz. bottle.  Deep plum in color and aroma with a nice creamy head.  Strong taste of plum and alcohol.  Very enjoyable.

bottle
Dark brown color with a  big brown creamy head. The aroma is of over ripe fruit and malt sweetness, plum, alcohol. 

The flavor is very powerful of a great malt blend, sweet, full of subtle flavors, very complex, a new sip every new taste, flavor. Nice long roasted aftertaste, hints of the alcohol, which tickles.  Very full bodied, massively complex flavors and aromas, lively carbonation.
Similar to the Westy 12. Fantastic! 
I accept from anyone at any time! :)

Poured from Draft. Dark amber with thick cream head. Dark fruit and sweet spicy, belgainy aroma. Fruit and spice in the fron with smooth caramel finish. Out of the top 3 rated quads, this is deservedly last and might not be in the same league as the other two.

Intense aroma of hops, chocolate, yeast, and fruit (apple, raisins). Very full bodied. Sweet, malty taste with porto, some fruitiness and a alcohol burn. A bit tart. The aroma is more intense than the flavor. Nevertheless a complex and delicious beer

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013  Bottle Poured into St. Bernardus goblet. Dark ruby red brown pour with an off white creamy head. Smells strong with fruit, figs, spices, booze. Mild tart aroma. Tastes so smooth and creamy yet bold with all of the spice and ripened fruits. Alcohol is hidden well, but it warms on the finish. some mild bitterness in the finish too to balance it all out. Wonderful.
Deep red/brown colour. No head. Sweet malty aroma, followed by sugary, fruity (almost red wine or port-like) and caramel/toffee flavours. thin texture with a ight fizz. Bit too sweet for me.
Well rounded flavor. Caramel sweet and noticeable wild yeast flavor. No hops that are noticed.

Draft @ The Ale House, Amesbury, MA. I waited a long time to rate this because I was searching for it on draft. This beer is a masterpiece. Deep crimson color in the 12 oz. chalice with thin tan head clinging to the side.  The nose is a great blend of caramel malts, Fruity Belgian yeast and dark fruits. Taste is complex and malty. The first sip is loaded with caramel, dark fruit (figs and raisins). After a few more swallows, you can pick up chocolate malts, notes of dried fruit and candy sugar. The alcohol makes itself known more in terms of the subtle warmth as it warms your throat and stomach. However, I cant pick up any alcohol taste at all. Which is unreal for being a draft sample. I can easily type more but why be long winded at this point? My overall option is simply this.. Delicious!
A very drinkable beer with nice flavours. Whilst enjoyable, it isnt sufficiently interesting to justify its price tag.

Draught at the Abbots Ale House. Pours a deep amber-brown with a thin cream coloured head, lingering with lacing on top. Aroma is very dampened as it was served far too cold, but I could at least get hints of straw, bread a nice heavy molasses. Taste is a nice sweetness to begin with, followed by a light bitter overtone and a slightly (very slight) boozy kick - nice floral tones, lovely caramel, apples and molasses ringing through. Finish is sweet, with the lovely thick mouthfeel of a quadrupel and a medium carbonation. Only a slight boozy warmth, which is an achievement considering the 10.5% abv! Really lovely beer, delighted to have finally tried it, and surprisingly refreshing and drinkable considering the strength of it. Will have to try on bottle at room temperature for a comparison, but it is definitely a really great beer regardless.
Overall this beer has tons of prunes and lots of stone fruits! Nice and little bits of caramel on the backend.
UPDATED: MAR 26, 2013 Dark beer. Yeaste with fruity tones. Good drinkable and sweet fruity. Warm and good to enjoy. Taste just very fine.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2014 Dark brown colour, medium light brown head, sweet fruity warm toffee smell, bitter warm sweet caramel tsdte, complex taste, creamy a bit alcoholic but not to much, a bit coffee chocolat liquorise like aftertaste
Dark and smooth abbey beer, subtle bitterness and great aftertaste and palate. Réglisse

Draft at Sybarite Pig. Tulip. Great, thick white head with tremendous lacing. The nose has significant fruit flavor with a bread overtone. Tastes of bread, dark fruits, light yeast, malts and slight bitterness of hops. Delicate finish with a nice aftertaste of fruits.

330ml bottle. pours a very dark brown/ruby/black with tanned head. aroma is of spices, alcohol and bread. tastes great. full mouth feel with molasses and bread coming through. slightly bitter aftertaste.

Reviewed on: 3-21-13

Appearance: Deep molasses brown with a touch of ruby.  Huge soapy off-white head for a 10% ABV beer.

Aroma: Overripe banana, a touch of clove and coriander (hurray, Belgians!).  Molasses and caramel provide a heavy, sweet richness.

Taste: Molasses, brown sugar sweetness, dark fruits (dates and figs), overripe banana, banana bread.  A hint of sour cherry in the finish.  A touch of booziness.

Mouthfeel: A lot more carbonation than I expected at the beginning.  The carbonation tingles the mouth.

Overall: This is a great big Belgian that works extremely well for me.  The combination of the big malt sweetness and the dark and sour fruits mix with the high carbonation in order to provide a drinkable beer that is sweet without being cloying.  Extremely pleasant.

Score: 9/10

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Need to re-rate this. Was overly yeasty and it overwhelmed the taste. Could have been a weird reaction to something I ate. In spite of that, still obvious craftsmanship in the other categories. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark Dark brown with med head. Smells.. ripened dark fruits, banana, malt, caramel, bread, yeast and some booze. Tastes..Dried fruit, caramel, malt, some yeasty goodness through the end and a little booze. Really, really good

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2013 De color oscuro. En nariz presenta muy dulce a caramelo, con notas a cafe y chocolate y algo especiada y notas florales. En boca presenta mucho cuerpo, dulce con notasa cafe y caramelo. Muy redonda. Excelente!!

Big bottle, rated from old tasting notes. Aroma with dark fruits, some yeasty notes and some dark bread aswell. Taste: sweet bready malts, brown sugar , alcohol and some faint mint-like notes. Long nice finish with dark sugars and yeast.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Nice beer. Orange and floral aroma I think. Pours a orange / amber color and the liquid is hazy. Taste was a bit boring. light sweetness and light bitterness.Palate was nice. full body, sticky dry texture and an average carbonation.The finish was alcoholic and bitter

Draft at Belly, Eugene. Pours a cloudy med brown, little head. Aroma has a slight sweetness, notes of stone fruit: plums, cherries. Body rich and slightly creamy; warming definitely there. Finish slightly tart and funky. This is a classic and its obvious why.
Somewhat thinner than Wv12 but has that same sort of raisin-almond taste. Lovely, and buyable!
Absolutely the best.  Once I discovered this beer all others pale in  comparison.  Thank you to the beer master at yard house!

A complex beer, with spice and fruit seeming to jump out from the alcohol. Extremely powerful... the kick is more noticeable than other Belgians of this strength Ive tried. Pepper, wood, vinous. Holy moly, I couldnt imagine a large bottle of this, the small kicked both our asses... there are many hard alcohols out there which feel weaker than this drink.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours dark amber in color with a creamy tan head. Dark fruits, some yeasty notes and some dark bread as well in aroma. Sweet bready malts in taste at first, some brown sugar and sweet syrup notes as well in taste. Warming alcohol effect as well, but this is quite subtle though. Sweet dark fruits in aftertaste and light yeastyness as well.

This as close to Rochefort and Westy as you can get. Great dark fruity taste and decent malty taste. Easily accessible unlike Westy. Great tasting beer!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Mmmmmmmmm, bottle from Chaucers. The archetype of what makes a great Abt/Quad. Theres a reason why this is considered in the ranks of the Rochefort 10 and the Westvleteren 12. Lots of maltiness and dark fruits such as plums and dates. A little bit of spice on the tongue, but mostly the dark fruits and caramels. Excellent beer.

Bruin, bijna amberkleurig en troebel bier met redelijk beperkte beige schuimkraag. Neus doet in eerste instantie fruitig en een beetje wijnachtig aan. Verder aroma van gebrand malt, butterscotch. Medium body, weinig koolzuur. Complexe smaak, mooie mix van zoet en bitter met lichte zure tonen.
nice belgian, not to boozy
UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Lettdrukket mørkt klosterøl.  Hint av frukt og lakris. Litt bitter ettersmak. God karbonering. Et godt øl. Melkebaren.
UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Et godt mørkt øl.  Friskt på smak og lettdrukket.  Et øl å anbefale i godt selskap.

Had out of a 12oz bottle. Pours deep dark murky brown with a nice big beige head. This beer has a marvelous aroma. Fruity and dominated by raisins and brown sugar with a hint of red wine and citrus. Taste is alcoholic. A lot of caramel malty sweetness. Fruity flavor with a lot of yeast and hops. This is a great quadruple. I am impressed.

Had this out of a bottle. It poured a murky brown and like pop. It was very effervescent with a nice head. After it has some time in the glass the effervescence goes away. It smells fruity and raisin with a little malts. The taste is similar to its nose but you can definitely taste the 10.5% alcohol. Its a pretty good quadruple but not as good as the Trappist rochefort 10.
Esta cerveza es excelente, y cada sorbo es mejor. Combina un sabor dulce con el de alcohol (10º). Perfecta.

Klein bottle. Hazy brown with a good sized head. Nose is quite fruity, brown malty beery. Theres the candi and westmalle-like yeast signature, and a plummy/raisin- fruityness which isnt porty or too dark, but rather balanced. Body is fullish. Sweetish malts, candi, yeasty goodery. A very good abbey quad. Full of flavour, but not too heavy. Quite drinkable, considering the abv.

Dark amber a bit hazy color, minimal white head. Sweet aroma of caramel, malt, dark fruits and coffee. Taste of caramel malts, dark fruits, some citrus and yeast, quite sweet with moderately bitter finish. Full body and medium carbonation, smooth palate, alcohol is very well hidden. Very elegant and delicious beer.

Bottle. Pours chestnut brown with medium white head. Aroma improves with rising temperature: notes of molasses, caramel, brown sugar, licorice, fennel, port wine and rye bread. Taste is medium sweet, light acrid and light acidic. Body is oily and chalky with lively carbonation. Finish is a long with notes of malt, vinegar, caramel and cream.
A brown pour with a white head. A strong rich flavor with fruity, malty, and hoppy overtone. Best beer in the world (that Ive had thus far).
Cloudy brown pour, thin cream head. Aroma of banana, cloves toast, bread dough, sweetness. taste is sweet banana, yeast, creamy toasty malts. Finishes sweet and smooth. Amazing.

La grande classe !
Je ne suis peut être pas complètement objectif car cest depuis longtemps ma préférée. Mais après lavoir regouté à la suite dune trentaine dautres bière, je suis bien décidé a camper sur mes positions.
Sa mousse, sa texture, ses arômes, ses saveurs et son corps, cest un sans faute a chaque fois !
(caramel, réglisse, pointe de fruits rouges)
Bottle 33 cl.

The absolute top quality in the hierarchy of the St. Bernardus beers. It is also the beer with the highest alcohol content (10.50 %). A dark ivory coloured beer with a high fermentation. The show piece of the brewery. Thanks to its soft and unconditionally genuine aroma, the beer can be smoothly tasted. The Abt has a very fruity flavour.

This pours a medium brown color with a foamy, beige head. It has a very inviting aroma of malts and yeast. The taste is rather amazing and easy to see why this is considered one of the best beers in the world. The texture is well carbonated as wheat, spices, and yeast tickles your taste buds. Quite filling and very well made, as if I would expect anything less from Belgium.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: Creamy long lasting head. Deep dark brown beer.
Nose: dark fruits, dark chocolate, some alcohol hints, lots of malts, has a specific "Westvleteren-like" nose, though its not the same beer.
Taste: chocolate, quadruppel like, malts again, very balanced for its alcohol, lots of caramel, little bitter.

Shockingly quaffable for such strength in alcohol..you could happily down 4 bottles (33cl) without realising you can no longer stand up! Pours with rich  colour into a St Bernardus chalice, mousy head dsapting quickly to leave a treacly yet light brew with a sweet Carmel aroma wig strong overtones  of banana, vanilla and cut wood, smell is crazy.  taste is so smooth and refined for such a powerful brew, too moreish for my weak resolve!

A magnificent beer, consistently good.

IT pours deep dark reddish brown with ruby highlights, it is translucent; the head is light-tan and marshmallow-like. The aroma has notes of: figs brown sugar, rum, peppercorns, and dates. The taste is medium  sweet that finishes light sweet; there are notes of: molasses, figs, pepper, toffee, and cloves. The palate is full-bodied, sticky, has low-carbonation, and a long sweet finish. Overall, almost as good as the Westvleteren XII (considering the similarities in yeast and brewing), and definitely a million times more economical.
Fine full body, very tastefull, surely one of the better beers consumed lately. Very complete product with its fruitiness, bitterness and lingering aftertaste.

On tap and chalice served at the Bavarian Lodge in Lisle, IL.. Displayed a clear & bright, ruby highlighted mahogany color, with a persistent head of  creamy white foam, and doily-like lacing. The nose was dark & dried fruit, candi & caramel sweetness, and a hint of banana from the Belgian yeast. The flavor was rich, sweet, lightly syrupy, moderately carbonated, medium+ bodied, with the alcohol making its presence known upon warming. Very nice!

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy red glowing darkest amber colour with huge firm, frothy, lasting, moderately lacing, off-white head. Fruity aroma has notes of red and dark berries, a dry touch of fruit parings. Taste is fruity, yeasty, alcoholic. Not that outstanding.

Tried this in a blindtasting with Westvleteren 12 (2005 and 2006) and rochefort 10. Suprised me by coming out last... Anyways, here it is:

Pours dark ruby with a small offwhite head. Smell is strong on the sweet side, with not much more than sweet candysugar. Taste is kind of astringent/metallic, with some basement-like flavours. Also very sweet with candysugar. 

I had high expectations, but this wasnt really all that much for me...

Dark deep brown with a red tint and a thick, lasting, lacy, creamy head. Smells of dark fruit  raisins, grapes, caramel and toasted malt with honey, yeast- dough, and some chocolate roasted notes. Tastes of a Trappist beer. Complex and malty. Fruity taste with caramel malt and a nutty centre with nice roast bitterness and a soft alcohol that Im sure would pass with some aging. So smooth and easy to drink it mostly never comes to mind that its 10.5%. A great beer and would happily enjoy again. I would like to get a larger bottle and age this sucker for about a year. Nice balance. A world classic

Originally reviewed: 11/27/12. Spent the holiday weekend down in Greenville, SC with some friends and had to go the Trappe Door for my Belgian fix. I really wanted a Quad, but alas, there were none on draft. This is one Ive wanted to try for quite some time, but keep passing up. Not this time. This was the small 11.2oz bottle, poured into a St. Bernardus chalice.

Pours a dark ruby-mahogany garnet with a small sheet of lace on top. Rich aroma of plum, grape, stawberry, alcohol, all washed in a pleasant floral scent. Carbonated well. Good heft to this makes this a great sipper. Holds up the richness of this beer quite well. 

The flavors mirror the aroma making this one a nice decadent treat. Fig, raisin, plum, molasses, syrup, and just a touch of booze on the finish. Theres a lot going on here, and Im not sure this bottle was big enough for me to capture all of the nuances. I guess thats what the 750s are for. This was a treat, and one I would gladly have again.

Volle neus van banaan en perzik. Fijn zacht en vol scala aan rijp fruit met kruidige toetsen. Afdronk is licht bitter en de alcohol komt nu pas iets naar boven en prikkelt wat in de mond. Smaak blijft niet lang plakken. Geweldig gebrouwen bier. Mooi en vol in evenwicht. Hoge alcoholpercentage zit kunstig verborgen. Rustig genieten. Heerlijk!
Bomber. Huge beer. Ever evolving flavors of caramel, raisins, plums and Belgian yeast.  Really good stuff.

UPDATED: MAR 3, 2014 Dark dark dark muddy brownish with off white head - looks dangerous. Aroma is yeast, then as warms up, toffee smells. Taste is fantastic - grape followed by caramel and toffee arising from the malt and belgian sugars. As it warms it becomes even more thick and warming. The alcohol is scarily hidden here. Not my favourite (Rochefort 10!) mainly because it is a very subtle brew and not crazy intense.

This is just a great Belgian beer!  I'm not going to try to describe it. There are plenty of other reviews that do that.  Instead I will just tell you to try it.  You won't be disappointed!  I have found that it pairs well with a nice mild goat cheese and crackers. Grab one and enjoy it!

---Mr. Dizzle

Belgian style beer tasting. Bottle. Dark ruby beer with a small head. Aroma of malts and warm alcohol. The taste is threaded with the alcohol warmth, not as strong as expected at its ABV though. It tastes of dark fruity malts and caramel. Very soft and smooth on the palate. Very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Fantastica quadruple al naso frutti rossi con leggero sentore di cioccolato/caffè e a lungo andare affiora un profumo di banana. Al gusto equilibrata corposa e molto complessa. Promossa a pieni voti. 

---Rated BY Italianbeer85
Ask for something with a good raisin back to it at the bar. This is what i got, will for now on drink this at Cafe Benelux
One of the best beer there is in Belgium. absolute top quality belgian style

Bottle at world of beer. Figs, caramel, malt, Spicey.  Excellent.  Give me more.  



               

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Two years old. Poured a nice murky brown with a fluffy head. Aroma was of Belgian yeast and dry red wine (that won me over) along with pitted cherries. Taste of dark fruits up front with the classic Belgian yeast. Finish was dry allowing you to crave more. Mouthfeel was light with prickly carbonation.

Dark deep brown with a red tint and a thick, lasting, lacy, creamy head. Smells of dark fruit  raisins, grapes, caramel and toasted malt with honey, yeast- dough, and some chocolate roasted notes.  Tastes of a Trappist beer. Complex and malty. Fruity taste with caramel malt and a nutty centre with nice roast bitterness and a soft alcohol that Im sure would pass with some aging. So smooth and easy to drink it mostly never comes to mind that its 10.5%. A great beer and would happily enjoy again. I would like to get a larger bottle and age this sucker for about a year. Nice balance. A world classic

Nice dark-red color. Very sweet aroma. Nice sweet taste and a full body. Also a full sweet aftertaste.

Mooie donkerrode kleur. Zoet aanwezig aroma. Lekkere zoete smaak. Vol aanwezige body. Ook de nasmaak is zoetig en vol.

Pours dark brown with only a bit of head. Aroma is full of different fruits, malt and a hint of alcohol. Taste has more of the same but with a bit of caramel and an bitter smooth flavor. Very balanced and overall a great quad.
Its a beer to test if you dont know it, in Belgium its a big classic! Quite strong, with a very well balanced sweetness, try it !

They say its a near copy of Westvleteren 12. Reviewed by many as worlds best beer.
Im not sure how close this is to the W12, but this is not my favorite beer.

appearance: Copper brown with creme firm head. Nice lacing. 

smell: Hard to pin point what im getting. Its sort of a acidic medicinal smell together with brown sugar. 

taste: There is some medicinal flavors going on, green apple and spices with alcohol in the nose. Some clove and very faintly some cinnamon. Followed by a more bodied brown sugar kick. Its at this point the beer feels more defined and whole. But the finish is then again quite spicy and alcohol tasting. The flavors seem to be gone quite quick. 

mouthfeel: Loads of carbonation. Actually quite a kick. Lacks a bit of creaminess to it. Its slighly milky maybe, but leaves a bit of a slimy effect on the pallet. 

overall: Not the best beer ive had. Maybe its because i had high expectations. But ive had 4 the last few months and ive had mixed experiences.
Great beer with a sweet tasty background. This us either a great starter or great ender.

Pours an average light brown frothy head that mostly diminishes. Body is red brown and cloudy. Aroma contains caramel, raisin, dough, plum, grape, coffee, slight roasted matls, cherry, forest fruits, wine, pear, spices, lemon and orange zest. Flavor starts off light acidic, to go to sweet and to finish in light bitterness. Body is medium, texture creamy and carbonation somewhere between soft and fizzy. Outstanding beer, very complex and much alike Westvleteren 12, but somehow less subtle and lesser aroma's.
Rød farge, tynt hvitt skum. Diskret aroma, strir munnfølelse, karamell, krydder, fint balansert, søt
Heerlijke quadrupel. Mooie kleur met een donkere volle schuimkraag. heeft een volle, bijna romige smaak. Heeft wat noten van karamel met een hoppige en toffee nasmaak.
Bottle @ Alus Salons. Dark brown with small head. Malty, fruty - very complex taste. Great quad!!!
Amazing quad! Malty, no head, and bitter. Amazing palate. Little head.

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2013 Dark brown reddish colour. Small white head stuck to the glas. Smells of candis sugar and toffe, very sweet smell. Malts, alcohol, spices, candis, hay(??) and some astringency. Very viscous and type specific.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber with a light tan head. Cloudy. Aroma is raisin, prune, yeast, and toffee. Flavor is stone fruit, raisin, phenols, and yeast. Full body. Great beer.

330 ml bottle @ Amundsen Bryggeri & Spiseri,Oslo
February 11,2013
Dark brown in color.A bit vinous beer.
Aroma of caramel,fruits,a bit yeast and oak.
Taste is fruits,caramel and a bit spices
A nice winter warmer

Dark brown with copper highlights, about two fingers of heads that fades but leaves thick sheets of lace.  The aroma is complex; dense, dry, rich, fruity.  The flavor is slightly sweet up front and dry and very crisp in the finish, and in between there are different notes with every sip.  Citrus and bananas, toffee, chocolate, caramel, walnuts, coffee... and then, on the exhale, other combinations of those flavors present.

33cl bottle. Thick brown appearance with thin frothy head. My nose is a little blocked so let's skip that part...wonderful heavy biscuit-y taste with caramel, banana and fruit notes. Really delicious to drink, warms the throat. It is very close to West XII in terms of greatness, in fact I'm gonna have to drink one of those tomorrow just to be sure! Highly recommended. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Blue Dog in Chalfont, PA. This beer is so unbelievably smooth that I really have nothing else to say.

Bottle at home, side-by-side with Westy 12 and Rochefort 10; 2011 Vintage. Pour is deep crimson-brown with a ling-lasting, frothy tan head and great lacing. Big dark fruits, caramel, belgian yeast, candi sugar, dark cherries, a touch of blackberries, bread, and toffee in the aroma. Taste is dark fruits, sherry, a touch of roast, bread, toffee, caramel, somewhat vinous, grapey, plummy, and sweet with a light alcoholic burn on the finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Great quad and very complex, but definitely a step below, both Westy 12 and Rochefort 10.

Poured into a Chimay chalice. Dark brown with a thick inch of foam that seems to last forever. When I first put the glass to my nose all I could smell was green apple, wonderful. The taste is just amazing. Carmel, dark fruit some green apple. Had to describe. Mouthfeel is medium with lots of carbonation. Halfway through the glass and theres still a quarter inch of foam. This may be one of the best beers Ive ever had. Simply amazing.

2012/12/31 - Pours a typical Dark brown/red trappist cloudy color. Visible particulate. Nice layer of Foamy, off white head. aroma is belgian yeast , banana, dough, toffee and dark fruits. Alcohol is apparent, but not overpowering. Dark dough, caramel, coffee, spices and dark fruit flavors. Heavy mouth feel. Extremely smooth. One of the best Belgian quads out there.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Deep cloudy brown with a steady, whipped tan head.
Aroma is soft, full...plums...malt.
Taste is sweet fruit, with a well-balanced alcohol backbone.
Slightly raisiny.
Comparable to Westvleteren XII....as some say.....only not quite so creamy, complex or chocolate noted.
A very fine beer all on its own merit.

330ml Bottle. Red brown. Large and lasting frothy head. Aroma: Yeast, dark fruits (dates and raisin) and spicy. Taste: Lots of dark and dried fruits, little banana and soft alcohol. Sweet and medium+ body, average and fizzy carb.

Csúcs ez a sör!!!Nem tolakodó mégis hirtelen támad az ízlelőbimbóinkra a magas alkoholtartalmával rendelkező vöröses-barnás színű,aszalt gyümölcsökre emlékeztető erőssen fűszeres ízű nedü!
Mindenképp kipróbálandó!!!!

This is ultimate in Belgian beers. No. Scratch that. This is the ultimate in beers, period. The heavy-weight champion. This has to be one of the most complexly, well-balanced beers Ive ever tasted. 

You havent tried beer till youve tried Abt 12

Et voici la 8ème merveille du monde, la basilique que lon navait pas retrouvée depuis
les temps antiques ... Je mexplique un peu : je peux dire pour plusieurs raisons
que cette bière peut être considérée comme la 8 ème trappiste (donc la 7ème de Belgique)
si jai la gentillesse dinclure la Trappe dans les trappistes authentiques...
On doit témoigner un respect maximal pour un brasseur qui a brassé (cest comme le chasseur
qui a chassé) la trappiste de Westvleteren... En effet, les bons moines ont confié leur recette
à un civil pour faire le travail de brassage....
Je suppose quen reconnaissance éternelle, le brasseur a voulu depuis porter fièrement le nom
dun saint, et quoi de mieux que St Bernard  Je brode, mais cette légende que jinvente
ressemble étrangement à la vérité...
Ce breuvage me rend strictement mystique à chaque fois que je le verse dans un verre.
Déjà il faut être très prudent et bien armé pour louvrir, parce que sa force vive à louverture
est proverbiale. Lécume ressemble sous la capsule à un océan déchaîné qui est impatient 
de vous révéler toute sa puissance dabord alcoolique (12 sur la capsule mais en fait 10,5 % abv,
sauf si on la laisse vieillir, auquel cas cette bière peut atteindre son niveau affiché), mais
aussi gustative... Au simple décapsulage, on est en présence des arômes qui se développent
dans la pièce, comme une fleur de printemps qui se répand dans votre intérieur.
Strictement fabuleux.
La couleur est un brun marron châtaigne tout à fait typique des trappistes brunes.
Déjà à ce niveau on est fixé... Que dire du reste ??
Clarté assez opaque, quoique en transparence on peut se rendre compte du pétillant fin
et bien réparti.
La mousse beige est bien crémeuse et vient tapisser ce breuvage divin, comme il sied à
un ornement religieux.
Les arômes, aaaah les arômes, comment vous expliquer .
Un jardin dOrient en pleine explosion, un volcan darômes, dabord sur la pomme cuite,
puis le pruneau (dAgen bien sûr), le banyuls millésimé, le porto vintage du bien nommé
Douro, des nuances de levure en suspension et une pointe de banane (pas la commerciale,
mais la petite africaine savourée sur place).
La texture est douce et suave, veloutée comme un tapis de mohair.
La 1ère bouche, que je mets en principe quasi 5 minutes à savourer, est un complexe
incalculable de nuances, avec des fruits mûrs, du pruneau, des céréales maltées, de la 
levure en quantité, avec de façon très amusante une pointe de bigarreau en arrière-bouche...
Mais que cette bouche est pleine et merveilleuse....
La 2ème que lon aura donc attendu longtemps... est sur lirish whiskey avec une pointe
de girofle qui aurait trempé dans lalcool quelques mois. 
La 3ème est de retour sur le vieux banyuls, la vigne du Médoc, le gâteau de Savoie, la
brioche, avec une très fine pointe de sureau tendre. Tout un art. Un plat 3 étoiles de 
restaurant de classe mondiale. Une fontaine dimpressions qui vous inondent et vous 
laissent quasi inconscient...
La levure est un véritable miracle, avec de larmagnac, du bois de chêne, de la prune mûre
et une pointe de vanille.
La longueur est divine, éternelle.
La finale est angélique.
Cette bière, et cest une des rares, a limmense pouvoir de me shooter à chaque fois...
cest un mystère divin qui se développe et se révèle devant vous comme la transsubstantiation,
et je peux vous dire que cest aussi long que ce mot... et même tout le sermon de la messe
du dimanche....
Cette bière est divine, et comme le divin est incommensurable, il ny a virtuellement pas de
cote pour cette bière. Si vous en voulez une absolument (très beau jeu de mots), alors disons
777 sur 100. Cest ma cote pour la Westvleteren 12, je ne peux pas plus, et quel honneur pour
cette bière...  Je voulais vous loffrir pour ma 50ème cote de 5 en bières belges. Merci mon dieu.

Poured from a 750ml bottle into a stemless goblet, many times. The aroma shows a bowl of dark fruit underneath the cascade of alcohol and chocolate. Blackberries, Concord grape jam, and a scintilla of Merlot. A stormy diadem of a head oozed globules of jeweled lacing from brim to base of the glass. On swilling, roused memories of coconut haystacks, chocolate-dipped banana, chocolate chip funnel cake, with a rich caramel and calvados kind of finish. Leaves a lasting impression in mouth feel like drinking a heavily oaked Cognac.
This beer was very good it had some real good flavors the aroma was good and it was smooth for a high alcohol beer.
Pours a dark colour, taste is rich and spicy with some malt on the palate, would like to try again
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 Great beer. Starts briefly strong but it smoothes out quickly. Little after taste. Fruit, malt, and just an awesome quadrupel! Came in a 50oz magnum bottle.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2013 Poured from magnum (excellent Christmas present, Brandon), reddish and clear. Cream head. Boozy note. Complex but super clean.

Bought the less than 12oz. bottle. Poured to a tulip glass. Brown in color with a fluffy white head. Aroma of dark fruits, and bread. Taste is very smooth, creamy mouthful of fruits, belgian spices, yeast, dough, not much detection of alcohol, and tasty. Enjoyable beer and will definitely have again.

1 pt 9.4 oz bottle. Pours golden amber with thick bubbles cream head. Smell is sweet, apple, raisin and bread. Taste matches the scent with a light balanced amount of hops and warming finish. Delightful beer, great balance. A delight. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown, cloudy color with creamy head. Nice aroma, sweet, dark malt and some fruits. Taste is good and rich, but too alcoholic for me. Overall excellent beer.

erveja que dispensa comentários! Eleita por muitos como uma das melhores do mundo, essa Belgium dark Strong ale fala por si só. Coloração escura, com carbonataçao marcante, desprendendo um aroma complexo e intenso, frutado como deve ser. O primeiro gole desce impactante, com notas amadeiradas, remetendo a frutas secas, banana e ameixas. O álcool aparece em seguida, sutil. Retrogosto marcante de frutas secas. Uma breja para se apreciar!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy copper brown. Off white head. Very carbonated. Aroma is subtle. Banana, bread, cereal, some fruit. Taste is sweet but more bitter than expected. Spicey, malty, fruitcake with a dry bitter finish. Very drinkable for abv.

Appearance: Cloudy dark brown color with a creamy tan head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Slightly sweet and complex. Fruity and dark malt.Palate: Full body. Balanced sweetness and a fine bitterness. Creamy carbonation. Oily texture.Taste: Fruity and sugary without being heavy sweet. Complex and balanced. Light spicy and some alcohol coming through.Overall impression: Complex and heavy. A beer that is best when ou are not having a lot of others. Still have one left. One quiet evening when it is cold outside a nice fire in the fireplace.Personal stats: Bottle  from a trade with ★Grima★.

750ml bottle. No Date. Poured into oversized snifter and allowed to sit. Very sweet aroma, dark fruits, plums, cherries, brown sugars. Very thick through the mouth, rich and filling. I really do like this stuff, and it gives any Quad a run for its money.

Bomber, split with myself.  Pours a cloudy brown with thin beige head that quickly recedes. Aroma is cherry, banana, fig, caramel. Sweet malts with a smooth finish.  The alcohol is well hidden but leaves you with a nice warm feeling in your stomach.  Really good quad.

Best of breed quad. Pours murky brown. The high ABV is quite well hidden and actually contributes to the flavor, inspiring the dark fruit notes, which the typical Belgian carbonation causes to dance on the tongue. Amazingly drinkable for a quad as well; if you are having this style, it's hard to imagine finding better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a cream colored head. Medium carbonation. This beer full of fruit and spice but balanced nicely with a lot of malt character. Great beer.
Den här skulle behöva lagras några år då smakerna inte riktigt kommer till sin rätt. Smak och doft av karamell, bränt socker, farinsocker. Söt och oljig.

On tap served in a branded, long stemmed snifter, at Biercraft on The Drive in Vancouver. Very dark, but not quite black, rather a very dark brown, with light tan head. Ripe fruits on the nose. The taste is bready, fruity, yeasty and malty. Yes, its got just about everything, and well it should at $10 a glass! Yummy!

Bottle from sampling session. 2008 vintage. From notes (Nov. 12, 2012). Sweet sherry-like aroma. Very complex mid and final: root beer, chocolate, licorice. OAK really comes through, although this isnt barreled (is it?)
Nice hazy red brown pour with white head. Sweet on the nose. Malt and yeast. Sweet and creamy. Good beer.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2014 Deep dark brown colour with red shine. Thick brown head, short lasting. Smells caramel, rhum and also some chocolate. Taste is sweet, liquorice, raisins and more. Alcohol well balanced. Complex beer. Great, really great.
Really really nice beer. Well balanced with the ETOH being well hidden. Very nice.

Bottle.  Dark pour. Very flavorful with rich chocolate, fruit favors. Higher carbonation and not dense. Could drink several in a sitting.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a slightly hazy dark brown with a good amount of off-white head. Smell is really nice, some sweetness, some dark fruit, and a slight hint of dough. Palate is on the heavy side of medium and has a good amount of carbonation. Taste is sweet at first then gets a bit of a roasty malty flavour which also has a slight bit of bitterness, which then gives way to a longer lasting roasty and slightly bitter aftertaste. Very nice, and quite complex, just what I like in a quad.

Strong beer great taste and long aftertaste also high in alcohol it drinks smooth and it digest fast in jour system.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone By Belleketels

Dark red-brown color and a fully lasting off-white head. Aroma is malty and yeasty, releases red fruits, caramel, alcohol. Sweet flavor but balanced with some bitterness, very long lasting. Full and oily body is ease with lively carbonation. A good quadrupel, not easy to drink alone.
