Head: brown, shrinking fast. Colour: clear ruby brown. Aroma: hops, caramel, yeast. Taste: bitter sweet. Palate: dry, medium bitter sweet finish, medium CO2. Overall: very nice.

I simply can not say enough about this brew. The Trappists at St. Bernardus have got it right: Sultana and sugar follow this beautifully malty brew. Slight marmite tangs blend so well into complex malt and fruit notes. Try just to be scotched.
Bottle, clean walnut pour w/ night sky head, juicy vanilla raisin aroma, full and sweet with a cmplex dried fruit profile, lots of rumm sugar, finishes surprisingly dry for a guad, delicious

Aromas of strawberries, grapes, cocoa, raisins, dark earth, and toast.  Dark reddish-purple with ruby highlights, and a long-lasting, small, off-white head.  Sweet with predominant rich, fruity and dark malty flavors.  Full body, creamy carbonation, spicy, strong, with a moderately long, very balanced finish.  Excellent.

330ml bottle. Dark chestnut color. Small off-white head stays forever. Burnt sugar, malt, faint raisins, alcohol in aroma. Alcohol, roasted malts, faint liquorice, slight breadyness in flavor. Very drinkable.
Buena cerveza para terminar. Bastante cuerpo, sabor bastante dulce, no demasiado alcohol.

33 cl bottle. One of my favourite beers, in my top 5. Plain delicious. Vivacious head (be careful with the overflowing when opening the bottle) which rapidly turns into a beautiful brown layer , dark brown color and murky liquid. The aroma is perfect, with hints of caramel, bread, chocolate, raisins and plums. Very malty. The taste is an absolute sensation, very balanced and refined. You just want to drink more and more. Full body, creamy texture and perfect average carbonation. The finish is long and a pure pleasure, with a slight bite of alcohol and a smooth and complex savour. You can feel in your mouth, perfectly integrated, all the things that you smelled in the first place. Overall one of the best beer I have ever tasted, at the same level that Rochefort 10. Both perfect beers, but I think that this is more accessible and a great choice for the novice to discover the belgian trappist quads.
Qué puedo decir ante la que sea una de mis cervezas favoritas..., solo disfrutarla como se merece..

33cl bottle, gift. Hazy brown pour with a tall beige head which subsides somewhat, but has excellent retention and leaves heavy lace. Nose is heavy malt, nuts and some citrus hops. Heavy body with fine, creamy carbonation. Ripe peaches, raisins, plum, caramel and a touch of citrus hops. Finish is medium and still confectioners sugar sweet. Very well integrated, but nothing super interesting.

Bottle. A clear dark red-brown colour with a high tanned head. An aroma of malt, coffee, plums, raisins and alcohol. The taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. A full body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long duration.

330ml bottle, poured into Leffe chalice. Dark auburn colour, 90% opaque, one finger tanned head, decent retention, fair amount of lacing. Aroma was grape and booze, slightly musty. Tasted rasin, plum, fig, fudge, molasses and brown sugar. Quite boozy compared with Rochefort 10. Finish was slightly bitter and biscuity. Well carbonated, light body, smooth but had a slightly coarse edge from the booze. It seemed to mellow as it warmed, got less boozy and the carbonation dropped off slightly. A very good beer rather than a great beer, places below Rochefort 10.

11.2oz Bottle A - Pours a hazy chestnut with a tan head. Huge floaters. Good lacing. S - Subtle, mild caramel, yeast, faint dried fruit. T - Sweet caramel malt, figs, raisins. Alcohol hidden well. M - Medium bodied. Tingly champagne bubbles. Smooth & creamy as it warms up. Sweet finish. O - Very good Big Belgium!

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2013 Both a 750ml bottle at Waterfront Ale House from a kind patron and on draft at BXL East.  Lovely dark pour with a frothy off-white head and a fruity (raisins, figs, plums) and caramel flavor and aroma. Incredibly smooth finish and balance on the palate.  Lovely stuff.

Westvletern 12 lighter and sweeter.  Smell like juicy fruit gum. Cloudy brown color.  Medium carbonation.  Slightly thick mouth feel.  Little bitter after taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: The pour is a cloudy dark mahogany with decent head. .

S: Good but not great aromas of sweet malt, caramel, and yeast. There might be a touch of alcohol as well.

T: A slight warming feel of alcohol goes well with some dark fruits and sweet, caramel malt. The yeast is not as quite prominent as many other Belgian beers.

M: Even with the high level of carbonation, the body is still quite full.

D: The alcohol makes itself known more in terms of the subtle warmth it provides the beer but isn't aggressive by any means. The flavors are sweet but balanced and are helped out by the carbonation.  Tastes like a Westvleteren 12 lite.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Kaatuu lasiin rubiininpunaisena/colanvärisenä keskikokoisella, valkoisella vaahdolla. Hajussa on kuivattua hedelmää, anista, luumua, ruohomaisuutta, tuoretta eksoottista hedelmää ja ripaus mausteisuutta. Maku on anismainen, vahvemman mausteinen, tuorean eksoottisen hedelmäinen (banaania, mangoa, sitrusta ainakin), luumumainen, kuivatun hedelmäinen ja hieman alkoholinen. Suutuntuma on lähes täyteläinen ja hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena todella loistava tuotos, yksi monimuotoisimmista ja täyteläisimmistä oluista, jonka olen tähän mennessä juonut ja on top5:ssä. Kypsyttely ehkä tekisi hyvää?

Brownish amber hue with a white head. Aroma of raisins and burnt candy sugar. Flavors include, malt, toffee, prunes and warming alcohol. Full mouthfeel with a pleasant, drying alcoholic finish. In my top 20!

Color cobrizo con espuma media. Aromas a Malta y especiados. Tb de fermentaciÃ³n. Matices de fruta ciruela. En boca presenta entrada dulce y amargor ajustado al final. Cuerpo medio alto. Postgusto largo y oleoso. Picor del carbÃ³nico. Sabor muy intenso. Muy rica y bastante compleja Filip

Pours a deep Amber with a fluffy Tan head. Aromas are malty with a prune and fruit. Taste is sweet with a bread and dry malt character. Pleasant aftertaste. Mouthfeel is nice and full. Lacing is also top notch
Murky burnt umber in hue. Bold,  full body, malty. Smacks of raisin, carmel and horehound. Smooth finish. Not too sweet or bitter. Subtle aftertaste.
Bouteille de 750ml, robe brune (violette), arôme de levure belge et de petites fruits sauvages, goût qui concorde aux arômes.

Pours an amber color with a finger head that doesnt go down much.  I got mostly plumb on the nose, as well as a bit of licorice.  Was bombarded with maltiness and was not overly sweet, if that makes sense.  I could understand fasting when you have this to drink.  Full bodied, but the finish doesnt last long.  This beer was a true pleasure to drink, a new standard on the style.
By far...the BEST beer that Ive ever tasted & Ive tasted well over +500 different kinds of beers in my lifetime. BARNONE.

We are doing Trappistes Rochefort 10 vs. St. Bernardus Abt. 12. Color is the same and the head is the same - orange brown and a bit cloudy. Aroma of Rochefort 10 is dark fruits,  caramel, melon, flowers. St. Bernardus aroma is chocolate,  earthy, nuts. Taste of Rochefort 10 is light sweet and amazing, so complex. Taste of St. Bernardus is (surprisingly) salty at the beginning then bitter and not so balanced actually. Rochefort palate is medium body, soft carbonation, oily texture. St. Bernardus is medium body , oily texture ,  average carbonation.  For me and my girlfriend Rochefort is the winner - its much more complex on the nose and taste.  Next time I will buy two Rocheforts rather then one St Bernardus and one Rochefort.

Appearance: very dark brown, practically black, medium size dark head that fades quickly Aroma: fruity, sweet Taste: moderately sweet, bit of fruit at the end Palate: hint of c02 burn, some froth, not much aftertaste Overall: hides the alcohol really well, not as complex as I thought it would be, a good beer tho ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
A rich brown beer with a thick head that dissipates relatively quickly.  The flavor is rich and complex without much of an aftertaste.  This was a little expensive but worth every penny.

A rich camel pour with a thick white head.  A high level of carbonation that makes the rich flavor of this beer dance on your tongue.  Perhaps the best beer Ive ever had.  It is pricey if you can find it but absolutely worth the price.
thick reddish caramel brown. Aromas of caramel, raisin and sweet bread. Dried fig, raisin and gingerbread on the palate. Malty and rich but balanced. Delicious.

I had this next to some Westvleteren 12, and it paled in comparison.  The aroma and flavor are not nearly as vibrant.  That being said, it wasnt bad.  It tastes of dark fruits, yeast, spice.  Theres a little grape soda in there as well.

On tap at duche central (mkt) . Pours a very cloudy muddy brown colour with small off white head disappearing quickly. This may be because of the really high pour but hey good bang for your buck so I shouldnt be complaining. Aromas of dark dried fruits notably plum, Candied sugar, caramel, perfumy, and very little booze. Flavours are exactly the same with a slight warming feeling.

Pours a darky murky cola looking color into the glass.  Nice one finger head that quickly dissipates.  The aroma was big dark fruits(plum?), slight molasses smell, but that was probably just more dark fruit, some bready notes.  Nice pop of carbonation at the tip of the tongue, This is followed by some bready notes and plum or raising flavor.  The taste is very similar to the nose.  As it warms it seems to become more rounded tasting.  I found no hint of the 10.5% ABV in the taste.  This was a good beer, very drinkable, and excellent example of a Quad style beer, however I think Rochefort 10 is more worth the money.

Deep brown, almost black; patchy light tan head; plently of floaty bits; aroma of sweet dark fruits, yeast, honey and molasses; chewy malts, spice and sticky stewed fruits - raisins, oranges; quite fizzy; underpineed by warmth from the alcohol; a toffeeish sweetness on the finish, which has a salty whiskeyesque feel to it; very good, but not exceptional like the Rochefort 10 (Westvleteren 12 still to come for me!)

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 Re-rated on 25/12/2013 as Christmas 2013 Belgian Quads Parallel Tasting" - Part 2 of 3

330 ml bottle bought at Belgian Beer International in Tsuen Wan.
Preparation: bottle maintained at ambient temperature of 10°C - 12°C overnight; Popped at 10.6°C (within recommended temperature range) onto the Chimay chalice.

Looks: Translucent blackish brown colour with dirt-like yeast sediments; Two and half finger head and beautiful, lasting light beige foam; Excellent sticky lacing with active carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant vanilla and bubble gum as soon as it was popped, with nicely-woven raisin, banana, caramel, sugar, cream, strong Bel yeast, malt, cinnamon, cloves and herbs. What a beauty! 

Taste: A great combination of flavours, started out with intense plum, raisin and dark fruits, closely followed by warming alcohol, sugar, malt, light banana, cream, bourbon, strong herbs, spices and fairly light grass.

Body: Mid to light, slightly slick and creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: a fantastic combination of taste varieties  intense dark fruits, good impression of banana, caramel and cream one dont normally find in a Quad, beautiful sweetness with light touch of bubblegum. Full maltyness, strong Bel yeast, and very nice herbal to top it off. Excellent!

Booze and Sweetness: The 10% abv is surely strong but unlike Rochefort 10, it doesnt scream out loud nor it bites my head off with subsequent sips. It hides itself quite well, and has light bourbon to show up now and then to mangle with the tastes. Sugar sweetness is very appropriate, never cloying, just intertwine perfectly with the booze to up the flavours. Marvelous!

Hoppiness: Complex! Fragrant cinnamon, herbal, light cloves and faint grassy nose and taste. Some faint bitterness in the background but at this level, who cares? The comfy sweet booze finish is good enough to round things up.

After Taste: Wet, lightly sweet boozy and smooth to mouth.

Comments: Thought I was too green to rate and appreciate Quads in early 2013, so the opportunity comes in Christmas Day to re-rate this one along with Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren XII, to find out which ones the best and to close the year in style! :)

With this re-rate, I have another perspective of Sint Bernardus 12 and I appreciate it more than ever. Rochefort 10 may have some kiss-ass whiskey and brandy taste, but its also alcoholic as hell and taste varieties is rather limited. On the other hand, Saint Bernardus 12 may have been following the tried and tested path of Strong Belgian Dark, but it truly excels on all front - beautiful colour, lasting head, pleasingly complex aroma and taste, very well-managed alcohol and sweetness - not to mention smooth and comfy to boot. Every aspect of the beer is so balanced and work so well collectively, it really deserves a pat in the back. It was amazing then and it still amaze me now. In absence or scarcity of the precious Westvelteren XII, I wholeheartedly recommend this one over Rochefort 10 on any given day. A true beauty!

Re-rated score: Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 5/5; Taste: 9/10; Palate: 5/5; Overall: 19/20. Re-rated Score: 4.7
-- 

(Original rating on: 06/02/2013)

Cloudy dark ale brown colour; Very good, thick and lasting beige head and frothy; Very good and longlasting lacing and oily; Fine and fragment smell of malt, yeast, plum and fig with a hint of alcohol; Medium body, hops taste minimal; Not quite as smooth to mouth as Chimay Blue but has a pleasant feel, alcoholic taste is subtle and not as pronounce nor potent as Rochefort Trappistes 8; Bitterness is minimal, comfy and subtle; lively, enjoyable throughtout with sweet aftertaste. At abv 10.5%, the rush didnt come as fast as I expected, after 10-15 minutes and its very gradual and I had no bad trip at all, lovely feeling as expected for a good abt. :)

Comments: As one of the top dog, St. Bernardus Abt 12 didnt disappoint. At abv 10.5%, I was worry it may be as boozy and explicit as Rochefort Trappistes 8, but its character hold up elegantly just like Chimay Blue. Its lack of palatable smoothness and creaminess may be the only minus but that doesnt prevent the Abt 12 from being one of the worlds top beers among beer lovers. Excellent with trappist cheese. Highly Recommended!

Original score: Aroma: 9/10; Appearance: 5/5; Taste: 9/10; Palate: 4/5; Overall: 19/20. Original Score: 4.6
Bottled. Pours brown with a huge brown head. Smells caramell malty, nutty, raisins, figs, abit parfume. Tastes caramell malty, figs, raisins, creamy, well balanced, abit alcohol in the tastes.

Pours hazy dark brown with a big, frothy white head that lasts long. Aroma of strong dark fruitiness and sweet maltiness; the usual notes of plum, raisin and licorice appear, as do some spiciness and pear - more fruity than spicy. Taste is medium sweet, malty and fruity. It is quite long and rich, flavours of raisin, pear, sweet dark malts, some yeasty spiciness. Palate is medium to full bodied, not too sticky. Very drinkable given the strength and palate, easier than Rochefort 10, for example. This is a great, malty and fruity quadrupel, one of the best Ive had.

Dit is tot nu toe de lekkerste bier wat ik heb gedronken.
Drink lekker en de smaak blijft lekker lang in de mond.

Tasting in Chimay Goblet, served at 52-60

Aroma is raisony, fig dark fruit in character and smells sweet

Color is dark red with sparkling bubble coming up

Taste, is sweet at first with some lingering bitterness evident of a low residual sweetness and sweetness is probably due do the alcohol level.  Slight afterburn from alcohol, very tasty!  Reminds me of quite a few Dubbels out there but more kick

Palate, very easy drinking and scary at 10.5%, as stated before, pretty dry and easy to drink.

I certainly liked this, a lot less of the plum character I get from westy 12.  I think this has more fruitiness and character that west 12 does.

After having quite a few Belgian Dark Strongs, at this point I am actually liking the Sierra Nevada Oliva

Reviewed 12/04/2012. About time I review this. 11.2 oz bottle into a Duvel tulip.

A: Pours a very dark reddish brown color. The head is a four finger light tan color. Rather than recede in a generic manner, the head merely loses texture before only collapsing partially. There is a LOT of lacing on the glass - not the ringed lacing of a good IPA, but spotty with large clumps.

S: Lots of caramel malts, stewed dark fruits (like fig, plum, and raisin), lighter fruit esters (pear, apple), and a hint of chocolate. Perhaps not as enchantingly nuanced as Rochefort 10, but still wondrously aromatic. Nicely bready.

T: The very first sip is loaded with chocolate, caramel, and dark fruit. After a few more sips, a balanced sensation of pears and phenols pop up on the finish along side faint alcohol warmth. I can also pick up a touch of raspberry and leafy tobacco as well, and the aftertaste has a bit of a milky cream flavor that is immensely enjoyable. It takes a while, but eventually, a spiced sensation of subtle nutmeg and cinnamon on the palate will show itself a little more than half way down the glass. Quite complex, but a little less so than Rochefort 10 - which is a moot point at the end of the day. This still has top caliber balance and craftsmanship.

M: Not perfectly delicate, but the bodys thickness is perfect. Theres just enough of a cleanliness to the finish to encourage one to drink this faster. The booze manifests as a slight warmth on the tongue and stomach - but because of its balance, it just works in concert with the whole experience.

O: It might be one of the more drinkable and balanced quads Ive ever had. Course, Ive never had Westy 12, but Hell, doesnt Westy 12 have a very, VERY similar recipe to this? Ah well, that doesnt matter, because its every bit as mindblowing as I hoped.

d une belle couleur brunatre une force un beau col enpeu fonce ou qu on sens des note de fruits en bouche ellecoule tout suel malgre le taux d alccol et on goute tres bien les fruit confit digne dune biere abt tres bonne (rate 27 )

Draft - Sweet red fruits, raisins, and a bit of alcohol.  Deep solid brown with a minimal head.  Sweet red fruits, no bitterness or alcohol.  A nice abt ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sour currant nose, dark rum appearance, dark fruit and chewing tobacco flavors. Light palate, bitter funky finish. Curdled aftertaste only defect.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is the most beautifully crafted beer I have ever tasted. After the first sip I always instinctively nod my head and think thats the stuff! 

This is a very complex beer. The aroma is of banana, bready, tarty, dark fruit cake, christmas pudding, fresh rolling tobacco and old leather.
The taste is molasses, banana, dark fruits and cakeyness. Full bodied, with a slick oily mouthfeel, excellent carbonation and lacing throughout. It has a very warm alcohol finish that goes all the way down to your stomach. 
An absolute top of the range beer!

Pours a hazy brown with a big off white head. Aroma is heavy sweet caramel some chocolate. Taste is bittersweet, dark fruits and toffee. Very carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
fizzy, medium body,   well balanced beer with a light aftertaste.  The yeast itself is a bit bitter and has great influence on the aftertaste.

Pours just a slightly murky brown, with an everlasting light brown head. Aromas of rum cake, drizzled fruit, some grape drank. Taste is really more reminiscent of a Baltic porter than a quad.  In my opinion, anyway. Which is a good thing. Some deep dark fruity overtones, along with a whole heaping of dirty malt. Drinks pretty good.

average frothy light brown head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. flat thick dark brown body. aroma: moderate malty, orange, raisin, wood, alcohol. if: heavy sweet light bitter. ff: heavy sweet moderate bitter; long duration. palate: medium full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, metallic heavy alcoholic finish. pesado dulçor alcoolico permeado por malte, caramel, chocolate e frutas secas, toques salgados no retrogosto, aroma conhaque, espuma fica cremosa, complexa, álcool não mascara nuances, mas surge bem forte no paladar 280 s
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2015 brilliant appearance with huge brownish-white head and coffee-dark colour; fruity sweetness with a bit too much alcohol-taste, otherwise excellent ale

Decent aroma. Pours a dark, golden brown. The palate is well balanced with some citrus, banana, and a hint of spice. Too much carbonation for my taste. However if you like carbonation in your Belgian beers, this is a great choice. Very drinkable and a much crisper alternative to many heavier belgian beers.

Bottle. Almost clear, deep brown liquid with red edges and a medium to big, fluffy light brown head. Nice lacing. Aroma of dark fruit (plums, figs), light banana, raw sugar, toast, biscuit, some nuts, toffee and some very light alcohol. Very elegant. Taste is light sweet and light bitter with notes of dark fruit, light banana/belgo yeast, a touch of chocolate and nuts. Very drinkable and digestible, as the style is intended to be with the candi sugar and all that. Medium bodied with medium carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel. Not overly carbonated as some examples of similar styles. Very well balanced and elegant stuff already at 4 months old. Will be interesting to see how this develops with age.
goed vol van smaak met een een goede en fruitige afdronk. zeer mooi uitzicht met een mooie creme kleurige schuimkraag.

(From notes 13.11.12) Bottle. Off-white, fluffy head. Bubbles of varying size. Leaves lacing. Very dark brown beer. Aroma is a noticeable sugary sweetness and some yeast. Reminds me of a sweeter Rochefort 10. Flavor is yeasty, warming, sweet. Mouthfeel is creamy, but a bit too much foam. Twirling the liquid a bit gets rid of some effervescence, improving the mouthfeel. Aftertaste is a sweet malt.Fantastic beer, especially once the cabonation settles.

33cl bottle. Pours a hazy red color with a large frothy head and very little lacing. Lots of carbonation. Very alcoholy. Initially sweet and smooth but with a bitter lasting aftertaste. Taste itself is complex but its hard to put my finger on what exactly it is, but theres absolutely lots of fruit, spices and malt in there. Very Belgian Quad like. Would drink again if I can find it at a good price.

.3cl serving in. St. Bern. snifter at ATL Corner Tavern.
VERY durable tan head covers the murky brown ale.  
High ABV is evident in the aroma and obvious in the taste, but well-integrated with the ales other characteritics.  Very fruity, rich and complex aroma, as is the flavor.  Very smooth and creamy feel with a full body.
Reddish brown with a thick, creamy head. Malty with fruity tones. Malt, fruit and toffee. Full body with a very balanced , complex after taste.

1.5 l bottle. Had a hard time getting the cork out. It was as if something tried to prevent us from tasting this beer. After a struggle it finally gave way and we were rewarded by a faboulus beer. Brown colour with a thick beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, yeast, dark fruit. Flavour of caramel, dried fruit. Full bodied.
Bottle pour. Second Quad Ive ever had. Like it a little less than Rochefort, but still a great beer. $12.99 / bottle
It poured a dark amber color with an off-white head. The aroma was of dark fruit and candied sugar.  The taste was similar with fruitiness and a little earthiness.  Very good.

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2012 33cl @home,  
kleur : diep rood/bruin aroma donker fruit, chocolade, caramel, kruidig
smaak: redelijk zoet, redelijk bitter, zeer sterk alcoholisch, mout ,peper, chocolade, caramout, mocca, fruit, smaken zijn goed op elkaar afgestemd
tip: vooral niet te koud drinken, anders mis de je aroma en de complexere smaken. 

 best wel goed bier, ietwat creme achtig

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2013 Bottle To Tulip, bortled bought in ordinary supermarket in Denmark (yes I am jealous). Points very dark Brown with enormous offwhite head that lasts forever. Aroma of bread and sweet fruits. Fantastik taste but difficult To define all the components. This is so much Beer one van get! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is one of the best beers, I have ever tried! It will go with everything from a salad to steak to dessert! One of my favorites!

Sweet funky aroma of bubble gum; feels rich and zingy; Flava is complex blend of root beer, hint of cinnamon ; def Belgian yeast and sugar; brown with thin lasting off- white head; cherry banana as it warms.

Tasting this along with 07 Westy 12. No comparison, very dissimilar in the aroma and flavor profiles. You would never convince me in a blind tasting that these are supposedly the same recipe. Clear reddish brown, very active carbonation, mild amount of lacing, better than Westy for sure. Banana on the nose, some alcohol, yeast, and mild nuttiness. Fruity body, nuts, alcohol, young. Somewhat yeasty in the finish. Not nearly as palatable as the Westy. Westy by TKO, but this is still a very good beer.

A beautiful beer.  Bottled 6/11.  Smells of dark fruits, licorice and candi sugar.  Tastes malty with nice flavors of raisins, plums and licorice.  Palate is silky smooth with medium carbonation.  Overall my favorite beer for the style, with Chimay Blue a close second.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2013 33cl bottle @ De Wiering, Leuven.
Re-Rate 33cl draught @ Castel, Gent.
Pours dark brown to purple, tan cream head. lacing.
Aromas contain vanilla, honey, dark fruit, caramel, whiskey, chocolat.
Taste like chocolate and caramel, fruits and liquorish alcohol in the finish.
Finish is warm and a bit sticky but not too much. Asks for more.
Always love this one.

25.4 oz. bottle.  Pours a very dark amber color with a tan, frothy, head that lasts a long time.  Aromas of licorice, clove, bubblegum and alcohol (kinda like vanilla extract).  Tastes very sweet with hints of bubblegum, licorice, and dried fruit (maybe fig or apricot???).  Beer is full-bodied with a nice creamy texture.  Carbonation is lively.  The finish is smooth and long.

This is one of the finest beers I have ever had.  I look forward to a long and loving relationship.  :)

Brune aux reflets rougeâtres, où une mousse flotte à sa surface tout en sagrippant au verre en y laissant une belle dentelle. Des arômes de cannelle et de levure dès les premiers instant. Ensuite, les fruits secs, mêlés à des odeurs florales. En bouche, cest intense, cest rempli de saveurs qui ne font pas mentir le nez. Cest, encore ici, épicé, cest floral, cest fruité, alors quune douce amertume se défait lentement du goût pour sinstaller tranquillement en arrière-goût. Belle corpulence. Ya du savoir-faire derrière cette bière. Très satisfaisant. (472-301112)

Fantastic brew. Perfect palate and appearance. Fantastic lacing that never disappears. Clear amber brew with no cloudiness.  The taste is raisons plums, apricots, and honey.  This is one of the best brews I have tasted.  Stong and pleasant to the palate to the nose with an essential finish that you can only receive in the 12.  Wow.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2012 Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Dark hazy brown color, small white head. Strong aroma of banana, juice, sweetness, nothing normal. Taste of sweetness, raisin, little alcohol, balanced flavours. Excellent belgian.
bottle. pours dark brown with great head. fruit cake and nut aroma. taste is lots of brown sugar and dried fruit very rich beer.
Sweet malty aroma with a boozy finish.  Goes smooth and leaves a nice alcohol/light banana after taste.
One off my favorites; full flavor, well balanced, alcohol lift, nicely hopped, fruity&spicy aromas like banana

33cl bottle (bottles!!) from Beers Of Europe.
This poured a deep dark brown crowned with a thick brown head.
A chocolate and banana fruity aroma and certainly that hint of warm rubber as described by Tim Webb.Loads of rich tastes there,rich fudgelike chocolate,liquorice,Christmas pudding,fruit,figs.Tastes fantastic  all the way throughand all this just in the 33cl sized bottle.Cannot wait to try the 75cl size and are really miffed we recently missed a chance on one of the last huge sized bottles that they occasionally produced.

Deep red brown coloured ale, nice head that hangs around. Aroma of cherries, berries, and forest fruits, sweet caramel malt and a touch chocolate. Not very bitter. Carbonation is quite high. Lively. Very drinkable. One of the best!

Has some nice bready/fruity caramel notes. Taste is similar with some vinous qualities, super smooth for the abv.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours a beautiful burgundy with a thin white head. Aromas of cherry, plums, caramel malts, and a good whiff of Belgian yeast.  Tastes like a mix of dried dark fruits, particularly cherries, with a very slight alcohol bite and some roastiness. Highly carbonated that spreads the complex flavor and lets it linger in your mouth. Delicious and highly drinkable.

Poured a nearly opaque brown into a Westy 12 glass.  Tasted side by side with the Westy, since they are supposedly a near-identical recipe.  SLightly more head than the westy retreated to a creamy, thin layer.  Like the Westvleteren, a very nice nose with lots of chocolate and coffee, perhaps not as many spice undertones as the Westy.  Lots of roasted malt smoke, hickory-like smokiness.  Some dried fruit in first taste, a bit more chocolate than the westy.  Lots of hop bitterness, roasted malt, a hint of alcohol.  A bit more licorice flavor than the Westy.  This particular bottle was definitely not a direct clone of the Westvleteren 12, but still a phenomenal, well balanced big beer.  One of the top five beers Ive ever tasted.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with Deanso. The aroma is very different and appears yeasty with some malt. The flavour is yeasty rich and alcoholic. This particular example was aged 5 years and it aged well!

Pours a very deep red with a fluffy off-white head. Aroma is boozey, fruity, vanilla, spicy, bubblegum, grapes, pine. Taste is very fruity, very much tasting of grapes, spicy, some yeast, alcohol, a very gentle burn. Its very to the point; its not overly complicated, it doesnt mess around. Some very nice lacing. Lots of carbonation is something I dont generally enjoy, but here it works quite well. Im shocked its taken me this long to try this splendid ale!
No la conocia pero desde mi última visita a Tilburg se ha convertido en mi cerveza belga favorita. Muy suave para la graduación alcohólica que tiene...

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2013 0,33 flaske(fra Belgisk Bryg)  hjemme, delt med Harald: 10% iflg. etiketten. Mørkebrun med høyt beige skum som varer en stund. Aroma og smak av maltsødme, svisker, tørket fiken, mørk sjokolkade, brent sukker og et snev av jordbær i anslaget. Et kompleks og helt fantastisk øl. Fra BB sin hjemmeside: "Bryggeriet Sct. Bernard bryggede indtil 1993 øl på licens for trappist-klostret Sct. Sixtus, der i dag er kendt for sin eksklusive bryg Westvleteren. Aftalen ophørte, da trappistklostret udvidede sin kapacitet, men rygtet vil, at bryggen fra Sct. Bernard stadig brygges på samme gær. " Fra fat på Fermentoren mai-13: o du salige, man kan havne i evangeliseringsmodus av mindre!

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2013 Re-rating.   Bottle->trappist glass.  Cloudy brown with faint head.  Aroma: sweet, dark fruit, honey.  Very pleasant.  Taste: complex fruits, yeast, malt.  High carbonation, great smooth finish.  Excellent.
Taste at the Post Office Vaults from a 1.5 litre bottle; dark brown colour, quite fruity complex taste with well balanced malts. Will have to try my own bottle, normal size though.

The head is average and the body is quite clear. It has a dark/red colour. When I smell this beer I find hints of plum and prune like if it was a dark fruit eau-de-vie. How interesting ! We can feel its cholates and caramel malts and a slight taste of grapefruit, a bit too sweety in my opinion. But the flavour lasts and tastes great.

Bottle at t Antwaerps Bierhuiske.

Malty, sugary smell. Very dark brown, brown head. Very sweet. Oily texture and lively carbonation. Some coffee, licorice, syrup, a faint of pepper.

From bottle. Great dark ruby appearance with small tan head. Lots of complex fruity aromas. As with many belgians, Im not a fan of the way the yeast flavors interact with the beers other offerings, but that seems to be a matter of my personal taste, so I wont hold it against it in my overall rating. Mouthfeel is excellent.

Pours a translucent red/chestnut colour, good off white head, fine carbonation and a strong off white head . Aromas of sherbet sour yeast, maybe a bit of vinegar, , some  malt character, candy banana which is soon overtaken by a strong lasting sourness. All in all decent glass of beer. 

via Beer Buddy

Una grande birra senza alcun dubbio. Aroma caldo suadente e fruttato. Al palato ingresso un pò troppo carbonato (bevuta a 12°) riscaldandosi ulteriormente diventa però più "liscia" e più complessa. Gusto fin da subito dolce ricco di uva passa, datteri, frutta in guscio, e qualche nota di cacao. Chiude con un fruttato che ricorda la banana. Davvero complessa e calda. Un ottima bevuta.
Bottom line-not worth the price.I wont be buying a bottle again.Nothing stand-out. Sweet caramel syrup taste not balanced out enough with other flavors. Flat-could use more carbonation.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2013 Impresionante cerveza. Mientras más veces la pruebas más y mejor se disfruta. Una maravilla. Cremosa. Muy especiada y herbal. Fondo ligeramente picante, mejor no muy fria.
Hodně dobrý trapistický pivák tmavé barvy a plné chuti, vysoká pěna. Lahváč z Bruselu.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2012 Tasted side by side with a Westy. Pours almost identical. Better head structure than the Westy. Slightly sweeter and easier to drink also, less complex but certainly not less enjoyable. Epic quad!

Bottle.  Dark murky mahogany with a light tan head. Sweet prunes, overripe red grapes, medium chocolate, darker caramel notes and toffee in the aroma. Prune juice reduction, quite malty caramel, dark fruits, rich cake.  Medium velvety body.

Bottled, 0.33l. Hazy amber brown color, large frothy tan-like head and yeast residue. Aroma of caramel, alcohol, spicy hops and dry fruits. Taste starts with sweet malt, followed by vivid fruitiness and a bit sourish, too. Mouthfeel is warm and mouth-coating, bitterness is hidden under strong, spicy and alcoholic aftertaste. Full body, thick texture and lively natural carbonation in palate. Its a classy beer, but a bit too strong for me...

11.2 ounce bottle-  Poured out a hazy auburn brown with a fairly thick and lasting head.  Aroma was hazelnut, apple and cinnamon.  First impression was that this ale was just too sweet.  The cloying sweetness and floral notes overshadowed an enjoyable subtlety.  Too sweet for my taste, but I understand the higher rating on this one.

My first venture into the belgian quads.  reddish brown color.  Notes of dark fruit.  Definately has the belgian spices that every other belgian beer has.  Not as overpowering as some.  This drinks pretty smooth, no signs of 10%+ ABV.  As far as the belgian beers go this is probably the best Ive had but I dont think it is as enjoyable as even the mediocre IPAs and stouts.  These belgians may still be an aquired taste but for now, I dont see what all the fuss is about.

Bottle @ Home.
Pours dark, hazy brown with a thick cinnamon coloured head. The carbonation keeps it alive. Full nose with hazelnut.
Very full rich flavour. Big dose of sweet malts, cane sugar (alcohol!) and caramel, as well as liquorice.
Very full filling.

Intriguing aroma and attractive amber brown pour with a well balanced taste and slightly warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smooth, round, sugar syrup, over ripe fruit, rum and raisin. Delicious!

On Tap. Dark clear amber color. ripe fruit on the nose.
Mouthfeel is medium body, caramel, candy sugar, banana, cherry, bubblegum and ripe fruit.
Sweet beer with an explosion of flavors that stunned, low perception of alcohol. A masterpiece, Quadrupel that makes school!
Bottle to tulip. Dark amber pour, off white head. Aroma is dark fruit, candi sugar and pure awesomeness. Very excellent quad. One of the best examples in my mind. The dark fruit is amazing on it!

I'm really nice dark beer with a complex aftertaste definitely going to drink this one more often in the future

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

light shows a deep reddish mahogany coloring that is beautiful. And incredibly frothy, four-finger head takes its sweet time dissipating. Lacing is prevalent and thick.

Wow. Figs, raisins, cherries hit on the very tip of the nose but quickly becomes a strong rum soaked scent. Theres a sweet bread character lurking in the background. Very sweet overall and almost wine like. Phenols are blossoming left and right. Extremely complex and heavy on the nose.

The sweet raisin and fig notes carry well on the front of the tongue and they dominate the top of the palate. The a strong sweet bread character on the center of the tongue that starts to blossom in warming alcohol at the end. The sugar shines on the center but doesnt carry to powerfully to not let the bread character shine. Im impressed by the alcohol lightness.

Very, very carbonated and I think that helps the flavors move better than the would otherwise. Things could be quite strong without the powerful carbonation and it makes sense here.

A wonderful example of the Quad as a style and a new favorite. The complex flavors here are wonderful and this is something I could sip on many nights.

The feel set this apart for me. The head of the beer was like a soft blanket for my lips. The taste was a little fruity with some slight bitterness. The high alcohol content is not detectable, so watch out.

Rewelacyjne piwo. Zapach piszkoptowo-octowy. Spory dymek po zdjęciu kapsla. Piana spora i gęsta niesamowicie. Smak winno-ciastkowo figowy. Suszone owoce pomieszane z karmelowym słodem. Takie miałem odczucia smakowe. Lekko słodkie piwo, mało goryczkowe ale wytrawne i bogate w smaku. Finisz zdecydowanie rozgrzewający, świetnie pasujący na chłodne zimowe wieczory. Gorąco polecam.

Birra di unaromaticità intensa dovuta essenzialmente al lievito utilizzato e allalta gradazione alcolica, fa prevedere allolfatto quello che poi si riscontrerà nel gusto, ovvero una dolcezza calda, avvolgente, ma senza risultare stucchevole, come spesso accade nelle produzioni belghe. Cioccolato, prugne mature, amarena, addirittura cuoio! Il colore è tonaca di frate, come è ovvio che sia trattandosi di una quadrupel (sebbene questa definizione di stile non abbia molto senso) e si nota una certa densità. La schiuma è cremosa e vellutata e, se ben servita, mantiene un velo sottile, ma persistente. Birra tendenzialmente dolce di frutta rossa matura, ma con un aspetto di cioccolato fondente che, come detto in precedenza, fà sì che non risulti stucchevole. Non ci sono asperità in questa birra. E fin troppo facile amare il suo equilibrio e la sua consistenza lievemente cremosa, la carezza della carbonazione e quel finale ancora dolce, con note di caffè, di liquirizia, che non ti lascia mai... Senza dubbio un capolavoro.

Bouteille 750 ml. Achetée à la SAQ. Servie dans un verre trappiste. Robe dun brun caramel avec des reflets rougeâtres. Léger collet blanc qui disparaît assez rapidement. Arôme et goût: malt, caramel, bananes, fruits confits, levures belges. Bon équilibre. Alcool somme toute bien dissimulée. Ronde en bouche. Texture sirupeuse.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2013 deep brown with medium size foamy beige head.
Aroma and flavour are really very fruity with really  nice malts. Rare but as an amateur in this actually I feel
yeasty aroma. Quite sweet thou pleasant bitterness always reminds its existence.
Awesome quadrupel. From my own exp, I start with abbey dubbel to enjoy this as second even more.

Bottle at home (from Spar, Popperinge) 20/10/12.
Slightly obscured copper brown with a thin tan head.
Nose is full of toffee, raisens, dates, yeasty tones, dark fruits, caramelised sugars.
Tastes follow nose, some hops, a degree of booze but well disguises, some spice.
Medium bodied with spritzy carbonation leading to a a dry  and sweet finish.
A decent enough beer in its own right but let down by being over carbonated and perhaps having had the real deal on the same day (Westvleteren 12) I was being over critical.
One to re-review having let it age for a few years.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Again, have had this before, but now rating it. Following the Prior 8. Another perfect pour into the Duvel glass (living in Belgium, you could start taking great-looking beers for granted!). Aroma is sharp, but light--dark fruits. Flavor is huge and powerful. Warming, reminiscent of a spirit, but not boozy. Some candy and distinct whiskey notes poke through at times. If this is a Westvleteren 12 clone, Id like to put them side by side. Palate is so fluffy and creamy. From trying W12 a couple of times, I think I still like that one better, but that doesnt mean the Abt 12 is bad. I am debating if I like this or the Prior 8 better, though. Another classic beer
Bottle at capitol beer. Has a sweet flavor at first with a some what banana Belgium yeast. This beer taste extremely light for what it is.

The aroma, while not strong, is primarily dark fruit fruit. Pours a dark brown with a rapidly diminishing ivory head and no lacing. Taste is medium sweet - plums, raisins, and some alcohol in the finish. Medium bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, an excellent quad.
On tap.  Nice reddish copper color.  Smells like the typical Belgian yeast.  Potent apple flavor goes into a smooth yeastiness.  Nice subtle spiciness.  A little light bodied, but a solid beer.
Clearly brewed in the style of Rochy 10 and Westy 12, this beer features a great combination of fruits, nuts and alcohol on the palate. Very hearty and characterful.

Great.  The nose is full of dark fruit and brown sugar with some spice notes as well. Deep brown with some red highlights and a fading beige head. Sweet with notes of dark fruit and spice all with a vinous character. Very smooth and full bodied with a sweet finish.

Bottle from Kris Wines (I think, bought it a while ago). Poured a brownish colour with ruddy depths. Aroma was vaguely spicy, fruity, some booze. Taste more of same, quite high carbonation initially, dark dried fruits - raisin and fruit cake, booze, some yeasty spice. Nice enough, but hugely disappointing for the score on here. This is only my rating 500-odd and it doesnt get in my top 50, and I have heavy Belgians up there so it isnt a style issue.

You can't go wrong with this beer. This is by far and away the most accessible and best beer in the world to me personally. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

According to me, one of the finest dark ales in belgium. Just genuine classic belgian strong brown beer! An absolute must to have. Even chilled it is nice, but at a temp of ca 14 degrees celcius it is astonashing!
A real good example of Quadrupel, quite a complex beer with a full body and consistent tanned head. Medium sweetness at taste and floral, resin, caramel aroma.
750 ml to snifter. Looks solid; a murky brown with light beige lacing. Smells and tastes solid; plum and caramel. Good on the palate. Tasty, but overrated.

Strong aromas of dark fruits and yeasty sour dough bread. Classic Belgian notes throughout. Taste is quite feisty helped along by the active carbonation. In the mouth the dough, plum and raisins although I was surprised by how dry it was considering the flavour profile. Left me wanting more from the flavour as it starts so powerfully but fades quickly. Still excellent nevertheless.

Pours a deep and luscious brown with big daddy white head.  Aroma of plums, figs and caramelized sugar.  Crisp, light body with a predominant fig flavor and subtle hints of licorice, mushroom, and brown sugar.  Very balanced and very drinkable for 10.5 ABV.
This is one damn good ale! I smell raisins, honey, yeast, and fruits; I taste all of the same. Pours dark amber with a light brown head. Very complex and balance, very good.

Brun, röd orange färgad med stort skum av stora bubblor som försvinner snabbt. Doftar skumbanan, jäst, alkohol, syrligt och sött, katrinplommon och gröna äpplen. Smaker som jag känner är: banan, mogna plommon, dadlar, päron, vanilj, papaya och röda äpplen bl.a. Kommer aldrig att glömma första gången jag drack den här, hade ett leende från öra till öra :)

Poured a 750ml bottle into a Duvel Tulip. Best by date of 3/13/17. Let the bottle sit for 50 minutes out of the fridge before decanting.

A: Dark, opaque brown with off-white head. Sporadic, sticky lacing down the glass.

S: Raisins, figs, breadiness, caramel.

T: Dark fruits, a spiciness (clove?), hop bitterness is there for balance. Sweetness reminds me of brown sugar. Peppery alcohol there as well. Dry finish. Alcohol warms gradually.

M: Thick and perfect. 

O: Had passed on this one and Rochefort 10 because "they are always there". Great quad and would rate it a close second to Rochefort.
Very nice and not overwhelmingingly sweet as some.  brown color and nice head, of course some candy with the high alcohol but more balanced than most

Pours dark brown. Fluffy head. Smells of prunes and fig. Taste explodes with fruit. Wasy deinker that hides the alcohol well. Leaves you wanting more. Great beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours with a huge had that lasts forever. Deep red color with some cloudiness. Raisin and caramel notes in the flavor. A delicious sipping beer.
UPDATED: MAY 18, 2013 Caramel, burn and ripe friut aroma. Taste is sweet and full bodied with long smooth finish.

Thick creamy head. Dark hazy red. Strong fruit notes. Smooth sweet cherry flavor with a tart finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2011 from my beer cellar
This is the second time tasting this beer.  The first time was on draft.  Somehow I didnt know if this beer would live up to the 100 rating that it has but hands down this might be one of the best beers I have ever tasted.  
Pours a dark brown with tan head. 
Has a very sweet aroma like raisins, plums, apples
Taste is the same.  Not disappointing.  Very complex and fruity with maybe a slight hint of chocolate.  
Overall this is a very smooth wonderful tasting beer.  You would never guess that it is 10% ABV

Yeast and honey aroma.  Pours a dark cloudy amber - like fresh raw unfiltered honey.  Thick off white to tan head that dissipates slowly.  Full bodied, thick mouth feel that I have come to expect and enjoy from good quads.  Grape or sweet white wine flavor.  Pleasant alcohol presence.  Slight bitterness at the finish.  Very smooth.  Overall an excellent beer.
Ottima davvera una quadrupla con i fiocchi!

This is a most splendid beer!!  This beer exudes flavor with such greatness!!  This beer is sweet yet subtle!  There is obvious high alcohol in this, yet so hard to tell.  The taste is so smooth for a very intensely high alcohol value!  This beer is certainly going into my all time favorites!  I was lucky to be able to get this in a draught store to go!  I was able to enjoy this beer in my home!

Aroma of deep oak and smoked maple malts. Deep crimson red in color with nice lacing against the glass. Flavors of dark fruits, burnt caramel and oats. Massive boozy overtones on the end. Overall, a tad bit dissapointing. Not as complex as I had anticipated. Mostly dark fruit and alcohol notes. Id give this a B- rating.

Bottle to a St. Bernardus trappist glass. Pours a dark ruby brown/black with a thick tan head and great lacing. Aroma is raisin, date, fig, brown sugar, sugar, sweet malts and more dark fruit. Taste is dark fruit. Raisin, date, fig, plum, brown sugar, sweet malt, grassy hops, and more dark fruit flavors. Mouthfeel is medium and easy to drink. Amazing beer.

Draught at the Norman pub in Tel Aviv. Dark brown, opaque with a frothy white head. Raisins and spices aroma, a little clove and nutmeg. Then lots of alcohol. Sweet, brutal alcoholic taste that evolves to grape juice and spices. Full body, carbonated, bitter finish.

33cl bottle. Pours very dark brown with a beautiful head. Sediments floating in it. Aroma is malty, fuity. Great flavors of malt, caramel, alchool perfectly balanced together. Great aftertaste. Lovely

Nice medium brown pour with generous off white head that lingers on top. Smells of sweet yeasty brown sugar, caramel. Bubbly mouthfeel with a sweet bite and tons of caramel and brown sugar tastes. Gorgeous beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2012 25/9/2012 
la bottiglia lho bevuta a metà,quindi diciamo che ho potuto testare poco la birra nel complesso..mi limito a giudicare almeno i parametri fondamentali,in attesa di un ulteriore degustazione,premettendo che dalle prime impressioni mi sembra inferiore alla Westvleteren 12 come complessità del gusto,ma allo stesso tempo più beverina e forse anche poco più buona della Rochefort 10..vedremo alla prossima!

18/10/2012 
non so se sto prendendo brutti scherzi dalle birre in bottiglia conservate male ma questa mi pare totalmente diversa da quella assaggiata precedentemente..laroma non dice quasi nulla,è alcolico ma non paragonabile alle sue "sorelle" la rochefort 10 e la westvleteren 12,assolutamente più complesse..come gusto invece attira poco..corposo ma poco saporito,poco complesso,lievemente maltato e poco dolce,con un finale secco e amaro che non ricordavo..ora come ora la rochefort 10 e la westvleteren 12 la superano di gran lunga..rimando il tutto ad un terzo assaggio..ultima nota: lho bevuta praticamente dopo una rochefort 10..forse la superiorità della rochefort ha influito sui parametri degustativi?..
Dark brown coloured beer with a with a small slightly brown head. Sweet and alcoholic aroma. Flavour of sweet malts. Easy to drink, a nice brew! (Bottle 33cl)
From a .75 l bottle vintage 2010. Pours a dark cloudy brown with a thin white head. Caramel and toffee aroma.  Raisins and candy sugar. Quite tasty.

Look: Dark brown body, off white head. Smell: Dried Dark Fruits ( Prunes, Risins, Figs), Bread Dough, Spice, Malt sweetness rounded by candy sugar, Slight Vinegar. Alot going on. Taste: Spicy Yeast, Figs, Burnt candy sugar, Roasted Malt with some Chocolate notes, Metalic, Cinnamon Bread, Vinegar, Slight Alcohol, Mild Bitter dry finish and a Earthly Funk aftertaste that lingers for a while. Feel: Full Bodied with Soft Natural Carbonation. Overall: There is alot going on in this brew. Yet, even though this is Highly Recommended, (Still being one of my favorites) I still prefer Rochefort 10.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2015 Nice beer. Dark brown colour, medium carbonation. Complex aroma: chocolat, coffee, fruit, banana,... Well balanced. Very good exemple of the style.
an awesome beer, sliky smooth, wonderful mouthfeel ness, nice aroma, good kick but the alcohol is not obvious...absolute majic,

Been waiting a long while to try this one, and I can say after the fact that I was very satisfied.  The nose was intense driven by sour grape, dry alcohol, mild toasted caramel and dried fruits.  It is a beautiful dark, dark brown that shows signs of ruby in the light - the head is beige and 1.5 finger and has great retention, when swirled alcohol legs are fantastic.  Tasted alcohol, grape, and caramel with dried fruit notes - follows the nose but not as complex.  Perfect Belgian body by my standards.

Aroma roasty, hay, Just quit smoking so not sure lol
Appearence red, brown, hazy, tan foam, 
Taste medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium sweetness, 
Palate full body, oily feel, lively, abrupt finish
Overall This is a beer i enjoy and it was better than i expected. Ill save a glass for my roomie cos i know he will enjoy it...    with some Bierstick
This beer was fantastic. I think Ive had it before but this was great. Tasted like grapes, sweet, but not too sweet. Dark and very aromatic. Splendid.
Nice sweetness combined with good bitterness. Notes of flowers and a hint of caramel. Color is reddish brown with a creamy head.
Fortunati ad averla bevuta alla spina.....indimenticabile!!!!& Birra imperdibile...da accompagnare con schiacciata, salumi e formaggio

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2014 Fruit van allerlei, snoep, banaan en karamel. Heftige smaak, overweldigende zoet, specerijen, zout en steenfruit. Mooie kraag, behoorlijk koolzuur, nasmaak zacht en lang. Winterbier. #2 smaak is standvastig, aroma wat kaal, cijfers omgedraaid.
Sweet caramel aroma. Flavour is yeasty and sweet brown.  Very flavourful. Raisin and plum.
Veramente fantastica, una ottima birra, molto corposa e dallaroma unico... Da provare

33cl at Cafeeke, Madrid. Pours clear, murky brown with a beige head. Malty aroma with dark, dried fruits, caramel and some roasted notes. Sweet and fruity, but very well balanced. Alcohol is well intergrated. Full body and high complexity. Some bitterness in the finish. Very nice! (2012-08-18)

Bottle at home.  One finger off with foam. Dark amber color. 
Pepper, malt, vinegar and then some. 
Totatly wonderful taste and feeling in the mouth. 
This belgian guys ... Damn they can make beer!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a large creamy tan head that dissipates slowly with near perfect lacing. Aroma is caramel, fruit, and touch of coriander, with a bit of grain poking through. Flavor is alcoholic, caramel, raisin, peach spices, Belgian yeast. Finish is alcoholic and very mildly bitter. This is very alcohol forward and really doesnt do it for me.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 33cl. bottle Geers. - RIch and creamy, dark and roasted, without any of the usual Belgian abbey ale side effects of cloying or sweetness. Chocolate and some ?butterscotch/caramel. - A great dessert beer in summer or winter- actually poured this 1  bottle in 3 sample glassed for desert with cheese and all went quiet at the table.

Pours a dark brown with a quickly dissipating fizzy off white head.  Smells of raisins, spice, and black licorice.  Taste is sweet, spicy, and fruity.  Probably the best Quad I've had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a dark mahogany with a large bubble head. Fruity aroma and taste. 
Palate is very smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2012 330ml bottle. Dark brown pour with a big fluffy head. Plum, phenols, cloves, spices, candi sugar, glace cherry fruitiness. So sweet up front, graduating into a fruitcake sweetness and eventually to a mild sourness, with a fizzing carbonation, medium heavy body and a slick mouthfeel. Long fruity finish. Sensational.
Bottle at bar. Dark brown color, beige head. Sweet, malty taste with plum, fruits, barnyard aroma, citrus and alcohol. Fruity finish with some alcohol. Excellent abbey beer.
Delicious abbey ale. Warming with a fruity nose. Taste of figs, and spice. Definitely worthy of drinking whenever you get the chance.

Not that Ive tried them all, but St. Bernardus Abt 12 is the best quad Ive had. It is a heavy brew for sure, but tastes so flavorful that doesnt matter. The first
thing you notice after popping the cork on this one is the smell. I love that malty aroma offset with hints of spice, figs, caramel, and many others. The
lacing on this brew is thick and lasting testament to the quality ingredients. Although you can taste the ever-present alcohol, its presence is not overpowering. Great offering from a classic and quality
brewery. Long live the Belgian quads!
This is a great ABT. Have had it on tap and from bottle. Tap is better but this is still a great beer out of the bottle.
E complicato  descrivere questa birra tanto è complessa; va solo bevuta e gustata in ogni suo aspetto perchè comunque, al secondo assaggio, sarà diversa...

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy deep chestnut, with lots of floating sediment. Its large off-white head lasts very well, and leaves good lacing. The aroma is a blend of port and well-oaked red wine, with a touch of alcoholic warmth and some spicy Belgian yeast notes. Mild spice hops offer a nice combination with the cinnamon and nutmeg character of the yeast, before fading into a lusciously smooth blend of port, rum and warming alcohol. There is an almost mulled wine feel to the finish, which lingers nicely. This beer is an absolute revelation: a delightfully complex, smooth and warming ale.

Tap. Pours medium brown with thick, creamy beige head; good retention and some lacing. Aroma is figs, raisins, caramel and toasted malts, earthy hops, Belgian yeast, and light woody notes. Flavor is strong malt forward wig good dark fruit esters and faint hops; dry, semi-sweet finish. Full body, low carbonation, and medium warmth.
33cl from cervezalandia. Dark brown color. Large and smooth white head. Medium to light carbonation. Medium sweetness. Malt, spicy, wood aroma. Beautiful.
My favourite Belgian ale. It is not shy on the alcohol, nor the fruits, nor the malts. The quintessential big beer.
Dark reddish brown.  Very cloudy.  Dark and malty and fruity.  Way too much carbonation.  The fizziness interfered with the whole experience.
Very smooth, consistent lacing, dark amber color. A welcome ambush of alcohol in the finish.

Mahogany brown with a nice smooth tan head that stayed with me the entire time.

Roasted caramel malts, bread, yeast, dark fruits and a bit of vanilla

a lot like it smells but I will say that I got a bit of a taste of metal from this bottle that I do not remember in the past that I was not as big a fan of.

Smooth and medium to full bodied. I loved the feel and could drink this all day.

For me this is a great nightcap and I will continue to enjoy it regularly.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2013 Draft at Monks. Very dark pour that shows as a red under bright light. Big fluffy tan head that reduces to some lasting islands of foam. Chewy dark malts. Burnt vanilla caramel. Tootsie Rolls. Balanced with some dark red fruit. Sulfered figs and dates. Plums. Raisins. Dried blueberries. Rich dark red tannins. Full body. Complex. Feels like a dark Quad but has a notable bright fruitiness to combat the dark malt flavors. Stands apart.

Bananas foster! High toned banana, caramelized sugar, and spice!!! Higher carbonation then I prefer for style, although it keeps the beer from being sticky or overly sweet. Layers of dried fruit, raisin and molasses add depth as beer comes to temperature.  Well balanced, with no apparent alcohol. A great beer for style.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Draft. Pours a an amber color with a thin white head. I get vinegar in the aroma. The taste is light and crisp for the color. The alcohol is hidden very well for a quad. Good stuff. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Total burp-fest drinking this one, carbonation is massive. couldnt really get much of a scent sticking my nose right in the glass, really had to try and pick something out. Taste is good, similar to a Rochefort for me, dried stone fruits and the like. Really satisfying alcohol warmth as it goes down. Good stuff.

On draft at WOB Tempe, dark brown pour, looks great in the glass.  Spicey, brown sugar is present with Belgian yeast in as well.  A very tasty awesome flavor with a little fruit flavor...just a beautiful dark ABT.

330 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with huge retentive head. Full aromas of roasted malts, brown sugar, dark fruit, and just a hint of caraway.  Very malty, creamy and warm, with flavors of prunes, burnt sugar, tobacco, and spice.
Had the pleasure of having this.on tap. Beautifully smooth, taste hits you like a train, liquoricey and deep. Very seductive beer, as good as a Westy 12 in my opinion.
Very Nice beer, litlle biter, greate taste, aroma could be better. Well thats it. Bye.

On 75 cl bottle at Amundsen.
Dark golden color, good foam.
Good fruity aromas , some dried fruits & malt.
Velvety carbonation& excellent balance.
Some immediate sweetness , also some bitterness.
Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A reputation well deserved. Smooth and rich, with  beautiful flavor. Deep brown color with thick fluffy head ( four  fingers). Taste stays with you on the palate. Drinkable and very enjoyable. Excellent!

Bottle, pours dark brown with small off white head. Aroma is dark fruits, dark sugar, some nuts, toffee. Very sweet, medium carbonation. Full body. 
Very nice quad.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2012 caramel, bread, roasty, chocolate, citrus, floral, dough, earthy, alcohol, banana, bubblegum, raisin, vanilla, woody, brown, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Very complex beer.  Savoured with hotwings, and the maltiness/deep caramel flavours paired extemely well.  Geat lacing after head dissipates, with great rum/raisin/citrus/earthy aromas.  Great Belgian strong dark!  The high abv is not at all apparent, so watch it!

75cl bottle at home. Dark copper. Tan head. Intense lacing. Strong classic Belgian beer aroma. Figgy. Smooth, coats mouth. Strong aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a medium brown color with many small particles and a light brown head.  There is a lot of carbonation.  Aroma is interesting and I can detect some pear, yeast and I think caramel.  The taste seems very well balanced with nothing sticking out.  It is very hard for me to describe as I am having difficulty discerning some of the flavors.  I have taken at least 20 sips and I still cannot detect many of the things noted by others.  To me it tastes a little sweet initially (I guess close to a very mild cherry flavor) with some malt but quickly changes to what I would describe as a tartness.  The body is medium and the alcohol is very well hidden.  You would be hard pressed to find another beer with comparable abv that is as easy to drink.

4oz pour at Bier Abbey, happy hour with ACBE. Dark brown amber with a little cloudiness. Fruit and caramel on the nose. Bright fruit flavors, alcohol, and whiskey character on the palate. Finish with big oak barrel flavors.
330ml bottle. Pours reddish brown with off-white head. Aroma of boiled vegetables and caramel. Flavour is more boiled vegetables, caramel malt and some sugar. :/

Pours a very dark brown, large head on pour, quickly fades though, beautiful lacing and the bubbles are very fine like in their Tripel, which I previously reviewed and loved. Scent is of dark fruit like plums and dates, belgian yeast, and malts. Taste is fantastic, notes of dark fruits, belgian yeast, and a bit of soy. There is a good amount of booziness though but not too much to detract from the well balanced flavor. This is a very very thick, full beer. Mouthfeel is thick, with that booziness and just a bit of very fine carbonation. Overall a fantastic brew, though due to how big of a beer this is, Its definitely one to take slow and enjoy. For those that want something a little crisper and less heavy, their Tripel fits perfectly - and I must say I enjoyed the two about the same overall.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Im not a very big fan of this beer, its a beer I like to show to people who enjoy many IPAs and darker beers. I didnt really like the bitterness with the grapefruit fruity taste. Its ok.
Dark amber color. Dark fruit, sweet smell. Malty taste with hints of chocolate and hints of spice.

Cream coloured head with a brown but hazy colour. Big rich aroma, toffee, banana and a fruity floral character. Rich beer with a sweet malt flavour, more yeasty/banana notes, and a nice fruit/whiskey cake finish. very tasty brew.

Top rate! Dark brown-red color with a fingers worth of head and nice lacing. The aroma was full of plum, dark fruit, Belgian yeast, malts, and alcohol. The taste followed with such complexity, adding a nice warming in the mouth at the end. Plums and green apples. Sweet and bready malts. Wonderful.  Pretty big mouthfeel and light carbonation...right for the 10%. 
Beer that makes you appreciate beer.
I dontt want to get into details here (everyone did it before). Well, the beer is (really) good and italian formaggio Taleggio goes very well with it.

Abt 12 is everything I love about signature belgian quads.  It has a coffeeness to it that seperates it from a traditional belgian quad, but the result is phenomenal.  The flavors hit you in multiple waves of awesomeness that prove its complexity.

On tap @ RnH.  Poured a deep dark brown with ruby hues, small tan head that dissapated quickly, and notable lacing.  Aroma of mainly fruit including plum, raisin, and cherry being dominant.  Taste is extremely well-balanced and smooth with flavors of dark fruits, malt, and licorice.  Nice creamy mouthfeel with slight alcohol flavor and warming on the finish.  Complex and tasty, but boozy flavor and ABV become apparent after the first few sips.

Kleur van kersenhout met een offwhite kop. Smaak is complex. Start met een vleugje alcohol vervolgens zoet fruit, rozijnen, banaan en brood. Eindigt met weer een vleugje alcohol. Echt een goed biertje.

Aldus Huubs.

A deep amber color and amazing slightly licorice she raisins aroma.  A very complex taste, nice malt and yeast profile. Not appropriate for outdoors in the summer however.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 A traditional abbey style scent. A nontraditional abbey style taste. The carbonation does wonders for the Abt 12. I taste sugar, malts, and whiskey. The malts are very noticeable with a sweet whiskey finish. All and all this was a tasty experience. It is worth a try even if abbey styles are not your thing like myself.
Deep dark mahogany colour with a frothy. Lace clings to the glass. Fruit, malt, berry aroma. Very nice flavour of malt, brown sugar and sweet whisky. Tasty brew.

Hazy brown color.  Aroma = sweet caramel with some citrus notes.  Taste = notably sweet with robust carbonation (suspect bottle-conditioned).  Heavier than average mouthfeel.  A great introduction to Abbey Ale - Quadrupels.  Highly rated as you can see :-)
An almost cola like brown beer, very soft taste feels almost creamy in the mouth.  The soft carbonation tingles on your tongue.
Bottle: Very tasty quad indeed. everything the discription says it is and readily available here. Nice!

Bottle. Just get one. This beer is dark, almost cola brown. Big tan head. Loads of soft carbonation. Yes there is suspended yeast, it is a quadruple. The flavors are all there. Alcohol just heating it up in the background. Not hoppy. A little caramel, a little toasty malt sweetness. Very good.

2010 bottle from Wegmans from when they opened. Pours and opaque dark brown with slight head that fades. nose is dried cherries and plums, with yeasty ketones. first sip is drird fruit including qjince paste and candi suvar finish is less boozy but still flavor ful

Bottle at home, thanks daisy!
Dark ruby tinged Brown with fine carbonation white head. Cherries, prunes and molasses nose. Rich chocolate malt, fruity yeast esters, long warming finish. Quite light bodied.
On draft at Brat Haus. What can I say about this beer- its fantastic! Spicy yet fruity. Smooth yet high alcohol. Complex yet very drinkable. One of the best!

Red/brown pour with a big creamy head. Sweet, fruity, malty nose. Nutty malts. Full bodied, soft, rich, and creamy.  Smooth so smooth.

I think I wanna make a dessert with this one!

Great Belgium beer, hazelnut color with aromas of fruit, that lead right into the taste, with just a hint of alcohol at the end.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had beer on-tap @ the iTap House (Soulard location) and was poured into a Tulip glass.

Appearance - Dark Brown with plenty of head (inch or more), with designs in the head as well

Smell - Tons of spice with a fruity type of background. Not sure where this came from. Smells of a sweet drink

Taste - Too many flavors to describe! For a minute, a hint of brown-sugar or a maple taste, followed by chocolate. Can also taste the hops but they are a small percentage of taste. 

Mouthfeel - Great smooth, medium-bodied beer with every taste and smell on the spectrum. Amazing in how they do this!

Drinkabilty - Wondering why this was the top beer of the month on-tap, I chose it and am glad! Im sure I could have many more but with a $7 glass of this beer, Im going to come back another day to taste more of this top 20 favorite now!

2010 bottle poured into snifter.  Pours a dark ruby-brown color with a decent amount of head the fades quickly.  Powerful fruit and malt aroma.  Getting strawberries, cherries, pineapple, cocoa, molasses, and caramel.  Smells delicious.  Taste is pretty sweet and fruity.  A very nice mixture of malts and fruits.  Very smooth and no alcohol burn in the finish.  Finish is long and fruity like a really good wine.  A great beer. UPDATED: DEC 2, 2015 Scuro color bruno-rossiccio lievemente torbido con un fragile velo di schiuma bianco sporco non molto persistente. Aroma fruttato e lievemente pungente con sentori di spezie, lievito e albicocche; sapore mediamente dolce e maltoso con note di frutta cotta e un retrogusto amarognolo e speziato molto piacevole. Brown.  Heavy body.  Very thick head.  High alcohol, but doesnt burn.  Drinkable for a quad.

UPDATED: JAN 3, 2014 Hazy reddish brown colour, reddish foam. Strong, sweet alcohol smell. Smooth feeling on tongue, fizzy. Very strong pleasant taste. chocolate, fruits. Very strong, warm, sweet, little bitterness. Very strong beer, strong smell and taste. Great, not the best, but still one of the first great beers I tried. Bottle.

Väldigt mycket kolsyra och stickig munkänsla. Bubblig och söt i munnen med mycket alkoholvärme och lite vass och kantig (dracks jämte Rochefort 10 och Westvletern 12). Ändå riktigt bra och smakrik med mandelmassa, maltsötma och torkad frukt. Skulle nog vunnits på att lagras några år.
Lovely beer.  Dark reddish brown color, lots of figs and spices in the nose. Quite carbonated for the ABV and the ABV is hidden quite well in this. Sweet but not overpowering sweet.

330ml bottle. Deep mahogany pour with tan head that sticks around and leaves lots of lace. Stewed fruit, spice, molasses and something port-ish on the nose. Slight warmth on the palate with the same flavours from the nose. Theres an added vegetal hint as well. Great beer, but not as good as Pannepot or Rochefort 10.
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2013 Sweet and refreshing nice undertones caramel and deliciousness. Bomber in LA bottle shop. smooth, loved this.

Bottle shared by esp0r last december during a brewing session.
Dark brown, red tint, big whitish head. Aroma of dark fruits, malt, caramel, alcohol. Taste is all good, burned, with toffee, pineapple, peach, dark sugar, fruits and nuts. Good carbonation, and a very belgian style finish.

This beer is highly overrated. Ill take a Chimay anyday! bread, herbs, alcohol, Excellent carbonation. brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, full body, thick feel, fizzy, astringent, Dont waste your money.
Really nice amber color , scent has a wonderful caramel aroma. Incredibly smooth beer. The head is nice once it settles it leaves just a light ring around the glass. One of the best beers out there.
After a fresh frothy bottle opening, pours nearly black with thin white head. Aroma of dried cake fruits, toasted malt. Strong boozy flavour with syrupy thick body. Long fruity aftertaste.

This is a whole lot of fantasticness! Smooth, dark, rich, sweet, and caramel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy dark orangebrown with a medium tan head. Aroma is yeast, some bananas, dark fruits and some alcohol. Flavor is well balanced and sweet. Caramel, yeast, dark fruits and bananas. Nice co2. Swell indeed!

A: Dark mahogany hue with a big creamy head that leaves sizable lace ringlets in its wake.

S: Enticing aromas of Belgian yeast, bread, Abbey ale, subtle fruit, alcohol.

T: Fabulous beer. This has been a "go to" beer for me for many years. It sounds appealing any time of day, any time of year. Extremely well crafted, this beer opens up as it warms and tastes incredible. As far as quads, this is second only to Westvleteren 12, in my humble opinion.

M: Very smooth with just the right carbonation. Slight alcohol finish.

D: Highly recommended. A world class beer.

Pours a dark ruby colour with a thick tan coloured head. Aroma is fruity notes of  plum and banana . flavour is sweet dried fruits with a bit of spice from the yeast very smooth in the finish. great beer

Pours a hazy reddish brown with a fair tan head.  Aroma is full of bananas, dark fruits, Belgian yeast, and alcohol.  Theres a lot more to discover on each subsequent sip. Taste is slightly sweet and spicy.  Body is medium to full with perfect carbonation.  Overall, a very well done and substantial, up there with the best of its competitors.  Ill gladly revisit this one.
Very smooth beer. its a very easy to drink beer while also being very strong and delicious.
The only thing i can say is that its a brilliant beer and i find it close to the dark west vleteren the one thats so hard to come by!

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2013 Draft to flute. 
Strong Belgian yeast, bread, and banana. Dark brown and opaque with a small tan head and lots of lacing. Flavours of sweet roasted malts, alcohol, and Belgian yeasts.

Rerating at St. Bernardus Tokyo
Draft to St. Bernardus goblet
Yeast, caramel, and some light esters.
Deep brown with a thick creamy white head
Taste is caramel, candied fruit, yeast.
A slight alcohol burn at the end,
A nice balanced flavour and quite good.

Poured into snifter. Pours dark brown with thick foamy head. On the nose is dark fruits, banana, root beer, and a strong aroma of alcohol. Tastes of fig, brown sugar, light phenols, with a boozy finish. Feels medium heavy with higher carbonation than expected. Overall this is an exceptional Abt whose alcohol is not ad well hidden as others like Rochefort 10. 

--- Cheers

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Mitra. Pours hazy dark brown with a big off-white head. Aroma of molasses, caramel and dark fruits. Intense in aroma and taste. Sweet without being too sweet, bitterness is almost non-existent but the beer makes up for by being very savory/umami.
A great beer that deserves even more recognition than it already receives.

750 ml bottle, shared with friends. Half hazy amber / brown color. Good ample foamy head. Little lace. Smooth, soft carbonation, more dry texture. Dark fruit and malt aroma. Slightly bitter sweet savory texture. Wintery spices (some cinammon) and booze.
Another one of my best ten beer in the world. Each year it tastes a little different, but always superb!

Pours a translucent, murky, very dark brown with a moderate but quickly diminishing light-tan head.  Aroma is very sweet and rich, full of dried pit fruits, but never cloying.  Flavor brings a ton of raisin, grape, prune and other fruit notes, bready, and deceptively conceals the alcohol.  A wonderful beer, sweeter than would typically be to my liking, but remarkable well executed.  One of those beers that I have loved in great quantity for several years yet never bothered to rate.  That is because when I am drinking 12, I am having too good of a time to be distracted by trivialities like ratings.
On draft at the Brass Tap, poured an amber color, aromas of light banas, fig, dark fruits, vanilla, and some sweet malt.  Flavors are the same, light bozzy aftertaste.  Nice beer overall.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2013 Poured from bottle. Hazy brown color. Aroma of sweet maltiness, maybe clove. Full bodied and smooth taste. Caramel maltiness. Very smooth for 10.5% alcohol. Impressive. I really like this beer.

First try: October 22, 2010, in Atlanta with Jesse. Really my introduction to good beer. This hooked me. But it hooked me on Belgiums for the next two years until I visited Southern California and had their IPAs. Still one of my favorites.

Been waiting a while to try this for a while. Dark ruby pour with a pillowy khaki head. Aroma of stone fruit, alcohol, fruity yeast esters, and a touch of earth and spice. Flavor is so smooth. Notes of sweet fruit, caramel maltiness, and an awesome fruity yeasty taste. Really high livens it up, but silky full mouthfeel. Easy drinking and awesome.

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2013 Smells of yeast and fruity phenols (dark fruits, esp. plums) along with alcohol.  Expected a little more, but still good.  Pours brownish-purple with good head.  Incredible flavor - dark fruits, chocolate, breads, alcohol, roasty, nutty, brown sugar, lingering malts, more alcohol.  Perhaps not quite as legendary as I was anticipating, but still a darn fine beer that is worth your drink.  OCTOBER 2013 RE-RATE: This is even better now that I am drinking it at a proper temp for an Abt (61º F).

Extremely good beer, the flavor isn’t overpowering, there is barely any hops, and the malt isn’t extremely strong or overbearing. Refreshing and slightly thick but not syrupy or watery. Great, great balancing. No bitterness. Great hearty beer. 

-Fish!
Incredibly sweet and yeasty, very little hop bitterness, as is expected. Also plums, spices and a bit of molasses.

Excellent aroma and taste! Very fruity like banana. Very smoothly without bitterness. One of my favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark brown reddish with a small, but stable tanned head. Fruity smell, sweet, maybe banana. Tastes also fruity, malty, caramel, biscuit, banana and peach. Medium sweetness, little bitterness. Full body, very nice.

Pours a hazy rusty color with a slight off white head that rings out... Aromas of plums, wood ear mushrooms, earthy spice and a touch of sweet malt.  On the palate this one delivers all that the nose hinted and more... medium body with good carbonation that brings the fruity plum and fig flavors to the front but always balanced well with its sweet malty undertones that linger into a very earthy rustic finish....

Marrone scuro, con schiuma beige chiara pannosa e persistente. Bel naso, abbastanza intenso e complesso con caffè, cioccolato, banana matura e malti tostati. Entra in bocca abboccata, calda, poco amara e con un corpo non pesante......buona ma non eccelsa.

Quickly disappearing head. Dark hazy amber. Smells like figs, dades, banana and other sweet fruits. I had rather high expectations because of its comparisons to Westvleteren 12, and i was disappointed. It sure got some of the same typical belgian characteristics, but do not at all show the same mad balance.

Pours a deep, murky brown with a massive off-white head with excellent lacing.  Mild aroma of yeast and grain with some earth tones as well.  Good flavor and body.  Flavorful without being too heavy.  Great and easy drink.

De största upplevelserna i livet låter sig sällan komprimeras till två eller ens tvåtusen meningar. Alldeles för mycket faller mellan också det mest finmaskiga språk. St. Bernardus hör sinnevärlden till och bör där få förbli.
pours a dark brown with a two finger head. sweet, but not overly so. rich catamel and fruitiness. alcohol extremely well hidden. great beer.

Pours a cloudy dark brown, with a creamy off-white head. On the nose is yeast funk, caramel, raisin, dark fruit, and grassy hops.
