Mouth feel is thick and chewy with good carbonation. Taste is caramel, leather, black cherry, plum, piney hops, dark chocolate, tobacco, spice, orange peel, and some light phenols. Finishes long and boozy, leaving dark chocolate and hazelnut. An incredible beer. So rich and complex
Pours deep amber with a high head. Aroma is malts and dark fruits. Flavor is malts, dark fruits and alcohol. Superb abbey ale.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2016 This beer has everything that is needed. Pours beautifully, gives a nice foam, aroma is wonderful, tastes strong enough with multiple different aromas. After Westy 12 best Quadrupel so far.
Testattu yhdessä Rochefort 10:n kanssa vertailumielessä. Väriltään oluet ovat hyvin lähellä toisiaan. Abt 12 on ulkonäöltään täysi kymppi. Luonnovalkoinen vaahto säilyy pitkään oluen pinnalla ja jättää kivan pitsin. R10 taas on selvästi pienivaahtoisempi ja hiilihappoista poreilua on havaittavissa pitkään. Tuoksussa Abt 12 on pehmeä, karamellinen ja yllättävän "mieto". R10 vahvasti anismainen. Maultaan Abt 12 on pehmeä, karamellisen maltainen ja hyvin miedosti, ei juuri lainkaan katkera. R10 on monimuotoisempi maultaan. Yhteenvetona: Abt 12 on "helpompi", pehmeämpi ja kauniimpi olut. R10 sisältää Rocheforteille tyypillisen anismaisen tuoksun. Lisäksi maku on syvempi ja voimakkaampi. Todellisia laatuoluita molemmat, mutta omassa arvoasteikossa Abt 12 on rinnan mitan edellä.

(2010 12oz bottle from LCBO) Poured near cellar temp, a very dark brown with a voluminous, pillowy tan head that persists. Aroma is predominantly dark brown sugar (muscovado?) from the malts, with just a faint hint of yeast and none of the expected dark fruit or spice complexity. Flavour followed the aroma almost exactly, and was sweet with a hint of bitterness at the finish. Mouthfeel was very full, and the carbonation soft and creamy, with no detectable alcohol at all. Very well-balanced but the expected complexity was completely lacking, very straight-forward and unidimensional. Given the rave reviews I am attributing this to degradation during cellaring though the beer is not particularly old. Will review again after another sample.

Botella de 330ml. Copa de Vino. Saboreada en may´12 y, por lo menos,  una vez cada mes. Brota con color cobrizo acastañado.Algo velada. Capa marfil, de burbuja mediana, que se disipa lentamente. Bonitos collares de encaje. Aromas de maltas tostadas dulces, especias, canela y azúcar. Los esteres se manifiestan como frutas maduras tanto en aromas como sabor. Cuerpo intenso con una carbonatación media-alta pero no punzante. Suave calidez alcohólica. Paladar cremoso, dulce y especiado. Un armonioso cuerpo malteado que danza junto al alcohol. ¡ Qué podemos decir de una de las, tal vez, mejores representantes del Estilo  Belgish ABT/Quadrupel  Bier!
330ml bottle. Oversized glass. Enjoyed on may´12 & at least once a month. Pours brownish copper in color. Chill haze. Off-white, medium bubbled, slowly dissipated head. Nice lacing collars. Sweet toasted malts, spices, cinnamon & sugar to the nose. Esters are ripe fruit-like both in flavor & aroma. Full body with medium-high, no puckering, carbonation. Smooth warming ABV. Creamy sweet spiced mouthfeel. Harmonious malty body dances with alcohol. What can be said about a, probably, one of the best spots of the Belgian ABT/Quad style!

color marrone con buona testa media persistenza!colpisce per sentori di frutta rossa matura.in bocca piena morbida malto caramello spezie.finale ben equilibrato da un buon amaro.forse leggermente troppo carbonata?
Buona birra di colore marrone scuro con schiuma bianca. Al naso risaltano soprattutto il malto , caramello e un leggerissimo sentore erbaceo. Una buona birra da fine pasto.

1 pint 9.4 oz. Bottle. Ive been waiting a while to try this guy. Dont know why I waited so long! Frothy head over a very dark brown pour. Some molasses, caramel, and dough on the scent. The palate was a carbo loaded, fizzy, medium palate. Bready dough taste up front followed by a smooth spice flavor and finished with a slightly boozy aftertaste. Ill drink this one again. Hopefully soon.

24pack from Systembolaget, Sweden. Slightly overcarbonated, like a true belgian. Pours dark opaque brown with a huge head. Aroma of toffee, raisins, dark berries and alcohol. Taste is sweet, some tofee, more raisins, fudge and yeast. Fantastic balanced and super drinkable, considering the 10+ % ABV. The best of the "common" beers of Belgium, and not far from a Westy12.

Hoppy, fruity aroma.  Pours a very dark copper, rust color.  Similar in appearance to a home-made apple cider.  Creamy, foamy head, dissipates slowly.  Some tiny particles float in the glass, mixing with carbonation bubbles.  Very little bitterness, but whats there is quite tasty.  Fruity, hoppy, malty taste and aftertaste.
Strong malty aroma, that is quickly followed by an even stronger caramel malt flavor with a hint of earthy yeast taste.  There is some alcohol taste but not too over powering.

600 ml bottle
Deep hazy purple to brown pour with a small light brown head. The lacing is quite nice. Tons of dark fruits aromas are found here, such as plums, slight booze, Belgian yeast and candied fruits/sugar. Very well balanced.

Classic quadruple taste. The balance is unbelievable. Dark fruits, not overly boozy, not overly sweet, just exactly what a good quad should taste like. 

Heavy body, medium to low carbonation. Crisp finish.

This is exactly my type of beer. The Het Kapittel may be slightly better, Id need to have them again one after the other. Highly recommended
Yes, this is definetely a very good Quadrupel, with its dark colour, malty taste and sweetness. Also a hint of alcohol and notes resembling wine are noticeable. Nice.

Pours a dark malty brown and with a surprisingly foamy head.  Guess this foaminess is the reason why this beer is so smooth, as it is soft and velvety.  Full flavoured, but given the pedigree of this beer you sort of expect that.

after pour you smell a malty, slightly citrusy smell.  The color is nice hazy amber color with yeast floating around.  The first taste is sweet with a medium body.  nice malty flavor.  Alcohol and the sweetness bounce back and forth as an aftertaste.  very smooth and very good.  nice sit back and relax beer.

Pours a nice dark brown with thick tan head; dissipates slowly and leaves nice lacing. Aroma is of sweet fruits and a bit of alcohol. Taste is super complex, of nice sweet fruits and esters, a little roasted, and a bit of an alcoholic backbone. Awesome beer.

Bottle. Dark brown colour with big frothy beige head. Sweet fruity aroma of plums, grape, figs and some toffee. Very smooth beer, taste is sweet, aftertaste is slighty bitter. Some notes of alcohol. Very good beer!
Much like the Rochefort 10 & 8. Less complex than the Rocheforts, but much more smooth to drink.

Bottle. Average head. Color is nicely dark with lots of residue. Aroma is spicy with a bit of alcohol and hints of fruits. Taste is quite complex with fruits, spices, liquorice and alcohol. Light alcoholic finish.

Brown 330ml bottle, best before 12-2011, drank 04-2007. 

Poured slowly, oh, so slowly, into Straffe Hendrik chalice. I didnt want any of the sediment to get into the glass, I failed. 

Dark aubergine purple in colour, the head vanished to leave a thin ever shrinking layer of bubbles, some of which tried to cling to the side of the glass. 

Victoria Plum aroma, with rich fruit cake, not a hint of hops, malts or yeast. 

Heavy on the alcohol, plum pudding, Dundee cake with malt bread and rich Christmas spices. 

A rich fruity, spicey, sweetness lingers on the palate, too sweet for me. 

Good beer, but not in my top 100, not from this tasting anyway, I have one more bottle, Ill allow it to age for a few years and re-visit in 2010, if I can store it that long. Better in 2010 but my original review still stands!

This is the best Abt/Quad I ever tried. Perfect balance, taste. Not too sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into a tulip glass from a 12oz bottle that pours a dark dark brown color with a light tan head that leaves little lacing. Smell is amazing of sweet juicy grapes, figs, raisin, all with a yeasty bread and light malt undertone. Taste is bready with an initial sweetness of some raisin and plum, caramel and delicious. On the back end is some grape tart bitterness. In both the smell and taste I sensed almost nothing of the alcohol content which is awesome. The body is medium and perfect and the carbonation is spot on and well balanced. Overall this beer is amazingly smooth with no susceptible imperfections and a beer I would never ever turn down.
Attractive dark brown color with a very generous foamy head.  Light aroma but medium sweet taste.  Really nice finish with a mixture of light coffee, caramel and fruit.

Consumed at the weekend. Was a great choice for watching a long movie. Medium carbonation, rich malt taste. Reminded me of Rochefort 8 but less complex. A little sediment in the bottle but quite fresh. Alcohol was nowhere to be found in the taste although could be felt a bit at the end ;)
330ml bottle from bierzwerg. Dark amber colour. Aroma is yeast. Flavour is dark fruits.

Poured into tulip glass with an enjoy by date of 9/27/16

A: This pours a murky brown mahogany like color with a great three fingers size of fluffy off white head. There are tight, small bubbles at the bottom of the head and larger bubbles in the middle and a wonderful rocky top surface. This head dissipates rather slowly and leaves gorgeous lacing on the glass.

S: Just how I expect a Quad to smell. Bready and biscuit like with yeast characteristics. There is wonderful sweet caramel and toffee aromas. I also pick out dark fruit like plum and raisin. I am having a hard time trying to get any alcohol on the nose and thats a surprise at 10% ABV. This smells outstanding and very inviting...cant wait to taste it. The smell just invites a sip.

T: Holy hell this is huge in flavor and complexity. I Get an initial sweetness and yeasty bready flavor followed by some caramel malt. Mid sip I pick up on the dark fruits of figs, raisins and plums. On the back end I sense a slight bitterness that is appealing and helps even out the sweetness. Fantastic tasting Quad!

M: Very, very smooth! This was the first thing that jumped out at me. I cant say just how smooth this is, unbelievably smooth! Little carbonation to speak of with medium mouthfeel. I do feel this coat my throat temporarily but it doesnt stick around too long. Great mouthfeel!

O: Just an overall outstanding Quad. Perfect in every aspect for this style and the drink ability is off the charts for a big beer like this! I love this beer!

12 oz draft.
Poured a deep brownish purple color with a nice tannish cap holding some lacing.  Note the raisin and grapes,.
More like a wine than a beer.  Not to my tastes, this type of beer, but it is outstanding in its class.

Poured into a tulip glass. Brown with red hues, two fingers of dirty white head. Solid, it is not going anywhere after many drinks.
Smells like wet straw, ripe apricot, orange and molasses.
Tastes of more ripe fruit and alcohol; and more complex than I can describe.
Medium body with almost no carbonation.. borderline syrupy.
One of the best beers out there. Always enjoyable and tough to beat.

A: Poured a deep brownish purple color with a nice tannish cap and a good cap, with some lacing

S: Big grapes, juicy purple grapes, some light fig, dates, plums with fresh red apples, candy

T: Wow, nice sweet upfront with huge amount of grapes, plums, light fig, dtes and prunes and a dash of raisins but the grape juice goodness is so nice. Lots of candy sugar and some fresh apples are hanging out as well

M: Medium mouthfeel, but a big body which is sweet and rich. Fantastic

O: Hands down, one of the best, if not the best I have tried. World class.

I had read that there was one place in Belgium where I could get this on tap, so I went all the way to the Cafe Rose Red, Bruges in April 2012 and was not disappointed.  Poured by the owners daughter into a St Bernardus 33cl chalice. Dark mahogany in colour with a barley white thick head. Strong aroma of plump sweet raisins and ripe figs with yeasty bread. Thick creamy mouthfeel and superb lacing throughout. Mixed complex malts deliver a powerful, silky smooth fruitloaf base laden with molasses, soft toffee, figs, raisins, damsons and then hints of mocha coffee and rich chocolate truffle appear. There is a cursory nod to the hops with a slight spicy prickle but this is easily overwhelmed by the onslaught of sweet malt again. Finish is rich and alcoholic with warming rum and raisins notes along with caramelised strawberry and vanilla oak flavours. This is a cracking beer and one of the best Belgium has to offer. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: APR 29, 2012 On tap. Caramel and fruit aromas, Pours really dark, with amber reflections. Nice light brown head, really thick and creamy, long-lasting, good lacework. Tastes sweety, malty and presence of high alcohol content noticed.Good long sweet finish.
Easy to drink on tap, extremely dangerous due to high abv.
Tasted also on bottle, a bit more mature and less sweet.

Pours deep brown, a little cloudy. Thick smooth head of medium height that lasts and clings to the glass. Sweet aroma of dates and plum with a touch of bitterness. Palate feel is medium bodied with a little bite from the alcohol and carbonation. Taste is smooth and a blend of malts and fruity grape and plum esters with a touch of yeast. Finishes easy and surprisingly light for a beer with so much body and flavor.

Dark ruby color with slightly brown colored sticking foam. Fruit tones, orange and pineapple, high alcohol but that is OK. (Velp 201204)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oooo have had this beer for about a year now.  Pretty excited to try it!  Pours a rich brown color with a light brown foamy head.  Many things present in the aroma!  Dates!  Grapes!  Yeast!  Something slightly sour!?  Taste is yummy!  Souring grapes.  Slightly bready.  Some dates and some apples?  Maybe not an apple.  But could be?! I can taste some carbonation as well.  Good stuff.  Pretty smooth and not as sweet as i thought it would be!

Extremely good beer, the flavor isnt overpowering, there is barely any hops, and the malt isnt extremely strong or overbearing. Its very cool, refreshing and slightly thick but not syrupy or watery. Great, great balancing. No bitterness at all. The smell isnt my favorite but the taste is on point.

330ml bottle.
Pours a hazy, deep amber, with a beige head.
Spicy, malty aromas, caramel, candied sugar, hops, yeast, chocolate, dark berries.
Semi-sweet, full bodied, medium bitterness, lively CO2.
Fruity, spicy taste, caramel, candied sugar, ashes, licorice, hops, chocolate, complex yeasty notes, and a quite vinous character.
Long, complex finish, very well balanced. (2012-04-19)
For an 10.5% this is a smooth and easy drinking beer. Surprisingly light with a liquor finish

brown, medium sweetness, medium body, cloudy, 
Ottima Quadrpel, colore netto e importante, ti da già lidea di una birra corposa col suo gusto fruttato pieno ma equilibrato per essere una quadrupel, incredibile!

A - pours dark unfiltered amber with very high head that last, leaves sticky lacing. S - very Belgian yeasts/ bubble gum up front. Notes of dough, bananas, apples, and funk. Quite soapy. M - very fluffy creamy mf. Full bodied, sweet, almost sticky. T - flavors definitely mimick the nose. O - good dark belgian. Creamy and full bodied. 7-

Bottle at North Bar, Leeds. Pours a murky deep brown, finger and a half of beige head. Aroma is great Abt: raisins, dark fruits, a bit of cream, coffee, some nuttiness, too. Taste is dark fruits, chocolate cherries, raisin, nuttiness. A touch overcarbonated, medium-full body with a surprisingly clean, dry finish. Not the best of its style that ice had, but thats hardly a criticism, considering the titans its up against. Very nice.

11.2oz bottle best before 9.27.16.  Pours murky and ruddy cider brown, lots of floaties, with a thin beige head.  Aromas of plum, fig, cherry, and fruity esters.  Mild banana, cherry brandy, yeast, and alcohol, with some grape and white wine.  Sweet dark fruit flavor, with mild vanilla and cherry, slight bitter grass, orange, and alcohol.  Really, really high carbonation, medium body, and dry.  This was nice, but the carbonation really detracts from the overall score for me.  [1014]

Bottle.The pour was a murky medium chestnut brown with an average sized (1-2 finger) light brown frothy head that reduced to a large cap, which lasted throughout and allowed for some excellent sheets of lace.

The aroma was a dark bread malt and a sweaty yeast with notes of caramel, a host of dark fruit (black cherries, plums, figs and raisins) and a large hint of alcohol.

The taste was moderately sweet and a bit acidic with a nice caramel flavor in the beginning, and finished sweetly acetic with a big dose of dark fruit and a heavy alcohol funk at the end. The flavor lasted for quite a while with a fruity alcohol warming sensation left behind for one to enjoy.

Mouthfeel was medium in body with a creamy, dry, syrupy texture and a nice lively carbonation. 

Overall this is an intensely satisfying and tasty beer, with a ton of unique flavors that are blended together extremely well. This is most definitely a brew to be savored again and again
A beer that is extremely flavorful that will excite the palate.  The high alcohol content is not noticed.  This a truly exceptional beer that must be tried by every real beer enthusiast.
Great taste. Awesome hops. Strong alcohol but wont taste it. Nice head. Just the right beer for a great time.

(33 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg; BBD: January 17th 2017; blind-sampled w/Rochefort 10 and Westvleteren 12 in the "triple quad challenge") Pours a clear, coppeer brown with medium, tan head. Good retention and lace. A comparatively more sharp aroma with notes of banana and alcohol. Medium carbonation. Full body. Creamy texture. Warming and almost astringent finish. Taste is leaning toward sweet with notes of something nutty and toasted.

Pours a dark brown with a thin head that leaves some nice lacing. Some malty notes on the nose. Taste is ridiculously smooth at 10.5%. A flavor explosion. Probably the best Belgian beer Ive ever tasted!

11.2 oz. bottle poured into a goblet

Pours a dark caramel-colored beige with a beautiful, fluffy off-white two finger head. Gorgeous lacing. The smell of fruit perhaps, plum, black cherries and a bit of fig on the nose, sweet malt, and spice as well. Initially clove and pleasant spice dominate giving way to sweet malt, dark fruit, and yeasty esters. Finishes sweet with pleasant alcoholic warmth. Perfect smooth, creamy mouthfeel. A near perfect beer and one of the best brews Ive had the privilege of drinking.

Bottle. Pours brown with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, burnt sugar, fruitiness, brown sugar, yeast and malt. Flavor is sweet and malty with some burnt brown sugar , vanilla and caramel. Medium to full body, soft carbonation.
The aroma is earthy, caramel.  The appearance amber, translucent, white head.  The flavor is earth, caramel, cocoa.  The fiish is caramel sweetness, resiny hops.  Good.

Bottle 330ml @ home
Pours deep brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, alcohol, prunes, raisin, sugar and yeast. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a long sweet fruity finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

A - coriander, cloves and light caramel
A - dark brown with thick creamy head
T - sweet with roasted bitter finish
P - mid and soft
O - great

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2015 Bottle from Rehills in Jesmond. Cloudy opaque, dark red-brown in colour pouring with a large foamy head.  It has a very rich spicy red fruity flavour, currants, caramel, candy sugar and a warming chocolate followed by a gentle sherry, oak and fruity finish.
11.2 from a snifter. Pours raisin colored. Notes of raisin, currant, rum and bread. Fantastic Belgian!
UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Pours dark brown with a short lived off-white head. Smells of dark fruits and roasted malt. Flavor is the same with some bitterness ans alcohol warming on the finish

Really enjoyed this one. Easy to drink, great flavor, and induces quite a buzz. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught (finally). Sugars, dark small fruit, spices with decent carbonation, lovely hue. Perfect balance.

Stewed blend of dark berries, yeast and baking spices, and alcohol. Black  coffee brown, plenty of activity and head. Very spicy taste, backburn of ginger and black cherries. Not what the drinker expects. Smooth consistency yet still harsh due to its unhidden strength. This is a good beer, but if I had to pick a repeat drinker from the Belgium ultra strongs, it wouldnt be this one.

#1413 draught; nose is cane sugar, cooked vegetables, rubber, later some sweet, rotten fruit, broad mediumsweet malt, feel is quite broad, carb is medium, taste Is decent bittersweet alcohol, some earth, later some rotten fruit, mellow late malt

3/30/12 Sipped slowly at a party out of a tumbler poured from a 750ml bottle, drank warm. A bready aroma of spices, syrup, and dark fruit, this aroma had to be the beers shining quality. The color was uniquely brown but pale, Im guessing that thats "Dark Ivory". There was almost no head and the lacing was thick and frothy. Taste was of fermented dark fruit, oaky and warm, but other than spice not much came through for me. Palate light, smooth, noticeably spicy, like worm cream soda. The spices showed up again in the finish but the beer remained smooth. Will try again and update rating

This quadrupel Abt pours a gorgeous dark ivory colour with a quickly disapating head that sits perfectly over over beer in a white froth of bubbles for the entire consumption of the beer. The beer has a perfect mix of flavor with hints of grains, vanilla and nuts with none of them overwelming the palate. The flavor lingers while you enjoy!

Poured from bottle sample, very little head. The aroma is dominated by alcohol and rich dark fruits. The beer certainly tastes better than it smells, its has chewy thick malts, hints of dark fruit and some toffee, its also has a nice creamy mouthfeel and by way of alcohol it warms my stomach. Very good quality beer.

Tap at Mikkeller Bar. Pours very dark brown with a red hue.  The nose has lots of bread, sweetness and raising much like the mash that leaves the brewery. Same things in the taste but many more details that I didnt manage to note down. Very malty and a sweet roundness. Long finish. A pleasure. Beer became better when slightly warmer than from the tap.

Pours dark brown with a big fluffy white head that hangs around for quite a while.  Nose is bready.  Strong malt presence.  Raisins, dates, plums, cloves and wood mix together to provide an intense smell.  Flavor is sweet, with a bit of bitter in the mix to bring it down to a very enoyable balance that continues through the finish.  Medium to heavy body, crisp and fizzy with a huge aftertaste.  For a mass produced beer, this is great!
amber brown color, aroma of dark fruits, candy sugar, caramel, flavors of dark fruits, candy sugar, caramel, toffee, pineapple, yeast, med body, oily texture, great beer

Bottle 330ml.
Pours brown with low off-white head, some lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, alchool, sugar, malt, caramel. Taste is of dark fruits, alchool, caramel, and bread. Very good beer.

750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber/brown with an orange tint and a persistent beige head. Smells like burnt caramel and a hint of citrus. Tastes like sweet, sweet caramel, chocolate, black cherry and red berries. Very warm, alcohol feel in the finish. Medium body. Excellent, top quality abbey.

Not a huge fan of dark beers, but this one was good. Not too bitter and quite flavorful. 
medium bitterness, brown, red,

0,33l bottle from Csakajósör, Budapest. Hazy light orange brown color with medium frothy light-brown head, which disappears quickly. Dry alcohol and grain odor. During the tasting the lively carbonation appears first and than the huge alcohol aroma. Fruits, roasted malt, nuts, honey, flowers, parfume, some caramel and the classic Belgian yeast aroma. Very complex aroma but the alcohol is the strongest component. Medium sweet taste. Full body with lively carbonation and creamy texture. Sweet finish with flower, honey and wine aroma. Very complex and strong beer. Not an easy-drinking beer. It has the classic Belgian characteristics. The yeast and the grain dominates, but its hard to find hops.
I cannot get into this one... its got a nice dark color with a thick head on it. Its got the sweet aroma you expect of a Belgian, but its got a taste almost reminiscent of sweetened burnt coffee.

Pours chestnut brown with a frothy two finger head. Aromas of fig, raisin, sour cherry. Medium bodied with a creamy mouth feel. Flavours are similar to the nose, with some sour notes and a yeasty, boozy finish.

Pours a deep reddish brown color. Nose is fruity Belgian yeast. Taste is dark fruit - raisins, plum with sour notes. Mouthfeel is medium thick. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

sadly, this beer stands in the shadows of Westvleteren 10, but as far as taste goes, it almost tops the Westvleteren. Its a Dark brown beer with a small (1-2 fingers) head. Very strong taste, aroma of caramel, nuts, resin. oily texture, medium carbonation. Highly recommended and way cheaper/easier to get than the Westvleteren!

33cl bottle. Brown colour with a frothy, moderate creamy, good lacing and mostly lasting off-white head. Aroma is strong caramel, sweet and alcoholic. Flavour is caramelish, sweet, with nutty hints, moderate malty and bready. The final is strong caramel and alcoholic. Carbonation is medium Body is medium to high. Texture is slightly oily.

One of my all-time favourite beers and a perfect example of everything that I like about quads. Dark brown in colour with a reddish tinge. Gorgeous sweet smell. Tastes rich, syrupy, sweet, smooth, subtly spicy; raisins. Lovely mouthfeel - very easy to drink. Like most quads, could only have one or two in a sitting.

75 cl. bottle from an ordinary grocery store in to a trappist glass. Amazing, that you can get stuff like this at a fair price in your local store. Served a bit colder than room temperature. Dark brown colour with a huge, tanned head that fades to a fluffy cap. Aroma that says big, Belgian beer: Lots of good stuff here - caramel malts, resin, dark dried fruits, licorice and unrecognisable herbs. Excellent! Taste is sweet with a pleasant alcohol burn. Full body with a slick texture, not as thick as beer with this abv. Lively, high fermented carbonation. Long lasting finish with lots of the flavour ingredients. Excellent beer from St. Bernard (as usual).

Year old bottle kept under cool cellar conditions.  Brown pour, 2 fingers of quickly disappearing ivory head.  Dark fruit and bread on the nose - Fig, Raisin, Yeast.  Dark fruit up front, dark wheat bread, dates, plum, raisin.  Heavy body, lighter carbonation, almost creamy.  Worth pouring into your favorite chalice.

750 ml pours amber with a off white head.  Aroma is sweet malt with a little nuttiness. Taste is malt with a bit of sweetness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is absolutely one of my favorites!
This is what you taste when drinking it:: caramel,  roasty, floral, basement aromas, alcohol.
aroma of roasted nuts with a floral hops. Good dark color, a little cloudy with a long lasting head. Heavy malty flavor with herbal bitterness. Creamy and refreshing with a long finish. 10% ABV
Draft, walnut brown pour with an off white head.  Sweet caramel, bread, banana aroma.  Sweet, raisin and caramel taste.  Glad to have finally had this on tap.

Bottle 330 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours brown with red/orange reflects. Medium brown-orange head. Aroma: Sweet, candy sugar, caramel and dark fruits. Taste: Sweet, caramel, dark fruits and hints of warming alcohol. Overall: Great beer. Very complex et well balanced. Nearly as good as Westvleteren XII.

2009 Vintage: Deep rich dark tree fruit flavor, smooth mouth feel with delicate carbonation. Delicious. 
2011 Vintage: Sharp carbonation with more watery mouth feel. Not as sweet. Fruit not as. Complex.  (750ml Bottle / France 44 / 03/2012)

Bottle 33 cl from Le Grain dOrge - Crissier (CH). Dark and opaque red brown, beige head. Very aromatic, it presents notes of candy store, fruiy and spicy. Unctuous mouth, rich, sugar and alcohol, very fruity and malted, dry fruits, coconut, roasted, earthy note, slight tingling. Finale sumptuous and greedy with heat of alcohol.
Very good beer. This one got me hooked on Belgian style beers. Nice dark color, great smell, and even better taste. Highly recommend this one.

Draft.  Clear dark mahogany with decent, creamy, tan head / Mellow nose of dark fruit and caramel / Medium to full body, somewhat sour, with great balance and finish / Rich, smooth flavors of dates, prunes, banana, grape soda, nuts, and caramel / A big but mellow beauty.
Tasty beer.
UPDATED: JUN 24, 2013 A nice belgian brown. The ABT ?s classic tobacco/sugar aroma. I still think this brew is the a Trappist brew. Worth having at least once a month. Or twice a day...

9mth conditioning in my fridge. Pours an amber brown with small head. Lots of floaties. Lots of bubbles. Aroma of malt, bread and a little yeast. Some fruitiness and a hint of raisin. It tasted of malt, chocolate, fruit, maple, alcohol and I think a hint of nutmeg. Sometimes there was a little hop in the finish. The large amount of malt is largely masked, this is a full body beer, VERY big. The flavor fills your entire mouth as the tiny champagne like bubbles dance on your tongue.
Ive had it from 75cl and 33cl bottles.  Pours hazy brown amber, medium head, and a little lacing.  Aroma is strong & sweet.  Overall, the best beer in the world as far as Im concerned.

AROMA: bread, nuts, forest fruits
APPEARANCE: brown, clear, frothy then minimal head
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter
PALATE: full body, lively, oily feel, bitter, long finish
OVERALL: nice soft aromas, overpowering bitterness and alcohol especially in aftertaste.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2012 33cl bottle. Pours deep mahogany brown with thin tan head - brilliant lacing. Aroma is beautiful with dark fruit, fig, plum, slight banana, bready malt, caramel all there. Incredibly deep & full taste, with dark fruit, chocolate, caramel, bread, slight clove, rich tobacco. Silky smooth mouthfeel and a lovely alcohol warmth as it goes down. A brilliant quad - incredibly close to knocking westvleteren xii from its lofty perch in my opinion. A real delight.

1.94 pint/champagne corked bottle into a pint glass.  Aroma is mostly bread and alcohol.  I was a little worried when I took in the aroma.  I was, however, intrigued by the effervescence and the large bubbles in the head.  There were bubbles running up the side, like champagne.  It looks dark, cola-like with the bubbly, huge head.  The taste is unique - its a different kind of carbonation.  When the beer specialist where I bought it told me that the 1.94 pint bottle was a different drink than the 4-pack, I was skeptical - no longer.  Slightly fruity, big, pleasant carbonation with a tart, full-bodied finish.  Very smooth on the palate, with very little bitterness and a malty aftertaste.  This is the best 4.2 rated beer youll ever have.  I just wish it smelled better!

Poured from bottle into tasting glass, shared with many as should be.
Dark amber with little head
Aroma is faint banana , fig, yeast.
Taste is easy.  Thats all I can say.
Palate is slick and soft.

Pours a dark brown with large tan head.  Aroma has a bit of caramel and fruit. Tastes bread with light traces of fruit.  Palate is light carbonation and has a quick finish.  Pretty good, overall, really boozy, would most likely drink it again

Dark brown color with a huge head. Delicious aroma of bread, chocolate, dark fruit, vanilla, and spice. Sweet caramel malt flavor with cocoa, licorice, and pepper. Finishes spicy, with cloves and more pepper, and a little bitter. The flavor is big, yet somehow delicate.

Bottle, approximately two years or more old.  Whoops?  Pours a coffee hued caramel brown with a large creamy tanned beige head.  Big sweet malt, hints of cocoa and coffee, malty and sweet, loads of caramel and oxidization.  Beautiful.  Medium bodied, smooth and soft.  Malty and warm, full of caramel and oxidization.  Rich and yet still delicate and balanced.  Really nice balance of oxidized malt and caramel.  A lot of depth.  Malty and smooth, lingering sweet malt and caramel.  Never boozy, super smooth and drinkable.  Warming hints on the finish, more caramel.

33 cl bottle vintage 2009 @ home, BBE 23.06.2014
Aroma is rather grainy with orange peel, some hay and toffee typical to an aged Belgian ale. Flavour has dark, ripe fruits, grain, toffee, hints of pear and a feeling of warming alcohol.
Aging has made the overwhelming sweetness and grain disappear, but on the other hand this has lost some of its character. Smooth and nice anyway, probably Ill wait with the other bottles to see what additional years have to offer.

This is by far my favorite beer. The flavor and finish is awesome!  Drink slowly and enjoy.                 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on tap at Bier Markt in Cleveland, poured into a snifter

a: hazy ruby red color with a small off white head with excellent retention

s: malt swettness mixed with spice and fruit

t: clove and fruit, the alcohol is present and warming

m&d: smooth and creamy mouthfee
This is possibly the closet thing to the perfect beer. Aroma, color, texture, and taste come together to create a sensation unknown to man.
St. Bernardus 12 is one of the all time must drink beers.  The complex and thick flavors leave the palate with a long linger of wonderful sugars and spices.

On tap it has a deep brown color in the glass. The aroma is strong with  some fruit and caramel. Taste is very complex and rich. There is roasted fruits and some licorice. The taste goes on with some mild sweetness and a little bite from the alcohol. Would like to have it again to try and break it down.

Draft at Crescent Moon: Pours a dark brown with a light tan head that dissipated quickly. Does not look like the beer in the picture when I had it. Aroma is complex with caramel malts, some alcohol and light spice. This might have been a little old or starting to lose its punch, so I should give it a try some other time. Taste was OK, but not nearly as complex as I had expected. Pretty good overall, but not the hype that had preceeded it. I will try this again sometime.
Bottle. Murky brown with small fluffy head. Candy fruits, raisins, spice, malts, yeast - so fucking complex.
Transfering data from personal beer file. I drank this beer a long time ago. Ill update this rating if I have the chance to drink it again.
Very nice dark brown beer with a fruity and caramel nose. In taste this one tastes like ripe bananas. Also a hint of salt which oddly makes the beer even sweeter.
Its about time I had one of these. Dirty brick color, no head. Well, an island of it anyways. Fresh bread and date aromas. Taste is bananas and a smooth breadiness. Stone fruit. Great.

From notes.  First reviewed 5/26/2009.  Poured from an 11.2 oz bottle into a tulip.

A dark, thick brown color, with no translucence. A thick, creamy head forms from the outset. A very elegant, soft tan head remains, leaving a smattering of lace around the glass. 

Various dark fruits and a little bit of alcohol are noticeable in the strong aroma.

Figs, raisins, and plums are all equally weighted strong flavors. Hints of toffee, red grapes, and various spices also work their way in. After the initial flavor push, the sweetness really kicks in and carries through the slightly alcohol flavored ending. Leaves a sweet residue. Nothing held back here.

Above average carbonation, and there is a creamy and syrupy feel. Even though this is an intense beer, it still retains some lighter qualities. 

There is definitely a very nice flavor, but a little strong, maybe even a little bit sweet to get through that many. I might have to rotate something in to complement it.
Pours a dark copper caramel color with aroma of caramel and mild nuts. Taste of high alcohol throughout with notes of sweet caramel.  A decent beer I found by accident.

Bottle.  Spent about a year in the cellar.  Beautiful, almost doughy head, half an inch thick.  Brown colour.  Aroma of clove with fig, bread in the malt and a hint of raisin.  Full bodied.  Creamy and smooth.  I taste raisin and grape skins, caramel.  Its mildly sweet, not overpowering.  Theres more of the clove flavour in there too with lots of toasty, bready malts.  Slight sweetness with dark fruit in the finish.

From notes.

Tasted side by side with a Westvleteren 12:

I must say, this is what I hoped Westy 12 would taste like...

A - Pours just like the Westvleteren - murky dark ruby swamp water with a stubborn island of foam that sticks around the middle of the head, twins separated at birth.

S - Smells fantastic. Dark fruit, toasted grains, some kind of sweet syrup. Smells fresher than the Westy even though it predates it by a bit.

T - All the points of the smell carry through in the taste. Wonderful. Great quad without that lingering tobacco that I found in the Westy.

M - Perfect. Not syrupy or oily - medium body, medium to low carbonation, really fitting for the flavors it carries.

O - This really surpasses Westvleteren 12 in my book, and seemingly much more consistent (and cheaper). If you ever find yourself tempted to fork out wads for a Westy off the auction site, remember these words: "Dont do it you pooter. Buy an Abt 12."

Pours a dark amber. Aromas of malt, candied sugar, slight Belgian yeast, dark fruits and alcohol. First taste has an alcohol punch with a finish of dark fruits, plum, dark cherries and Belgian yeast. Maltiness and a slight alcohol burn round it out. Mouthfeel is slightly sticky but not too bad. Not a bad beer but dont see what the hype is.

Top drawer. Dark, deep brown with an ivory head. Served in a red burgundy wine glass. Layers of nuts and red fruits on the nose. Savory and sweet in varying layers on the palate. Alcohol is undetectable. Delicious!
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2015 Lives up to its reputation and more.  Candy and fruit on the nose and palate.

Wow, thats lovely !
Pours cloudy brown. Very complex nose full of stuff: peach marmelade, beewax, dried plum, nutty. Mouthfeel, rich and deep, estery and malty, well balanced. Pure jewels from the abbey !

Definitely one of the best beers in the world. Pours jet black (like westvleteren, blacker than rochefort) with a red rosey hue when held up to the light and a foamy white head which lingers longer than those on most Belgian strong ales. It smells, hmm what can I say, DELICIOUS! Dark sugar and dense alcohol smells with a hint of spice. Tastes as it smells, spicy carbonation on the front and middle of the palate, sugary sweet malt on the middle and at the back. Do yourself a favour - buy yourself a 750mL bottle and dont share! Bliss...
BOTTLE. Spice, ginger, and dark fruit. Awesome beer. One of my top 3 quads.
Incredible beer! Smooth and strong at the same time! Normally I dont like beers with a heavy alcohol percentage, but this one is a keeper!
brown, black, hazy, hay, cereal, roasty, medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, lively,
Pours dark brown with a high head. Aroma belgian yeast, anis, some fruits an citrus. Somewhat raw feel as its a new bottle. Full body and high carbonation. Not Bad.
Dark woody brown with beige head. Sweet fruity nose. Amazing fruity malt flavour. Candy sugar. Frothy mouthfeel. Really delicious.

Being the first beer Ive rated here, Im glad it is this wonderful mixture! Its not the first time Ive had it and I should have written this on the first taste and am now half finished the bottle, but here we go anyway.

The aroma is very mild for a beer of this alcohol content but quite fruity. I would say a banana smell as much as Ive had in a beer. After quite a few sniffs looking for something else I smell a very light hint of citrus in it as well.

Appearance is a nice red as you would expect from most ales. It heads on pour fairly frothy which lasts about 5 min or so. 

Taste is sweet but not overly at all. Its sweetness is almost muted by the textures and aromas that accompany. Not much alcohol flavor for such a strong beer. The flavor improves with each sip and hangs afterward for a bit but certainly not too long.

Palate on first pull I found quite average for an ale except its very smooth. Very full bodied and quite creamy as well, almost milky in texture if it werent for the soft carbonation. The finish matches the taste and hangs around smoothly and softly for a bit but not too long.

I give this beer a f*cking awesome out of 10. I love it.

"Purchased as a St. Bernardus Sampler pack over the holidays. Poured into a Bernardus Chalice at around 50 Degrees F right out of my cellar.
Label reads best before 08/09/16
A - Poured a very dark brown with a 4 finger head that was tan in color. The head subsided pretty slowly. The color has some amber tints on the edges but its a very deep brown ale just like Chimay blue label.
S - Whoa. Yeah, nice breadiness with a lot of earthiness as well. Loving the vanilla notes with a bit of hazelnuts. The smell just screams Belgian Big beer Quad
T - Oh wow. The vanilla and earthiness comes through strong. Nice Belgian yeast which is very mellow and not in your face. Im getting a lot of raisins and malt. The alcohol isnt in your face but you notice it. I get some figs as well. Thats good cause I love figs!
M - Very full bodied beer with an immense mouthfell. Very carbonated, very in your face but perfect to just sit down and sip for a while.
O - Yeah, this beer deserves its Beer Advocate rating. Im a huge fan now. I only had the 375 and I didnt keep in in my cellar longer than a month but I just couldnt wait. This is a beer Ill buy again in an instant. Very delicious and a very solid quad."
Brown colour. Taste of caramel and toffee. No hint of high alcohol level. Very nice!

Pours a hazy brown with slightly off-white head. Lots of yeast sediment. Aroma is fruity - typical belgian. Tastes of molasses, caramel, and dark fruit. Slightly sweet, warming finish. medium bodied and very fizzy. Overall, very tasty, but not as good as Rochefort 10.
Was fortunate enough to sample this at The Dabbler.  Wonderful wonderful beer with a superb flavor and aroma.

Apperarance was clear brownish with 2finger lasting head. Lacing there estery sweet with biscuity smell. A sweet clean taste no hint of alcohol. Velvetty delicate full flavours with an average smooth  finish. Love it and will have again...

Bottle 750ml. January 27th, 2012.

Dark brown color with nice ring white head. Yeast and red fruits aroma. brown sugar and fruity yeast flavors. A great beer to drink all year long.

Rating #37
Bottle. Pours a real  clear dark brown colour with a good white head, real soft fruity aroma, the taste is fruity and malty with a dry finish.

Pours a rich ruby brown with a thick white head. Exotic spices and flowers on the nose. Brown sugar, honey, lots of mellowed out spices and floral. This taste very balanced and full of flavors. I could sip on this all night.
Thin palate. Little bit of alcohol heat, but still really good.

Pours a cloudy deep amber brew with a one finger head with god retention, it has an intense aroma with notes of clove, banana, alcohol and caramel, very similar to hte one you precibe in a weizenbock, but maybe sweeter. The body is medium to robust, the flavor has notes of clove, banana, caramel, dark fruits, and in the finish some citrusy hops. I´m not a fan fo sweet styles but this is a pretty good brew.

Ohhh 1300th rating!  Kinda ashamed it took me this long, but oh well.  Deep brown in color with a luscious foamy head with lots of lace.  Neat dark aroma of dark Belgian fruitsh like raisin, plum, and a hint of stone cherry. There is also a tone of candy sugar in the nose, as well as dusty toffee malt with a smidge of honey. But mostly Belgian raisin. Taste is large but not overpowering, restrained but firm and complex. Theres some sugary toffee with a bunch of earthy fruit malt tones, lots of raisin, fig, a touch of stone cherry, dusty honey, Belgian yeasty esters, sweet but not cloying, very minimal bitterness. The dusty sweet fruitiness and chewy dark malts make it definitely taste like a mono brewed it. Very nice.

Bottle  bb 2014     deep reddish hazy brown with a good beige head . Malts  caramels  alcohol in the aroma    - rich sweet warm taste  full mouthfeel  with a slightly bitter juicy finish. Medium carbonation . really smooth and the high abv is hidden well    . Too drinkable !   A great beer  - all should try !

birra color ambrato scuro opaco, con schiuma persistente di trama medio fine. aroma delicato. gusto molto marcato, lalcohol si sente, ma è davvero piacevole..
 Alla fine i 10 gradi si sentono soprattutto nellumore :)
il mio resoconto è piu che buono!

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2012 Brown with a finger of big bubbly head. Smells like Belgium yeast, dirty chocolate, a bit sour and acidic. Taste is very rich, smokey, fig, earthy, bitter, creamy, chocolate. Its pretty well carbonated and very balanced, very rich and very big. Good beer.

Edit: part of a blind tasting with Westy, Rochfort, and Achel.

Pours dark brown, small off white head, good lacing and retention. Smell prune and plum, red fruit notes, richest of the four smells. Taste is balanced fig, earthy, no alcohol, mellow, lighter flavors come out as it warms, clove/gum, Belgium Yeast and Candi Sugar, almost a hint of pepper, fuller taste later on, but still very drinkable.

The aroma is sour cherry and rose-hips. Red wine grapes; hint of Concord grape juice. Sweet and inviting. Brett-funk emerges as it warms up.

The appearance is brownish brick-red. Decent head, nice lace. Cloudy like a glass of Lake Erie.

The flavor is Belgian funk galore. Cherries and pungent dates. Dry red wine. The funk sits on the back of the tongue, while the sweetness fades. Raisins and dates and plums.

Feels fizzy as hell; prickly on the tongue, dances on the palate. A big, bold Abbey ale. All of the stone fruits, none of the chewiness. Love it.

Meleg vöröses barnás színe van, szellős, kandiscukros habja, ami hamar múlik, csak egy kis fátyol marad utána. Az illata csípősen, furán, illetlenül élesztős, konyakosan alkoholos és gyümölcsös.
Az első korty édes és borsosan szúrós, selymesen karbonált, a maláta őszibarackosan üde, parfümös és fügésen gyümölcsös, amit az alkohol és a bizsergés azonnal feltol az orrüregbe miközben a szájban már konyak koncentrált íze gyűlik. Érdemes hosszan szájban tartani, mert folyton sugározza az új ízeket, lehet vele játszani, mint a robbanós cukorkával, ahogy kiadja magából a szénsavas, fügés, konyakos ízeket, előkerül a pipadohány, a vanília, majd végül az utóíze nehéz zsibbasztó száraz alkohol, akár egy konyak után.
Persze a komló is ott van valahol, de alig lehet rámutatni, annyira belesimul a komplex, barokkos harmóniába. Személyes véleményem szerint ebben a sörben jobban fel lehet ismerni a trappisták sörfőző művészetét, mint akár a Rochefort 10-esben, akár egy sor másik ennél, erősebb, barnább,. egyértelműbb kolostori sörben.

The nose is very inviting. This murky brown beer tastes like raisins with a light crisp finish. The toasted hops linger on your pallet teasing you to drink more. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amazing beer on tap, almost no head how it was served. Great taste and finish. Dark, slightly fruity and spicy.

750ml bottle in Chimay glass.  Pours deep red or mid brown, with a creamy head of about 1/2 a finger which slowly dissipates.  Aroma is very subtle to me, as is the flavor.  Alcohol is well hidden for abv, occasionally presenting itself.  Mild carbonation on the finish.  I can see why the monk on the label is smiling.
pours with a thick creamy head. Color is a deep red/ brown. Very creamy and sweet.  Soft carbonation, long finish,

750ml bottle.
Deep brown pour with a good amount of head.  Aromas are great and taste is even better.  A near perfect Abt/Quad - tons of dark fruit and spicy Belgian yeast.  Hints of bready malt and chocolate.  Crazy drinkable for the ABV.
A bit bitter for me.  And almost chocolate, also not a favorite.  Feels good, nice aftertaste.

Pours a murky brown with a 1 finger head. 

The aroma is just epic. Huge brown (if brown had a smell) Belgian spice with massive dark fruits and alcohol. 

Taste is amazing! Huge alcohol soaked dark fruits! So freaking tasty. Pretty damn drinkable also at 10.5%. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
La première chose est le nez très différent. Le goût ensuite est complexe malheureusement lalcool est très présent.

Beautiful dark, yeasty aroma and dark brown color with slightly tan head.  Taste is malty and deep with notes of wine/grape similar to a Gulden Draak, although not as smooth.  There is a dry bite at the end of the sip that fades and leaves a slightly watery finish.  Enjoyable beer, and definitely a good one, but there are others I would prefer more, such as Gulden Draak, Rochefort 10, Malheur 12, etc.

33cl bottle. I dont usually attach much importance to the look of a beer, but dark, beige headed Abt 12 in its own glass looks sublime. Nice aroma of yeast, bread, raisins, alcohol. Somewhat creamy texture. Long alcohol finish.

Pours dark broen with thin head from from bottle. Malty roasted aromas with faint atom of dark fruits. Hint of sweet up front with tart and bitter finish. This bottle has some off flavors. Boozy . Tastes burned with unripe fruits.  Hoped for more from this beer. Wondering if I got a bad bottle.

Simply the best Trappist beer out there. Pours with a thick, frothy head that gives way to a sweet, almost fruity aroma. Once the head goes down, the thick, dark beer with a hint of deep red to it reveals itself. A very thick beer, as youd expect from an abbey quadruppel, with nice, full body and a slight sweetness to it. Has an almost chocolatey finish to it. If forced to live out my days on a desert island with only one beer...well...Id prefer not to have to make that decision, but this would be on my short list.

12 pours a deep ruby red, creamy with a great beige head and lacing. The aroma fruit and flowers cascade from the glass as well as caramel. Slightly dry and bitter on the palate with tonnes of sweetness from the fruit and caramel, low carbonation. I pick up slight spice and cognac heat, complex.

Great drop!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Malty and fruity. This beer pours a nut brown with a thin hazy head. The finish is strong and complex with both hops and fruity flavors hitting hard then cleansing with the carbonation.

Bruinig van kleur, flinke kraag die uiteindelijk als een dun laagje op het bier blijft liggen. Geur van brood. Smaakt vrij zoetzurig. Te weinig body naar mijn smaak, ik vind m eigenlijk wat tegenvallen.  Weinig interessante nasmaak.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2011 Bottle shared at Dajes Place. Bought at Barleywine, Copenhagen
Dark brown, thin tanned head. Smells of apples, plums, raisins and malt. Nice and complex. Malty body good sweetness. Some acids and alcohol in the back. Some pricking carbonation and thick feel.  Quite complex finish.  Bitterness of fruits malt and hops. For me this beer is quite nice and a ok copy of Westvleteren 12, but not top 50 material. There must be some westy-hype that takes it up there

11.2 oz bottle with about 1 year on it.  Pours a deep cloudy brown with a large white head.  The nose has molasses, prunes, ripe plum, toffee, brown sugar, and raisins.  The flavor is mostly sweet caramel malts, brown sugar with raisin and plum.  The mouth feel was a bit thinner than expected but not watery.  The finish had some alcohol to it.  I really enjoyed this, though I dont think it was as good as the Westy 12 or Rochefort 10.

Pours a nice deep brown with a tan head.  The head dissapates quickly.  Smells of spices; cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice.  It has a very lively palate with an immediate nutty taste and finishes with a slight hint of dark fruit; grape, fig, etc.

Overall an excellent beer.  It is easy to see that this is the flagship beer of the brewery.

Pours hazy chestnut brown with soapy tan head. Nose and flavor are both quite spicy (cinnamon, ginger) with some fruit too. Flavor follows with the addition of some grainy and nutty (walnut) malt characters. So complex, the way a belgian should be. Smooth and creamy, medium body with dry finish. Just a little hot alcohol. One of my favorite beers. First time on draft.

On tap. Pours a reddish brown with cream colored head. Aroma of bread, yeast, and dark fruits. Smooth mouthfeel with good body. First flavors are rum raisin and plums. Alcohol is definitely present. Finishes with the fruit and burnt sugar.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2014 In bottle; aroma was almost sweet and sugary (like root beer ...). Pours a nice dark brown color with clean cream head. Taste; first two sips werent very good so I let it warm up a little. After that, very good ... notes of plum and dark fruit, with subtle chocolate notes and root beer (maybe its just me). Considering the 10% ALC, very easy drinking ... I will definitely be buying this again

Bottle at home. Cork popped right off the bottle! Dark maroon copper, thick foamy head that stays with some lacing. Massive fruitcake, raisin, plum nose. Booze is apparent but subtle. Big rich fruit palate, subtle leathery yeast character, dry peppery hop, boozy finish. Super smooth but rich and complex. Amazing.

St. Bernardus Abt 12 has a medium, beige, root beer-type head, with an opaque, brown color, and lots of streaming bubbles. The aroma is of fruit cake, plums, sugar, caramel, spice, bread, and pepper. The taste is of fruit cake, malt, monkey bread, spice, fruit, fruit cake, plum, caramel, and a touch of hop bitterness. The mouthfeel is thick and syrupy, and St. Bernardus Abt 12 finishes mostly dry and profound. Overall, this is excellent and wonderful and complex. RJT

Bottle. Pours a murky brown with a nice fizzy head white. Smells and tastes of caramel, roasty, alcohol, banana, raisin, figs,banaana. medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, slick feel, lively. Wonderful beer that is a go to when ever I want a sold beer for a good price. Finishes a bit dry but in a good way.

(bottle)  Poured a murky ruby-brown.  Quite a thin head for a Belgian which did not persist.  Tasted of some spices and dark fruits.  I drank this a little too cold so may have missed a lot of the flavours, but the main impression I got was of acetone and warm alcohol.  A little bit disappointing, since I loved the Prior 8.

Poured a murky brown with a tan head that faded to a ring, but left great lacing. Aroma was raisins, figs, and a hint of alcohol. Taste was raisins, dates, and a touch of molasses. A good bit of carbonation and the alcohol is well concealed.

Pours a dark reddish brown with frothy off-white beaded head that lasts until the last drop.  Aroma is dark fruit, raisins, figs, candi sugar, and spicy belgian yeast.  Taste is very fruity much like the nose, but there are also some bubblegum and boozy notes.  Carbonation is high but not quite champagne-like.  Very smooth, dry finish.  This is excellent.
Fruity Quad with a nice note of dark neats foot.. Its taste has some chaptering and it is overall a decent sipper. Its grandeur is in its fame but I hoped for some subtler taste-bud amore.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2012 Pours a dark brown colour with a fruity aroma with hints of caramel. Taste is sweet, fruity (especially dark fruits), spices and very syrupy. The alcohol is hidden extremely well considering is a beer containing over 10%. Edit: Even better the second time

A cloudy brown beer with a creamy head that leaves lace. Nice retention too. Aroma is yeasty, a bit of dark fruit, some alcohol. Flavor is lots of dark fruit, figs, plums, raisins, prunes, dates, etc. Not quite up to westy, but real close. Would love to brew something like this.

Pours a deep amber with medium tan head that quickly dissipates. Delicious aroma with caramel, coriander, fruit and subtle alcohol. A medium to heavy sweetness, but not overwhelming with a slightly bitter finish. This beer is great!

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2012 Deep amber/brown coloration, thick head, good lacing.  Caramel aroma and taste, next to no alcohol taste despite its high alcohol content.  Heavy spicing inc. coriander.  Bought at Schiphol (12-7-12) had this again with Jess upon her arrival in Amsterdam.  Tried a vintage 4 year old bottle at the Bruges bierfest in 2012 with Jess and Dave.  Even better if thats possible.
Dark brown color, sweet smelling, dark fruit flavor, and enough alcohol to leave you on the floor after just a few of them if you dont sip carefully.

Pours a very dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is lightly roasted malt with caramel, fruit and yeast. Taste is also lightly roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits, spices and yeast leading to a sweet and warm alcohol finish. Delicious!

Très active dans la bouteille, en la versant on a une énorme tête difforme et agressive. Dun bout à lautre cest pratiquement sans faille. Les figues, dattes, raisins, chocolat se massent et macèrent jusquau picotement au fond du palais. Complexe mais ridiculement accessible. Très content de la revoir à la S.A.Q.

Cloudy dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is yeast, honey, coriander.  Rich creamy mouthfeel with a hint of booze in the aftertaste and a very subtle bitterness. Taste is dark fruit, brown sugar, spices, hint of licorice. Love it.

Red-brown, dissipating head.
Alcohol, dark fruit, spicy.
Spicy, quite sour.
Medium palate, some carb.
Bit too sweet.

330 ml bottle @ The Rover on December 3. Pours deep chestnut brown with a rather small white head that quickly dissipates. Smell is malty sweet with prunes, raisins, figs, liquorice, spruce wood and alcohol. Smell is huge with sweet dark fruits, lightly toasted malts, liquorice, herbs, metal and gummi candy. Finish is malty sweet and slightly spicy.

Pours deep brown with a thick whitish head. Smells of dried fruit, some caramel, slight bit of coffee. Tastes a bit hot on the tongue.  A little alcohol burn but doesnt detract from the syrupy flavor.  Very good.
Holy mother of god! This beer rocks. Delicious yeasty finish. Rich fruit with caramel notes. The sweetness in this beer is a absolutely perfect

Dégustée en bouteille de 750 ml achetée à la SAQ. Couleur brune opaque avec légère mousse en surface, bien que des bulles remontent en surface et viennent piquées la langue. Les arômes de caramel, de caramel au beurre, de sucre candie et dalcool dominent cette bière très bien balancée. Plaisante au palais. Excellente bière.
Bottle at BarVolo. aroma of dark fruits and malt. flavour of malt caramel and some fruits. Only complaint is the flavour/aroma could be more pronounced?
Cloudy dark brown with small collar. Smell of caramel and abbey beer. Strong beer, a bit too strong for me, but nice level of sweetness. Bitter aftertaste.

13 01 06 on the label, meaning its from 01/13/11. 330 ml bottle into a chimay goblet. Allowed to warm up a bit.

A - Dark brown body, fairly cloudy and bubbly. Splotchy off white/light khaki head. Decent lacing and retention.

S - Caramelized and candied dates, figs, and raisins. This is followed by light spice and Belgian yeast. Im drinking this after a westy 12, and the aromas are quite similar.

T - Similar to the nose. Starts off with the candied dark fruits, and is followed by some light spices. The finish is bready and yeasty. Alcohol presence is ever so slight. Mouth feel is medium and creamy with perfect carbonation. 

O - This is a damn good quad. I enjoyed it much more than rochefort 10, and I think the taste, aroma, mouth feel follow close behind the infamous westy 12.
Fra fat på t Antwaerps Bierhuiske 28 Apr 11. Dyprød/sort. Lavt skum. Velintegrert og sammensatt aroma & smak. Litt krydder. Litt frukt. Meget behagelig. Hvor er alkoholen?

Pours into the glass with a burgundy body topped by a thick natural longlasting head with a good amount of lace left behind. Sweet fruity malt aroma with caramel notes. Brandylike aroma. Sweet caramel malt flavor with fruity notes and a good spiciness. The finish si nutty and slightly spicy. Full bodied, tingly from the carbonation and warming.

(Flasche) Die Falle ist ein sehr dunkles Braun, klar filtriert, aber dennoch wenig durchsichtig, mit einem weißen Schaum. Im Aroma riecht man die belgische Hefe, die fast weißweinartig Aroma frei setzt. Im Kopf geht das Aroma Richtung Cranberry. Der Geschmack ist samtig, leicht malzig und im Kopf leicht säuerlich obstig. Die Bittere ist so gut wie nicht vorhanden. Die Karbonisierung ist fein aber gut vorhanden. Alles in allem ein deftiges Bier aber wenn man es trinkt ist es ein Erlebnis, das einzige negative ist, dass der Alkohol eindeutig zu schmecken ist.
Pours a cloudy brow with high carbonation. Smells of sweet grape. Very malty with almost no hop presence. Absolutely delicious

This is a delightful, complex brew. Aroma includes dried fruit, lots of malt, belgian yeast an alcohol. The alcohol character was very present in my bottle; I wonder if it would have benefited from aging. It is moderately dry, medium bodied and well balanced on the tongue. A very fine belgian ale.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 Pour murky brown/black with low head.
Aromas are sweet cherries, oak, phenols, dried fruits 
Taste has notes of burned caramel, cherries, dried fruits, brown sugar, phenols, spices
Palate very round, sweet with great ending.

Pours a murky brown with a light tan head. The nose is a massive hit of caramelised bananas and not much else beside. Tastewise again the banana thing dominates, with a touch of spice, some apples and pears, and a smooth caramel background. A bit thin, but ok.

Nr. 1227
Dunkelbraun ist der Abt 12 mit kleinen Schwebeteilchen und bräunlichem Schaum. Das Aroma ist sehr hefig bis sauer und leider auch spritig.
Leicht brotig-malziger Antrunk, nur minimal süß. Allerdings kommt auch permanent der Alk. deutlich, ja zu deutlich hervor. 
Fazit: Aromenarm, hefig-sauer und viel zu spritig. Nicht mein Bier. Da gibt es viel bessere Belgier.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2011 red/brown color, hazy, lightly bitter, medium sweetness, full body, average carbonation, long finish.
it should taste similar to the westvleteren, however this st bernardus has got more of a wine touch to it, its a little sweeter and agressive tasting, its just less balanced than the westvleteren...

Very malty, weird/wonderful spicy yeast flavor. It pours a roasty brown, cloudy, some sediment, and has very little head. The palate is a tiny bit fizzy and prominent in upfront, does not linger too long.. maybe a little bit of lingering in the back of the throat. The Belgium of this beer is very delicious!!

Pours a nice dark amber color with a thin off white head.  Aroma is very yeasty,flavor is very rich and creamy.  Very nice and easy to drink considering the alcohol content.  One of the better brews Ive had

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2012 Pours a thick prune juice colour with sediment and some off white head. Smells like sweet malts, some bubble gum and booze. Nice medium bodied mouthfeel. Tastes like raisins, bubble gum and a boozy finish. Oh so good.
A very good Quadruple with a wide variety of different aroma... A good beer for every one that want to have a good time
For some reason I always forget just how good this beer is until I have another. Rich, complex aroma and flavor. Almost makes me want to become a monk.
02.11.2011 - @home - bottle 33Cl - Mahony dark - caramel/chocolate - slightly bitter ending.

This beer was served in a wide mouthed goblet.

Ar- The beers aroma is caramel and toasted notes. Not so much roasted or cocoa notes as I expected. The beer has medium dark fruit notes. The expected figs, dates and raisins are all in the aroma. A very nice clove spicyness breaks up the sweetness. Masterfully done!

Ap- The body of the beer is a bright orange coloration. Noted yeast debris rising to the surface of the beer on an active wave of carbonation. The head is a cinanmon tinged biege coloration. Crazy amounts of lacing mark my glass in a way I have only seen with Belgium quads.

T- The flavor of the beer is complexly wonderful. The flavor of the beer is toasted dark bread with a light caramel spread. The beer has dark fruit flavors but more of a melange than distinct flavors. The spicy yeast creates a clove and peppery finish to the beer. 

P- The beer has a commanding palate. I love a full bodied beer and this one delivers. This is a full bodied beer with active moderate carbonation. The alcohol doesnt play a factor in the beers palate. 

O- This beer is another example of beer drinking bliss. This beer should get mentioned in any conversation involving world class beers. Dam near a religious experience in a bottle.
As good as it gets when it comes to world class offerings.. As far as complexity and taste, you will get your hands on a better beer available to the United States

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 Fruity Quadruppel with a nice note of dark chocolate. Its taste has some bitterness and it is overall a decent beer. Its Palate has a nice aftertaste and I am very impressed by how balanced it is.

Pours dark brown with a pillowy cream colored head. Nose is fig, plum, yeast and sweet malts. Flavor is complex with lots of rich malts and dark fruits that turns rather dry in the finish. Very delicious.

33cl bottle pours dark with a pillowy tanned head. aroma is yeasty and bready with sweet dark fruits and brown sugar. taste is deep, rich and complex. sour cherries, and dark fruits are prominent, with a high carbonation, and a long delicious finish.. a lovely drink!

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2012 An excellent beer. Pours brown with a big tan head. Lots of lacing. Aroma is heavy with brown sugar, caramel, some bready malt, spices and dried dark fruits. Taste follows, and has a very delicate balance between the sweet malty tones and a lingering hoppiness throughout. Mouthfeel is second to none, with a lovely full quality, fairly low but still very present carbonation and an overall very refreshing quality. Overall, itâs Belgium at its best, yet I canât help but feel it might be lacking some of the character of Rochefort and Westvleteren, not to mention some of Struiseâs best.
dark chocolate brown with light brown head. good fruity aroma. the body is medium to full.in the flavour there is plum and maybe raisin

Pours a murky brown with a huge tan head...outstanding lacing and retention.  Aroma has some caramel and toffee, raisins, and notable candy sugar...subdued hoppiness.  Definite raisin and candi sugar flavors...fig, nice subtle, spicy hoppiness.  Mouthfeel is silky smooth and the finish is dry with some fig and roastiness.

Truly fantastic. I love all the trappist ales and I love quads. Pours rich with a big off white head. Bready and Belgian to the core. Many esters prevalent. Deep fruits in both aroma and flavor. Pretty dry. Smooth. Wonderful mouthfeel. A really dangerous and delicious brew.

From notes: Pours cloudy nut brown with a creamy light tan head.  Aroma is of sweet candied fruit mixed with yeast funk.  Deep, with a very slight thickness to it.  Flavor primarily of candied fruit.  As it warms, it takes on notes of biscuity yeast and mild spice.

bottle... this is supposed to be a limited quad limited to only 600 bottles... seemed a bit old to me, wasnt really bursting with aroma or flavor, a really subued quad, but it tasted fine and the alcohol was hidden nicely Earlier Rating: 7/2/2009 Total Score: 4.2Drank from a bottle into a chalice in Brussels.  

This beer pours drank brown with a tan head that stays around for awhile.

It smells truity with a tad of spice.

It tastes a bit like chocolate and coffee.  Its a heavy beer that goes down smooth.
Bottle. Medium brown with a thin off white head. Aroma of berry and caramel. Flavour is fruit, some cherry with a warming alco feel. Palate is sweet and slightly syrupy
UPDATED: JUN 20, 2014 Donkerbruin met cremekleurige kraag. Smaak overrijp fruit, vrij zoet. Minder smakelijk dan de Rochfort 10.
My personal favorite beer of all time. Great balance with light citrus... This is there best.
On draft at iron abbey. This is my 100th rating, selected by Jeff, who stinks. This beer doesnt. Has a raisny sweetness, very smooth, very big. Awesome.

By now, I have tried several St. Bernardus Abt 12 which in my opinion is the best beer I have tried: complex, sweet, fruity, toasty, aromatic, just wonderful!

I have poured into a Chimay chalice, and a Duvel tulip, both are ideal for this beer. I see how a perfect brown sugar cotton candy colored foam develops on top, crowning a dark molasses colored liquid. The aromas, are licorice, raisin, sugary, the taste is really good, no control, just amazing notes of toast, same aroma as taste. They went for everything, no taste overpowers any other, they all shine, like a rainbow? Yeah! like a rainbow, together all the tastes are wonderful, you take one out and it is just a normal beer.

In my mind, the St. Bernardus is better than the Westvleteren 12, it tasted courageous, like tradition, like a great beer: what Aragorn toasts and drinks with when in the company of great men!
From bottle. Murky orange colour with a thick white head. Very well balanced trappist ale. Nice orange and zesty flavours. Not too tart. My favourite trappist so far.

Served on-tap at Shady McGradys into a snifter.
A - Pours deep brown with a thick cap of one finger tall white head, dissipating down to a light film, leaving thin webs of lacing down the glass.
S - Very strong smell overall. Hints of sweet malt, dry yeast, strong booze, dark fruits, and a touch of caramel sweetness. The booze is ever present and seems to only get stronger as the beer begins to warm.
T - Now we are talking. Still plenty of warming alcohol but it is tempered with hints of sweet malts, dark fruits, dry Belgian yeast, and some light spice. Finish is a mix of sweetness and warming booze. Very nice beer overall, just a touch too boozy for my liking.
M - Heavy body and flavor with moderate carbonation. Sweet, boozy, feel with most of it lingering throughout the finish.
D - Pretty good. I like quads, and this one is no different, but they really wear on me over the course of the glass. The combo of high price, $8 for this snifter...ouch!, and the strong booze really bring the drinkability down.

33cl bottle. Dark brown with a mighty head. It goes of so Ill pour some more ...Smells like cherry favored whysky with some banana. Sip : sweet with a smooth body, finely carbonated. Alcohol is there every sip and it could bother me with a second glass couse its that kind of alcohol aroma that goes deep down. Its still a good beer, the malts tasts familiar to many beers I drunk here in Belgium like for exemple Tripple Karmelit. But this beer is more familiar to Rochefort 10 still I prefer the Trappist one. Not a bad beer, far from it : its a great beer but like I said : I see often Rochefort 10 and St.Bernardus 12 side to side on the shop shelves and not twice Im gonna think wchich one to choose.

Bottle.   Reddish brown pour with a large head that dissipates quickly.  Really great aroma of cherries and prunes with a hint of alcohol.  The cherries also really stand out in the flavor, as does the alcohol.  I would say that the carbonation is at the medium level.  The body was also medium, unlike the Rochefort 10 which was very heavy.  I really enjoyed this beer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2012 Bottle @ Head of Steam, Durham. 081011. Rating 9/4/9/5/19
App - Very dark brown, hazy, big tan head. Served in St. Bernardus glass.
Aroma - Dark complex malts, bready yeast, dark fruits, not much alcohol aroma.
Complex flavours of roasted malts, caramel malts, dark fruits, raisins, bready, very smooth and well balanced. 
Palate  - Moderate to high carb which is perfect for the beer, smooth. Finish is smooth, complex dark malts and dark fruits. Alcohol is very well hidden. Dangerously drinkable.
Overall - A world-class beer, superb. I really enjoyed this and it is so well blended  - but the taste is just not as complex as Rochefort 10 - I think there is less spiciness, less layers of flavour. Very, very impressed, but not mind-blowing. One to re-rate with a bottle at home.
Take 2 - Its good but not quite as good as I originally thought so its
8/4/9/5/17

From a 75cl into a snifter.  Pours a purpleish brown.  An inch or two of head.  Great, funky aroma; really, really fantastic.  Mouthfeel is thick and really oily.  Some mediciney taste too.  Taste is of dark fruit, cherries, bubblegum, funk, cough syrup, soy, wood, vanilla and dirt.  Overall, an OK beer, but I doubt Id buy again.  It tastes much more like a heavy dubbel than a quad.  I just dont like the dubbel style much.  Seems like there are few really good ones out there.

Pour deep amber-mahogany with a big foamy, slightly off white head.
Nice and complex aroma, of dark fruits, citrus, and belgian yeast. The taste stays on the tongue for severel minutes. 
The beer has a quick whip on the tongue due to the alcohol.

This is a delightful, complex brew. Aroma includes dried fruit, lots of malt, belgian yeast an alcohol. The alcohol character was very present in my bottle; I wonder if it would have benefited from aging. It is moderately dry, medium bodied and well balanced on the tongue. A very fine belgian ale.

750ml bottle from Westroads poured into my Chimay Trappist glass. Pours a dark nut brown with a half finger of tan head. Aroma of fermented fruit and bready yeast. Aroma is medium sweet. Taste of dark bread, fermented fruit and apricot. Medium bodied with a thick and creamy texture. Lively carbonation and a long finish. Overall, very good. I would drink it again.

Bottle.  Pours dark dark ruby with large foamy tan head.  Im really not picking up much on the nose at all, mostly yeast, some raisin and other dark fruit, slightly sweet.  What the aroma lacks is more than made up for on the tongue: molasses, dark fruit, sweet dark alcohol on the finish.  Sticky; slightly carbonated.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2011 Fles 33 cl.
Kleur: Bruin-rood; Een beetje troebel.
Stabiele witte schuimkraag die kleeft aan het glas.
Geur: Fruitig en zoet.
Smaak: Zoet met een beetje bitter en ook fruitig. Variërend bij elke slok.
Prikkelend op de tong. Volle smaak
Stevige afdronk, die minutenlang blijft hangen.

Een erg lekker en bijzonder bier!

bottle from diarmaidbhk - pours a deep brownish red with a finger of off white head. leaves great lacing on the goblet. Aroma is fruity, malty, nutty, with a touch of caramel. I didnt smell the alcohol, but I do taste it, though it is a mild peppery note.The taste is slightly sweet, but finishes slightly peppery-bitter. Palate is creamy. Nice! Not my favorite quad, but definitely one of the best.

Definitely one of the most extravagant tasting brews I have ever tasted. Poured up a dark mahogany-brown colored body with a one-finger head that was extremely creamy with amazing retention and lacing. Aromas of rich sweet malts, cloves, and dark fruits. The flavors are so complex in the fine brew; cloves and brown sugar along with spicy notes throughout. Full-bodied, creamy smooth, with a very warming and sweet finish. DO NOT RUSH THROUGH THIS BREW! Take your time and slowly savor every drop!

Excellent quadrupel!  Nice two finger head with lacing that lasts for a while on the glass and great head retention.  Not much to add on the taste, but this is a satisfier if you like Rochefort 10 and the like.  A sipper, not overly sticky for 10.5% ABV and alcohol well hidden.  I place this one a close third behind Westvleteren 12 and Rochefort 10.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2013 Compared to the great belgium beers (Rochefort, Achel, Chimay, Westmalle, Maredsous et al) this one doesn?t add up. The flavor is lacking, and the beer falls flat. 9-20-11. Retasting this... This is a great beer. I switched from 3.2 to 4.1. Nice smoothe creamy palate with great creamy head that resides. Some prunes and rich malts. A notch lower than rochefort with more detectable alc and not as much malt depth.

Poured an almost opaque red with a fingers head. Smells great, tastes better. Fruit and spices stick out to my senses. While its a world class beer, doesnt do enough on the palate to blow me away. If it did...

Nice look. 
Hint of vinous smell. Strong/spicy in the after-taste. Taste of some wine and dried fruits, maybe apricot. The yeast sediment contributed with a lot of extra taste. Only a small hint of alcohol in after.taste. A very good beer. Fruity through the taste with a soft and spicy after-taste.

Pours a dark, cloudy brown with a nice off-white head. Big, bright, impressive aroma; smells sweet, tons of candied dried fruit, brown sugar, molasses, clove, spice. Medium-bodied, palate-coating, sweet but not overly so, fruity, alcohol completely hidden, delicious. Excellent.

Malziger, süßer Geruch mit einem Hinweis auf Schokolade. Nach dem Öffnen der Flasche schäumt das Bier fontainenartig aus der Flasche - zum Glück das Allermeiste in das nebenstehende Glas. Malzig-süßer Start, fast schon aggressiv. Dann ein eher sanfter fruchtiger Mittelpart, aromatisch. Im Abgang wieder Malzsüße und wärmend alkoholisch. 
Schmeckt in allen Belangen gut. Test vom 14.7.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche

A great well balanced quad, that I find tastes best with 3-5 years of age. While it is great fresh, I like this beer with a bit of oxidation on it. From what Im told its about as close to a Westy 12 as I am going to see without jumping thru a bunch of hoops. Currently sitting on 2 bottles to see how 7 and 10 years treats them.

33 cl bottle. BBE 01.12.2014.
Originally rated on 20090321 (9+4+9+4+17).
Pours dark red colour with large foamy head. Aroma is dark malts, sweet caramel, belgian yeast, lots of spices, mild fruits, earth and some toffee. Flavour is mild ripe fruits, sour malts, sweet caramel, spices, some plum and notes of toffee at the end. Medium carbonation, lightly sour palate with a sweet caramel finish. Very complex and rich-bodied brew. Enjoy slowly.
5337

Medium-brown pour with a white fluffy head that dissipates quickly. Smell is standard belgian yeast, sugar, bread, and toffee. The flavor boasts some nice dried fruits as you get raisins, dried peaches, a hint of craisins, and some beautiful yeast and sticky sweet raw sugar notes over malted barley. Great beer, but it can get very sweet over the course of a 22oz bomber.

The beer is thanks to James over at Whole Foods Chandler. It pours a burgundy with about 1/4 inch of head that disappears quickly with little to no lacing. 

The beer smells sweet and subtle with hints of wood, carmel and plums or raisins. Either way the beer is smooth, and the dark malts and yeasts are substantially more balanced than similar styles I have had. The night is slowly moving so I am going to end my rating there and say that the descriptions I have read of this beer are accurate. Its amazing but still doesnt compare to Westy 12 in my mind...
